"We cannot rely only on policy...You cannot take indication from the government only, we need to seek clarity from other influencers, whether that is Supreme Court or the NGT," he added.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Elon Musk mocks people who bet against Tesla's stock
article: After the valuation of electric carmaker Tesla hit an all-time high on Monday, the company's billionaire CEO Elon Musk took a dig at short sellers or people who bet against its stock by tweeting, "Stormy weather in Shortville." He added, "Tesla is absurdly overvalued if based on the past, but that's irrelevant. A stock price represents risk-adjusted future cash flows."

author: Aarushi Maheshwari
abstract: Italian Police gets new Lamborghini to nab speeding drivers
article: The Italian Highway Patrol has got a new Lamborghini Huracán to catch speeding drivers and transport organs. With a maximum speed exceeding 300 km/h, the specially modified Lamborghini features a gun holster, computer and tablet. Handing over its keys to Interior Minister Marco Minniti, Lamborghini CEO Stefano Domenicali said, "We are very proud to continue our collaboration with the police".

author: Sultan Mirza
abstract: Curb over-speeding with CEAT’s ‘Drive Safe Dad’ initiative
article: In its commitment to make driving on roads safer, CEAT has released a video under the “Drive Safe Dad” initiative which shows an innovative way to curb over-speeding. CEAT would install a bobblehead, that looks exactly like your kid in your car. It syncs with the speedometer and sends a warning signal every time the car crosses the speed limit.

author: Azhar Iqubal
abstract: Tata Motors to host India’s only truck racing event on March 19
article: India’s only truck racing championship, Tata Motors’ T1 Prima Truck Racing Championship will return for its fourth season on Sunday, March 19. The event will host celebrities like actor Akshay Kumar and singers Garima Yajnik, KK and Siddharth Mahadevan. The race, which has been themed ‘Junoon-e-Trucking’, will be held at the Buddh International Circuit in Greater Noida.

author: Azhar Iqubal
abstract: Apollo Alnac 4G tyres designed for miraculous performance
article: Apollo Tyres has introduced its latest 4th-generation range of tyres, Alnac 4G which offers high-quality driving precision, outstanding control, improved braking and impeccable stability while cornering. It will provide enhanced vehicle control during city driving with large outer shoulders, firm centre rib & new-gen tread compound. Alnac 4G tyres have superior dry and wet grip to ensure confidence during emergency.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Don't make 'Half Car', tweets user on Chetan Bhagat's plan
article: Reacting to author Chetan Bhagat's announcement of setting up an electric car project, a user tweeted, "Just don't make Half Car". Another user tweeted, "Don't do that. You know you can't make a movie out of it". A user also tweeted, "Trying to be Elon Musk?" Another tweet read, "Hope your Twitter account has not been tampered!!"

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Dubai has the world's fastest police car with 407 kmph speed
article: Dubai Police's Bugatti Veyron holds the Guinness World Record for being the world's fastest police car in service. The supercar, which cost the police about ₹10.5 crore, can accelerate from 0-96 kmph in 2.5 seconds and has a top speed of 407 kmph. Dubai Police's fleet of supercars also includes a Lamborghini Aventador and an Aston Martin One-77.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Chetan Bhagat announces an electric car project
article: Author Chetan Bhagat on Wednesday announced on Twitter that he will be setting up an electric car project. "Turning gears. Moving from writing to setting up an electric car project. Always a mechanical engineer #TimeToGetSmarter," he tweeted. Bhagat added that he is not going to stop writing. "I'm not at liberty to reveal further. Stay tuned," he said.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber suspends all self-driving car tests after crash
article: Uber on Saturday suspended all of its self-driving car tests on public streets after one of its self-driving cars crashed in Arizona. No serious injuries were caused in the accident where another car failed to give way to Uber's car, making it flip on its side. The tests will remain suspended until the investigation into the crash is completed.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Intel buys self-driving tech startup Mobileye for $15.3 bn
article: American computing giant Intel on Monday acquired Israeli self-driving technology startup Mobileye in a $15.3 billion all-cash deal. This is the world's biggest purchase of a company solely focused on the self-driving sector. Mobileye has teamed up with Intel for its fifth-generation of chips aimed to be used in fully self-driving vehicles scheduled to be launched around 2021.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: 13 get life imprsionment over 2012 Maruti factory violence
article: A Haryana Court on Saturday imprisoned 13 people for life and gave a five-year jail term to four others in the 2012 Maruti factory violence case. Further, the court said the jail sentence already served by 14 other convicts was sufficient. As many as 117 factory workers were earlier acquitted over a manager's murder at the Maruti's Manesar plant.

author: Sanira Mediratta
abstract: Duo holds world record for covering car in 120 kg human hair
article: A Fiat 500, owned by Maria Lucia Mugno and Valentino Stassano from Italy, is recognised by the Guinness World Records as the 'hairiest car'. The interior and exterior of the car were covered using 120 kilograms of natural human hair in over 150 hours. The record was established in March 2014.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hyperloop starts building its first full-sized passenger pod
article: Hyperloop Transportation Technologies (HTT) on Tuesday announced that it has started building its first full-sized passenger pod for commercial high-speed transportation at speeds of up to 1223 kmph. To be completed in 2018, the 100-foot-long pod will accommodate 28-40 passengers at one time. Hyperloop is aiming to send a pod in every 40 seconds on a station.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bentley takes 57.7 billion-pixel image of its car
article: Bentley has released a 57.7 billion-pixel image of luxury sports sedan Flying Spur W12 S taken from a camera suspended 264 metres up the Cayan Tower, one of Dubai's tallest buildings. NASA-derived technology was used for image, which took 48 hours and 1,825 frames to create. It can be zoomed-in till the letter 'B' is clearly visible on the car.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber unable to locate engineer involved in Google lawsuit
article: Taxi-hailing startup Uber has admitted in court that it is unable to locate a former employee who has been accused of stealing self-driving car technology from Google spinoff Waymo. The engineer in question, Radu Raduta, is one of the three former Google employees who allegedly downloaded sensitive information before taking up jobs at Uber.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup raises ₹215 crore to build the fastest passenger jet
article: Virgin Atlantic's Founder Richard Branson-backed startup Boom Supersonic has raised over ₹215 crore in Series A funding round to build what it claims will be the fastest airplane for passenger flight. The jet, called 'Baby Boom', will cover 5,500 km between New York and London in about 3.5 hours. A passenger plane usually takes 6.5 hours to cover the distance.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Ford sued by Mustang owners for selling defective cars
article: Owners of three 2016 Shelby GT350 Mustang sports cars have sued Ford for "knowingly selling... cars with defective and dangerous powertrains". The lawsuit claims that the Mustangs overheat and go into a "Limp Mode with drastically reduced speed and performance", despite Ford calling its cars "track-ready". Ford has also been accused of refusing to replace or modify the defective components.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Bugatti launches limited-edition bicycle at ₹25.5 lakh
article: French carmaker Bugatti has launched a limited-edition bicycle with luxury bikemaker PG priced at over ₹25.5 lakh. The bicycle, which weighs less than 5 kg, has a shock absorption bar and aerodynamic tubing. The company also notes that the bike "is a piece of sports equipment which is not intended to be used on public roads."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Chinese company files trademark complaint against Mercedes
article: Chinese automaker Chery has filed a complaint with the country's trademark regulator over Mercedes-Benz's use of "EQ" brand for its green-energy vehicles. Chery claims to have used the name "eQ" for its two-door battery electric car for two years. China is a key market for Mercedes as more electric cars are sold in China than rest of the world combined.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: I was a dumb idiot to name Tesla car 'Model 3': Elon Musk
article: Electric vehicle maker Tesla's Co-founder Elon Musk has said that he was a dumb idiot to name the startup's upcoming car 'Model 3'. "Am noticing that many people think Model 3 is the "next version" of a Tesla, like iPhone 2 vs 3. This is not true," tweeted Musk. Tesla claims that Model 3 will be its most affordable car.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Elon Musk jokes about Tesla car models forming word 'S3X'
article: Electric vehicle maker Tesla's Co-founder Elon Musk recently joked about the company's different car model names, Model S, Model 3 and Model X, collectively forming the word 'S3X'. Musk's initial plan was to form the word 'SEXY' with Tesla cars' model names. However, Tesla's Model E was renamed to Model 3 after Ford sued Tesla to block Model E trademark.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Bajaj Auto, Kawasaki end 8-year old alliance in India
article: Bajaj Auto on Saturday said it has agreed with Japan’s Kawasaki to end their eight-year old alliance for sales and services in India from April 2017. However, Bajaj and Kawasaki will continue to maintain their cooperative relationship across the rest of the world. Bajaj has had an alliance with Kawasaki for the latter's motorcycles through its Probiking network since 2009.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Elon Musk's Tesla raises $1.2 billion, 20% more than planned
article: American electric carmaker Tesla, led by billionaire Elon Musk, on Friday said it has raised $1.2 billion by selling common shares and convertible debt. This amount is roughly 20% more than what Tesla had announced it was looking to raise. The capital will fund the production of Tesla's upcoming Model 3 car, which will reportedly also be available in India.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: BMW loses ₹6.5 crore in 40 min as workers pass out from weed
article: BMW had to shut an assembly line for 40 minutes, which cost the company over $1 million (over ₹6.5 crore) in lost production, after two employees got high and collapsed while working, reports said. The workers smoked a joint in the locker room during their break. Later, one of the employees was fired, while the other was relocated, reports added.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Volkswagen cuts executive pay by 37% amid emissions scandal
article: Volkswagen slashed compensation of senior executives by 37% last year as the automaker faced criticism over past generous pay packages amid its diesel-cheating scandal. Remuneration for management-board members dropped to $42 million from $67.2 million in 2015. However, CEO Matthias Müller's wages, benefits, and bonuses jumped 52% to $7.7 million in 2016, his first full year on the job.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Hackers tried to steal our driverless car tech, claims Baidu
article: Chinese internet major Baidu has revealed it strengthened its cybersecurity team after a group of "hackers-for-hire" tried to steal its self-driving car technology. Baidu says it is supporting a team of  "white hat" student hackers to avert future hacking attempts. "If we can help students find the right way, that means less enemies in the future," said Baidu's Cybersecurity Head.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla looking to raise $1.15 billion to fund its Model 3
article: Elon Musk-led electric vehicle maker Tesla is looking to raise about $1.15 billion from stock and debt sale in order to fund the production of its next car Model 3. Musk will be purchasing $25 million of the company's stock. Tesla has had negative cash flow since 2014 and posted a quarterly profit only twice since going public in 2010.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Elon Musk responds to 5th class girl's letter
article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Wednesday retweeted a letter written by a 5th-grade student suggesting that he should hold a competition for the best homemade commercial for Tesla's electric cars. Noting that Tesla does not typically advertise itself, the student said the company could offer a year of free charging or a Model 3 easter egg to the winners.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: India among regions with highest potential: Hyperloop One
article: High-speed transportation technology startup Hyperloop One has said India is among the countries that have the highest potential in the world. "We can go into a city without disturbing the city. We can go underground and no need for government to buy land," said CEO Rob Lloyd. "We're looking at both intercity and intra-city transportation concept for India," he added.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Hyperloop One asks Indian public to vote for preferred route
article: High-speed transport system developer Hyperloop One on Tuesday launched a poll asking the Indian public to vote for their preferred route from among the proposed five. The proposed route from Mumbai to Old Delhi will have a travel time of 80 minutes, while the one from Chennai to Bengaluru will take 20 minutes.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: New York offers ₹1.3 lakh each to people buying electric car
article: New York is offering up to 1.3 lakh each to people who are buying an electric car or a plug-in hybrid. If a person is buying a car that also qualifies for the federal credit, the rebate on the car could shoot up to ₹6.6 lakh on the original price. The move is a part of the city's eco-friendly initiatives.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Rolls-Royce makes car with 1,000 crushed diamonds
article: British luxury automaker Rolls-Royce has created a customised unit of its Ghost car named 'Elegance' with 1,000 crushed diamonds in the paint. The paint, which was applied only to the top section of the car, took two months to create and is the most expensive paint on a Rolls-Royce car. The car has leather seats and lambswool footmats inside.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla CEO Elon Musk enters Hurun 2017 Rich List with $14 bn
article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has been included among the world's richest 100 billionaires for the first time in the Hurun Global Rich List 2017 published on Tuesday. Musk was ranked 75th with a net worth of $14 billion, up by 59% from last year. He has been listed above former Google CEO Eric Schmidt and News Corporation Founder Rupert Murdoch.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hyperloop shows its full-scale test track for first time
article: US-based high-speed transportation startup Hyperloop One has shared the first images and video of its under construction full-scale test track named 'DevLoop' in Nevada. The startup is aiming for the first full-scale test in the first half of 2017 using the 500 metre-long DevLoop. The proof of this concept will be used to connect Dubai and Abu Dhabi via Hyperloop.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup aims to turn regular cars to self-driving at ₹4 lakh
article: US-based startup 'AImotive' is working on a project to convert regular cars into self-driving at a cost of only ₹4 lakh. Unlike Uber and Google's self-driving car projects using radar-like technology that cost up to ₹66 lakh, AImotive uses regular cameras combined with artificial intelligence. Its car features four fish-eye cameras, dual stereo cameras and a computer in the trunk.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber owns patent for technology involved in Google lawsuit
article: According to a Reuters report, Uber's self-driving unit Otto owns a startup called Tyto that has a patent for the LiDAR technology over which Google spinoff Waymo has sued Uber. Tyto's unpublicised acquisition was by Otto made in May 2016. According to the lawsuit, former Google employee and Otto Co-founder Anthony Levandowski stole over 14,000 confidential files from Waymo.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Germany urges public to avoid using cars for 40 days
article: Federal Environmental Agency of Germany has urged drivers to avoid using cars for the 40-day period during which Christians observe Lent. "We could change our perspectives... and at least during the fasting season switch to other forms of transportation," said an official. A discount on public transportation including regional train services has also been proposed in the country.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Trump's old Ferrari expected to fetch ₹2.3 crore at auction
article: A Ferrari F430 F1 Coupe formerly owned by US President Donald Trump has been put up for auction and is expected to raise up to ₹2.3 crore. The red Pininfarina-designed Ferrari was purchased by Trump in 2007 and used for four years. Trump drove the car for over 3,800 km and the subsequent owner used it for about 6,000 km.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Nissan, Ford, BMW sue Takata over losses from faulty airbags
article: Automakers Nissan, BMW of North America, and Ford have accused airbag manufacturer Takata of fraud in a lawsuit seeking to force it to cover losses from its faulty inflators. The automakers claimed Takata withheld information about airbag defects, which caused at least 17 deaths worldwide. Earlier, Takata pleaded guilty to criminal charges in a $1 billion settlement with US prosecutors.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Peugeot maker to buy General Motors' Opel in ₹15,300 cr deal
article: PSA Group, the maker of Peugeot cars, has agreed to buy rival Opel from General Motors in a deal valued at $2.3 billion (₹15,300 crore). This would create Europe’s second-largest carmaker to challenge market leader Volkswagen. GM, which owned Opel for almost 90 years, is cutting ties after the division contributed to losses worth $9 billion (₹60,000 crore) since 2009.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Airbus concept car can be lifted by drone to avoid traffic
article: European aircraft manufacturer Airbus has unveiled a self-driving electric transportation concept called 'Pop.Up' which uses drones to airlift car pods to avoid traffic. An Airbus platform allows passengers to book their rides and sends them self-driving cars. The 8.5-foot-long cars are carried through the air by a drone and dropped to the destination to avoid traffic.

author: Sanira Mediratta
abstract: Lowest roadworthy car has a height of 45.2 centimetre
article: The lowest roadworthy car 'Mirai' measures 45.2 centimetre (17.79 inches) from the ground to the highest part of the car, according to the Guinness World Records. The car, which runs on six main batteries, was created by students and teachers of Okayama Sanyo High School in Japan, in November 2010.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Bugatti Chiron supercar-themed yacht with Jacuzzi launched
article: French luxury carmaker Bugatti has launched a limited edition sports yacht inspired by its ₹17 crore Chiron supercar. The Bugatti Niniette 66 yacht comes with a Jacuzzi, fire pit, champagne bar, and a master suite equipped with a double bed. The yacht offers space for two guests and one crew member with a top speed of about 81.5 kmph.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: New Volvo SUV to automatically steer, brake to avoid crashes
article: Swedish automaker Volvo has announced that its upcoming XC60 SUV will have a software that will take over the steering and braking when necessary to avoid collisions. The system, which will operate between 60 kmph and 140 kmph, will also alert drivers if they move out of their designated driving lanes. Volvo's car will also have an animal detection system.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Volkswagen concept shows self-driving car run by one button
article: Volkswagen has unveiled a concept for its autonomous car Sedric, short for "self-driving car", which can be summoned by a button. The remote will also ring to indicate Sedric's arrival and vibrate to guide a person with impaired vision to the car. Volkswagen claims the car will be able to recognise its users and open its doors to them automatically.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ford begins testing 3D printing of large-scale car parts
article: American carmaker Ford Motor Company has begun testing 3D printing of large-scale as well as customised one-piece car parts. "Printed parts are lighter in weight than traditionally manufactured parts, and may help improve fuel efficiency," said Ford. With 3D printing technology, Ford says it can reduce the cost as well as the time taken to build the car parts.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Female engineer's harassment claim unsubstantiated: Tesla
article: Tesla has responded to a female engineer's 2016 lawsuit accusing the Elon Musk-led company of harassment at workplace. "After an exhaustive review of the facts, the claims of gender discrimination, harassment have not been substantiated," said Tesla's statement. Tesla also said the employee has been moved into successive engineering roles "despite having no formal engineering degree."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Google asks court to freeze Uber's self-driving car project
article: Google spinoff Waymo has formally asked a judge to block Uber from operating its autonomous vehicles while the legal case between the two is ongoing. According to the lawsuit filed last month, ex-Google employee Anthony Levandowski stole over 14,000 files from Waymo and used the stolen technology to start a new self-driving startup called Otto, which was bought by Uber.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Learnt of Volkswagen scandal from media: German Chancellor
article: German Chancellor Angela Merkel on Wednesday denied having any prior knowledge that auto giant Volkswagen was running an emissions cheating scam, saying she first learnt of the scandal through the media. Notably, a special commission is carrying out a probe into whether Merkel colluded with the automaker to protect it from regulators despite knowing that it was running a scam.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: New McLaren supercar to have rotating display on dashboard
article: McLaren has unveiled a rotating display on its dashboard, which will be featured on its upcoming Super Series car. Drivers can select the larger screen with more options for regular driving, while the folded display is meant for racing. The display will automatically slide down to show current gear and speed information when the car is put in track mode.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: 10 lakh Mercedes vehicles to be recalled after 51 fires
article: German automaker Daimler AG has said it will recall ten lakh newer-model Mercedes-Benz vehicles worldwide due to the risk of fire, after 51 fires were reported. The multinational added that no injuries or deaths were reported relating to the vehicles. It will begin recalling the vehicles in the US market in July when parts become available, the company added.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla car in Autopilot mode crashes into construction zone
article: A Texas-based driver has claimed that his Tesla car crashed into the side of a highway construction zone while on Autopilot mode without any warning. Dashcam footage shows that the car did not curve along with the road to avoid the collision. The car was reportedly using a first-generation Autopilot system, which isn't designed to change lanes to avoid collisions.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Self-driving car startup NIO unveils its first concept
article: Silicon Valley startup NIO has unveiled its first consumer-focused electric self-driving car concept 'NIO EVE'. The car's interior glass doubles as smart displays and an inbuilt artificial intelligence system interacts with the passengers. While the car can run 965 km on a single charge, a wireless charging system provides 320 km of travel in just 10 minutes of charging.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Video shows Tesla's yet to be launched Model 3's prototype
article: A video of Elon Musk-led Tesla's yet to be launched Model 3's prototype has been shared by Unplugged Performance, a car modifying shop located near Tesla's Design Studio in the US. It shows the prototype driving along SpaceX's Hyperloop test track. Claimed to be its most affordable car to date, Tesla will begin producing Model 3 from July 2017.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: What is the technology over which Google has sued Uber?
article: Google spinoff Waymo has sued Uber for stealing its 'LiDAR' technology used by self-driving cars. LiDAR is a radar-like system that uses rotating lasers instead of radio waves to build 3D images of the surrounding landscape. Waymo claims it discovered the theft after it received an email from LiDAR components supplier meant for Uber with similar circuit board designs.

author: Sultan Mirza
abstract: WagonR launched with new dual tone interiors & piano finish
article: Maruti Suzuki has launched a new variant of its WagonR tallboy car with dual tone interiors with piano finish and alloy wheels. The VXi+ variant of the WagonR is available with revolutionary Auto Gear Shift (AGS) technology offering mileage of 20.51 km/l. WagonR also comes with dual airbags and anti-lock brake to ensure safety.

author: Sanira Mediratta
abstract: World's most expensive license plate was sold for ₹95 crore
article: The world's most expensive car license plate was bought by Saeed Abdul Ghaffar Khouri from UAE for about ₹95 crore ($14.2 million), according to the Guinness World Records. The plate with the number '1', was sold during a special number-plate auction in February 2008. The auction was organised by Emirates Auction Company in Abu Dhabi.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: India can have Hyperloop in 38 months, says Co-founder
article: Hyperloop Transportation Technologies' Co-founder Bibop Gresta has said India can have a hyperloop in 38 months if the government is serious. "We're ready with the technology and we can bring money. We just need land and a commitment from the government," he added. Hyperloop refers to a technology which transports people in pods at high speeds along specially built tubes.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Takata to pay $1 billion over faulty airbags that killed 16
article: Japanese automobile parts maker Takata on Monday pleaded guilty to fraud and agreed to pay $1 billion for concealing an airbag defect that caused at least 16 deaths. Takata admitted hiding evidence that its airbag inflators could explode with too much force, hurling lethal shrapnel into passengers. Over 31 million cars have been recalled worldwide over the faulty airbags.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Billionaire's ₹2,800 crore superyacht with helipad seized
article: Russian billionaire Andrey Melnichenko's ₹2,800 crore superyacht 'Sailing Yacht A' has been seized before delivery over unpaid bills to the shipbuilder Nobiskrug. The yacht, which is one of the largest sailing yachts in the world, is taller than the Big Ben tower and longer than 13 buses. It also has a helipad, a swimming pool and an underwater observation pod.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup builds hovering bike for ₹1 crore
article: Russian startup Hoversurf has built the 'Hoverbike Scorpion-3', a ₹1 crore manned hovering bike that can go up to 33 feet high in the air and hit speeds of 48 kmph. The electric bike can remain airborne for up to 27 minutes on a single charge. The bike's creators claim that the bike can be driven without any prior experience.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Man who stole ₹1 crore Maserati during test drive arrested
article: A Florida man accused of stealing a Maserati GranTurismo car worth $1,50,000 (nearly ₹1 crore) by fooling the salesman during a test drive has been arrested. The 45-year-old was tracked using his driver's licence that he had presented to the dealership when he initially took the car. However, according to reports, the car has not been recovered yet.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: 10 supercars seized in Chennai for illegal racing
article: Chennai police on Sunday impounded 10 supercars that were allegedly involved in illegal racing in the city. The cars, estimated to be worth around ₹30 crore in total, include two Lamborghinis, a Ferrari, and an Audi. According to the police, the cars were being driven at 180 kmph on a 60 kmph stretch.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla, Ford only US car startups that aren't bankrupt: Musk
article: In an email to employees, electric carmaker Tesla's CEO Elon Musk said, "We should never forget the history of car startups originating in the United States: dozens have gone bankrupt and only two, Tesla and Ford, have not." Addressing claims of poor compensation and safety conditions at Tesla, Musk added, "The forces arrayed against us are many and incredibly powerful."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Google's suit baseless attempt to slow down competitor: Uber
article: Ride-hailing startup Uber has called allegations by Google spinoff Waymo that Uber stole its self-driving car technology a "baseless attempt to slow down a competitor". Waymo's lawsuit claims that a former Google engineer stole 14,000 confidential documents, which he used to build cars for Uber's autonomous truck subsidiary Otto. Waymo is seeking the return of the allegedly stolen materials.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Ford denies its staff sleeps while testing self-driving cars
article: American automaker Ford has denied a report by Bloomberg that its engineers have been falling asleep while testing the company's self-driving cars. However, Ford noted that "high levels of automation without full autonomy capability could provide a false sense of security" to drivers. Ford's autonomous vehicle plan includes removing the car's brake pedals, gas pedals and steering wheel.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: In pictures: Vintage car rally organised in Delhi NCR
article: The 7th edition of the 21 Gun Salute International Vintage Car Rally and Concours Show was organised in Delhi NCR from February 17. More than 100 vintage cars from makers like Benz, Moon Motor Car, Fiat, Ford and Rolls-Royce participated in the event. The show is organised every year as a tribute to maintaining and restoring of iconic car models.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Man arrested for selling over 50 stolen bikes on OLX, Quikr
article: Delhi Police have arrested a man named Sarfaraj Ahmed for stealing more than 50 motorcycles and selling them on used vehicle platforms like OLX and Quikr. As many as 18 costly motorcycles and scooters were recovered from him along with fake number plates, IDs and SIM cards. Ahmed had rented a room in Delhi's Matiala to store the stolen vehicles.

author: Ankush Verma
abstract: Traffic jams cost US drivers ₹80,000 a year: Study
article: Traffic jams cost US drivers an average of $1,200 (over ₹80,000) a year in wasted fuel and time, a study has revealed. Drivers in Los Angeles reportedly spent the most time, an average of 104 peak drive-time hours, fighting slow traffic in 2016. New York, San Francisco, Atlanta and Miami followed Los Angeles as the most traffic-choked US cities.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: How much do supercars cost around the world?
article: Most luxury automakers like Bentley and Lamborghini have stable base pricing around the world, but governmental tariffs vary greatly. For example, the Rolls-Royce Ghost is priced at over ₹4 crore in Mumbai, which is an increase of more than 200% over its UK price. Similarly, the price of a Cadillac CT6 is roughly 85% more in Tokyo than in Canada.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Cars pollute and kill us by running over us: Rajiv Bajaj
article: In a recent event when Bajaj Auto's Managing Director Rajiv Bajaj was asked about a Bajaj-branded car launch, he said, "Cars are too big, too fast, they pollute, they congest and they kill all of us because they run over us". He added, "We are an anti-car company. We feel that people should either walk, cycle, use two-wheelers or three-wheelers".

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Female engineer accuses Tesla of sexism, harassment
article: A female engineer at American carmaker Tesla has accused the Elon Musk-led company of ignoring her complaints of "pervasive harassment" and paying her a lower salary than men doing the same work. The engineer's discrimination lawsuit, filed last year, also claims harassment from men on the factory floor "including... inappropriate language, whistling, and cat calls."

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Ford files patent for head-rest with secret travel pillow
article: US-based automaker Ford has filed a patent for a head-rest with a built-in secret compartment that can hide a wrap-around neck pillow. The design of the headrest features a hidden door that allows it to split in two, revealing the concealed pillow. Ford has noted that this feature will facilitate 'napping' and represent 'a significant advance in passenger comfort'.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Carlos Ghosn to step down as Nissan CEO after 16 years
article: Japanese automaker Nissan has announced that Carlos Ghosn will step aside as CEO after leading the company for 16 years. Ghosn, who joined Nissan as Chief Operating Officer in June 1999, will continue to be Chairman at Nissan, Renault, and Mitsubishi. Hiroto Saikawa, a company veteran of 40 years, will take over from Ghosn from April 1.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup unveils self-driving race car with 320kmph top speed
article: Britain-based race series for driverless electric cars Roborace has unveiled its first self-driving race car 'Robocar' which has a top speed of 320 kmph. The Robocar is bigger than a standard Formula 1 car and measures 4.5 metres long and 2 metres wide. It has two radars, five LiDARs, 18 ultrasonic sensors, two optical speed sensors and six AI-driven cameras.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla CFO quits months before new car Model 3's launch
article: Tesla's Chief Financial Officer Jason Wheeler has quit the company months before the electric vehicle maker is set to launch its new car 'Model 3'. Tesla's former CFO, Deepak Ahuja, will return to the company next month to replace Wheeler. Set to launch in July, Model 3 will be the cheapest car launched by Tesla to date.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: World's first driverless car circuit race ends with a crash
article: The first race between two driverless cars, which was hosted by Formula E's Buenos Aires ePrix on Saturday, ended after one of the cars crashed into a statue. While still in testing phase, the winning car 'Devbot1' reached a top speed of 186 kmph. The driverless cars' racing league, Roborace tweeted, "No drivers were harmed though!"

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla announces plan to build 3 new Gigafactories
article: Elon Musk-led electric carmaker Tesla has announced plans to build three more 'Gigafactories' in addition to the ones being built in Nevada and New York. The upcoming 6 million-square-foot Gigafactory in Nevada is touted to be the world's biggest building by footprint. The lithium-ion battery factory will reportedly also have the world's largest rooftop solar array once it is operational.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: China orders cars in violence-hit area to install GPS system
article: Chinese authorities have ordered all vehicles in the violence-hit region of Bayingol, Xinjiang to be installed with GPS tracking devices as an anti-terror measure. "Cars are the main transportation means for terrorists, and a frequently chosen tool to carry out attacks," said Bayingol traffic police. Cars without the tracking devices will not be able to buy petrol in the region.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla's stock surges by 48% in 3 months to rival Ford, GM
article: According to a Bloomberg report, electric car maker Tesla's stock has surged by 48% in the past three months, despite analysts considering it overvalued. The Elon Musk-led startup has become one of America's 'Big Three' automobile companies in terms of market value, joining General Motors and Ford. Tesla delivered around 80,000 cars in 2016.

author: Sultan Mirza
abstract: Mercedes to launch the new E-class on 28th February
article: Luxury car-maker Mercedes-Benz is ready to launch one of the most awaited luxury saloons for 2017, the fifth generation of E-Class in India. With this product, Mercedes would create a new benchmark in driving dynamics, rear seat comfort and safety. For the first time in this segment, the E-Class will have rear seats that can recline.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Almost all cars will be self-driving in 10 years, says Musk
article: While launching Tesla in Dubai on Monday, the electric vehicle startup's Co-founder Elon Musk said in 10 years it will be very unusual for cars to be built that are not fully self-driving. "Getting in a car will be just like getting in an elevator...You just tell it where you want to go and it takes you there," he added.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: World's first commercial flying car goes on sale at ₹2.67 cr
article: The world's first commercially available flying car made by Dutch company PAL-V, 'Liberty' on Tuesday went for pre-order at a starting price of ₹2.67 crore. The three-wheeled vehicle has a retractable top-mounted rotor and can be in flight for up to 4.3 hours non-stop. It has a top speed of 160km/h on the ground and 180km/h in the air.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Rolls-Royce posts its largest-ever loss over bribery scandal
article: British automobile maker Rolls-Royce on Tuesday reported a record loss of £4.6 billion (over ₹38,600 crore) for 2016, reflecting a fine to settle bribery charges and the weak pound. Rolls-Royce agreed to pay £671 million (over ₹5,500 crore) in January to authorities in Britain, Brazil, and the US. The amount, which is payable over five years, has been booked together.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla stock hits record high as it debuts in Dubai
article: The stock of Elon Musk-led electric vehicle maker Tesla on Monday hit a record high after a 4% rise, the same day it launched the online booking of its cars in UAE. Tesla stock witnessed its last all-time closing high in July 2015. Tesla is currently gearing up for its third car launch, the Model 3.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Toyota recalls all Mirai cars over software glitch
article: Japanese carmaker Toyota has recalled all of its zero-emission Mirai cars globally over a software glitch that can shut off the car's hydrogen power system. Mirai, which means 'future' in Japanese, was launched in December 2014. The recall is expected to affect nearly 2,800 Mirai cars, software of which will be updated by the company free of cost.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tata Motors loses ₹15,000 cr after shares fall most in 5 yrs
article: India’s largest automaker by revenue, Tata Motors on Wednesday lost over ₹15,000 crore from its market value after its shares closed down 10.3%, its biggest fall in five years. The company's stock was the worst performer among the Sensex-30 companies. The slump comes a day after Tata Motors reported 96% dip in its profit for the third quarter ended December.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Suit claims Porsche hid emails about Paul Walker's car crash
article: According to the lawsuit filed by Paul Walker's daughter against Porsche, the carmaker concealed emails that proved Porsche knew that the car the actor died in was dangerous. The email in question was reportedly exchanged between employees and said, "Another Carrera GT bites the dust...Total worldwide production of the Carrera GT was 1280 and to date...200 of them already totaled."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tata Motors, Microsoft to make India's first connected car
article: Tata Motors on Thursday announced a partnership with technology major Microsoft to develop India's first cloud-connected smart cars. The first vehicle showcasing the companies' technology will be unveiled at the Geneva International Motor Show on March 7 under the newly launched 'TAMO' brand. This comes after Tata Motors said it would premiere its first sports car 'Futuro' at the event.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Poets will save the world, not technology: Anand Mahindra
article: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra on Friday said, "It is going to be poets, writers, musicians who will save the world, not technology... It is the people who use their imagination..." He said this in response to being asked whether technology could save the world. Mahindra later tweeted, "I have never been clearer in my mind about an answer."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Ford invests ₹1,300 crore on tunnel to blast wind at 320kmph
article: Ford has announced a $200 million (over ₹1,300 crore) investment to build a wind tunnel complex which will simulate airflow of up to 320 kmph. The complex will also have a climatic chamber with temperature ranging from -40° Celsius to 60° Celsius. Spread across 13 acres, the complex is aimed at improving fuel economy of both production and racing vehicles.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla rival Lucid Motors tests its electric car in -18°F
article: Electric vehicle startup Tesla's rival Lucid Motors has released a video which shows its first car 'Air' being tested in snow, ice and mixed road conditions, and temperatures below -18°F. Unveiled in December, Air churns out 1,000 horsepower and claims to travel up to 640 kilometres per charge. It is expected to launch in 2018 at around ₹66.84 lakh.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Disappointed at the sale of Ambassador brand, say Unions
article: Trade Unions have said, "It is disappointing that the management has sold the brand Ambassador while dues to the workers still remain unresolved." The “intuition of the management” is to sell off everything and “deprive workers”, they added. Notably, Hindustan Motors signed an agreement with Peugeot to sell the iconic Ambassador brand for ₹80 crore.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Honda has no plans to launch a car under ₹5 lakh in India
article: Japanese carmaker Honda has no plans to launch a car costing under ₹5 lakh in India, Honda India's President and CEO Yoichiro Ueno said. "Maybe it is not our market. We are talking about a couple of years. In the long term...we might consider," he added. Notably, sub-₹5 lakh segment accounts for nearly 50% of passenger vehicles sold in India.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: 3 held in Spain for turning Toyota cars into fake Ferraris
article: Spanish police have arrested three people after raiding a workshop where Ferrari and Lamborghini body kits were being bolted onto second-hand Toyota and Ford cars. The investigation was launched when the group attempted to sell a vehicle online for ₹29 lakh. Additionally, the group's leader had a fully equipped facility for the cultivation of marijuana with 950 prepared pots.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: London to levy a daily fine of ₹800 on polluting cars
article: London Mayor Sadiq Khan has said that the city will start levying a daily 'toxicity charge' of about ₹800 on 'polluting' vehicles, typically registered before 2006. He described the fine as "the toughest emission standard of any world city." This will be in addition to London's Congestion Charge, which applies from Monday to Friday between 7:00 AM and 6:00 PM.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Toyota sold only 1 Prius in China in over 6 months
article: Japanese carmaker Toyota sold only one unit of its gas-electric hybrid car Prius in China in the second half of 2016, down from 75 in the first 6 months. Toyota stopped producing Prius in China in 2015, subjecting buyers to 25% customs tax on the imported cars. With the added taxes, Prius sedan costs at par with Audi Q3 SUV.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Audi dealers demand ₹27,000 crore to cover losses of 3 years
article: Audi dealers in China are demanding $4 billion (around ₹27,000 crore) to cover losses over the past three years. The dealers blamed the automaker for adding too many distributors, which potentially worsened a sales decline that saw BMW and Mercedes-Benz overtake the luxury brand last month. Notably, Audi lost its leadership in China’s premium car segment as deliveries fell 35%.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ambassador was sold due to lack of innovation: Giriraj Singh
article: Union Minister of State for MSME, Giriraj Singh on Saturday said that lack of innovation in Hindustan Motors led to the sale of iconic Ambassador car brand to Europe's Peugeot. The manufacturing of Ambassador was discontinued in 2014. It was sold to Peugeot a week ago in a deal worth ₹80 crore.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Musk slammed for claiming Tesla worker was paid to agitate
article: America's United Automobile Workers union has rejected a charge by Tesla CEO Elon Musk that a factory worker who publicly criticised the company was paid by the organisation. "We hope Tesla would apologise to their employee for spreading fake news about him," said the union organisation. The worker had complained of injuries, unfair promotions and low pay at Tesla.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Lamborghini recalls 5,900 supercars after 7 cars catch fire
article: Italian luxury automobile manufacturer Lamborghini has recalled 5,900 supercars after confirming 7 instances of fire because of a fuel system fault. The recall includes the ₹2.6 crore Aventadors and each of the 12 limited edition Venenos, priced at about ₹26 crore. According to the recall statement, gasoline coming in contact with hot exhaust parts caused the fires.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Musk rewards Tesla owner who damaged own car to save a life
article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has announced that the carmaker will provide free repairs to a Tesla Model S owner who damaged his car to save another driver's life. The driver swerved his car in front of a Volkswagen after noticing that the driver appeared to be unconscious. The collision that halted both the cars caused damages worth about ₹7 lakh.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Trump will make America great to invest in: Anand Mahindra
article: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra on Friday said President Donald Trump's programme to ‘Make America Great Again’ will make US a great place to invest in. Mahindra further said Trump’s presidency presented an opportunity for India to play a more important role in the world. “India can serve as a bridge-builder at a time when nations are separating,” he stated.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tata Motors Q3 profit tanks 96% on loss in India operations
article: Tata Motors on Tuesday reported its third-quarter earnings where its profit plummeted 96% over lower sales at its luxury car unit Jaguar Land Rover Automotive and losses in India. Net profit fell to ₹111.57 crore in the quarter ended December 31, from ₹2,952.67 crore in the year-ago period. Tata Motors attributed the loss in the domestic vehicle market to demonetisation.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: 'Made in India' is becoming 'Mad in India', says Rajiv Bajaj
article: Bajaj Auto Managing Director Rajiv Bajaj on Thursday said stifling innovation will turn 'Made in India' into 'Mad in India'. "If your innovation...depends on government approval...it will not be a case of 'Made in India', but 'Mad in India'," Bajaj said, adding that India is the only country that has not given the company permission to sell its four-wheeler.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Anand Mahindra tweets on S Korean drivers' accident response
article: Mahindra Group's Executive Chairman Anand Mahindra on Tuesday tweeted a video of South Korean drivers' response to a tunnel accident with the caption, "It's the kind of culture we need...everywhere, in all things." The 45-second video shows drivers parking their cars to the tunnel's sides in an orderly manner to make way for police and medical help.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Mercedes launches ‘Night Edition’ of luxury compacts A & B-Class
article: India’s leading luxury carmaker Mercedes-Benz launched the A-Class and B-Class ‘Night Edition’ cars starting at ₹27.31 lakh (ex-showroom, Pune). “The trendy and fashionable ‘Night Edition’ are a synthesis of youthful design, modern luxury and fantastic performance, designed for the ‘go getters’ who believe in arriving in style wherever they go,” said Roland Folger, MD & CEO, Mercedes-Benz India.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla drops 'Motors' from its name
article: Elon Musk-led electric vehicle maker Tesla Motors dropped the word 'Motors' from its name on Wednesday. This comes after Tesla acquired solar panel-making company SolarCity in a deal worth $2 billion last year. Earlier, Musk also revealed a plan to start a service where Tesla car owners can rent their cars out when they're not in use.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Lamborghini India launches Huracán RWD Spyder at ₹3.45 crore
article: Italian luxury sports car maker Lamborghini on Wednesday launched Huracán RWD Spyder in India at ₹3.45 crore (ex-showroom, New Delhi). The drop-top version of Hurácan RWD coupe can accelerate from 0 to 100 kmph in just 3.6 seconds and reach a maximum speed of 319 kmph. The 5.2-litre engine of the car produces 572 hp and generates 540 Nm torque.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Dutch university's pod wins Musk's Hyperloop competition
article: Travel pod named 'Delft Hyperloop' made by students from the Netherlands-based Delft University of Technology has won Hyperloop's first ever competition organised by Elon Musk's space company SpaceX. The pod passed the safety and design tests and reached a speed of 94 kmph at the final run of the competition. A total of 29 teams took part in the competition.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla beats own record for fastest electric car acceleration
article: In a new track test, Tesla's Model S car accelerated from 0-100 kmph in 2.275 seconds using the recently-updated 'Ludicrous+' mode. Tesla's fastest production electric car beat its own record time of 2.389 seconds. The car was previously recorded as being quicker than Faraday Future's FF 91 by just a thousandth of a second.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: General Motors to give bonuses up to ₹8L to 52,000 workers
article: American vehicle manufacturer General Motors' 52,000 hourly workers will receive bonuses of up to ₹8 lakh after the company registered a record year in 2016, including around ₹80,770 crore profit in North America. The General Motors' profit-sharing bonuses are the biggest given by the company to date. General Motors' trucks and SUV sales drove the profits in its home market.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: How is the ₹17 crore worth Bugatti Chiron supercar made?
article: One of the fastest production supercars in the world, French luxury carmaker Bugatti's ₹17 crore worth Chiron supercar is assembled at the company's factory in Molsheim, France. Each Chiron takes about six months, 20 people, and 1,800 parts for production, and no robot is involved in the process. Chiron can accelerate from 0-100 kmph in under 2.5 seconds.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ambassador car brand sold to Peugeot for ₹80 crore
article: Kolkata-based automaker Hindustan Motors on Friday sold the iconic Ambassador car brand to French car manufacturer Peugeot in a deal worth ₹80 crore. Hindustan Motors began manufacturing the Ambassador car in 1958, which was also used by several Prime Ministers. The production of the car stopped nearly three years ago in May 2014.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Ford puts $1 billion in startup by ex-Uber, Google engineers
article: American automaker Ford has announced an investment of $1 billion in tech startup Argo AI, founded by former Google and Uber engineers. Ford will acquire a majority stake in the startup, which will focus on developing software platform for Ford's self-driving car. In August, Ford said it will mass-produce fully self-driving cars without brake pedals and steering wheels by 2021.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Musk joins Trump manufacturing council with Dell, Ford CEOs
article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has been appointed to US President Donald Trump's manufacturing council, led by Dow Chemical CEO Andrew Liveris. Other members of the council include Intel CEO Brian Krzanich, Dell CEO and Founder Michael Dell, and Ford CEO Mark Fields. Musk is also part of Trump's Strategic and Policy Forum, which advises on economic matters.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Man seeks NGT nod to ply 20-yr-old Rolls-Royce car in Delhi
article: The owner of a 20-year-old Rolls-Royce car, Delhi resident Ashok Kumar Jain, has approached the National Green Tribunal (NGT) for its approval to let him ply his car in the city. The NGT banned plying of 15-year-old petrol vehicles in 2014. Jain says that he bought the car in 1995 for ₹1 crore and has the requisite pollution test certificate.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: GM uses codenames like 'Cheetah', 'Penguin' for cars
article: In a report on its driverless cars, General Motors revealed it uses codenames like Penguin, Cheetah and Iron Man for each self-driving car being tested. Chevrolet Bolts are named after animals, while Nissan Leafs are named after Marvel Comics characters. The codenames make it easier to identify the electric vehicles in the garage since all of them are white.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Adidas files complaint against Tesla Model 3's old logo
article: Sportswear manufacturer Adidas has filed a legal challenge against carmaker Tesla's old logo for its upcoming Model 3 cars. Adidas claims that the three horizontal bars used by Tesla resemble its 3-Stripes trademark and will "cause confusion" between the brands. However, Tesla CEO Elon Musk has confirmed the company will use the numeric '3' instead of stripes as the logo.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ford makes car parts from tomatoes and Coca-Cola bottles
article: As a part of its biomaterials research, American automaker Ford is making car parts from shredded cash, leftover tomato parts and Coca-Cola bottles. Ford is also using plants like bamboo, wheat, rice hulls and coconut skins to make reliable car parts. Soybean-based foam developed by Ford is being used in every seat cushion of its cars.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tata Motors to launch sportscar under new sub-brand 'Tamo'
article: Tata Motors on Thursday launched its new sub-brand 'Tamo' under which the company will premiere its first supercar 'Futuro'. The supercar will premiere at the upcoming 87th Geneva International Motor Show on March 7, 2017. Tata Motors said Tamo will act as an incubating centre of innovation towards new technologies, business models and partnerships.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Jaguar Land Rover engines worth ₹24 cr stolen from UK plant
article: Over $3.7 million (₹24 crore) worth of Jaguar Land Rover engines were stolen from the company's factory in Solihull, England this week. The thieves reportedly hooked a trailer full of engines to a stolen truck and drove off. The same factory witnessed a similar theft three years ago, in which the engines taken were worth $1.2 million (₹8 crore).

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Musk calls claims of low wages at Tesla 'morally outrageous'
article: Tesla's Elon Musk has called a factory worker's claims that pay at Tesla is among the lowest in automotive industry "morally outrageous". Musk added that the man "doesn't really work" for Tesla, but has been paid by a union organisation to agitate for a union. The worker called Tesla "a company of the future with working conditions of the past".

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Honda recalls over 40,000 cars in India over faulty airbags
article: Honda on Tuesday recalled 41,580 units of its Accord, Civic, City and Jazz models in India which were made in 2012 to replace faulty airbags. This takes the overall number of vehicles recalled by Honda in India with Takata-manufactured airbags to around 3 lakh. Japan-based Takata's exploding airbags have been linked to at least 17 deaths worldwide.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Rolls-Royce ends 13-year run of Phantom VII
article: British luxury carmaker Rolls-Royce announced that it has built the last unit of its seventh generation Phantom car after a 13-year run. The 'Blue Velvet' car has a nautical theme with white lines on the tyres and a ship motif on the coach lines. It sports a V12 engine which offers 453 bhp and a top speed of 240 kmph.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Musk shares video of MIT's Hyperloop run in vacuum tube
article: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has shared a video of MIT's entry to SpaceX's first-ever Hyperloop competition in which teams built pods to travel inside a 1.5-km long tube. "Air has been removed from the Hyperloop tube to almost vacuum conditions," Musk captioned the video. MIT Hyperloop won the Safety and Reliability award at the competition.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Online automobile marketplace CarTrade raises ₹370 crore
article: Online automobile classifieds portal CarTrade on Wednesday announced that it has raised about ₹370 crore ($55 million) in a funding round led by Temasek Holdings and a US-based family office. Temasek, which is a government-owned investment firm from Singapore, had led a ₹950 crore funding round in CarTrade in January 2016. CarTrade also provides automobile reviews, on-road prices, and comparisons.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Elon Musk explains what Tesla, SpaceX logos mean
article: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk in a recent tweet explained what the logos of the companies, which manufacture electric cars and reusable rockets respectively, mean. Tesla's stylised 'T' logo is intended to represent the cross-section of an electric motor, Musk said. The extended 'X' in SpaceX's logo symbolises a rocket's trajectory.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ex-Hyperloop Co-founder begins new high-speed travel startup
article: The former Co-founder and CTO of Hyperloop One, Brogan BamBrogan, has started a new venture named 'Arrivo' that will build a 21st-century high-speed transportation system for passengers and freight. The new venture's technology will be based on the Hyperloop architecture. BamBrogan had quit Hyperloop last year and sued the company of harassment and violation of the labour laws.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Faraday Future will only build 2 cars from the planned 7
article: Electric car startup Faraday Future is scaling back plans to build vehicles in the US and has reportedly slashed its planned car portfolio from seven to two. Its upcoming $1 billion factory has also been downsized to a quarter of the original size. Faraday Future, which is pitted against Tesla, has lost over 10 key executives in 9 months.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla will hopefully launch in India this summer: Elon Musk
article: Electric automobile maker Tesla's CEO Elon Musk on Tuesday responded to a user's query on Twitter about the company's plans to launch its cars in India with, "Hoping for summer this year." Tesla had opened pre-orders for its Model 3 cars in India last year. Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari had also asked Tesla to make India its Asia manufacturing hub.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Ford could lose ₹4,000 crore due to Brexit, warns Executive
article: Ford Europe CEO Jim Farley has warned that the slump in the value of pound since Brexit could cost the automaker around $600 million (over ₹4,000 crore) this year. Ford makes 20 lakh engines in the UK and employs 15,000 staff, Farley said. In this regard, the company will have a lot of work to do in 2017, he added.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: I get to shape buyer perception: Škoda India Sales Director
article: Ashutosh Dixit, Director of Sales and Marketing of Czech automaker Škoda's Indian subsidiary, in a recent interview said that he loves his job as he gets to "shape consumer perception for the brand in India." He added that the volatility and hyper-sensitivity of the Indian automotive market make his life "difficult."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: South Korea to develop train that travels up to 1,000 kmph
article: South Korea is planning to develop a high-speed train system in the next three years, aimed to travel at speeds of up to 1,000 kmph. Based on a hyper-tube technology, that propels floating pod-like vehicles through tubes under partial vacuum, the train will travel from Seoul to Busan in half an hour, instead of the current time of three hours.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Girnar Software to fire 136 employees to cut costs
article: Consumer internet firm Girnar Software, which runs auto portals like CarDekho, Gaadi, and Zigwheels, is firing 136 employees as part of restructuring exercise to cut costs. The exercise is aimed at becoming profitable by first quarter of next fiscal, as promised to the board. Employees with structurally negative unit economics were identified for job cut, said company's CEO Amit Jain.

author: Aarushi Maheshwari
abstract: Mahindra Marine unveils new luxury yacht
article: Mahindra Marine has unveiled the Mahindra Odyssea 55, its new flagship yacht. The 55-feet-long luxury yacht, which features a saloon and master cabin with a personal bar area, can travel at speeds of up to 48 kmph. "Our flagship Mahindra Odyssea 55 series, built to suit Indian conditions, embodies 'Make in India' in its true form", CEO Hiten Ghelani said.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Anand Mahindra trolls Twitter user who asked him to buy car
article: Mahindra Group's Executive Chairman Anand Mahindra on Tuesday trolled a user who asked Mahindra to buy Pininfarina Maserati Birdcage car, picture of which he shared on Twitter. "That's one cage I wouldn't mind being imprisoned in", tweeted Mahindra, to which a user replied, "What stops you from buying it? Go for it". "We bought the company instead....(Pininfarina)," Mahindra tweeted back.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Firm stops making fastest car to reach 0-300 kmph in 13.61s
article: Hennessey Performance Engineering has announced the final Venom GT, which is the Guinness record holder for the fastest car to accelerate from 0-300 kmph in 13.61 seconds. Powered by a 7-litre V8 engine, the 1,451 bhp Venom GT Final Edition will be finished with "glacier blue" paint and white stripes. The car has been priced at $1.2 million (₹8 crore).

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Nissan makes largest-ever map of India to mark Republic Day
article: Nissan India is set to enter the Limca Book of Records after it made the largest-ever outline of India's map to commemorate the country's 68th Republic Day. A Nissan GT-R sports car carved out the approximate map of India on Sambhar Lake's dry surface in Rajasthan. The map covers a 3-kilometre-square area with a perimeter of 14.7 km.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Nothing more British than Tata's Jaguar Land Rover: UK PM
article: UK PM Theresa May said that even though the country's biggest manufacturer Tata is Indian, there cannot be anything more British than its Jaguar Land Rover. Speaking at the World Economic Forum, she said Britain would be open for trade even after leaving the European Union. May further said that Britain has started talks for stronger trade pacts with India.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: DC Design enters two-wheeler segment with Bullet 350
article: Indian automobile customisation firm DC Design has entered the two-wheeler segment with its sub-brand DC2 by launching styling kit 'Carbon-Shot' for Royal Enfield Bullet 350. Priced at ₹76,000, the kit includes all-LED headlamp and front indicators in billet casing, along with leather and steel rider seat. Other features include carbon rear fender and micro fender and billet fuel tank cover.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Faraday Future sued for ₹12.2 crore over unpaid dues
article: Electric carmaker and Tesla rival Faraday Future has been sued for ₹12.2 crore by visual effects studio The Mill Group over unpaid dues. The studio, which made a graphical presentation of the startup's first car FF 91, alleges it received only ₹13 lakh from Faraday against the agreed ₹12.42 crore. Faraday's payment to the company was due in October 2016.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Driver in fatal Tesla crash had 7 secs to react, says report
article: The driver killed in a car crash last year while Tesla's Autopilot was active had at least seven seconds to take action before impact, claims a recently concluded investigation by the US government. Even though the tractor trailer had been visible to the driver, he "took no braking, steering, or other actions," added the report.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: World's longest range electric car travels 539 km per charge
article: Elon Musk-led carmaker Tesla's Model S has become the world's longest range electric car that travels up to 539 kilometres on a single charge. This comes after adding a '100D' battery pack, giving the car an extra range of 32 kilometres. The Model S 100D still hits 250 kmph top speed and goes from 0-100 kmph in 4.2 seconds.

author: Sanira Mediratta
abstract: Chinese man wheelies 20.8 kilometres in 46 minutes
article: Chinese stunt driver Han Yue recently set the Guinness World Record for the 'fastest side wheelie lap of the Nürburgring Nordschleife in a car' by completing the lap in 45 minutes and 59.11 seconds. Driving a red Mini Cooper, Yue navigated 73 turns, spanning 20.8 kilometres, without letting the car's right wheels touch the ground.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US President Donald Trump meets Ford, General Motors CEOs
article: US President Donald Trump on Tuesday met the CEOs of country's three major automakers namely Ford, General Motors and Fiat Chrysler Automobiles. Noting pollution regulations are “out of control”, Trump said he believes he can cut regulations "by 75% or maybe more". He also assured the government will reduce taxes so that cars sold in the US are built locally.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Which cars does US President-elect Donald Trump own?
article: Donald Trump, who is set to be sworn in as the 45th President of the United States on Friday, owns a number of luxury cars. Trump owns a Rolls-Royce Phantom, a vintage 1956 Rolls-Royce Silver Cloud and a Mercedes-Benz SLR. He also owned a Lamborghini Diablo sports car, which he sold on eBay in 2016.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla sues ex-Autopilot Director over stolen company secrets
article: Elon Musk-led electric vehicle maker Tesla has sued former Director of its driver-assist technology Autopilot, Sterling Anderson, accusing him of stealing the company's secret information. Tesla accused Anderson of trying to recruit at least a dozen former Tesla colleagues and build a new car startup. Anderson started working on his new autonomous-car venture Aurora Innovation in 2016.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Video shows evolution of Range Rover SUV from 1969 to 2017
article: Land Rover created the first prototype for the iconic Range Rover in 1969 under the name 'Velar'. In 1973, Range Rover got its recognisable floating roof, the four-door body was introduced in 1981 and the car became world's first all-aluminium SUV in 2012. In its latest rendition, the SVAutobiography Dynamic 2017 features the most powerful engine in Range Rover’s history.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Chinese car owners set record for biggest Tesla parade
article: Tesla Model S and Model X car owners in China recently set a record for the largest parade of Tesla cars. Over a hundred Model X SUVs also formed a giant X as part of the presentation. The Model X cars performed the Christmas light show easter egg that Tesla had released in December as part of an update.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Most expensive US house for sale has 12 cars, 10 motorbikes
article: The most expensive house listed in the US for ₹1,703 crore ($250 million) includes 10 motorcycles, 12 cars and a helicopter. The cars in the mansion include Rolls-Royce Dawn, Ferrari 488, and two of the most expensive cars in the collection, a Pagani Huayra, and a 1936 Mercedes-Benz 540K. While Pagani costs around ₹13 crore, Mercedes costs over ₹102 crore.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla knew drivers would misuse Autopilot, reveals US govt
article: According to a report released by the US government, electric carmaker Tesla knew that drivers would misuse its semi-autonomous Autopilot mode and tested all possible scenarios. "Tesla considered that drivers might fail to pay attention, fall asleep, or become incapacitated," said the report. Tesla has been cleared of any fault in a fatal accident involving its Autopilot system last year.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Will benefit from Trump policy on Mexico imports, says Ford
article: Ford Motor expressed optimism about US President Donald Trump's policies, saying it could be one of the main beneficiaries of possible tariffs on imports from Mexico. The US automaker's CEO Mark Fields said Trump’s first steps since taking office had been positive. “He’s focused on driving policy that drives investment and job creation in manufacturing and automotive manufacturing,” Fields added.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Toyota planning to launch India-specific hybrid car in 5 yrs
article: Toyota is planning to launch an India-specific model focusing on hybrid technology in five years, according to a top official. The car will comply with India’s Corporate Average Fuel Economy (CAFE) norms, to ensure that mileage of cars improves by 10% between 2017 and 2021, and 30% from 2022. Further, carbon dioxide emissions shall reduce to 108 grams/litre starting 2022.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Okinawa launches electric scooter in India at ₹43,700
article: Gurugram-based automobile company Okinawa Autotech on Monday launched electric scooter 'Ridge' in India at ₹43,700 (ex-showroom, Delhi). The zero emission vehicle clocks speeds of over 55 kmph and features anti-theft alarm, central locking smart controller and Eco and Power mode options. The vehicle claims to travel for up to 90 kilometres on a single charge.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Company teases electric supercar that resembles a flower
article: Vanda Electrics has teased the all-electric Dendrobium, which is named after a type of orchid native to Singapore, as the car's automatic roof and doors resemble the flower's petals as they open. Dendrobium is considered to be Singapore's first home-grown supercar. The car is expected to have 1,500 horsepower and a 0-100 kmph time of about 2.6 seconds.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Ford launches brand to sell auto parts for rivals' vehicles
article: American automaker has launched Omnicraft, its first new Customer Service Division brand in 50 years, which will sell parts to fix competitors' vehicles. The division will start selling 1,500 most commonly requested parts from non-Ford auto brands. Ford expects business for automotive parts, which is estimated to be $500 billion currently, to expand by 70% in the next six years.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Electric cars not a game changer for oil demand: Oil firm BP
article: Spencer Dale, Chief Economist of oil company BP, formerly British Petroleum, has said that growth of electric cars will not be a "game changer" for oil industry. "It's not Teslas and the US. It's the fact that 2 billion people, mainly in Asia, are moving to middle income and can buy their first car, that drives oil demand," he said.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: AirAsia denies ₹21 crore link in Rolls-Royce bribery scandal
article: Malaysia-based AirAsia has denied any connection to the corruption scandal surrounding Rolls-Royce, which reportedly paid bribes to win contracts. After its largest graft probe, Britain's Serious Fraud Office alleged Rolls-Royce bribed an AirAsia executive with credits worth $3.2 million (₹21.8 crore). This financial advantage was given for favouring Rolls-Royce in purchase of products, it added.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tata Motors launches hybrid, electric buses at ₹2 crore
article: Tata Motors on Tuesday launched its Starbus brand of fully electric and hybrid buses with prices ranging between ₹1.6 crore and ₹2 crore. The company also unveiled India's first hydrogen-powered fuel cell bus developed in partnership with ISRO (Indian Space Research Organisation). The bus produces electricity using hydrogen and oxygen with only water and heat as a byproduct.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Ducati launches India's most expensive bike at ₹1.12 crore
article: Audi-owned motorcycle manufacturer Ducati has launched India's most expensive production bike, the 1299 Superleggera, at ₹1.12 crore (ex-showroom, Delhi). Ducati claims the 1,285 cc bike has the most powerful twin-cylinder ever produced, which delivers 215 horsepower with 146.5 Nm of torque. Only 500 units of the 1299 Superleggera will be offered globally.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla beats world's fastest electric car by 0.001 second
article: Tesla's latest update 'Ludicrous Plus mode' to its Tesla S model made the car accelerate from 0-100 kmph in only 2.389 seconds. This beat the world's fastest production electric car Faraday Future's FF 91 record of 2.39 seconds by just a thousandth of a second. Earlier, Tesla Co-founder Elon Musk tweeted that even 2.34 seconds is achievable by the company.

author: Azhar Iqubal
abstract: Mercedes-Benz is the leading luxury car brand in India
article: India’s leading luxury car brand Mercedes-Benz sold over 13,000 units for the second year in a row despite demonetisation and diesel ban for eight months in Delhi-NCR in 2016. “This was the most successful year for Mercedes-Benz in the history of the company,” Mercedes-Benz spokesperson said. The SUV range grew by more than 20% with GLE being the most sold.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: US should make better cars: Germany responds to Trump threat
article: German Vice Chancellor Sigmar Gabriel has said US should "build better cars" when asked what Donald Trump could do to make sure German customers bought more American cars. Trump had earlier threatened to hike taxes for cars produced outside the US. "The tax would make the US car industry weaker, worse and more expensive," Gabriel added.

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: US environment agency accuses Fiat of cheating emission test
article: The US Environmental Protection Agency on Thursday accused Fiat Chrysler Automobiles of using a software that allowed excess diesel emissions in over one lakh trucks and SUVs sold since 2014. Fiat, however, dismissed the accusations claiming that its software was "properly justified". The allegations against Fiat came after a probe that stemmed from EPA investigation of automaker Volkswagen.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Volkswagen to pay $4.3 bn fine to US over diesel emissions
article: German automaker Volkswagen has agreed to pay $4.3 billion in fine to the United States for making its diesel cars cheat in pollution emission tests. The fine brings the total amount paid by Volkswagen for cheating the tests to at least $19 billion. Volkswagen admitted having installed the software in 11 million cars worldwide to fake emission tests.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Volkswagen to recall 3L cars in India over emissions scandal
article: German automaker Volkswagen will recall nearly 3.43 lakh diesel cars across 13 models in India as a part of a global recall to replace a software that helped vehicles fake pollution emission tests. The models to be recalled include Polo, Vento, Jetta, Audi A4 and A6 among others. Volkswagen has paid over $19 billion in fines for cheating emission tests.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Man stranded as Tesla lock refuses to open with smartphone
article: A man named Ryan Negri was stranded at Red Rock Canyon on Sunday after his Tesla car's smart lock refused to open using his phone. Negri claimed the lock didn't open as the phone was unable to catch a signal. Negri's wife ran three kilometres after which her phone received a signal and she got the car's key from home.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Vin Diesel welcomed to India by women on Royal Enfield bikes
article: Hollywood actor Vin Diesel and Deepika Padukone were welcomed to Mumbai this week by a group of women riding Royal Enfield motorcycles. The women wore traditional Maharashtrian sarees in red with yellow turbans and boots. The ladies also applied 'tilak' on Diesel's forehead as Marathi folk music played in the background.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Volkswagen warns senior execs not to travel to US: Reports
article: Senior Volkswagen managers have reportedly been warned not to travel to the United States after six current and former executives were charged for their role in the German carmaker's diesel test-cheating scheme. "One doesn't need to test the limits," a legal adviser said. German citizens can be extradited only to other European Union countries or to an international court.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: President unveils Subhas Chandra Bose's restored car
article: President Pranab Mukherjee on Wednesday unveiled the restored car in which Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose escaped house arrest in 1941. Netaji reportedly travelled from his Kolkata residence to Gomoh railway station in Jharkhand to catch a train to Delhi in the car. The Wanderer W24 Sedan has been restored by Audi to mark the 76th anniversary of the escape.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla hires key designer of Apple's new MacBook Pro
article: Elon Musk-led electric vehicle maker Tesla has hired Matt Casebolt, the key designer behind Apple products like MacBook Air, Mac Pro and the latest MacBook Pro. Casebolt has taken over as the Senior Director of Engineering, Closures and Mechanisms at Tesla Motors. Tesla has also hired Apple's Chris Lattner as its Vice President of Autopilot Software.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Modified Tesla Model S goes from 0-100 kmph in 2.1 seconds
article: A modified version of the Tesla's fastest electric car Model S, created for the Electric GT Championship, successfully accelerated from 0-100 kmph in only 2.1 seconds. While Tesla's original Model S accelerates from 0-100 kmph in 2.4 seconds, its rival Faraday Future's FF 91, the world's fastest electric car in production, achieves the same feat in 2.39 seconds.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Trump threatens BMW with 35% border tax on Mexico-built cars
article: US President-elect Donald Trump has warned that the country will impose a 35% border tax on cars that German carmaker BMW plans to build at a new plant in Mexico for US market. It would be "much better" for BMW to build its new factory in the US, he stated. Trump earlier gave similar warnings to other carmakers including Toyota.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla allows self-driving cars to break speed limit
article: Electric car manufacturer Tesla has rolled back a function that limited the speed of its cars in Autopilot mode according to traffic rules. Users will be able to set the speed limit of their self-driving cars at 8 kmph more than the limit on roads, while the limit for highways can be set up to 145 kmph.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Hyundai to invest ₹21,000 crore in US after Trump's threat
article: Hyundai Motor has said it plans to lift US investment by 50% to $3.1 billion (over ₹21,000 crore) over five years after US President-elect Donald Trump threatened to tax imports.
