Toyota may also build a new plant in the US. Notably, Trump has warned of a 35% tax on vehicles imported from Mexico amid attempts to revive US industrial jobs.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Rolls-Royce to pay ₹5,500 crore to settle bribery case
article: British automobile manufacturer Rolls-Royce has agreed to pay £671 million (over ₹5,500 crore) in penalties to authorities in Britain, Brazil and the US to settle bribery and corruption charges. The company was accused of paying bribes to secure high-value contracts in countries around the world. Under the agreement, Rolls-Royce will avoid being prosecuted, though executives may still be charged.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: BMW India appoints ex-Harley-Davidson India MD as President
article: BMW has appointed former Harley-Davidson India MD Vikram Pawah as the President of its India operations. Pawah has previously worked with Honda Cars in India and Australia as the Assistant Vice President and Operating Head of Sales. Current acting President Frank Schloeder will assume the position of Head of Business Steering - Luxury Class in Germany.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Musk hints update to make Tesla Model S fastest electric car
article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Thursday tweeted about an update to make Tesla Model S world's fastest production electric car by accelerating from 0-100 kmph in 2.42 seconds. This would make the cars 0.05 seconds faster than rival Faraday Future's recently unveiled 'FF91'. Responding to Musk's tweet, Faraday Future said, "We're ready to work together to elevate the electric industry."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tata to conduct India's first self-driving car test: Reports
article: Tata Elxsi, a design firm part of the Tata group, will reportedly become the first company to test self-driving cars in India. The company is said to have sought permission to test re-engineered sedans equipped with ultrasonic sensors and LIDAR radars in Bengaluru. Tata Elxsi is not building its own autonomous cars, but working on software for other carmakers.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Ex-Volkswagen CEO refuses to say when he knew of diesel row
article: Former Volkswagen CEO Martin Winterkorn on Thursday declined to tell German lawmakers when he first learned about the automaker's emissions scandal. On being asked whether he had known about software cheating earlier, he said, "That is not the case." Earlier, Volkswagen agreed to pay the largest ever US criminal fine levied on an automaker for cheating diesel emission tests.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Ex-Rolls-Royce CEO might lose knighthood over bribery case
article: The Opposition party in Britain has called for Sir John Rose, the former CEO of Rolls-Royce, to lose his knighthood after the company admitted to charges of bribery and corruption during his tenure. Earlier this week, the automobile manufacturer agreed to pay £671 million (over ₹5,500 crore) in penalties to authorities in Britain, Brazil and the US.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Luxury yacht concept with sofas, AC and bathroom unveiled
article: The luxury vehicle division of Japanese car maker Toyota, Lexus has unveiled an eight-seater yacht concept that comes with a refrigerator, sofas, air conditioning and a bathroom fitted with a shower. The yacht is powered by a pair of V8 engines that churn out 880 horsepower to deliver a top speed of 79 kmph. It has a see-through engine compartment.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla hires senior Apple executive for Autopilot technology
article: Electric carmaker Tesla has hired Apple's Senior Director and Architect Chris Lattner as its Vice President of Autopilot software. During his 11-year stint at Apple, Lattner led the creation of Swift, the programming language for building apps on Apple platforms. Tesla claims Autopilot is a full self-driving capability at a safety level substantially greater than that of a human.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Chevrolet unveils life-size Batmobile made of Lego bricks
article: American automaker Chevrolet has unveiled a life-size model of Batmobile made of Lego pieces at the ongoing Detroit Auto Show. The 17-feet long and nearly 7-feet tall Batmobile was made using 3,44,187 individual Lego bricks of 17 different colours. It took 222 hours to design the car and 1,833 hours to put the Lego pieces together.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Self-driving shuttle offers free rides to users in Las Vegas
article: French vehicle manufacturer Navya has started a trial of its self-driving shuttle in Las Vegas, US and is offering free rides to commuters. The 12-seater vehicle has a top speed of about 43.4 kmph but will be restricted to 19 kmph during the trial. The full-scale shuttle service is expected to cost Las Vegas approximately ₹6.8 lakh per month.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: France opens probe into emissions test cheating by Renault
article: Paris prosecutors have opened a preliminary probe into possible cheating on exhaust emissions by French automobile maker Renault. Shares of the company dropped by 6% in Paris trading, wiping $1.6 billion off its market value. Stemming from the Volkswagen probe, Fiat Chrysler has also been accused of using a computer software to cheat emission tests of its diesel models.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Fiat concept car has selfie camera, 10 phone chargers
article: Fiat Chrysler has revealed 'Portal', an electric concept car with double-sliding doors, ten docking stations to charge smartphones or tablets, and a selfie camera. Portal, which claims a range of over 400 km, will be able to operate semi-autonomously. It also has an internal intercom and a display at the back to encourage riders to post about their trip.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: World's fastest electric car goes from 0-100kmph in 2.39 sec
article: American startup Faraday Future on Wednesday unveiled the 'FF 91', which it claims is the world's fastest production electric vehicle that accelerates from 0-100 kmph in just 2.39 seconds and generates 1050 horsepower. Expected to launch in 2018, the fully self-driving car can travel about 608 km on a single charge and has facial recognition technology that allows keyless entry.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: World's fastest 4-seat car goes from 0-100 kmph in 3.5 sec
article: British luxury carmaker Bentley on Friday unveiled the world's fastest four-seat car, the 2017 Continental Supersports which can accelerate from 0-100 kmph in 3.5 seconds and has a top speed of 336 kmph. The car is also Bentley's fastest and most powerful production model to date and can cover the length of a football field in a second.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Mercedes beats BMW after a decade as biggest luxury carmaker
article: Automobile manufacturer Mercedes-Benz became the world’s biggest luxury-car brand in 2016, marking the end of rival BMW's more than a decade-old success run. Mercedes-Benz sold around 80,000 more units of its vehicles than BMW all over the world last year to reach the top spot. Further, German carmaker Audi stood at the third spot during this period.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Make in USA or pay big tax, Trump tells General Motors
article: US President-elect Donald Trump on Tuesday threatened to impose a hefty tariff on General Motors if the Detroit-based company does not manufacture its automobiles in the country. "General Motors is sending Mexican made models of Chevy Cruze to US car dealers-tax free across the border. Make in USA or pay big border tax!", tweeted Trump.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Hot Yoga founder Bikram Choudhury's 43 luxury cars missing
article: Hot Yoga founder Bikram Choudhury owned 43 luxury cars that have gone missing after he lost a sexual harassment case filed by his former legal adviser Minakshi Jafa-Bodden. A US court directed Choudhury to give up the cars, which included 13 Rolls-Royces and eight Bentleys, to Minakshi. He was also ordered to give up his income to pay for damages.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: I don't think driverless cars will come to India: Pichai
article: Citing a recent statement by Uber CEO Travis Kalanick that India will be the last country to get driverless cars, Google CEO Sundar Pichai has said, "I don't think for a country like India you are gonna see, as Travis said, completely automated cars." However, he added that using cars as a shared resource will benefit India greatly.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Toyota's concept car alerts other drivers of upcoming turns
article: Japanese automaker Toyota has unveiled a new concept of self-driving car called 'Concept-i', that notifies the cars driving behind it about upcoming road hazards or turns through an exterior LED lighting system. It also greets both the driver and the passengers approaching towards it. The car's integrated with a virtual companion 'Yui' that learns the driver's behaviour and driving pattern.

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: Ford cancels ₹10,000 crore plant after Trump's criticism
article: US automaker Ford's CEO Mark Fields on Tuesday announced that the company is scrapping plans to build a ₹10,900-crore small car production plant in Mexico. This comes after US President-elect Donald Trump criticised Ford for shifting jobs out of the US. Ford, USA's second largest automaker, had planned to shift production to Mexico to cut costs amid declining car sales.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Volkswagen concept 8-seater travels 480 km in 30 min charge
article: Volkswagen on Monday unveiled ID Buzz, an eight-seater electric minivan with a range of 600 km which can charge up to 80% in 30 minutes. The steering wheel of the self-driving minivan retracts into the cockpit and the driver's seat can be turned around to face the passengers in the back. ID Buzz is Volkswagen's first fully autonomous concept car.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Automobile sales growth at 16-year-low after demonetisation
article: Monthly growth rate of automobile sales in India slipped to a 16-year-low in December 2016, reflecting the negative consumer sentiment in the market due to demonetisation, said SIAM Director General Vishnu Mathur. Total vehicle sales declined by 18.66% from a year ago period. Sales of two-wheelers also witnessed the steepest ever decline of 22.04% in December 2016.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Hyundai concept car also acts as air conditioner for houses
article: Hyundai has revealed a "Mobility Vision" concept that shows an autonomous car docking into the interior of a smart home. As part of the living space, the car can act as an air conditioner, share its entertainment facilities by connecting with the home's devices and even provide power in emergency situations by using its onboard fuel cell as a generator.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Woman sues Uber, Honda after being paralysed in car crash
article: An American woman has sued Uber and Honda after the driver of her Uber cab jumped a red light, leading to a crash that left her paralysed from the chest down. The suit alleges security lapse on Uber's part for ignoring previous drug and gambling charges against the driver. The owner of the Honda-branded taxi has also been sued.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: In pics: Hi-tech cars at world's largest electronics show
article: A range of hi-technology cars was showcased at the world's largest consumer electronics show CES held in Las Vegas from January 5-8 this year. Startup Faraday Future unveiled the 'FF 91', the world's fastest production electric vehicle that accelerates from 0-100 kmph in just 2.39 seconds. Hyundai revealed a self-driving car concept that also acts an air conditioner for houses.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Electric scooter that can charge 5 devices together made
article: A US-based startup has developed a foldable electric scooter 'URB-E Sport' which can charge up to five devices simultaneously. The scooter's battery can charge an Apple MacBook five times or an iPhone 40 times over. Priced at about ₹61,000, the scooter has a range of 25.7 km on a single charge and a top speed of 22.5 km.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Japan defends Toyota after Trump threat on Mexico-built cars
article: The Japanese government defended Toyota Motor as an "important corporate citizen" of the US, after President-elect Donald Trump threatened to impose punitive tariffs on its Mexico-built cars. "Toyota Motor said will build a new plant in...Mexico to build Corolla cars for US. NO WAY! Build plant in US or pay big border tax," Trump said in a post on Twitter.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Samsung car battery gives 600km of travel in 20 min charge
article: South Korean technology major Samsung's lithium ion and renewable division, Samsung SDI, has developed a new electric vehicle battery that claims to give 600 kilometres of travel after just 20 minutes of charging. This range is higher than 426 kilometres, the current range offered by a fully charged Model S car manufactured by Elon Musk-led electric vehicle maker Tesla.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Honda unveils self-balancing bike that follows its owner
article: Honda has unveiled its Moto Riding Assist technology to make a motorcycle capable of balancing itself when at rest. The front wheel of the bike twitches back and forth to keep it upright. A video shared by Honda also shows the motorcycle driving itself to follow its owner at a slow pace.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Google's first self-driving minivans to ride on public roads
article: Waymo, the self-driving startup spun-off from Google last year, will be deploying its fully self-driving fleet of minivans made with Fiat Chrysler on public roads for the first time later this month. The minivans will be deployed in California and Arizona's Phoenix. All the self-driving technology including cameras, sensors, and mapping has been developed in-house by Waymo.

author: Anmol Sharma
abstract: Pakistan Court issues arrest warrant against Wasim Akram
article: A Karachi court on Tuesday issued bailable arrest warrant against former cricketer Wasim Akram after he failed to appear before the court during the last 31 hearings of a case. Akram had lodged the case himself in August last year after his Mercedes was shot at in Karachi. Akram has been asked to appear before the court on January 17.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: BMW's car concept lets each passenger listen to own music
article: Automotive major BMW has revealed a concept depicting the interior of a futuristic self-driving car with "Sound Curtains" that allow each passenger to play their own music without the need for headphones. The music is played through a component at the head of each seat. The model also features BMW's HoloActive floating touchscreen with navigation and entertainment functions.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Faraday Future car's self-parking fails during launch event
article: American startup Faraday Future, which unveiled world's fastest production electric car FF 91, failed to get the car park itself with a button press following a technical glitch during launch. The car failed to move when company's investor and LeEco Founder Jia Yueting pressed the self-parking button. "It's a little bit crazy," said an executive after the failed attempt.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Honda's self-driving car concept lets owners earn money
article: Japanese carmaker Honda on Friday unveiled an electric self-driving car concept called 'NeuV' that uses artificial intelligence to understand owners' emotions and also helps them earn money via ride-sharing. NeuV is designed to operate as a part of a self-driving ride-fleet, letting owners generate revenue from their vehicles when they're not in use.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Few Mexican-made Chevy Cruze sold in US: GM on Trump's tweet
article: After United States President-elect Donald Trump threatened to impose hefty tariff on General Motors (GM), the automaker said only a small number of Mexican-made Chevrolet Cruze models are sold in US. Trump had alleged that GM sends Mexican-made models of Cruze to American car dealers tax-free across the border. "Make in USA or pay big border tax," Trump's tweet read.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Mercedes self-driving cars to rival Tesla's Autopilot system
article: Mercedes' self-driving E-Class cars, which are expected to compete with Tesla's Autopilot system, have been granted a test license for autonomous driving in the US. The Drive Pilot technology by Mercedes will maintain the car's speed and keep it within its lane. It will request a driver response every 10 seconds, depending on current road conditions.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Logo on Nissan's concept car lights up in self-driving mode
article: Nissan on Monday unveiled the 'Vmotion 2.0' concept car whose logo on the front grille and rear diffuser will glow when the car operates in self-driving mode. The front and rear doors of the sedan swing outward to open. The headrests of the car's seats feature Bose speakers that can control the direction and distance of sound.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Nissan's self-driving cars to use NASA's Mars Rover tech
article: Nissan has said its autonomous cars will use the Seamless Autonomous Mobility technology built by NASA for the Mars Rover. On facing an uncertain situation, the vehicle will park itself in a safe spot and request help from a command centre. A human assistant will assess the situation and "paint" a virtual lane for the car to drive itself through.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Actor suing us using celebrity status to hurt company: Tesla
article: Responding to South Korean celebrity Ji Chang Son's lawsuit, electric vehicle maker Tesla said that before filing the lawsuit the actor threatened to use his celebrity status to hurt the company. The actor claims that a Tesla Model X suddenly accelerated during parking, and rammed through his living room causing injuries to him and his son.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Volvo launches 'Red Key' that limits car's top speed
article: Swedish carmaker Volvo has launched a 'Red Key' that restricts the car's top speed to 120 kmph and makes the adaptive cruise control maintain maximum distance from the car in front. The maximum volume of the audio is also reduced and features like distance alert and traffic sign recognition are permanently activated when the car is driven with Red Key.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Google reveals the most searched carmakers in 2016
article: Google has revealed the world's most searched carmakers in the year 2016, with Japan's Honda topping the list and its Civic being the most popular model on the platform. Germany's Mercedes-Benz and Elon Musk-led electric vehicle maker Tesla were the second and third most searched carmakers respectively. Lamborghini, Maserati and Rolls-Royce were also among the most searched carmakers.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Automatic brakes saved lives in Berlin truck attack: Reports
article: The truck used to barrel into a Christmas market in Berlin on December 19, killing 12 people, could have reportedly killed more if the vehicle's automatic brakes had not activated. The brakes were reportedly engaged after sensing a collision, stopping it within 250 feet. Automatic brakes have been required in trucks weighing over 3,500 kg since 2012 in Europe.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Man sues Tesla after car crashes into his living room
article: A Tesla Model X owner on Friday sued the electric carmaker claiming that his SUV suddenly accelerated while being parked. The man said the spontaneous acceleration caused the car to crash through the garage and into the owner's living room, injuring the driver and a passenger. Tesla calls its Model X "the safest, fastest and most capable" SUV in history.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Emirates receives its first Rolls-Royce powered Airbus A380
article: Dubai-based airline Emirates has received its first Rolls-Royce powered Airbus A380 superjumbo after resolving a dispute with the British engine maker over a technical issue. Rolls-Royce is to supply engines for 50 double-deck Emirates A380 jets in a $9.2 billion deal, which was announced in April 2015. Emirates is the biggest A380 operator, having ordered 142 of the superjumbo jets.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: I-T dept asks car dealers for customer list post note ban
article: The I-T department has issued a notice to car dealers across India asking for a list of customers who bought cars after the demonetisation of high-value currency on November 8. These customers would get notices from January 2017, once the list has been examined by the department. Further, car dealers will have to furnish bank account statements for these transactions.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Parents of car crash victim sue Apple over use of FaceTime
article: Parents of a 5-year-old girl who died in a car accident in 2014 have sued Apple for failing to implement a patented technology that could lock out FaceTime to prevent distracted driving. That patent would prevent users from activating or using FaceTime while driving, utilising a motion and scenery analyser to lock out certain features under certain conditions.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Royal Enfield launches Classic 350 Redditch Series at ₹1.46L
article: Royal Enfield has launched its Classic 350 motorcycle in three Redditch series variants – Red, Green and Blue, in India at ₹1.46 lakh (on-road, Delhi). The series is inspired by 1950’s motorcycles manufactured in Redditch, a UK town known as the birthplace of Royal Enfield motorcycles. Powered by a 346cc Twin spark single cylinder engine, the motorcycle produces 19.8 bhp.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hyundai America fires CEO for not meeting sales goals
article: South Korean car manufacturer Hyundai Motor has fired its America CEO Dave Zuchowski with immediate effect. While the company did not mention the reason for Zuchowski's departure, reports claim that he was sacked over missing the company's internal sales goals. Zuchowski, who earlier worked with Ford and later Mazda, took over as Hyundai's America CEO in 2014.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: 19 people sit inside Tesla Model S to attempt world record
article: As many as 19 people stuffed themselves inside a Tesla Model S sedan to attempt the world record for most people in a smart car at one time. People in the car included a kid, who wasn't counted as all participants require to be 18 years and above. The attempt failed as the existing record is set for 20 people.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Global CEO of Faraday Future quits before debut of 1st car
article: Ding Lei, Global CEO of Tesla's rival electric vehicle startup Faraday Future has quit the Chinese-backed, American start-up technology company days before the debut of its first fully electric production car at Consumer Electronics Show (CES) 2017. Lei is also a top executive at technology firm LeEco and spearheaded its self-driving electric car project, the LeSEE.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Demonetisation has given a severe blow to us, says Toyota
article: Managing Director of Toyota Kirloskar Motor, the Indian subsidiary of the Japanese automaker, Akito Tachibana has said that demonetisation gave a severe blow to Toyota. There has been a downfall of 30-40% post the decision, he stated. Further, India is the most challenging market in the world and 2016 has been the toughest year in India operations, he added.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Volvo's high-end 90 Series cars to have Skype built in
article: Swedish automaker Volvo has announced that it will integrate Microsoft's Skype into its high-end 90 Series cars. Skype will be accessible through a touchscreen on the dashboard which will display a list of scheduled meetings and a shortcut to the user's complete contact list. Volvo is exploring the use of Microsoft's digital assistant Cortana in its cars, including voice recognition.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Google, Fiat Chrysler working on Android car technology
article: Google and Italian carmaker Fiat Chrysler are working on an Android Nougat-based in-car system technology under Google's newly set up self-driving car company Waymo. The new system called Uconnect, includes an 8.4-inch screen for accessing Android apps and in-car controls like air conditioning, heat, and terrestrial radio. The new technology will be on display at CES in a Chrysler 300.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Taxis to overtake private car sales soon: Maruti's Bhargava
article: Maruti Suzuki Chairman RC Bhargava has said the bulk of future vehicle purchases will be in the taxi space and fewer cars will be bought for personal use. The changing car-buying pattern, however, is unlikely to impact sales, Bhargava said. This is positive, as anything that increases efficiency has to be good for the customer and the industry, he added.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla Autopilot applies brake on anticipating highway crash
article: Dashcam footage from a Tesla Model X in the Netherlands shows the car anticipating an accident on the highway and applying brakes to prevent collision. However, the car in front of the Tesla crashes into an SUV seconds later. Tesla's Autopilot software has a radar processing technology, giving the car the ability to see ahead of the car in front.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Volkswagen teases electric car with foldable steering wheel
article: German automaker Volkswagen has teased a new electric car with self-driving capabilities and a steering wheel that retracts into the 'cockpit'. Volkswagen has called the car, which appears to look like a classic microbus, a "multi-functional vehicle for a new era." The vehicle will debut at the North American International Auto Show in Detroit in January 2017.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Volkswagen buys app to let users pay for parking with phones
article: Volkswagen has acquired Canadian digital payments provider PayByPhone to let users pay for parking with a smartphone. PayByPhone is running a pilot program in London in which license plates are connected with user accounts and the user is automatically charged when they leave a parking lot. In 2015, Volkswagen bought a 92% stake in leading German mobile payments firm SunHill.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Hidden Tesla car feature activates Christmas light show
article: Elon Musk has revealed an Easter egg which has been rolled out with the latest software update for its Model X cars that activates their folding Falcon wing doors, fog lights, headlights and more to put up a Christmas-themed light show. The cars also play a holiday soundtrack in sync with the lights.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber launches fleet of electric Tesla cars in Spain
article: Ride-hailing startup Uber has launched a fleet of electric Tesla Model S cars in Madrid, Spain. Uber was banned in the city till March this year and aims to improve its image in the city with the introduction of cleaner cars. The company started trials with fully-electric cars in Portugal and London, earlier this year.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: 2 top executives quit Faraday Future before debut of 1st car
article: Tesla's rival electric vehicle startup Faraday Future has reportedly lost two of its top executives, less than a month before the debut of its first production car at Consumer Electronics Show (CES) 2017. Marco Mattiacci, Chief Brand and Commercial Officer, and Joerg Sommer, VP for Product Marketing and Growth have been removed from the company's website.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: BMW to recall 1.93 lakh cars in China over faulty airbags
article: German automaker BMW will start recalling over 1.93 lakh cars from August 2017 in China over a defect in their airbags. The cars are being recalled as the gas generators inside the inflating airbags may damage and cause flying debris, posing safety risks to the passengers. BMW has promised to replace the defective airbags free of charge.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: New Audi ad shows Barbie doll driving an R8 sports car
article: A new animated advertisement by Audi in Spain aims to tackle gender stereotypes. Titled 'The Doll that Chose to Drive,' the video shows a Barbie doll entering the 'Boys' section of a toy store and driving away in an Audi R8 sports car. The commercial ends with the tagline, 'Let's change the game.'

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Panasonic to invest $256 mn in Tesla's solar cell factory
article: Japanese electronics company Panasonic will invest more than $256 million in a New York production facility owned by Elon Musk's Tesla Motors to make solar cells and panels. Following the announcement, Tesla's shares were up by 3.5% on Tuesday. Panasonic is the exclusive supplier of batteries for Tesla's Model S, Model X, and the upcoming Model 3.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: What were the most expensive cars launched in India in 2016?
article: The most expensive car launched in India this year is the bullet-proof Mercedes-Maybach S600 Guard. Called the "safest luxury spot on earth" by Mercedes, the car is priced at ₹10.5 crore (ex-showroom Delhi). Other cars on the most expensive list include the Audi A8 L Security limousine and soft-top Rolls-Royce Dawn at ₹9.15 crore and ₹6.25 crore respectively.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla rival Lucid Motors' new car travels 640 km per charge
article: Electric vehicle maker Tesla's rival Lucid Motors on Thursday unveiled its first car called the 'Air' which travels over 640 kilometres on a single charge. Powered by a 100 kWh battery, the luxury sedan accelerates from 0-100 kmph in just 2.5 seconds. Founded by former Tesla and BMW executives, Lucid Motors plans to launch the Air in 2018.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: John Abraham gets India's only Nissan GT-R Black Edition
article: Actor and model John Abraham has become the owner of India's only 2017 Nissan GT-R Black Edition car with orange brake calipers and shared a video showing his new ride. The Nissan GT-R was launched earlier this month at ₹1.99 crore for a base model. Powered by a twin-turbo 3.8-litre V6 engine, the car churns out 562 bhp.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: BMW launches six-door Mini Clubman in India at ₹37.90 lakh
article: BMW-owned British carmaker Mini has launched its six-door Clubman in India at ₹37.90 lakh (ex-showroom, New Delhi). Powered by a 2.0-litre turbocharged petrol engine, the Mini Clubman churns out 189 bhp, has a top speed of 228 kmph, and accelerates from 0-100 kmph in 7.2 seconds. The four-seater Clubman is one of the longest models in the British carmaker's lineup.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Blind man was first to get ride in Google's self-driving car
article: Google recently launched 'Waymo', a company for its self-driving vehicle division. Steve Mahan, a legally blind man from California, was among the first members of public to get a ride in Google’s self-driving car prototype in 2015 without a Google engineer onboard to take over the wheel if needed. Google is working to develop self-driving cars with Fiat Chrysler.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Why do we need self-driving permit but not Tesla, asks Uber
article: Uber has responded to California regulators' order to stop its self-driving taxi service in San Francisco by asking why it is required to get a permit while Tesla's autopilot technology does not need one. The multi-billion dollar startup has argued that its self-driving cars don't need the permit since there is always a human driver behind the wheel.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Google sets up separate self-driving car company 'Waymo'
article: Google on Wednesday announced to set up a separate company focused on its self-driving car push called 'Waymo', which derives its name from Google's mission of finding new way forward in mobility. The independent company will work within the Alphabet umbrella, where Google was also moved last year. Google's self-driving car project was started in 2009.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Faraday Future sued for $10 mn for late payments to supplier
article: Tesla's rival Faraday Future has been sued for $10 million by its supplier named Futuris over late payments. Futuris alleged that Faraday owes it $10 million, of which the payment of $7 million is more than 30 days late. A warehouse owner has also sued Faraday claiming that the company owes it over $100,000 in missed payments.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Nano serious drain on Tata Motors financial resources: Wadia
article: Tata Motors board's independent Director Nusli Wadia in a letter to shareholders said that Nano, a car that was initially priced at ₹1 lakh, has proved to be a serious drain on the company's financial resources. "Even now, when it sells at ₹2.25 lakh, its sale is at a substantial loss to the company," Wadia added.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Porsche wishes Audi on exit from endurance racing in video
article: Porsche has thanked corporate sibling Audi "for all the tough fights" in Le Mans endurance car racing in a video. In October, Audi announced its exit from the World Endurance Championship after an 18-year run, including 13 victories at Le Mans. Audi reportedly withdrew from the championship as parent Volkswagen has been facing increased costs due to Dieselgate emissions scandal.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: New JLR system prevents doors from crashing into objects
article: British carmaker Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) has developed a new technology to prevent the doors of a car from crashing into nearby objects when opened. The system uses existing car sensors to detect approaching cyclists or to measure how far a door can be opened to prevent denting. The system can also help while parking the car in tight spaces.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: How do self-driving cars work?
article: Self-driving cars are those which can drive themselves without assistance from a human driver. Such vehicles are equipped with digital cameras, lasers and radar sensors which are embedded around the car, giving it a 360° view of its surroundings. Visual images are converted into code for the car's systems to interpret to control the steering, braking, and throttle.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Why did the shape of cars change from being boxy to curvy?
article: Cars made in the 1970s had boxy designs with sharp edges, while those from the 1990s had curvier, smoother exteriors. This change was caused by a push for fuel efficiency and new technologies that allowed manufacturers to create curved shapes easily. Curved exteriors make the cars less wind resistant, thereby requiring less fuel to travel the same distance.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: BMW concept shows floating touch-sensitive display in cars
article: German luxury vehicle manufacturing company BMW has unveiled the concept for a virtual touchscreen that appears to be floating inside the car. The display will show the driver information about music and navigation among other things. BMW has said the floating display will give drivers the sensation of physical touch to avoid distracting them from the road.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber ordered to stop self-driving cabs on day of launch
article: Uber has been ordered by regulators to stop testing its self-driving cabs in San Francisco after they were launched on Wednesday. Uber was asked to secure the necessary permit that allows companies to test autonomous vehicles on public roads. However, Uber claims it doesn't need the permit as there is always a standby human driver present in its self-driving cabs.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber's self-driving cabs start picking San Francisco riders
article: Uber on Wednesday expanded the pilot of its self-driving taxi service to San Francisco, its second location. The self-driving Volvo XC90 SUVs with a spinning LIDAR sensor and rooftop cameras will be offered to UberX riders. The cars will have a safety driver and Uber test engineer onboard to monitor the rides and take control of the wheel if required.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber's self-driving car runs red light on day of launch
article: One of Uber's self-driving taxis was caught running a red light on Wednesday, the same day the service was launched in San Francisco. However, the ride-hailing service has blamed the incident on the human driver who sat behind the wheel of the autonomous car to take control if required. Uber added that it has suspended the driver involved.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Google stops development of own self-driving car: Report
article: Google has reportedly cancelled plans to develop its own self-driving vehicles and will instead pursue partnerships with existing car makers to possibly launch an autonomous ride-sharing service. Google's existing autonomous car fleet consists of Lexus SUVs and two-person pod cars. The company also partnered with Fiat Chrysler earlier this year to produce self-driving minivans.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber admits its self-driving cars took dangerous turns
article: Uber has admitted that there's a problem with the way its self-driving cars cross bike lanes in San Francisco, that the advocates fear could have deadly consequences for cyclists. An Uber spokeswoman said engineers are working to fix the flaw in self-driving programming. On the first day of its launch in the city, an Uber car jumped the red light.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla's emergency braking system prevents serious accident
article: The automatic emergency braking of a Tesla Model X electric car recently helped in preventing a potentially serious accident. The car, which was not on Autopilot or semi-autonomous mode, used its sensors and radar to determine an accident was imminent before sounding the alarm and applying the brakes.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Hyundai to hike prices of all models by up to ₹1 lakh
article: Automaker Hyundai India on Tuesday said it will hike prices of all its models by up to ₹1 lakh from January 2017 to offset higher input costs, fluctuating exchange rates and marketing expenses. Citing similar reasons, Nissan Motor India also said that it will increase prices of its vehicles by up to ₹30,000 from next month.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Porsche race car Technical Director joins Apple: Reports
article: Apple reportedly poached the Technical Director of Porsche's race car program Alexander Hitzinger earlier this year. Hitzinger's LinkedIn profile says he left Porsche to join "a technology company" as an engineering executive. Earlier this month, Apple had revealed its plan to make autonomous vehicles in a letter asking regulators to impose fewer restrictions on developers of self-driving cars.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Mercedes launches car-sharing service open to all brands
article: Mercedes-Benz has launched a peer-to-peer car-sharing service called 'Croove' in Munich that lets owners of any car put their vehicle on rent. The Croove app instructs owners on how to price rent, and lets renters find a car that suits their needs. For the duration of the rental, the cars will be insured for up to ₹7 crore.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: Faraday Future prototype races Bentley, Ferrari and Tesla
article: Electric car manufacturer Faraday Future has released a video clip in which a prototype of its electric car EV is seen racing Tesla's Model X P100D, Bentley's Bentayga SUV and Ferrari's 488 GTB. The Faraday Future prototype managed to beat each of its opponents in the one-on-one drag races held at California's Irwindale Event Center.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Tata Motors to hike passenger car prices by up to ₹25,000
article: Auto major Tata Motors on Monday said that it will hike prices of its passenger vehicles by up to ₹25,000 in order to offset increased input costs. The company will be increasing prices of its passenger vehicles starting from ₹5,000 up to ₹25,000, depending on the model, Tata Motors said. The increase will be effective from January 1, 2017.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Google's Waymo unveils fleet of self-driving hybrid minivans
article: Waymo, Google's new autonomous vehicle company, has unveiled a fleet of 100 Fiat Chrysler Pacifica minivans. The hybrid cars can go about 48 km in pure electric mode and are fitted with custom computers, sensors and telematics used on Google's Lexus SUV and other self-driving cars. The vehicles will debut on public roads in 2017.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: In Pictures: Ferrari Challenge World Finals 2016
article: From December 1 to 4, Ferrari held its annual Finali Mondiali (World Finals) event in Florida's Daytona, the first time in North America, with Ferrari Challenge finalists from around the world competing in the event. There were also demonstrations of past F1 cars, and the last Ferrari LaFerrari ever built was auctioned to help victims of the recent Italy earthquakes.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hyperloop to reduce Pune-Mumbai travel time to 25 minutes
article: US-based high-speed transportation system Hyperloop, if introduced in India, will reduce the travel time between Pune to Mumbai to only 25 minutes, according to company's Chairman Bibop G Gresta. "You can live in Pune and work in Mumbai or vice-versa," said Gresta. The Hyperloop proposal is with Union transport minister Nitin Gadkari for its feasibility evaluation in the country.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: What is Hyperloop transportation and how does it work?
article: American startup Hyperloop Transportation Technologies is developing a high-speed transportation system including vacuum tube trains traveling at speeds up to 1,200 kmph. It claims to cover the distance of 328 kilometres between Washington DC and New York in 30 minutes. The system includes self-driving cars to pick and drop passengers from their location to Hyperloop stations and vice-versa.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Volvo to make world's largest bus to carry 300 passengers
article: Swedish automobile company Volvo has unveiled the world's largest bus chassis called the 'Gran Artic 300', which is 30 metres long and can carry up to 300 passengers. The new bus has been designed for Brazil's BRT system, a transportation system where buses run on dedicated lanes. One biarticulated bus of the model replaces three standard buses.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup's electric truck travels 1930 km on one charge
article: US-based electric vehicle startup Nikola has unveiled its new hydrogen fuel cell powered 'Nikola One' semi-truck that claims to travel 1930 kilometres on a single charge. The truck's navigation system will determine the most effective route between destinations. Nikola has also announced plans to build stations to refuel its new trucks, that will be launched in 2020.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Vijay Mallya owns 21 luxury cars, claim hackers
article: Liquor baron Vijay Mallya, whose Twitter account was hacked earlier on Friday, owns at least 21 luxury cars, the hackers claimed in a list tweeted through Mallya's account. The list includes cars from brands including BMW, Ferrari, Jaguar, Mercedes, Porsche, Rolls-Royce and others. Besides the list, various email addresses of Mallya with their passwords were also made public.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: BMW remotely locks sleeping thief inside stolen car
article: US police successfully caught a man who had stolen a BMW car by trapping him inside the car with the carmaker's help. After the owner reported the car missing, the police got in touch with BMW to locate the vehicle and remotely lock its doors. The thief was found sleeping inside the stolen vehicle with a small amount of meth.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Fiat heir arrested for faking own kidnapping
article: Lapo Elkann, the grandson of late Fiat patriarch Gianni Agnelli, was arrested in New York last weekend for faking his own kidnapping. The 39-year-old allegedly called his family and told them he was being held against his will in Manhattan and needed $10,000 to be released. Elkann was later found to have spent the weekend consuming drugs with an escort.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: One-off Pagani Zonda supercar crashes in Japan
article: A custom-made Pagani Zonda supercar reportedly crashed with a Maybach 62S in Tokyo, Japan earlier this week. The purple Pagani Zonda Zozo was commissioned by Japanese billionaire and Founder of online fashion retail website Zozotown, Yusaku Maezawa. Powered by a 7.3-litre V12 engine, the model delivers 760 horsepower with a reported top speed of 345 kmph.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Donald Trump names General Motors CEO to his advisory panel
article: US President-elect Donald Trump has named General Motors CEO Mary Barra to his economic and job-creation panel. The panel, set to meet for the first time in February, consists of CEOs from JPMorgan Chase, Walt Disney, Boeing, and other companies. Barra is one of the only two women on the panel, the other being IBM CEO Ginni Rometty.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Mercedes unveils headlights that can project images on road
article: Mercedes-Benz has unveiled a headlight system called 'Digital Light' that can project HD images onto the road. The headlights can display navigation directions or the width of the car when trying to squeeze through a gap. The system uses computer chips and mirrors to display the images and can adapt to its environment to adjust the brightness of the beam.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: 120 BMW cars damaged after train carrying vehicles derails
article: German vehicle manufacturing company BMW has confirmed that 120 of its cars were damaged on Sunday after a train carrying the vehicles derailed in the US. The train was carrying X model cars from an auto-making plant in South Carolina. Two locomotives and 12 train cars were also damaged, but no human injury was reported.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Ola may deploy 1 million electric cars, says Masayoshi Son
article: Ola investor SoftBank's Founder and CEO Masayoshi Son has said that the ride-hailing startup may introduce a fleet of one million electric cars. The vehicles will be locally manufactured to support the government's 'Make in India' campaign, he added. SoftBank has already invested $2 billion in Indian startups like Ola, Snapdeal, Oyo Rooms, and Grofers among others.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Last LaFerrari ever made to be auctioned for charity
article: Ferrari has announced that it will auction off the last LaFerrari supercar ever made to raise money for earthquake relief in Central Italy. While only 499 hybrid coupes were initially planned, Ferrari will make one more for the auction. Powered by a 6.3-litre V12 engine and an electric motor, the car delivers 950bhp at a top speed of 350 kmph.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Audi technology lets cars communicate with traffic lights
article: Audi has unveiled a system that transmits information from traffic lights to compatible Audi cars over a 4G connection. The system lets drivers see how long it will take red lights on their route to turn green or how fast to go to hit more green lights. Further, engines could be programmed to start immediately as the light turns green.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: Mercedes releases new ad seeking Formula One driver
article: Mercedes is running an advertisement seeking a replacement for the newly-retired Formula One world champion Nico Rosberg. "Ideally, you will have a proven track record in skills including steering, braking and in particular, accelerating. Possession of an FIA Super Licence will be an advantage," reads the ad. Rosberg announced his retirement last Friday, after winning his maiden F1 title.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: George Hotz makes code behind self-driving project public
article: George Hotz, the hacker known for unlocking the first iPhone, has publicly released the self-driving car software developed by his startup, which he called an "open source alternative to Tesla's Autopilot." Hotz recently cancelled his startup's $999 kit which could be fitted into cars to turn them self-driving as he did not want to "deal with regulators" in the US.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Honda's new electric vehicle to respond to driver's emotions
article: Japanese automaker Honda has claimed that its new electric vehicle concept called 'NeuV' will have an 'emotion engine' that will allow the car to react to its owner's conversations and emotions. The engine integrates artificial intelligence to help the owner make a bond with the vehicle. The concept will be showcased by Honda at consumer technology show CES next year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Apple letter reveals its self-driving car plans
article: In a letter to US National Highway Traffic Safety Administration, technology giant Apple has acknowledged that it is excited about automation in numerous fields, including transportation. Apple added that it wants to test its self-driving car technology and address to both the ethical and regulatory issues. The company has confirmed investing heavily in machine learning and autonomous systems.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Lexus covers car with 42,000 LEDs that respond to music
article: Japanese automaker Toyota's luxury car division Lexus has covered one of its cars in 41,999 programmable LED lights that change colour on owner's gestures and respond to the music being played. The hand-placed LEDs, if placed end-to-end, would stretch at least 800 metres in length. However, the LED-lit car cannot be purchased as it has just been made for display.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Porsche tells how to pronounce its name in new video
article: German sports car company Porsche, which was founded back in 1931, has released a video that tells how to correctly pronounce the company's name. The video tells that Porsche is a two syllable word, that is often mistaken as one. Porsche was named after automotive engineer Ferdinand Porsche, who founded the company and later worked for Adolf Hitler.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Ford, Toyota found guilty of anti-competitive activity
article: The Competition Appellate Tribunal (COMPAT) has upheld Competition Commission's (CCI) order that found automakers Ford, Nissan, and Toyota guilty of anti-competitive practices in the spare parts market. The COMPAT also imposed a 2% penalty on the companies' average annual turnover from spare parts for the three years preceding 2011, the year when the inquiry into the issue had started.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Ferrari to stop selling its retired F1 cars
article: Ferrari has announced the end of its 'Corse Clienti' program that allowed select customers to purchase its retired Formula One cars. It also offered owners a chance to drive the F1 cars at circuits around the world with a full team of mechanics. The cars built for 2014 and onwards will not be sold as they are "difficult to maintain."

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Tata Motors suffered from legacy products: Mistry
article: Some “legacy” passenger cars in Tata Motors product portfolio had a "large negative contribution" on the brand perception, ousted Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry has said. Further, the automaker also suffered due to quality and service responsiveness issues, Mistry added. Notably, Mistry had earlier said the loss-making Tata Nano project was not shut down because of emotional reasons.

author: Mriganka Sen
abstract: Last LaFerrari auctioned for ₹47 cr to help quake victims
article: The last new LaFerrari supercar ever made was on Saturday auctioned off for more than ₹47 crore to rebuild the parts of central Italy affected by series of earthquakes. The supercar has become the most valuable 21st-century automobile ever sold at an auction. Notably, a new LaFerrari costs a little over ₹10.2 crore.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Honda Cars sales fall by 20-30% after demonetisation
article: The India arm of Japan's Honda Motor has reported a 20-30% fall in car sales in the retail market since November 9. Honda Cars India senior VP Raman Kumar Sharma said that he doesn't expect retrenchment in the sector as "things are going to improve shortly." Two-wheeler sales are picking up and auto sales will gather steam shortly, he added.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Volkswagen launches mobility service start-up MOIA
article: German carmaker Volkswagen on Monday unveiled its new mobility brand MOIA under which it plans to focus on ride-hailing, autonomous driving and electric cars in European cities from next year. This comes amid Volkswagen's attempt to become a leading on-demand transport service provider. The business could reportedly generate revenues worth $2.1 billion by decade end.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: BMW expands its venture capital fund 5-fold to ₹3,627 crore
article: BMW is increasing the size of its venture capital fund, BMW i Ventures, nearly fivefold to $530 million (₹3,627 crore) from around $106 million (₹725 crore), according to a German business daily. The fund has been focussed on themes such as electric mobility and mobility services, and plans to expand to autonomous driving, digitalisation, cloud services and artificial intelligence.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Big Dog Motorcycles debuts India with a ₹59 lakh bike
article: America's Big Dog Motorcycles has made its debut in India by launching its K9 Red Chopper-111 motorbike priced at ₹59 lakh (ex-showroom Delhi). The 10-foot long bike is powered by an 1807cc 45-degree V-twin engine. No two bikes by the company will be the same in India as it makes only custom bikes.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Apple takeover talks didn't go anywhere, says McLaren CEO
article: McLaren's CEO Mike Flewitt in a recent interview revealed that the company was in talks with technology giant Apple for a takeover, but it never reached a stage where Apple made a bid. He said, "They visited. We talked. We talked about what they did. We talked about what we did. They toured. It never matured to a definitive proposition".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Indian Motorcycle launches new bike in India at ₹31.99 lakh
article: American bike manufacturer Indian Motorcycle has launched its 'Chieftain Dark Horse' bike in India at a starting price of ₹31.99 lakh (ex-showroom Delhi). Powered by a Thunder Stroke 111 1811cc V-twin engine, the motorcycle comes with a solo seat and hard bags on both the sides. It will be available in the country in its signature black matte colour.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: New electric car goes 0-100 kmph in 2.7 seconds
article: Chinese startup NextEV has unveiled its first electric car 'NIO EP9' which accelerates from 0-100 kmph in only 2.7 seconds. Powered by four electric motors, the car generates 1,360 hp and has a top speed of 314 kmph. Only six units of the car have been made, which are already bought by the startup's founders at ₹8.1 crore each.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Hero Bicycles unveils electric assist cycle at ₹42,000
article: Bicycle manufacturer Hero Cycles on Thursday unveiled a new brand in India called 'Lectro' which offers a range of electric bikes with pedal assistance, priced between ₹42,000 and ₹83,000. The cycles, with a top speed of 25 kmph, have a detachable battery that can be charged in around 4 hours to travel 50 km.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Australian team unveils pod design at Hyperloop competition
article: VicHyper from Australia, one of the 30 teams selected through Elon Musk-led SpaceX's competition to develop a viable high-speed Hyperloop transport system, has unveiled the design for its pod vehicles. The pod will head to California for testing by SpaceX in January, 2017. The Hyperloop system will reportedly have a top speed of 1,200 kmph.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Rolls-Royce’s engines not up to standard, says Emirates
article: The world’s biggest long-haul airline Emirates said it is unhappy with the performance shortfalls affecting $6.1 billion worth of Rolls-Royce engines it ordered. "We have a new engine coming on and there are some issues with that...We want the engines as promised in the contract," President Tim Clark said. The engines would power a batch of 50 Airbus A380 jets.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla invites people to swap cars with Model S for 1 week
article: Electric carmaker Tesla has launched a 'Drive to Believe' challenge in European markets that will let selected people exchange their cars with Tesla's Model S for one week. According to the company, "It takes driving a Tesla and experiencing its superior performance, safety, and technology to be convinced." Model S claims a range of up to 572 km per charge.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Chinese company made staff jump in front of self-driving car
article: Chinese technology major Baidu made some of its engineers jump in front of an autonomous car in motion, as revealed by Baidu CEO Robin Li in a speech. The company undertook the stunt to demonstrate the ability of its driverless cars to prevent collisions. Although the car stopped in time, Li said he "felt it was a little risky."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber-owned startup ran driverless truck without license
article: Self-driving technology startup Otto, which demonstrated a driverless truck in Nevada and got acquired by Uber, did not have a license for autonomous testing and knowingly broke the traffic rules, according to an investigative study. However, Otto didn't face any consequences as the current rules don't punish violations. Amendments to the current regulations could introduce penalties only by 2017.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Man crashes car during auto show, injures eight people
article: A 24-year-old man crashed a Fiat 500 electric vehicle into a concrete pot, which broke and injured eight people during a test drive at the Los Angeles Auto Show on Tuesday. While no one sustained life-threatening injuries, six people were hospitalised, including the driver. The driver reportedly did not have a valid driving license.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Trump is a game changer for auto industry, says Fiat CEO
article: Italian automaker Fiat's CEO Sergio Marchionne has said, Donald Trump's election as the US President is "a game changer" for the auto industry. "I think that there are a number of conditions in US which are not yet spelled out," added Marchionne. Trump called for 35% tariff on products made by companies which are moving production out of the US.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: 7 Maruti models in 10 best selling passenger vehicles in Oct
article: Seven of Maruti Suzuki India's passenger vehicle models have featured among the top 10 selling brands in October. Further, Maruti’s Alto retained the first position with 18,854 units during the period under review, according to the Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers' data. Further, Renault’s entry-level model Kwid and Honda Car's mid-sized sedan City also featured among the top 10.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Singapore tests self-driving scooters for pedestrians
article: Singapore-based researchers are testing self-driving scooters to curb accidents involving pedestrians who are on their phones. The one-seater weighs 50 kg and travels at a top speed of 6 kmph. The scooters move along a predefined route on footpaths and make use of laser sensors to navigate around obstacles and avoid collisions.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: BMW cancels self-driving car project with China's Baidu
article: BMW and Chinese technology major Baidu have called off their partnership to develop self-driving cars. "We have now found that the development pace and ideas of the two companies are a little different," said BMW's China CEO Olaf Kastner. Baidu had been using BMW 3 sedans for on-road tests in China, but will use Ford's Lincoln for its US testing.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: In pictures: Cars at the Los Angeles Auto Show 2016
article: A number of cars including electric vehicles were showcased at the annual Los Angeles Auto Show, which took place from November 18-27. While Bentley, Bugatti, Ferrari, McLaren, and Rolls-Royce skipped the show, Jaguar, Alfa Romeo, Lamborghini, and Mercedes participated in the show. A Chinese startup unveiled electric car 'Nio EP9', which accelerates from 0-100 kmph in 2.7 seconds.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Intel forms a dedicated self-driving car technology unit
article: World's largest chip maker Intel has formed a new unit called 'Autonomous Driving Group' dedicated to self-driving car technology. Intel recently announced that it’s making $250 million bet on self-driving technology via its Intel Capital investment arm. Autonomous driving will only be a part of the new vertical as Intel will also focus on driver assist technologies.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla's 'instant' acceleration avoids rear-end accident
article: A video captured by a Tesla Model S P85D's rear-mounted dashcam shows how the car's 'instant torque' feature helped avoid a rear-end collision. The video shows a speeding Toyota Prius coming from behind the stopped Tesla car. Through the ability of Tesla's electric motors to speed up instantly, the driver was able to accelerate before the Prius collided into it.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Maserati to launch its first electric car in 2020
article: Italian luxury vehicle manufacturer Maserati has announced to launch its first all-electric car in 2020. It will be an electric version of its two-seater sports car Alfieri, which is scheduled to launch in 2019. Maserati's electric car would not rival Elon Musk-led Tesla's Model S, but instead will be a grand-touring coupe.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Volkswagen set to cut 30,000 jobs after emissions scandal
article: German automaker Volkswagen has reached an agreement with workers to cut up to 30,000 jobs globally and save $3.9 billion in expenses as it deals with its emissions-cheating scandal, reports said. “This is a big step forward, maybe the biggest in the company’s history,” brand chief Herbert Diess said. Earlier, Volkswagen admitted that it rigged fuel emission tests since 2009.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Video shows how a Tesla car drives itself
article: Elon Musk-led electric car making startup Tesla has released a video which shows how it looks like from the inside of a car when it fully drives itself. While the car's steering can be seen moving on its own, three different camera views show the car detecting lanes, people, traffic lights, other cars, signs and houses on the road.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Volkswagen to cut spending over next four years
article: Volkswagen has said it will reduce capital expenditure to 6% of automotive sales by 2020 from 6.9% last year. This comes as the German automaker looks to fund its strategic shift to electric cars apart from reeling with the cost of the emissions scandal. Volkswagen has also announced 30,000 job cuts which could save the carmaker around $3.9 billion.

author: Sanira Mediratta
abstract: Largest collection of model cars has over 37,000 pieces
article: Nabil "Billy" Karam from Lebanon, who has 37,777 toy cars, recently established the Guinness World Record for the 'largest collection of model cars'. The former racing driver broke his own record set in 2011, by adding 10,000 model cars since then. He also has the record for the 'largest collection of dioramas', meaning miniature exhibits, which includes 577 items.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: BlackBerry starts testing self-driving cars in Canada
article: Canada has started testing its first self-driving cars developed by technology company BlackBerry. The pilot program also includes cars made by automaker Erwin Hymer Group and the University of Waterloo. The project will test the vehicles at various stages of automation in varying weather conditions and road qualities found in Canada's most populated province, Ontario.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Electric carmaker raises ₹9 crore through crowdfunding
article: Sweden-based startup Uniti has raised nearly ₹9 crore ($1.3 million) through a crowdfunding campaign for its three-wheeled electric vehicle. The two-seater cars, which will cost about ₹14.8 lakh each, claim a top speed of 130 kmph and a range of 150 km on a single charge. The car aims to rival Renault and Nissan's electric vehicles.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: 4-year-old boy test drives McLaren's electric car
article: British sports carmaker McLaren has shared a video of a four-year-old boy test driving its fully electric 'McLaren P1' car for kids. The open-top car can accelerate from 0 kmph to a top speed of 4.8 kmph in two seconds. Priced at nearly ₹32,000, the car comes with an MP3 player pre-loaded with popular nursery rhymes.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Video shows the evolution of the F1 steering wheel
article: A three-minute video describes the evolution of Formula One car steering wheels from the 1950s to the present day. It highlights the transition from traditional wood and aluminium wheels to the modern angular, carbon-fibre 'controller' with hand-clutch and gear-shifting, programmable switches and LCD display. Wheels used by F1 legends Ayrton Senna and Michael Schumacher have also been featured.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Mercedes S 500 convertible launched in India at ₹2.25 crore
article: German automaker Mercedes-Benz has launched the S 500 Cabriolet in India at a price of ₹2.25 crore (ex-showroom, New Delhi). The luxury car, equipped with a 4.7-litre, V8 bi-turbo petrol engine, can go from 0-100 kmph in 4.6 seconds and has a top speed of 250 kmph. The company also presented its C-300 Cabriolet, which is priced at ₹60 lakh.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: India's cheapest Porsche launched at ₹76.84 lakh
article: German car maker Porsche on Tuesday launched the 'Macan R4' SUV in India at ₹76.84 lakh (ex-showroom, Maharashtra), making it the cheapest Porsche vehicle available in the country. Powered by a 2.0-litre petrol engine, the car generates 252 horsepower, accelerates from 0-100 kmph in 6.7 seconds and has a top speed of 229 kmph.

author: Ankur Vyas
abstract: Centre proposes making airbags mandatory in all vehicles
article: The Centre has proposed making it mandatory for manufacturers to provide airbags, rear-view sensors and speed warning systems in all new vehicles from October 2017. The Road Transport and Highways Ministry in a draft notification also proposed the setting up of its own safety authority, the Bharat National Car Assessment Programme (NCAP), which will rate vehicles on safety.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Vespa launches scooter priced at ₹12 lakh in India
article: Italian two-wheeler brand Piaggio on Tuesday launched the 'Vespa 946 Emporio Armani Edition' in India at ₹12,04,970 (ex-showroom, Pune) to mark the 40th anniversary of fashion brand Giorgio Armani. The Vespa 946 Emporio Armani, which is the second most expensive scooter in India, is powered by a 125cc single-cylinder engine that generates 11.7 bhp of power.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Man drives Mini Cooper on side wheels for 20 km
article: A world record-holding Chinese driver named Yue Han, recently completed the Nordschleife lap in Germany's Nürburgring racing complex entirely on the left two wheels of a Mini Cooper. The feat involved negotiating 73 corners and a 300-metre difference in elevation over a 20.8-km track. Han finished the task in a record 46 minutes, averaging a speed of around 27 kmph.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jaguar unveils its first ever electric car
article: Jaguar Land Rover's luxury arm Jaguar on Monday unveiled the 'I-PACE' SUV, the company's first ever all-electric vehicle. Powered by a 90 kilowatt-hour lithium-ion battery pack, it generates 400 horsepower and accelerates from 0-100 kmph in 4 seconds. Aimed to travel about 354 kilometres on one charge, the car is scheduled to launch in 2018.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Indian Motorcycle launches new tourer bike at ₹31 lakh
article: The owner of Indian Motorcycle brand, Polaris India on Thursday launched the Indian Springfield tourer bike in India at ₹31.07 lakh (ex-showroom, Gurugram). Powered by a Thunder Stroke 1811cc engine, it generates 138.9 Nm torque at 2,600 rpm. The bike can be converted from a tourer into a cruiser by removing the quick-release windshield and saddlebags.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Volkswagen admits Audi also had emissions cheating software
article: German carmaker Volkswagen has admitted that automatic Audi cars have technology that can distort or cheat emissions when they are tested. Volkswagen-owned carmakers Audi and Porsche vehicles have been proved to emit up to nine times legally allowable pollution levels. In one of the biggest automobile scandals, Volkswagen had admitted fitting emissions cheating devices in 11 million of its cars.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup unveils 3D printed bike 50% lighter than other bikes
article: US-based startup Divergent 3D has unveiled a 3D printed bike at the ongoing Los Angeles Auto Show, which it claims to be 50% lighter than traditional bikes. While the bike's chassis is 3D printed, its motor has been borrowed from a Kawasaki H2 supercharged sportbike. Last year, the startup unveiled a 3D printed supercar called 'Blade'.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Samsung buys Harman for $8 bn to enter smart car market
article: South Korean electronics maker Samsung on Monday bought Harman, a US-based auto and audio product making company, for $8 billion in an all-cash deal. The move will help Samsung in its plan to enter the smart car market. Samsung said this is the largest ever overseas deal by a single South Korean company.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Pawan Goenka elevated to Managing Director of Mahindra
article: India's largest utility vehicle manufacturer Mahindra & Mahindra on Friday said Executive Director Pawan Goenka has been elevated to the position of Managing Director, and Anand Mahindra was redesignated as the Executive Chairman. This is in line with the practice followed by Mahindra Group companies, where the position of Managing Director is kept distinct from the Chairman, the automaker said.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Audi builds Final Fantasy-themed car for ₹3.16 crore
article: Audi has built a ₹3.16-crore limited edition R8 sports car based on Final Fantasy, a science fiction video game. Powered by a 5.2-litre V10 engine, it delivers 610 horsepower, accelerates from 0-100 kmph in 3.2 seconds, and has a top speed of 330 kmph. Only one unit of the car has been made, which will be sold through lottery.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Toyota agrees to ₹22k cr settlement in US class action suit
article: Toyota Motor has agreed to a settlement of up to $3.4 billion (over ₹22,000 crore) for a class action suit filed by the US owners of pickup trucks and SUVs. The settlement covers about 1.5 million vehicles which have allegedly received inadequate rust protection. This could lead to corrosion serious enough to jeopardize the car's structural integrity, court papers stated.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Lexus unveils spaceship designed for upcoming movie
article: Lexus, the luxury vehicle division of Japanese automaker Toyota, has unveiled its design for a spaceship called 'Skyjet' for the upcoming science fiction movie 'Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets' starring Cara Delevingne. The Skyjet is a 28th-century single-seat pursuit   craft and features Lexus' "spindle" grille with the headlight design of the 2018 Lexus LC coupe.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Volkswagen claims 'defeat device' is legal in EU
article: German automaker Volkswagen has claimed that the software allowing its diesel vehicles to evade emission rules does not violate European law. "The software represents no unlawful defeat device under EU law...there's no question of manipulation," said Volkswagen. The company had agreed to a $16.5 billion settlement in the US last year for fitting the 'defeat device' in 11 million vehicles.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: In photos: Mini unveils its first ever plug-in hybrid model
article: British automaker Mini on Wednesday unveiled 'Countryman S E', its first petrol-electric plug-in hybrid model. The 3-cylinder petrol engine and electric motor together produce a total output of 224 hp. Based on parent company BMW's all electric eDrive technology, the electric mode alone will have a top speed of 125 kmph with a range of 40 kilometres on a charge.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Porsche opens ₹406-cr experience center with racetrack in LA
article: German automobile manufacturer Porsche has opened a ₹406-crore experience center in Los Angeles, which has a racetrack where the company's customers can drive their cars. The racetrack has two circuits with a total of eight different training modules, a racecar exhibition, and a high-end restaurant. Besides Porsche's existing owners, visitors are also allowed for a 90-minute driving session.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: 50% of all new Jaguar Land Rover cars to be electric by 2020
article: Jaguar Land Rover CEO Ralf Speth has said that half of the company's new vehicles will be offered with the hybrid or electric option by 2020. "We are developing our own approach to autonomy, connectivity and electrification," he said. The Tata Motors-owned automaker recently unveiled its first all-electric Jaguar I-PACE SUV concept at the Los Angeles Auto Show.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Audi R8 Exclusive Edition gets laser beam headlights
article: German automobile manufacturer Audi is launching an Exclusive Edition of its R8 coupe in the US, which comes with laser beam headlights. A converter adjusts the 450-nanometer laser into visible light that fires up above 64 kmph. The edition will be available to only 25 consumers in the US.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: In Pictures: Mercedes-Maybach S 650 convertible
article: German automobile manufacturer Mercedes-Benz has revealed its limited edition Mercedes-Maybach S 650 convertible. Powered by a 6.0-litre engine, the car produces 621 horsepower with a reported top speed of about 250 kmph. The company will sell only 300 units of the car, along with a travel luggage set matching its interiors, at $323,000 (approx ₹2.2 crore).

author: Sanira Mediratta
abstract: World's smallest roadworthy car is 63.5 centimetres tall
article: The world's smallest roadworthy car has a height of 63.5 centimetres, a width of  65.41 centimetres and is 126.47 centimetres long, as per Guinness World Records. The car is licenced to be driven on public roads with a speed limit of 40 km/h. Created by Austin Coulson from the US, it was measured in Texas on September 7, 2012.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Volkswagen to fix, buyback 80,000 cars over emissions scam
article: Volkswagen has reached an agreement with US regulators for a mix of buybacks and fixes for around 80,000 polluting Audi, Porsche, and Volkswagen 3.0-litre vehicles, reports stated. The German automaker had reached a separate $10.03-billion buyback offer for 4.75 lakh 2.0-litre vehicles in June. Notably, the carmaker has already agreed to spend up to $16.5 billion over the emissions scandal.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Honda to produce 80 business jets annually by March 2019
article: Japan-based carmaker Honda expects to produce 80 business jets annually by March 2019 from up to 36 currently, Honda Aircraft Company CEO Michimasa Fujino has said. The company began deliveries of its $4.5 million jets in December and says it has received around 100 orders so far. Notably, Honda is Japan's first automaker to develop aircraft globally.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Mahindra's net profit up 21.78% in September quarter
article: Country’s biggest utility vehicle maker Mahindra and Mahindra has reported a 21.78% year-on-year increase in its standalone net profit, which stood at ₹1,163.27 crore for the September quarter. Mahindra's revenue also surged 14.98% from the year-ago period to ₹11,166.22 crore, owing to new launches and better monsoon. The domestic sales of its utility vehicles also rose 15.6% during the quarter.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Volkswagen being probed for destroying documents
article: The US Federal Trade Commission has said that it has been investigating whether Volkswagen destroyed documents related to the emissions cheating scandal. The German automaker had admitted in September 2015 that it installed a secret software in its diesel cars to cheat exhaust emissions tests. Volkswagen has agreed to spend up to $16.5 billion to date, over the scandal.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Auto industry can contribute over 12% to India's GDP: Maruti
article: Indian automobile industry can contribute over 12% to the country’s GDP and generate around 6.5 crore additional jobs over the next decade, a top Maruti Suzuki India official said on Wednesday. Currently, the automobile industry is contributing 7.1% to the GDP of India and around 3.2 crore people are employed directly and indirectly by the sector, he added.

author: Nissan
abstract: Nissan launches Terrano AMT starting at ₹13.75 lakh
article: Auto major Nissan has launched an all-new 6-Speed Advanced Auto Drive variant of Terrano SUV at a starting price of ₹13.75 lakh (ex-showroom, Delhi). It features a 1.5-litre diesel engine, generating 110 PS of power and 248 NM of torque leading to an efficient fuel efficiency of 19.61 Kmpl. The result is smooth, computer-controlled gearshifts for a stress-free drive.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Off-road car concept without wheels unveiled
article: South Korean carmaker Hyundai's subsidiary Kia Motors recently unveiled an off-road SUV named 'Sorento Ski Gondola', which has triangular tanks tracks instead of wheels. It combines all-terrain capabilities and autonomous technology, allowing users to control the vehicle via a tablet located inside the cabin. The SUV's interior is waterproof to protect against ice and snow.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Akhilesh Yadav's ₹5 crore campaign bus has in-built elevator
article: Uttar Pradesh CM Akhilesh Yadav is campaigning in a customized Mercedes-Benz bus for the upcoming assembly elections, that cost him ₹5 crore and features an in-built elevator. The elevator gives Yadav access to the roof of the bus, enabling him to address the locals gathered around. The bus also has bulletproof glass, a kitchen, a living area and an office.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Self-driving electric truck that builds in 4 hrs unveiled
article: UK-based startup Charge has unveiled a self-driving electric truck that takes only four hours to be built by a single person. Made with ultra-lightweight materials, the truck produces zero emissions for the first 160 kilometers it travels. The truck will be available for sale by the next year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Self-driving cars won’t work in India: Maruti Chairman
article: Maruti Suzuki Chairman RC Bhargava in an interview said that self-driving cars won't work in India as “nobody obeys any of the driving rules”. He added, "How will you devise a technology that will predict customer behaviour? Nobody can predict customer behaviour". Bhargava. however, said that he'd love to see people put self-driving technology to use in Indian driving conditions.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Nano failed to meet customer aspirations: Maruti Chairman
article: Maruti Suzuki India Chairman RC Bhargava on Thursday said Tata Nano failed because it did not meet the aspirations of customers "in totality". "The project at that price became an insurmountable challenge," he stated.
