When two-wheeler owners look to upgrade their vehicles, they look for the luxury a car can offer and not just another means of transportation, he added.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: BMW posts record profit at $2 billion in Sep quarter
article: German luxury carmaker BMW on Friday posted record net profit at $2 billion, a rise of 15.3% against the year-ago period for the September quarter. The company attributed the rise to selling record number of vehicles. Notably, the group sold more than 5,83,000 cars in the period, posting a 7.1% increase from the year-ago period.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Three Apple employees quit to join Tesla, Ford
article: Three members of Apple's communications team have quit to join car companies Tesla and Ford in the past few weeks. This comes after it was rumoured that Apple has decided to scale back its plans to make an autonomous car under its Project Titan. The team working on Apple's self-driving vehicles has been given a deadline of late 2017.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Israeli firm creates '100% more fuel efficient' car engine
article: An Israeli firm named Aquarius Engines claims to have created an internal combustion engine with more than twice the efficiency of currently available alternatives. The $100 engine, which the firm says can allow cars to run up to 1,600 km on a full tank, replaces the traditional multiple-vertical piston engine with a novel single-horizontal piston design.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla adds an all-glass roof to the Model S
article: Elon Musk-led electric vehicle-making startup Tesla has added an all-glass roof option to Model S for an additional $1,500 (nearly ₹1 lakh) over the base model priced at $76,200 (approximately ₹50.9 lakh). Tesla claims that the glass roof blocks 98% of UV rays and 81% of the heat. Tesla Model 3, launching next year, will feature a similar glass roof.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: In Pictures: Cars owned by Bollywood actor Ranbir Kapoor
article: Bollywood actor Ranbir Kapoor is known to have purchased four luxury cars, the most recent of which is a 4.4-litre diesel engine Range Rover. He also owns a white Audi A8 L with crimson interiors and a Mercedes-AMG G63 which can travel at 210 kmph. He also owned an Audi R8 sports car which he has now reportedly sold.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Man customised Harley-Davidson bike to look like a burger
article: Harry Sperl or 'Hamburger Harry' in USA owns a 1987 Harley-Davidson Sportster bike which is customised to look like a hamburger. The top bun of the 'Hamburger Harley' is fitted with hydraulic cylinders, the beef patty is tuned to emit steam like a warm real-life meat patty, and the stereo plays the sound of frying burgers.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: BlackBerry partners with Ford to make 'cars of the future'
article: Canadian technology company BlackBerry has partnered with American automaker Ford to make 'cars of the future' by providing software to help develop self-driving cars. BlackBerry has previously worked with startups to develop technology that brakes a car automatically when it spots something in its path. Ford has announced plans of selling 1,00,000 self-driven taxis by 2021.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: New Ford software will automatically change car direction
article: Ford has announced the development of features like 'evasive steering' that will change the direction of the car if it predicts an accident through its radar system. The cars will be able to park themselves without the driver's input and give audio and visual warnings if they sense wrong-way driving. Additionally, the headlight beam will automatically be widened at roundabouts.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Hyundai to let users make calls by pointing at windscreen
article: Automaker Hyundai has partnered with Seoul-based startup VTouch to commercially produce gesture-based heads-up displays (HUDs) by the end of 2017. The display above the dashboard will let drivers browse through music, make calls or set navigation just by making gestures with their fingers towards the windscreen. BMW recently unveiled a similar concept called 'AirTouch' for its 7 Series.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Toyota makes device that turns smartphone into car key
article: Toyota has made a Bluetooth-enabled device called 'Smart Key Box' that allows users to unlock and start a car's engine by just using their smartphone. The device is aimed at people who want to share their vehicle to make money. A code on smartphone is sent via an app, which allows user to access the device acting like car's key.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Tata Motors posts strongest car sales in 4 years
article: Tata Motors on Tuesday said that it has posted the highest car sales in four years with a growth of 28% in October as against the year-ago period amid strong festive demand. Further, total sales grew 21% during the period under review. The hatchback Tiago continues to be the volume driver, with retail showing a firm pick-up, the company said.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Volvo launches S90 sedan in India at ₹53.5 lakh
article: Swedish car manufacturer Volvo on Friday launched its flagship sedan S90 in India at a starting price of ₹53.5 lakh (ex-showroom, Mumbai). Powered by a 2-litre diesel engine, it generates 190PS of power and has a top speed of 230 kmph. The car will compete against the likes of Audi A6, BMW 5 Series, Mercedes-Benz E Class and Jaguar XF.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Hyundai posts highest ever monthly sales in October
article: Automotive major Hyundai Motor India on Tuesday reported its highest ever monthly sales at 64,372 units in October, a 4.3% rise against the year-ago period. This came after Hyundai saw its highest-ever domestic volume during the month, the company said. This also came amid the recently launched Elantra receiving an overwhelming response, CEO YK Koo said.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Suzuki to invest ₹6.4k cr in 2nd production line in Gujarat
article: Japan's Suzuki Motor will invest about 100 billion yen (₹6,400 crore) in a yet-to-be-functional second production line at its new Gujarat plant, reports said. The second line could debut in 2019 and will have the same capacity as the first production line, which is slated to start in 2017. This could raise the automaker's capacity to 2 million cars annually.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla rival Fisker's first car travels 640 km on one charge
article: Elon-Musk founded electric car startup Tesla's rival Fisker on Monday revealed its first electric luxury sedan named 'EMotion', which claims to travel over 640 kilometres on a single charge. The car will have all the hardware required to allow full self-driving ability in the future, and a top speed of 259 kmph.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Ford delays sales report due to fire at headquarters
article: American automotive company Ford on Monday delayed the release of its monthly sales report because of an electrical fire at its global headquarters. The fire interrupted power to the company's main data centers where sales are reported and tracked. However, Ford said the data was protected during the power outage by the system's battery backups.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Video shows Tesla battery exploding after crash
article: A one-minute video shows the lithium-ion battery of a Tesla Model S exploding like fireworks after the car crashed into a tree. The collision, which took place on Thursday in the US, killed the driver and passenger. "Some of the smaller cells that had broken apart began firing off almost like projectiles," said a fire department representative.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Volvo self-driving cars to be unmarked to avoid 'bullies'
article: Volvo's first self-driving cars in Britain will be unmarked so that aggressive drivers do not attempt to "bully" them. "People will challenge...with really harsh braking in front of a self-driving car or putting themselves in the way", said a Volvo executive. According to a study by the London School of Economics, autonomous cars are seen as "easier to deal with".

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Maruti's domestic sales rose 2.2% in October
article: Country's largest carmaker Maruti Suzuki India's domestic sales rose 2.2% to 1.23 lakh units over a year-ago period, the company said in a statement on Tuesday. The muted growth came due to a 9.8% decline in the sales of its entry-level models of Wagon R and Alto. Maruti's sales of compact car models also dropped 1.8% to 50,116 units.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Volkswagen board calls meet over brand overhaul: Report
article: Volkswagen's supervisory board is set to hold an 'extraordinary meeting' on November 4 over the restructuring of the carmaker's brand, reports claimed. This comes amid the management and labour leaders seeking to agree on matters like cutting costs and investments. The supervisory board is also scheduled to meet on November 18 to ratify the group's spending plans through 2021.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: 1st delivery by Uber's self-driving truck is 50k beer cans
article: Uber's 18-wheeler self-driving truck recently made its first ever delivery by transporting 50,000 cans of Budweiser beer across nearly 200 km in the US. The delivery was in partnership with brewing company AB InBev and each can read, "First delivery by self-driving truck". The Volvo truck was supplied by Otto, a self-driving vehicle group acquired by Uber in August.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: New MINI Cooper launched in India on Amazon at ₹39.90 lakh
article: The MINI Cooper S Carbon Edition has been launched in India exclusively on e-commerce platform Amazon at ₹39.90 lakh. Only 20 units of the hatchback are available for sale in the country. Powered by a 2.0-litre turbo petrol engine, it generates 192 hp and accelerates from 0-100 kmph in 6.7 seconds.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: 19-yr-old Indian builds car by watching YouTube videos
article: A 19-year-old teenager from Mumbai, Prem Thakur has made a working two-seater car at a cost of ₹2.50 lakh by watching YouTube videos. While Thakur welded the chassis and did the paintjob, the engine and transmission were sourced from a second hand Hyundai Accent. The car sports LED headlamps, turn indicators, and a music system with a USB port.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla posts second quarterly profit in 13-year history
article: American electric car manufacturer Tesla on Wednesday announced its first profit after 12 consecutive quarterly losses, and only the second profitable quarter in its 13-year history. The company, led by Elon Musk, recorded net income of $21.9 million for the third quarter compared to a loss of $229.9 million a year earlier. Tesla's revenue more than doubled to $2.3 billion.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: George Hotz cancels kit made to turn cars self-driving
article: George Hotz, the hacker known for unlocking the first iPhone, has cancelled the kit developed by his startup Comma.ai, which could be fitted into cars to turn them self-driving. A US regulatory agency had asked Comma.ai for information regarding safety following which Hotz tweeted, "Would much rather spend my life building amazing tech than dealing with regulators...It isn't worth it."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Mumbai Fire Brigade gets customised Royal Enfield bikes
article: The Mumbai Fire Brigade recently showcased customised Royal Enfield Himalayan motorcycles which will be used by the force in the city. The bikes will be fitted with high-pressure water pumps with a capacity of 60 litres. The modded bikes will reportedly cost ₹9-10 lakhs, while the stock bike costs around ₹1.55 lakhs (ex-showroom, Mumbai).

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hyundai Motor's profit hits record low of $935 million
article: South Korean automaker Hyundai Motor's net profit fell 10% to hit a record low of $935 million for the third quarter ended September. This marks a fall in the company's profit for 11th consecutive quarter. In July to September this year, the company's domestic factories were hit by its worst labour strike.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Honda Civic removed from list of most reliable cars
article: Consumer-advocacy organisation Consumer Reports on Monday released its list of 2016's most reliable car models based on road-test scores, owner satisfaction data and independent safety testing. Honda Civic, Mini Cooper and Volkswagen Jetta are among the cars no longer recommended to buyers. Japanese automaker Honda's rank fell to 10 from 8 last year on the list of reliable car brands.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: BMW, Ola tie up for luxury cab services
article: Luxury carmaker BMW and taxi-hailing app Ola have entered into an agreement to provide on-demand luxury cab services in India. The tie-up will allow Ola cab operators to avail cheaper credit to buy BMW cars, receive after-sales support and guaranteed buyback. Ola will induct BMW cars across Delhi, Mumbai, and Bengaluru as a part of its Ola ‘Lux’ fleet.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla rival Atieva rebrands itself as Lucid Motors
article: Electric vehicle maker Tesla's rival Atieva has changed its name to Lucid Motors. The Silicon Valley-based startup will unveil a concept of its electric sedan by the end of this year and begin the sales by 2018. It will be powered by an 87 kWh battery that generates 900 horsepower and provides acceleration from 0-100 kmph in under 3 seconds.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: 6 Maruti Suzuki models in top ten list in Apr-Sep
article: India's largest carmaker Maruti Suzuki saw six of its models featuring in the top ten selling list in the first half of 2016-17, helping the company maintain its 47.2% market share in the domestic passenger vehicles market, data revealed. Further, the firm's car Alto retained its position as the best selling model in April-September period, despite a 7.93% decline year-on-year.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Hero MotoCorp to invest ₹205 cr in electric vehicle startup
article: Indian motorcycle manufacturer Hero MotoCorp has announced to invest ₹205 crore in Bengaluru-based electric vehicle startup Ather Energy. The company will pick up a 26-30% stake in the startup which claims to make India's first smart electric scooter, S340. Founded in 2013, Ather Energy has previously raised funding from Tiger Global Management, and Flipkart Co-founder Sachin and Binny Bansal.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tuned Lamborghini Huracán Spyder goes 0-100 kmph in 2.7 sec
article: German car-tuning company DMC has unveiled a customised Lamborghini Huracán Spyder that can accelerate from 0-100 kmph in under 2.7 seconds, down from the original 3.4 seconds. The power output has also been boosted to 1073 hp with a pair of turbochargers. The car has a top speed of 345 kmph, while the stock version can travel at 324 kmph.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Toyota's Lexus listed as the most reliable carmaker
article: Japanese automotive manufacturer Toyota Motor Corp's Lexus and Toyota brands have been listed as the two most reliable car brands in an annual reliability ranking by consumer advocacy group Consumer Reports. Toyota Prius was rated the most reliable car of 2016 followed by Lexus CT 200h based on road test scores, owner satisfaction data and independent safety testing.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Consumer Reports ranks Tesla among least reliable carmakers
article: Consumer-advocacy organisation Consumer Reports on Monday ranked autonomous carmaker Tesla 25 on a list of 29 automakers, calling it one of the least reliable car brands. Consumer Reports has also listed Tesla's Model X as the sixth least reliable car of 2016, calling it "more showy than practical". The car's "falcon wing" doors are said to be a problem area.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: 'Volkswagen's shift to electric cars may cost over 10k jobs'
article: Volkswagen expects the shift to electric cars to cost over 10,000 jobs in coming years, the carmaker's Human Resources Chief Karlheinz Blessing was reported to have said. Volkswagen's works council is reportedly in talks with the company's brand management over a turnaround plan and expects up to 25,000 staff to be cut over the next decade as older workers retire.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Nissan converts electric van into mobile office
article: Japanese automobile manufacturer Nissan in collaboration with design firm Studio Hardie transformed its e-NV200 electric van into a mobile office. The e-NV200 Workspace includes a desk space, touchscreen PC and pop-up coffee machine along with Wi-Fi and app-controlled lighting. The emission-free mobile workplace can travel for up to 170 kilometres on a single charge.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Singapore to turn regular buses self-driving with sensors
article: Singapore has launched a new pilot program where large buses will be turned into self-driving buses with high-tech sensors. Once ready, the buses will travel roughly 1.4 kilometre between a university and a nearby industrial park for field trials. A month ago, self-driving car technology startup nuTonomy started testing its cars in Singapore.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Faraday Future shows its first production car in new clip
article: Elon Musk's rival electric vehicle startup Faraday Future has released a short 15-second video clip showing its first production car riding in a desert. No sound of the engine is audible in the clip, where the company says, "Can't hear the engine? You're not supposed to". This is the first time that the company has shown its working prototype.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Volkswagen's $14.7 bn settlement over emission scam approved
article: A US judge on Tuesday approved Volkswagen's $14.7 billion (over ₹98,000 crore) settlement with the federal and California regulators, and vehicle owners over its diesel emissions cheating scandal. The German automaker said it would begin buying back polluting cars in mid-November. Owners will get the pre-scandal "trade-in" value of the vehicle and $5,100 to $10,000 in additional compensation.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: In Pictures: 2017 Michelin Design Challenge winners
article: French tyre manufacturer Michelin has announced the winners of the global 2017 Michelin Design Challenge "Le Mans 2030: Design for the Win". Works by individuals and teams from Australia, Brazil, Canada, China, Czech Republic, India, Portugal, and Russia were among the winners and finalists that were selected from more than 1,600 registrants representing 80 countries.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hyundai Motor executives to take 10% voluntary pay cut
article: In the first such move in seven years, South Korean automaker Hyundai Motor has said that about 1,000 of its executives will take a 10% voluntary pay cut. Applicable from this month, the pay cuts will affect executives at 51 group companies. It comes amid concerns of Hyundai's falling market share in China, South Korea, and other emerging markets.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: General Motors net profit jumps 103.6%
article: Vehicle manufacturer General Motors on Tuesday posted a 103.6% increase in net profit to $2.77 billion for the quarter ended September, as against the year-ago period. Further, the company's revenue increased by 10% to $42.83 billion, a quarterly record for the company. The growth came amid strong truck sales in its home US market and continued strength in China.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mahindra launches new platform for used cars auction
article: Mahindra's used car sales platform Mahindra First Choice Wheels on Monday launched a new platform named 'True Time Bids' that allows buyers to participate in traditional 'on-the-ground' used car auctions via the internet in real-time. Vehicle auctions are typically conducted offline while some are also done online to attract non-local bidders. Mahindra's platform combines both the auction formats.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Audi tests car-sharing services with red A4 sedan fleet
article: German automobile manufacturer Audi has announced its foray into the car-sharing business with a pilot 'Shared Fleet' program. Customers will be able to locate and unlock their assigned red Audi A4 sedans with a connected smartphone app. The pricing for Audi's fleet is said to be based off the time used, not the distance driven.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: BMW recalls 1.5 lakh vehicles in US, Canada
article: German carmaker BMW is recalling 1.5 lakh vehicles registered in the United States and Canada for a fuel pump problem that could cause stalling, the company has said. However, BMW told the US regulators that no injuries have been reported due to to the said fault. Of the vehicles recalled, nearly 88% are registered in the United States, reports said.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Bajaj Auto profit rises 6.68% to ₹1,122 cr in Q2
article: Two-wheeler manufacturer Bajaj Auto has reported a 6.68% year-on-year growth in the second quarter profit, which stood at ₹1,122 crore. Bajaj’s income from operations was up marginally by 0.38% from the corresponding period a year ago to ₹6,432 crore. However, Bajaj Auto sold 10.3 lakh units in the quarter, compared to 10.56 lakh units sold in the year-ago period.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: LeEco unveils self-driving car with foldable steering wheel
article: Chinese technology company LeEco on Wednesday unveiled its autonomous electric car 'LeSee Pro' in San Francisco. The steering wheel of the car folds up and retreats into the dashboard when the car is in autonomous mode. It also features an exterior light display that shifts between five different colours to let pedestrians know which the mode the car is in.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Video shows a Tesla car driving and parking itself
article: A four-minute video shows a Tesla car driving completely by itself and parking in an empty lot without any human assistance. The car is fitted with eight 360-degree cameras and twelve sensors that can distinguish between hard and soft objects. A radar allows the car to 'see' through heavy rain, fog, dust and even the car ahead.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: All new Tesla cars to have full self-driving capabilities
article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk announced on Wednesday that all vehicles currently in production by the electric carmaker will have a fully self-driving hardware. The hardware, being installed on Tesla's Model S, X and forthcoming Model 3 sedans, will make the cars "substantially safer than a human driver". The cars will have 8 cameras with 360-degree viewing and 12 ultrasonic sensors.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: LeEco delays car unveiling due to Transformers director
article: Chinese technology firm LeEco, which unveiled its autonomous electric vehicle LeSee Pro in US on Wednesday, was unable to display the car on stage. The car was delayed on its way from London where it was being used by Transformers director Michael Bay for the latest instalment of the movie. The car was made available for viewing after the event.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla targets fully self-driving road trip of over 4,400 km
article: American electric carmaker Tesla is targeting a road trip from Los Angeles to New York, covering a distance of over 4,400 km, in one of its fully self-driving cars by end of 2017. Tesla CEO Elon Musk said on Wednesday the goal was to travel from "LA to Time Square in New York and then having the car park itself".

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: New car brand unveils first car with a dedicated app store
article: Chinese automotive manufacturing company Geely has launched a new car brand called  Lynk & Co that claims its electric compact SUV '01' is "the most connected car in the world". The 01 is said to have the first dedicated app store for cars that includes a feature through which users can give friends access to the car through digital keys.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Self-driving car collides with truck in Singapore
article: US-based self-driving car startup nuTonomy's car on Tuesday collided with a truck in Singapore during an attempt to change the lane. No one was hurt in the accident where two engineers were onboard the self-driving car traveling slowly. In September, Uber's rival Grab partnered with nuTonomy to allow some users to book driverless cars via its app in Singapore.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: LeEco unveils Android-based 'Super Bike' in US debut
article: Chinese technology company LeEco on Wednesday unveiled its Android-enabled 'Super Bike' in the US. The bike has a 30-speed shift, fingerprint scanner, built-in alarm and location tracker along with a 4-inch display touchscreen between the handlebars. While the price of the 7,090 mAh battery model has not been revealed, LeEco's bikes sell in China at a range of $800-$6,000.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla Autopilot will run on ‘shadow mode’ to prove safety
article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk announced on Wednesday that all Tesla cars being produced will have the hardware to achieve full Level 5 self-driving. To prove the safety of Tesla's autonomous Autopilot mode, the cars will initially run with Autopilot in the background in "shadow mode" which will register how the car would have acted if the computer was in control.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla asks owners not to use self-driving cars to make money
article: Following the announcement of fitting all its new cars with fully self-driving hardware, electric carmaker Tesla has asked customers not to use the cars to earn money. "Using a self-driving Tesla for car sharing and ride-hailing for friends and family is fine, but doing so for revenue purposes will only be permissible on the Tesla Network," the company said.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Negative media on autonomous cars killing people: Elon Musk
article: In response to a question about the safety of Tesla's autonomous systems, CEO Elon Musk on Wednesday said, "In writing some article that's negative, you effectively dissuade people from using an autonomous vehicle, you're killing people." He added that he finds the media coverage of Autopilot crashes "quite disturbing", as they are "basically almost none" relative to manual crashes.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Why Tesla Model X’s doors open and close automatically
article: Elon Musk Co-founded electric vehicle startup Tesla's Model X, which was launched in 2015, automatically opens and closes its doors to drop off owners. The feature is a part of Tesla's larger plan to make cars able to drop its owner off and park itself. Musk on Wednesday revealed his plan to have fully self-driving capabilities in company's new cars.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tata Motors hikes passenger vehicle prices by ₹12,000
article: Indian automotive company Tata Motors has announced a raise in prices of all its passenger vehicles. "We have hiked prices of our passenger vehicles by 1% ranging between ₹5,000 and ₹12,000 due to rising input costs," said a company executive, citing the increased cost of steel and zinc.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Toyota's hydrogen bus 3 times powerful than Tesla Model S
article: Toyota's hydrogen fuel cell buses set to launch in 2017, will deliver 235 kWh of power, which is three times the power produced by Tesla's all-electric Model S sedan. The bus will consist of 10 high-pressure tanks holding 600 litres of compressed hydrogen. It can be used as a generator or power source in the event of disasters.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Honda Motorcycle ranks 1st among 13 states, UTs
article: Honda Motorcycles and Scooters has become the leading two-wheeler selling brand in 13 states and Union Territories across India in June quarter, increasing from eight states/UTs last year. These 13 states/UT markets contribute half of India's total two-wheeler consumption. The growth was attributed to 'Activa', which has become India's most selling scooter.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Aston Martin to launch one new car every year in India
article: British carmaker Aston Martin plans to launch at least one new product globally, including introducing one new super luxury car in India every year till 2020. This will include an SUV and the new Vantage, among others. With this, the London-based carmaker is aiming to strengthen its position among luxury car manufacturers in India in order to boost sales.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla’s self-driving car hardware to cost $8,000 extra
article: The new self-driving car hardware being fitted into new Tesla cars will cost customers $8,000 (₹5,35,000) more on the company's S and X models, Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said. However, he added that the software required to enable fully autonomous operation is still being tested. The cost for the upcoming Model 3 starts at $35,000 (₹23,41,000) without new hardware.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Nissan completes $2.2 billion takeover of Mitsubishi
article: Japanese automobile major Nissan Motor on Thursday said that it had completed a $2.29 billion deal to acquire a controlling stake in Mitsubishi Motors. Nissan will take a 34% stake in Mitsubishi, making it the single largest shareholder in the smaller firm. Further, Nissan said it would retain Mitsubishi's CEO to ensure the automaker's recovery from a mileage cheating scandal.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Kawasaki delivers bikes to buyers affected by fraud dealer
article: Kawasaki India on Tuesday announced that it had delivered 13 motorcycles to customers affected due to its fraudulent SNK Palm Beach dealership in Navi Mumbai. The Japanese motorcycle maker had terminated the showroom's dealership in September for failing to deliver motorcycles booked by users and issuing refunds for the payments made.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Manufacturers to give each vehicle's detailed emission info
article: The Centre has made it mandatory for automakers to furnish detailed declaration about the emission and noise levels for each vehicle from April 2017. Information like levels of pollutants and sound level for horn needs to be provided. These rules will apply to all vehicles which run on petrol, CNG, LPG, and diesel, as well as electric and hybrid vehicles.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: McLaren offers Arctic driving experience at ₹10.22 lakh
article: British carmaker McLaren is hosting an event called 'Pure McLaren Arctic Experience', where it will let people experience driving 570S Coupe in the Arctic Circle for ₹10.22 lakh. To be held from January 15 to February 3 next year, the event will also let people spend three nights in the former home of Finland's President to witness the Northern Lights.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup makes self-charging foldable electric bike
article: Austria-based startup Vello has created a foldable electric bike that can charge itself while the user pedals, by converting mechanical energy into electrical energy. The less than 12-kg bike has a 250-watt motor and offers top speeds of 25 kmph with a range of 50 km on a single charge. The base model can be pre-ordered for $1,899 (approximately ₹1,27,000).

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Harley-Davidson net income falls by 18.67% to $114 mn
article: Motorcycle manufacturer Harley-Davidson on Tuesday reported an 18.67% year-on-year decline in net income for the quarter ended September to $114.1 million. Further, weak US industry trends dragged the company's total global retail sales, which fell by 4.5%. Further, the company's revenue also fell by 3.7% to $1.27 billion during the period under review.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Fiat Chrysler recalling vehicles in the US, Canada, Mexico
article: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles has said that it is recalling about 74,833 vehicles in the US to replace the alternators because of a problem that could result in engine stall. The company said it was aware of a single potentially related injury. Fiat said that it is also recalling 10,077 vehicles in Canada, 1,088 in Mexico and 134 outside North America.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Red Bull Racing releases documentary on history of pit stops
article: F1 team Red Bull Racing has released a documentary showing how the pit stops have changed from over-a-minute to less than three-second-long stops. The video titled 'The History of the Pit Stop - Gone in Two Seconds' also revealed how McLaren F1 designer Gordon Murray and his team used pressurised beer kegs in the 1980s to fuel a car.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Jaguar Land Rover, Ford, Tata Motors testing connected cars
article: Jaguar Land Rover, Ford, and Tata Motors are testing connected cars, which can communicate with each other using technology designed to speed up journeys and cut accidents, the first such trials in Britain. These cars can warn drivers when another connected vehicle brakes suddenly and also regulate their speed to encounter fewer traffic signals.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Man restores first Honda car sold in US
article: The N600 hatchback car, which was the first Honda car sold in the US has been restored by a professional Honda restorer, Tim Mings. Tim performed a ground-up restoration, from the interior to the car's 600-cc, 9000-rpm, two-cylinder engine. The finished car was recently showcased at the Japanese Classic Car Show in California and will be preserved in Honda's museum.

author: Fiat India
abstract: Fiat launches ‘The New Urban Cross’ at ₹6.85 lakh
article: Automobile major Fiat has launched the ‘The New Urban Cross’ at an introductory starting price of ₹6.85 lakh (Ex-Showroom Delhi) with powerful engines – 145PS Abarth & 93PS Powertech. The car, which is available in both diesel & petrol, comes up with 12.7cm touch-screen navigation system as standard, dual-tone interior with optional designer package, alloy-wheels, airbags & ABS with EBD.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla Model S becomes best-selling luxury sedan in US in Q3
article: Elon Musk Co-founded all-electric vehicle maker Tesla's Model S has become the best-selling luxury sedan in the US with 9,156 units being sold in the country in the third quarter. The sedan's sales surged 59% from last year. Mercedes-Benz S-Class and BMW 7-Series were the second and third most sold sedans in the US during the period.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Triumph launches Bonneville T100 in India at ₹7.78 lakh
article: British motorcycle manufacturer Triumph on Tuesday launched its Bonneville T100 bike in India at a starting price of ₹7.78 lakh (ex-showroom, New Delhi). It comes with a 900 cc parallel-twin cylinder and a liquid-cooled engine that delivers an output of 54 hp. The bike also has a USB charging socket located under the seat.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Mini teases its first ever plug-in hybrid model
article: British automaker Mini on Sunday teased its first petrol-electric plug-in hybrid model which will be based on its Countryman range. The engine is expected to be a 1.5-litre turbocharged three-cylinder unit with a top speed of approximately 125 kmph in the electric mode alone. The output of the car, expected to launch in 2019, is pegged to be 224bhp.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ashok Leyland launches India's 1st indigenous electric bus
article: Hinduja Group flagship Ashok Leyland on Monday launched 'Circuit', the first zero-emission electric bus made entirely in India. Created specifically for Indian roads and passenger conditions, the bus costs between ₹1.50 to ₹3.50 crore and can travel up to 120 kilometres on a single charge. The bus has a seating capacity of 65 passengers.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US technology company offers Tesla car to new employees
article: A US-based technology company, Axon is offering the yet to launch Tesla Model 3 sedans to its new employees, which include a web developer and some engineers. The sedan is being given to the employees who commit to stay in the company for at least 90 days. Existing workers are also being offered the sedan on referring three new workers.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Apple gives self-driving car team 2017 deadline: Report
article: Apple has reportedly given the team working on its self-driving project called 'Project Titan' a deadline of late next year to prove the system's feasibility. Apple is said to have laid off and reassigned hundreds of employees from the Project Titan team. Earlier, Apple reportedly changed directions from building its own self-driving car to only working on autonomous car software.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mercedes self-driving car to save passengers, not bystanders
article: Global automobile manufacturer Mercedes-Benz's self-driving cars will choose to save the lives of its driver and passengers over the lives of pedestrians, company's executive Christoph von Hugo has said. "If you know you can save at least one person, at least save that one...Save the one in the car," he added. However, Mercedes engineers are working to prevent such situations.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mercedes launches GLA Activity Edition in India at ₹38.51L
article: Luxury automobile manufacturer Mercedes-Benz on Monday launched its GLA 220 d 4MATIC 'Activity Edition' in India at ₹38.51 lakh (ex-showroom, Pune). Powered by a 2143 cc inline-4 engine, the SUV generates 167 bhp and goes from 0-100 kmph in 7.7 seconds. This marks Mercedes-Benz India's sixth SUV launch and the ninth product for 2016.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Bike-hailing startup partners Bajaj Finance for easy loans
article: Gurgaon-based on-demand bike taxi startup Baxi has partnered with Bajaj Finance to procure loans with minimum processing fees and low down payment. These loans will be provided to salaried individuals who want to buy new bikes with the option to operate on a ride-share basis for Baxi. Founded in 2015, the startup claims 3,000 daily rides in Gurgaon and Faridabad.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber to allow Mumbai users to book Porsches on Oct 16
article: Ride-hailing app Uber has partnered with German sports car maker Porsche to allow its Mumbai users to book the car between 2 pm to 4 pm on October 16, 2016. Porsche rides will be available under a 'Supercar' option in the app. Selected riders will also get a chance to experience Porsche's Boxster roadster and win Uber's 'Swag Baskets'.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Hyperloop One raises $50 mn, hires former Uber CFO
article: American transportation technology company Hyperloop One on Thursday raised $50 million (₹334 crore) in a fresh round of funding led by Dubai-based DP World Group. The startup also hired former Uber Chief Financial Officer Brent Callinicos as a full-time strategic adviser. Hyperloop One will reportedly conduct a full-scale test of a Hyperloop system in the first quarter of 2017.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Torq unveils electric vehicle for bomb squads
article: Torq Defense Systems has unveiled an all-terrain electric vehicle named 'LTEV', designed specifically for bomb disposal squads. The vehicle can carry the squad as well as all the necessary tools in its cargo at speeds of up to 48 kmph. It also comes with a fire suppression system, two detachable fire extinguishers and an LED spotlight.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Luxury carmaker Lexus to debut in India with three models
article: Toyota-owned luxury vehicles maker Lexus is reportedly set to debut in India by the end of this year, by launching three models namely the RX SUV, the ES sedan and the RC-F coupe. The Lexus ES sedan could come with a hybrid variant. With initial dealerships in Delhi and Mumbai, Lexus is expected to price the sedan under ₹1 crore.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Racing team creates 'world's most powerful Suzuki Swift'
article: Japan-based racing team D-Language claims to have created the most powerful Suzuki Swift in the world by modifying a Suzuki Swift Sport model to produce 350 horsepower. With a 1.6-litre petrol engine, the hatchback typically produces 120 hp. The car was fitted with a large turbocharger to achieve 350 hp and carbon fibre parts were added for better aerodynamics.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Volkswagen sales highest in over 2 years in September
article: German carmaker Volkswagen’s sales rose 7.1% in September, the largest monthly gain in two-and-a-half years, the company said on Friday. The growth was attributed to a 20% jump in China, its biggest market, and persistent growth in Europe, the company added. Further, the 6.3% gain in its home region was the company's second-biggest monthly gain this year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup's first electric car to rival Tesla's Model S
article: Silicon Valley startup Atieva's first electric car, to be unveiled in December 2016, reportedly resembles rival Tesla's Model S sedan. The car, which will be called 'Atvus', will be a four-door sedan, like a Model S. Earlier in September, the company's deputy general manager had revealed that the car will accelerate from 0-100 kmph in under three seconds.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Germany asks Tesla to not use 'Autopilot' in ad
article: German Transport Minister Alexander Dobrindt has asked Elon Musk's electric vehicle maker Tesla to stop using 'Autopilot' term in its advertisement, as this might suggest drivers' attention is not needed during driving. A Tesla spokeswoman said that the company has always made it clear to the customers that the Autopilot assistance system requires drivers to pay attention all the time.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Volkswagen to step up savings amid emissions row: Report
article: Amid attempts to deal with its diesel emissions scandal, Volkswagen's CEO Matthias Müller said that savings will be heavy and won't be done "without pain", a German newspaper reported. "The effects of this crisis...will go to the limits of what we can bear," he added. The German carmaker is facing a $15.3 billion settlement for rigging emission tests since 2009.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: New BMW 5 series to be 1st car with wireless Apple CarPlay
article: German automaker BMW's 2017 5 series will be the first vehicle to feature Apple's wireless CarPlay infotainment system. Drivers will no longer have to connect their iPhone via USB to replace the car’s central software with Apple’s version. This will allow the phone and its apps to be operated via the in-car screen via touch control or an iDrive Controller.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: GM's car-sharing firm starts operating in San Francisco
article: General Motors-owned car-sharing platform Maven started operations on Friday in San Francisco. The service rents out GM vehicles, including the Chevrolet Volt hybrid electric vehicle and the Cadillac Escalade SUV, with prices starting at $8 per hour. Cars can be booked and unlocked via an app, and have to be returned at the same spot.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Ford F-Series Super Duty launch delayed over 'parts issues'
article: American carmaker Ford delayed the launch of its latest F-Series Super Duty truck, over unspecified "parts issues", according to a union official at Ford's Kentucky factory. It is "impossible to build all of the lost units in the third-quarter", and can negatively affect Ford's third quarter earnings, the official added. The 2017 Super Duty is priced starting at $32,500.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Ford to temporarily shut production at 4 plants
article: Ford Motor on Monday said it will shut the production of its best-selling F-150 pickup truck for a week at a US assembly plant, and temporarily idle three other plants within few weeks. About 13,000 hourly workers will be laid off. This comes amid Ford lowering its 2016 profit forecast following a charge in the September quarter for vehicle recalls.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Genovation launches Corvette-based EV at ₹5 crore
article: US-based electric vehicle manufacturer Genovation has started accepting pre-orders for its upcoming model, a C7 Corvette Grand Sport based all-electric vehicle, priced at around ₹5 crore. The vehicle's motor delivers 660 hp and takes less than three seconds to hit 100 kmph, with a 210-km range. Further, the car's exterior is reportedly modified with an environment-friendly composite material.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Porsche's first race car featured on Jay Leno's show
article: Popular television host and comedian Jay Leno this week featured the first race car ever campaigned by Porsche, in his garage show. The 1951 Porsche 356 SL Gmund Coupe had made its debut at the Le Mans Grand Prix, winning the 1100 cc class. The car was brought to the US after Porsche discarded it after the race.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Missouri 17th US state to sue Volkswagen over emissions scam
article: The state of Missouri sued Volkswagen on Monday, becoming the 17th US state to take legal action against the German automaker over its cheating on diesel emissions. Volkswagen has already agreed to pay a total amount of $16.7 billion in settlements related to its use of illegal software to defeat emissions testing in the US.

author: Audi
abstract: The new A4 is a segment leader with Audi Virtual cockpit
article: The newly launched Audi A4 is the only car in its segment to offer a class leading ‘Audi Virtual Cockpit - a 12.3-inch LCD screen replacing the traditional mechanical speedometer and other dials’. The other unique features of the all-new A4 are the Next-Generation MMI and Audi Smartphone interface. The new A4 was launched last month starting at ₹38.1 lakh.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Aston Martin DB11 launched in India at ₹4.27 crore
article: British automaker Aston Martin has launched luxury sports car DB11 in India, priced at ₹4.27 crore. The DB11 has a 5.2-litre twin-turbo V12 engine which produces 608PS of power and 700Nm of torque, making it the most powerful car in the DB family. It can reach 0-100 kmph in 3.9 seconds and has a top speed of 322 kmph.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Mercedes-Benz posts its highest monthly sales in history
article: Luxury carmaker Mercedes-Benz has recorded the highest monthly sales in its history in September 2016. The Daimler-owned brand sold 2,11,286 vehicles in September, marking the first time it crossed the 2,00,000-mark in a month. "In September we scored a hat-trick, the best month, the best quarter and the best first nine months of a year," the company said.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: BMW unveils concept of self-balancing bike without helmet
article: German automaker BMW has presented a motorcycle concept that eliminates the need for the rider to wear protective gear, including a helmet. The company claims that the bike has self-balancing systems to keep it upright both when standing and in motion. The bike offers riding advice and comes with a pair of glasses that span the entire field of vision.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Passenger vehicle monthly sales hit 4-year high
article: Sales of passenger vehicles (cars, vans and utility vehicles) increased by 19.92% year-on-year to 2.78 lakh units in September, the highest monthly volumes recorded since 2012. During the same period, sales of two-wheelers surged by 21.59%, while commercial vehicles fell by 1.9%, as per data by the Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers.

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: Renault India recalls Kwid over faulty fuel system
article:
French carmaker Renault has recalled around 50,000 units of its best-selling entry car Kwid 
to install a fuel hose clip and check the overall functionality of the fuel system. The recall has been for those Kwid cars that were manufactured till May 18, 2016. Also, the company will contact the customers for a free of cost inspection.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Indian buys car number plate for ₹59 crore in Dubai
article: Indian businessman Balwinder Sahani has paid 33 million dirhams ($9 million) for a Dubai licence plate for one of his Rolls Royces. Plate ‘D5’ was sold at a government auction on Saturday, the proceeds of which will go to Dubai’s Roads & Transport Authority. Notably, in the United Arab Emirates, a shorter number is a status symbol.

author: Sanira Mediratta
abstract: Indian Railways to introduce train coaches with glass tops
article: Indian Railways will introduce three train coaches with glass ceilings in trains in Kashmir Valley and Araku Valley. The project, which was started in 2015, is slated to be launched in December this year. Jointly designed by organisations including IRCTC and Integral Coach Factory (ICF), the manufacturing cost of each coach is reportedly around ₹4 crore.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Ford shuts Mustang factory for a week after sales drop 32%
article: American automaker Ford is shutting its Mustang factory in Michigan for a week after the sports car suffered a 32% sales decline in the US last month. Mustang was outsold by the Chevrolet Camaro for the first time in almost two years. The factory was idled to match production capacity with demand and would resume production on October 17.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Limited edition Kawasaki Z800 launched at ₹7.5 lakh
article: India Kawasaki Motors has introduced a limited edition Z800 motorcycle for the Indian market, priced at ₹7.5 lakh. The special edition C will be limited to 10 units in the country and comes wrapped in black and blue dual paint with white and red graphics. The limited edition motorcycle uses 806cc, liquid-cooled motor, same as the standard model.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Jaguar Land Rover sees highest ever September sales
article: Tata Motors-owned Jaguar Land Rover on Friday reported a 28% year-on-year increase in retail sales at 61,047 units, its highest-ever September sales. The month’s performance was driven by strong sales of the Land Rover Discovery and Discovery Sport, among others. Further, the company delivered "solid" growth across key regions, with China growing 50%, followed by a 32% growth in Europe.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Datsun recalls 932 units of redi-Go over faulty fuel system
article: Japanese automaker Nissan is recalling 932 units of entry-level car redi-Go from its Datsun brand in India to fix its faulty fuel system. The recall will affect units manufactured till May 18, 2016, a company official said. Datsun will start notifying affected owners from this month and the inspection will not incur any cost to owners.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Maruti to export Baleno to over 100 countries
article: India's largest carmaker Maruti Suzuki India (MSI) is planning to launch its premium hatchback Baleno in new markets in the coming months, amid attempts to export the model to over 100 nations. The car, which has crossed the 1 lakh sales milestone in the domestic market, will be shipped to countries in Latin America, South Africa, and South East Asia.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Tata Motors 2nd most valuable Asian automaker outside Japan
article: Tata Motors has surpassed South Korean automaker Hyundai to become the second most valuable automaker in Asia outside Japan, Bloomberg data showed. The Indian automaker's valuation stands at about $27.3 billion, while Hyundai’s market capitalisation is around $27 billion. Chinese state-owned automobile firm SAIC, valued at $36 billion, is currently the most valuable Asian carmaker outside Japan.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: 'Passenger vehicle sales to touch 30 lakh in FY17'
article: Domestic passenger vehicle (PV) sales will touch the 30 lakh mark this fiscal if sales grow as they have in the April-September period, Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers Deputy Director General Sugato Sen has said. Twenty-seven lakh units were sold in the segment last year. Notably, PV sales grew 12.34% in the April-September period to stand at 14.94 lakh.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Audi kills its $1.1 million electric supercar: Report
article: According to reports, German automaker Audi has ended production of its R8 e-tron electric coupé which was unveiled at the 2015 Geneva Auto Show. The company is said to have produced less than 100 units of this $1.1 million supercar which could accelerate from 0-100 kmph in about 3.9 seconds. Audi is still selling its A3 e-tron plug-in hybrid hatchback.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: In Pictures: Aston Martin DB11 launched in India at ₹4.27 cr
article: British automaker Aston Martin has launched luxury sports car DB11 in India, priced at ₹4.27 crore. The DB11 has a 5.2-litre twin-turbo V12 engine which produces 608PS of power and 700Nm of torque, making it the most powerful car in the DB family. It can reach 0-100 kmph in 3.9 seconds and has a top speed of 322 kmph.

author: Sanira Mediratta
abstract: Video explores future world with self-driving cars
article: A three-minute video discusses how the world would be if self-driving cars became common over the next 10-20 years. Stating that self-driving cars would help the visually impaired and elderly people to drive, the video adds that such cars could "drastically" decrease the number of accidents. The video further explains the software that a self-driving car functions on.

author: Saloni Tandon
abstract: Raid de Himalaya called off after rider's death
article: The Raid de Himalaya, a 2,500-km motorsport rally raid currently being held in Himachal Pradesh, was called off on Tuesday after a rider died in an accident during the race. Kolkata's Subhamoy Paul reportedly lost control of his motorcycle, a KTM 500 EXC, over the Kunzum pass and died on the spot after suffering a head injury.

author: Aarushi Maheshwari
abstract: Luxury motor home with built-in garage unveiled
article: A luxury motor home which comes with its own built-in garage is on display at the Motorhome and Caravan Show at the National Exhibition Centre in Birmingham, England. The Morelo Empire Liner features a "well-equipped" kitchen, a "luxury" bathroom and a panoramic roof window. The motor home comes at a price of £350,000 (about ₹2.8 crore).

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Passenger vehicle sales to grow 8% in 2016: Moody's
article: Credit rating agency Moody’s has predicted passenger vehicle sales in India to grow 8% to 34 lakh units in 2016, on account of new launches, lower fuel costs, and ease in financing. Further, it projected a healthy growth trajectory in 2017, with unit shipments climbing 6%. However, it cut the global auto industry's outlook to negative due to weakening demand.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: In Pics: Goa's 1st Vintage Bike and Car festival
article: Goa Tourism Development Corporation recently held its very first vintage car and bike rally, called the 'Vintage Bike and Car festival 2016'. The event witnessed the participation of 83 vintage cars and 40 vintage bikes as the vehicles participated in a rally in Panaji. The event was flagged off by Minister for Tourism, Dilip Parulekar.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Mahindra MOJO motorcycle available online at Paytm
article: Automaker Mahindra Two Wheelers and e-commerce platform Paytm have entered into a partnership to make the Mahindra MOJO motorcycle available online. Mahindra has opened the first two-wheeler brand store on Paytm, listing the Mahindra MOJO. The automobile manufacturer has also launched an introductory benefit of a Magnetic Tank Bag on every purchase of MOJO made through Paytm.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Mahindra shortlisted for building next-gen vehicle in US
article: Mahindra & Mahindra on Monday said it is among the six manufacturers shortlisted by the US Postal Service for developing Next Generation Delivery Vehicle prototype. The awardees will have around one year from contract award to design and deliver their prototypes. "This is a strategic development in Mahindra’s ambition to become a global mobility player,” Chairman Anand Mahindra said.

author: Parichit Mainra
abstract: Driverless car tested in public for the first time in UK
article: A two-seater electric driverless car was publicly tested for the first time in UK's Milton Keynes on Tuesday. The car traveled for 1 km at 8 kph on pavements around Milton's railway station. The car's software was developed by Oxford University's Robotics Institute, who called this "a landmark step" towards bringing self-driving vehicles to the roads of the UK.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Tata Motors' global sales up 5.35% in September
article: Tata Motors on Monday reported a 5.35% increase year-on-year in its global sales at 1.02 lakh units for September. The sales of Tata-owned luxury brand Jaguar Land Rover were up by 3.6% from the year-ago period to 52,914 units during the month. Further, the automaker's commercial vehicles and passenger vehicles sales grew 1.85% and 7.2% respectively.

author: Kabir Khan
abstract: Mahindra’s Ssangyong Motor explores JV with Shaanxi Auto
article: Ssangyong Motor, the South Korean SUV maker and subsidiary of Mahindra & Mahindra, is exploring a joint venture in China with Shaanxi Automobile Group to produce vehicles in the world’s largest auto market. Ssangyong signed a letter of intent with Xi’an-based Shaanxi Auto on Wednesday to study a possible joint venture and local production plant.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: India's first electric motorcycle launched at ₹1.25 lakh
article: India’s first all-electric motorcycle 'Tork T6X' was launched by Pune-based startup Tork Motorcycles at ₹1.25 lakh on Friday. To be sold in Pune, Bengaluru and Delhi initially, the bike has a top speed of 100 kmph and can travel up to 100 kilometres on single charge. The startup has already set up six charging stations in Pune and Lonavala.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: China unveils its first hanging monorail network
article: China recently completed a test run of its first suspended electric monorail network in the Chengdu city, over a 300-meter line. The project's chief designer said the lithium battery-powered train has a top speed of 60 kmph and load capacity of 120 passengers per coach. He estimated the project's cost to be one-fifth to one-eighth of that of underground rail.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Maruti posts highest-ever domestic monthly sales
article: India's largest carmaker Maruti Suzuki on Saturday reported its highest-ever domestic monthly sales at 1,37,321 units in September, up by 29.4% from the year-ago period. The record beats Maruti's previous best of 1,25,778 units registered in July. This comes amid robust demand for Vitara Brezza, Baleno, and Ciaz, besides recovery in volumes of the small car segment.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mahindra launches Mojo Tourer Edition at ₹1.88 lakh
article: Mahindra Two Wheelers has launched the Mojo Tourer Edition motorcycle that comes pre-equipped with an accessory kit, at ₹1.88 lakh (ex-showroom, Delhi). The price is about ₹35,000 more than the standard offering. The bike's accessories include a magnetic tank bag, a mobile holder, a fog lamp and a tourer jacket among others.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Ford invented world's first moving assembly line
article: The world's first moving assembly line started production on October 7, 1913 at Ford's Highland Park plant. The setup had 140 assemblers stationed along a 150-foot line who installed parts on a car chassis as it was dragged across the floor. The moving assembly line helped reduce man hours of final assembly from over 12 hours to under three hours.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Nvidia's self-driving AI learns by watching humans
article: Chipmaker Nvidia has demonstrated an AI-based self-driving system that learns by observing human drivers. Nvidia claims the system can drive on any type of road as it learns by observing how humans drive in a specific situation. Dubbed 'BB-8', the program uses 'deep neural networks' to successfully navigate an obstacle course containing simulated construction zones and narrow country side roads.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: We’re building a driver: Google on self-driving cars
article: Google's self-driving car project's technology head Dmitri Dolgov in a recent interview said, "Driving is a social activity...we’re building a driver". Dolgov added that a self-driving car should not only be able to detect and recognise humans and other objects, it should also be able to understand their behaviour. He said that Google cars can detect and understand hand signals.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Tesla posts 70% rise in deliveries in Sept quarter
article: US-based Tesla Motors on Sunday reported that its deliveries rose 70% over the previous quarter to 24,500 electric cars in the quarter ended September, amid production improvements and reports of discounts on some vehicles. Further, production rose to 25,185 vehicles during the period under review. The improved deliveries bring Tesla closer to meeting its second-half target of 50,000 vehicles.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Mahindra names its new electric car ‘e2oPlus’
article: India's lone full-fledged electric car manufacturer, Mahindra Electric has named its next-generation battery-operated four-door car as the e2oPlus. The new features on the car include a refreshed design and faster charging capacity, according to the company. The current range of the car stands at 120 km but the company claims that it will be upgraded significantly.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Dutch firm converts Tesla into a hearse
article: Dutch limousine maker RemetzCar has converted Tesla's luxury sedan Model S into an all-electric hearse, a vehicle for conveying the coffin to a funeral. The company sawed the sedan in half and stretched it 31.5 inches, where a glass roof has been installed. The hearse can travel for up to 350 kms on a single charge.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jaguar F-Pace prices start from ₹68.40 lakh in India
article: British manufacturer of luxury vehicles, Jaguar has announced to launch its F-Pace SUV in India on October 20 at a starting price of ₹68.40 lakh, which goes up to ₹1.12 crore (ex-showroom, Delhi). The SUV's 2.0-litre 4-cylinder turbocharged Ingenium engine generates 179.5PS of power. It will be competing against the likes of Range Rover Evoque, BMW X5 and Mercedes-Benz GLE.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Nissan to launch 8 new products in India by 2021
article: Japanese automaker Nissan will launch eight new products in India by 2021, senior Vice-President Christian Madrus has said. These new products will be equally distributed across Nissan and Datsun brands, he added. Further, he said Nissan is also making India an export hub for Africa and the Middle East. Nissan currently has around 2% share in the Indian car market.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Volkswagen, Audi recall 3.34 lakh cars in US, Canada
article: Volkswagen Group is recalling around 3,34,000 vehicles of Volkswagen and Audi brands in the US and Canada in three separate recalls, each due to fuel leaks, the German automaker said on Friday. However, no one has been injured because of these issues, a company spokesperson said. Volkswagen has not clarified if the recalls will affect vehicles outside North America.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Audi launches Q3 Dynamic Edition in India at ₹39.78 lakh
article: German automobile manufacturer Audi on Thursday launched its compact luxury SUV Q3's Dynamic Edition in India at a starting price of ₹39.78 lakh (ex-showroom, Delhi). Only 101 units of this special edition of the Q3 will be available in India. Powered by a 2.0-litre TDI four-cylinder diesel engine, the Audi Q3 Dynamic Edition generates 176PS of power.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Honda launches new Brio in India at ₹4.69 lakh
article: Japanese automobile manufacturer Honda on Tuesday launched the 2016 model of its Brio hatchback in India at a starting price of ₹4.69 lakh (ex-showroom, Delhi). Powered by a 4-cylinder 1.2-litre i-VTEC engine, Brio delivers a maximum power output of 88PS. Brio's exterior has been reworked with a high-gloss black and chrome finished front grille and a redesigned front bumper.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Mercedes to launch fully electric vehicles in India by 2018
article: Luxury carmaker Mercedes-Benz India has said that it can introduce models with alternative fuels, including plug-in hybrids and full electric vehicles, by 2018. "We have our cars ready but we need support... from the government," CEO Roland Folger said. This would be two years ahead of the government's plan to put 6-7 million electric vehicles on road by 2020.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: GLM's new electric car travels 400 km on single charge
article: Electric vehicle maker Green Lord Motors which is also known as 'Tesla of Japan', recently unveiled the concept of new luxury sedan GLM G4 that can travel up to 400 km on a single charge. The car generates 536 horsepower and accelerates from 0–100 kmph in 3.7 seconds. It has four roof-hinged doors, four racing seats and multiple digital screens.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: In Pictures: Vehicles from Paris Motor Show 2016
article: The biennial Paris Motor Show, which took place from 29-30 September this year, witnessed unveiling of new models and concepts from major automakers including Mercedes, Ferrari and Audi. However, manufacturers like Ford, Mazda, Volvo, Bentley and Lamborghini skipped the show. While Mercedes debuted a new brand 'EQ' for electric vehicles, Volkswagen unveiled its first fully electric vehicle.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Volvo's new system for e-buses detects pedestrians
article: Swedish automaker Volvo has developed a new system for its electric buses that will automatically detect pedestrians and cyclists on the road, and alert the driver about the same. It constantly monitors the bus surroundings and emits a gentle warning sound to signify that a vehicle is approaching. On detecting a clear collision risk, the system issues a loud warning.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: World's highest energy density EV battery unveiled
article: California-based electric vehicle (EV) company Faraday Future, in collaboration with LG Chemical, has unveiled what it claims to be the 'world's highest energy density' EV battery. Elon Musk's Tesla and Panasonic currently have the highest energy density batteries, at 60 kWh and larger. Earlier, the company had revealed plans for a $1 billion EV factory in Nevada.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Ford ends car production in Australia after 91 years
article: American multinational Ford Motor Company ended 91 years of car manufacturing in Australia on Friday, having opened its first Australian production line in 1925. Ford, General Motors, and Toyota had announced in 2013 that they were quitting Australia and shedding 6,600 jobs because of high production costs, distance from potential export markets and increasing competition.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Volkswagen says no plans to sell brands due to emissions row
article: German automaker Volkswagen is not considering the sale of any of its brands or a capital increase to deal with the costs of its emissions scandal. "The Volkswagen group is financially solid," its supervisory board Chairman Hans Dieter Poetsch said. Moreover, Volkswagen has set aside $19.8 billion to meet the settlement costs for rigging fuel emission tests since 2009.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Aston Martin previews DB11 in India
article: British manufacturer of luxury sports cars, Aston Martin recently previewed its DB11 model for the first time in India, at Delhi. Powered by a 5.2-litre twin-turbocharged V12 engine, DB11 generates 600 hp and a top speed of 320 kmph, making it the most powerful production DB ever. The company is reportedly planning to launch the model in India this month.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Over 7k Hyundai Eon units recalled over faulty clutch
article: South Korean carmaker Hyundai Motor has decided to recall 7,657 units of its entry-level small car 'Eon' to fix faulty clutch and battery cables. The recall will cover Eon units manufactured in the month of January 2015. Earlier in 2014, the company had recalled 2,437 units of its sports utility vehicle 'Santa Fe' to replace a faulty stop lamp switch.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Škoda India launches MyŠkoda mobile app
article: Czech automaker Škoda's India division has introduced the 'MyŠkoda' mobile app for iOS and Android. The app lets Škoda owners access the service history of a vehicle, cost of various parts and estimated cost of each service, besides storing documents like registration certificates and insurance policies. The app also keeps a record of daily fuel expenses.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Tata Motors to hike prices of passenger vehicles
article: Indian automaker Tata Motors is planning to increase prices of its passenger vehicles during the ongoing festive season, the company's Passenger Vehicles Business Unit President Mayank Pareek has said. This comes amid increase in input costs and some industry players already undertaking price hikes, he stated. Earlier, rivals Mahindra & Mahindra, Hyundai, and Maruti Suzuki also hiked prices.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Tata Motors sales up by 8% in September
article: Tata Motors on Saturday reported an 8% year-on-year increment in its total sales in September, which stood at 48,648 units. The automaker's passenger vehicles sales in the domestic market rose 24% from the corresponding period a year ago to 14,601 units last month. Further, its exports during the month were up 29% from the year-ago period at 5,687 units.

author: Audi
abstract: Audi A4 is a technology lover's dream: Review
article: The newly launched Audi A4 is "a technology lover's dream; It has fuel-efficient engine, an impressive sense of quality, and restrained, tasteful styling," writes The Telegraph. "The new A4 is a great overall package. And as far as in car technology goes, it is far ahead of its competition," writes CarDekho.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: McLaren's first electric car made for kids only
article: British sports car maker McLaren on Monday launched the company's first fully electric car named 'McLaren P1', a $486 car for kids aged between 3-6 years. The open-top car can accelerate from 0 kmph to a top speed of 5 kmph in two seconds. It comes with an MP3 player and audio system with pre-loaded popular nursery rhymes.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Most countries visited on single tank of fuel is 14
article: British automotive services company RAC and Audi together set the Guinness record for most countries visited on a single 73-litre tank of fuel by covering 14 countries to demonstrate the efficiency of Audi's diesel engines. The drivers started their journey in the Netherlands and ended their trip at Hungary. The journey took them a total of 28 hours to complete.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla on Autopilot mode collides with bus in Germany
article: German police on Thursday said that a Tesla car operating under Autopilot mode had driven into the back of a bus while changing lanes. The police said they plan to investigate "why (Autopilot) did not work". However, the electric car maker said in a statement that the collision was unavoidable because the bus swerved into the vehicle's lane.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: New map service will find parking space in real-time
article: Mapping data provider 'Here', co-owned by Audi, BMW and Mercedes-Benz, has developed a platform through which cars will be able to exchange information in real-time. Vehicles will use their sensors and cameras to offer details on free parking spaces, traffic conditions and road hazards. The platform, scheduled to roll-out in 2017, will start by sourcing data from its parent automakers.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Giant working clock made by 14 moving trucks
article: Swedish automobile maker Scania recently generated a 750,000 sq ft working clock in a deserted airfield by strategically deploying 14 trucks that kept moving round-the-clock. Scania employed 90 drivers for two hours each, to drive the trucks representing the second, the minute and the hour hands of the clock. Fleet managers kept guiding the trucks from a monitoring room.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: No discounts on new Tesla cars: Musk to staff
article: Electric car maker Tesla CEO Elon Musk in an email has directed employees to follow the company's no negotiation and no discount policy on new cars, after a Twitter user raised concerns. Musk responded on Twitter saying, "Am tracking this down...There are zero discounts even for family." Musk also apologised to his employees for the "draconian language" in the email.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jeep unveils India-bound compact SUV 'Compass'
article: American automaker Jeep on Monday unveiled its India-bound compact SUV 'Compass' in Brazil. The car will be locally manufactured at the company's facility in Ranjangaon, near Pune, and will be launched in India in 2017. The exterior of the Compass resembles the company's Grand Cherokee, which marked Jeep's debut in India last month at a starting price of ₹93.64 lakh.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Toyota drops diesel engine from new model over 'Dieselgate'
article: Japanese automaker Toyota announced on Thursday that it will not offer a diesel variant of its new C-HR compact model following Volkswagen's emissions scandal. The company's Executive Vice President said that demand for diesel engines has fallen sharply over the past 6-12 months. He added that Toyota is likely to drop diesel variants from future renewals of its models also.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ford slashes Endeavour prices by up to ₹2.82 lakh
article: American automaker Ford has slashed the prices of its Endeavour SUV by up to ₹2.82 lakh. The price reduction comes after the company announced a price hike for Endeavour by up to ₹1.72 lakh in August this year. Starting from ₹23.78 lakh, the SUV's 2.2-litre diesel turbo engine generates 160PS of power.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: New human-powered speed record set at 141 kmph
article: A new human-powered land speed record was recently set by cyclist Todd Reichert by riding a bicycle inside an egg-shaped shell at a top speed of 141 kmph in Nevada. Made by company AeroVelo, which makes human-powered vehicles, the bicycle was faster than most of the Indian trains, including Shatabdi Express. The bike had a lightweight frame and thin tyres.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Nissan launches Datsun redi-GO Sport at ₹3.49 lakh
article: Japanese automaker Nissan on Thursday launched a limited 'Sport' edition of its Datsun redi-GO hatchback in India priced at ₹3.49 lakh (ex-showroom Delhi). The car, which will be available for sale only during the festive season, was presented to Olympic medallist Sakshi Malik at the launch event. Powered by a 799cc petrol engine, the car delivers 53 bhp.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Hyundai Motor union stages 1st full strike in 12 yrs
article: Automaker Hyundai Motor's South Korean labour union on Monday staged its first full nationwide strike in 12 years. This followed a series of partial stoppages since July at Hyundai's South Korean factories, its biggest manufacturing base. Notably, these have resulted in lost production of 1,01,400 vehicles worth $2.02 billion (as of Friday), Hyundai's biggest output loss in vehicles' value terms.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hero launches Achiever 150 at ₹61,800
article: Indian motorcycle maker Hero MotoCorp on Monday launched the Achiever 150 bike priced at ₹61,800 for the drum brake variant and ₹62,800 for the one with disc brake (ex-showroom, Delhi). Powered by a 150cc petrol engine, the bike delivers 13.4 hp and comes with side stand indicator, new body graphics and start-stop function.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Hero MotoCorp to phase out Maestro scooter
article: Hero MotoCorp has announced that it will phase out the production of its 109 cc Maestro scooter, reportedly to end the royalty payments to Honda India. The scooter, which starts at ₹48,300 (ex-showroom, New Delhi), uses a Honda-developed engine to deliver 8.05 bhp. Hero MotoCorp will continue to sell the new Maestro Edge in the 110 cc scooter segment.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: New Land Rover Discovery unveiled at Paris Motor Show
article: The 2017 Land Rover Discovery was unveiled at the ongoing Paris Motor Show on Wednesday. The seven-seater SUV features 'Intelligent Seat Fold' function, which allows users to reconfigure the second and the third row using the infotainment touchscreen or their smartphone. It comes with an 'Activity Key' to lock and unlock the vehicle, that can be worn as a wristband.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Volvo recalls 1.27 lakh vehicles over faulty AC
article: Swedish automobile manufacturer Volvo has recalled more than 1.27 lakh vehicles globally over an air-conditioning system fault. The air conditioning system may reportedly leak water into the vehicles and eventually lead to a malfunction of the airbags. The recall includes 2016 and 2017 XC90 SUVs, S90 sedans and V90 wagons, and is expected to officially start from November 14.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Microsoft partners Renault-Nissan for cloud-connected cars
article: Technology company Microsoft has partnered with the alliance between automotive manufacturers Renault-Nissan to work on connected car technologies. The services will provide advanced navigation, remote monitoring of car features, and over-the-air updates for cars connected to Microsoft's cloud computing platform Azure. Renault-Nissan aims to develop over 10 autonomous vehicles by 2020.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Mercedes built world's 1st diesel engine passenger car
article: The Mercedes-Benz 260 D in the W138 series was the world's first production diesel passenger car. It was presented in 1936, over 40 years after the diesel engine was invented by Rudolf Diesel. The car was powered by a 2.6-litre four-cylinder engine which produced 45 hp. Less than 2,000 units of the six-seater car were manufactured.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Audi releases political satire ad on US election
article: The US division of German automobile manufacturer Audi has released a new commercial asking its viewers to "choose the next driver wisely" in the upcoming presidential elections. The political satire has been titled 'Duel' and depicts two hotel valets fighting over who will drive an Audi car. The company has also revealed that the commercial hides 18 'Easter eggs'.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mercedes launches India-made GLC SUV at ₹47.90L
article: German automaker Mercedes-Benz on Thursday launched an Indian-assembled version of GLC-Class SUV in India at ₹47.90 lakh (ex-showroom, Delhi). The 220d Sport has been priced at ₹51.50 lakh and the GLC 300 Sport petrol variant costs ₹51.90 lakh. The SUV's 2.2-litre diesel engine generates 170PS of power. The vehicles will be assembled at the automaker's manufacturing facility in Chakan, Pune.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Audi suspends sale of Q5 in India over emission
article: German automobile manufacturer Audi has suspended the sales of its Q5 SUV in India after Automotive Research Association of India (ARAI) found emission level from the model higher than the prescribed limit. "We have conducted testing of the solution in Q5 vehicles with ARAI," said an Audi spokesperson. The company is waiting for ARAI's approval for the proposed fix.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Volkswagen to pay $1.2bn to dealers for emission fraud
article: Volkswagen on Friday confirmed that it will pay up to $1.21 billion to 652 US brand dealers as part of the compensation for losses suffered by them due to the German automaker's emissions scandal.
