In June, Volkswagen agreed to a $15.3 billion settlement involving a buyback of 4,75,000 US vehicles after admitting to have violated fuel emission tests since 2009.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Mahindra launches Mirzya-themed Centuro at ₹46,750
article: Mahindra on Wednesday launched a special edition of its Mahindra Centuro motorcycle, celebrating its association with the upcoming Bollywood movie Mirzya directed by Rakeysh Omprakash Mehra. Priced at ₹46,750 (ex-showroom New Delhi), the 106.7cc motorcycle delivers 8.5PS and develops 8.5Nm of torque. The bike also has features like black alloy wheels, flip key and LED tail lamps.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Firm raises $2.5mn to protect self-driving cars from hackers
article: Israeli cybersecurity startup Karamba Security has raised $2.5 million in series A funding to protect internet-connected cars and self-driving vehicles from hackers. Venture firm Fontinalis Partners led the investment, joined by existing investors YL Ventures and GlenRock. Karamba's software locks in factory settings of a car, and prevents foreign code and restricted behaviour from running.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Maruti's passenger vehicle sales up 31% in Sept
article: The country’s largest carmaker Maruti Suzuki on Saturday reported a 31.1% year-on-year growth in its passenger vehicle sales in September, which stood at 1.49 lakh units. Sales of mini segment cars, including Alto and WagonR models rose 24.8%. Meanwhile, the compact segment, comprising Swift, Ritz, Celerio, Baleno, and Dzire models, saw a rise of 12.3%, the company said.

author: Nissan
abstract: Nissan launches the new Micra with European-style interiors
article: Automobile major Nissan India has launched the new Micra hatchback with a new ‘Sunshine Orange’ colour and European-style all-black sporty interior, ahead of the festive season. The car has a starting price of ₹4.55 lakh (Ex-showroom, New Delhi) and its CVT version, priced at ₹5.99 lakh, is India’s most affordable premium automatic car equipped with a continuously variable transmission (CVT).

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Lamborghini launches Huracan Avio in India at ₹3.71 cr
article: Italian supercar-maker Lamborghini on Thursday launched the limited edition Lamborghini Huracan Avio at ₹3.71 crore (ex-showroom, Delhi). A tribute to the bravery of the Air Force, the car is powered by a 5.2-litre V10 engine that develops 602 hp and 560 Nm of torque. With a top-speed of over 325 kmph, it can go from 0-100 kmph in 3.2 seconds.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Largest diesel engine consumes 6,000 litre fuel in 1 hour
article: The world’s largest diesel engine, the Wärtsilä-Sulzer RTA96-C, produces 108,920 hp of power and consumes over 6,200 litres of fuel per hour at its most efficient power setting. The 20 lakh-kg engine has been powering Emma Mærsk, one of the world's largest container ships, since 2011. With a height of 44 feet, it is taller than an average four-storey building.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Honda vehicle sets land speed record at 421 kmph
article: Japanese automobile maker Honda's S-Dream Streamliner has set a land speed record by reaching a speed of 421 kmph, making it the fastest vehicle in its class. The record has also made the roadster the fastest ever Honda-powered car. The modified S-Dream Streamliner was powered by a three-cylinder 600-cc engine, making it three times more powerful than the original vehicle.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Venturi breaks electric speed record at 576 kmph
article: Luxury electric car maker Venturi has set a new land speed record for electric vehicles with a top speed of 576 kmph in its Venturi Buckeye Bullet-3. The 3,000-horsepower car also claims an average speed record of 549.4 kmph in the electric vehicle category. The team broke its own top speed record achieved with the Venturi Buckeye Bullet-2.5 in 2010.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: World's fastest Volkswagen Beetle runs at 330 kmph
article: A specially-tuned Volkswagen Beetle LSR recently achieved 330.11 kmph over a flying mile, the fastest speed ever recorded for a Beetle. Powered by a 2.0-litre turbocharged engine, the car produced 543 horsepower and was outfitted with a pair of parachutes to slow it down. Volkswagen’s standard Beetle R-Line coupe model delivers 210 horsepower at a top speed of 209 kmph.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Toyota using human waste to power electric car
article: Yoshikazu Tanaka, the chief engineer of Toyota's hydrogen fuel-cell car Mirai, has revealed that the Japanese automotive manufacturer is converting human waste into hydrogen to fuel the car. Microorganisms are added to the solid waste from sewage to create biogas and eventually extract pure hydrogen. Mirai combines hydrogen and oxygen to make electricity, while only emitting water vapour.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: McLaren denies $1.3 bn Apple acquisition report
article: British sports car manufacturer McLaren has denied reports that technology giant Apple had proposed a strategic investment or a potential acquisition of the company. "We regularly have confidential conversations with a wide range of parties, but we keep them confidential," added a McLaren spokesperson. Reports had pegged McLaren's valuation to be between $1.3-1.95 billion.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: New Jaguar XF launched in India at ₹49.5 lakh
article: British car manufacturer Jaguar on Wednesday launched 2016 version of its Jaguar XF sedan in India priced between ₹49.5 lakh – ₹61.85 lakh (ex-showroom, Delhi). Its 2.0-litre turbocharged petrol engine generates 237hp. Jaguar XF accelerates from 0-100 kmph in 8.7 seconds and has a top speed of 229 kmph. The sedan's deliveries are scheduled to begin from September 2016 end.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Google self-driving car crashes into a van
article: Google's self-driving car on Friday crashed into a van after the van reportedly crossed a red light in Mountain View, California. Nobody was injured in the accident and local television stations reported that the Google car had been in control at the time of the crash. The car was reportedly manned by a Google employee who applied the brakes.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: LeEco raises $1.08 bn to build electric sports car
article: Chinese technology company LeEco has raised $1.08 billion in its latest funding to make its first electric sports car. LeEco's Founder and CEO Yueting Jia claimed that the funding is the largest ever in the automotive industry to date. The company has already unveiled the LeSEE, a concept sedan design intended to be completely self-driving.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Bentley, Lamborghini skip motor show to cut costs
article: German automotive company Volkswagen has withdrawn Bentley and Lamborghini from the 2016 Paris Motor Show next week as a cost-cutting measure, following its diesel emissions scandal. Earlier this year, Volkswagen had settled for about $15 billion after admitting it had used illegal software to rig diesel emissions tests. Ford, Volvo and Aston Martin will also be skipping the show.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Sachin Tendulkar buys customised BMW 7 Series
article: Former cricketer Sachin Tendulkar has got himself a customised BMW 750Li M-Sport, a 7 Series model by German luxury vehicle maker BMW. The car has been customised for Tendulkar by BMW Individual, the carmaker's customisation vertical. Earlier this month, Tendulkar got a custom paint job for his BMW i8.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla sued for 'Insane Mode' not being fast enough
article: Electric car manufacturer Tesla has been sued by about 126 Norwegian car owners, alleging that cars marketed with an "insane mode" of acceleration didn't go as fast as advertised. The owners claim their cars only reached 469 horsepower instead of the promised 700 horsepower. Tesla has said its cars meet requirements "according to the measurement method required by the authorities".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: New ride-sharing electric car to last for 16L kms
article: Dutch startup Amber Mobility is planning to launch a ride-sharing electric vehicle next year called 'Amber One' which will have a lifespan of more than 16 lakh kilometres. It will accelerate from 0-100 kmph in seven seconds and have a top speed of 160 kmph. The company claims it to be the first car specifically designed to be shared.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Researchers control Tesla Model S from 19 km away
article: A team of Chinese researchers was able to wirelessly access a high-tech Tesla Model S sedan and take control of its brakes, door locks and dashboard computer screen, from 19 km away. To gain access, the car was connected to a malicious Wi-Fi hotspot set up by the team. Tesla acknowledged the vulnerability and fixed it through a software update.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Maruti launches MS Dhoni inspired special edition Alto
article: Country's largest carmaker Maruti Suzuki India on Saturday launched 'MS Dhoni inspired' special editions of Alto800 and AltoK10 cars as part of the carmaker's association with the upcoming movie 'MS Dhoni – The Untold Story'. The special edition cars will be available for sale at Maruti Suzuki dealerships from the first week of October 2016.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Volkswagen wins Nobel spoof award for 'defeat device'
article: German automaker Volkswagen has won the 26th Ig Nobel spoof award in Chemistry for engineering its vehicles to produce fewer emissions whenever the cars are being tested. The company equipped a 'defeat device' in its vehicles that controlled emissions of an engine while undergoing government tests. Volkswagen is spending up to $16.5 billion to address US environmental and owner claims.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup develops electric car for on-demand carpooling
article: Danish startup Spiri has revealed a prototype of the electric car for its on-demand carpooling service set to launch in 2017. The startup has pooled talent from Aston Martin and Tesla to create the "lab on wheels". Spiri has claimed that through its system, the average passenger fare will be as low as a bus ticket.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber rival Grab launches self-driving car fleet
article: Uber's rival Grab has become the world's second ride-hailing service to offer self-driven cars on a trial basis by launching a fleet of autonomous cars in Singapore. This comes days after Uber debuted its self-driving vehicles in the United States. Grab has teamed with driverless software developer nuTonomy for the fleet, and plans a commercial launch by 2018.

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: Mahindra to recall new gen Scorpio over faulty hose
article: India's top SUV maker Mahindra & Mahindra on Wednesday said they will recall an unspecified number of its new generation Scorpio and NuvoSport SUVs to rectify a faulty fluid hose. The company added that free inspection and rectification of the fluid hose in the engine compartment will be available for all Scorpio and NuvoSport SUVs manufactured till June 2016.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Maruti crosses 15L units mark in cumulative exports
article: The country's largest automaker Maruti Suzuki India on Friday announced crossing the milestone of 15 lakh vehicles in its cumulative exports. These have been exported to over 100 countries including Europe, Latin America, and Africa, the company stated. Earlier, the company’s premium hatchback Baleno, manufactured exclusively in India, became the first car to be exported from India to Japan.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Mini unveils 2017 John Cooper Works Clubman
article: BMW-owned Mini has unveiled '2017 Mini John Cooper Works Clubman' which will go on sale in December. Powered by a 2.0-litre Mini TwinPower Turbo engine, the car produces 228 hp and delivers higher torque than any previous John Cooper Works model. The car has a top speed of 236 kmph, and can accelerate from 0-100 km in about 6 seconds

author: Sanira Mediratta
abstract: Turkish company builds real-life transformers
article: Turkish company, Letvision, has built a working prototype transformer called Letrons that transforms all by itself. In the BMW vehicle mode, it can be driven via a remote control, and in the robot mode, internal hydraulics allow it to move body parts. The company seeks to sell these life-sized toys, which will transform from robots into various types of BMWs.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: MAN to cut 1,400 jobs to save over $500 million
article: German heavy goods vehicles maker MAN has planned to cut 1,400 jobs at its diesel-engine operations to increase savings by over €450 million ($500 million). The restructuring plan includes streamlining internal processes, cutting costs in development, distribution and other areas, and promoting strategy and portfolio development, the automaker said. Notably, MAN is owned by the Volkswagen Group.

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: Honda increases the price of all its cars in India
article: Honda Cars India on Wednesday increased the price of all its cars in India from ₹6,300 to ₹14,250 depending on models, reports said. The hike, applicable from September 15, 2016, will see the premium sedan Honda City's price raised by ₹11,000. The newly introduced crossover Honda BR-V will get a price hike of up to ₹14,250.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Chiron can suck in 60,000 litres of air per minute
article: Luxury sports car Bugatti Chiron can suck in 60,000 litres of air per minute, almost as much as a human being would breathe in five days. Chiron, with a top speed of 420 km per hour, has four turbochargers pumping air inside the engine cylinders for combustion. The automaker's founder, Ettore Bugatti was born on September 15, 1881.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Bentley took a 53 billion-pixel car pic with NASA tech
article: Bentley used technology developed by NASA for its Mars rovers to take a 53 billion-pixel image of its 'Mulsanne Extended Wheelbase' car crossing San Francisco’s Golden Gate bridge. The image is over 4,000 times larger than a smartphone picture and can cover a football field if printed. Bentley Co-founder WO Bentley was born 128 years ago on September 16, 1888.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Man takes home demo Kawasaki bike after non-delivery
article: A Chennai resident reportedly took home a Kawasaki bike meant for display from a Navi-Mumbai showroom after being denied delivery of his motorcycle despite making full payment. The man asked the staff to either refund his money or give him the display bike. The showroom's dealership was terminated by Kawasaki about a week ago, citing failure to make deliveries.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Bentley CEOs still receive the company car from 1930
article: A 1930 8-litre Bentley, which was the last car designed by Co-founder Walter Owen Bentley for the company, is still handed down to successive CEOs as the symbolic company car. The car, restored in 2006, has a top speed of 160 kmph and was marketed as being 'dead silent'. WO Bentley was born 128 years ago on September 16, 1888.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: General Motors failed to buy Ford due to cash shortage
article: American automobile multinational General Motors reportedly tried to buy rival Ford Motor Company in 1909, but failed due to lack of $2 million in cash. Out of the total $8 million deal, $2 million had to be paid in cash upfront, but GM could not secure finances because of earlier acquisitions. General Motors was founded on September 16, 1908.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla sues man for pretending to be Elon Musk
article: Tesla has sued a man for pretending to be CEO Elon Musk to procure non-public data about the automaker. Tesla CFO Jason Wheeler received an email signed with Musk's name requesting detailed information about the company's second quarter results. Tesla believes that the email was from an oil industry executive trying to undermine Tesla's push for energy-efficient transportation alternatives.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: The original James Bond car was a Bentley
article: Fictional British Secret Service agent James Bond drove a 1930 4.5-litre 'Blower Bentley' in 'Casino Royale', the first 007 novel by Ian Fleming. Bond drove the car "with an almost sensual pleasure", wrote the author. Fleming switched Bond's car to an Aston Martin in the series' seventh book, 'Goldfinger'. Friday marked the 128th birth anniversary of Bentley Co-founder WO Bentley.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: General Motors invented automatic transmission in 1939
article: American automobile multinational General Motors developed the world's first fully automatic transmission for passenger automobile use in 1939, called the Hydra-Matic. The clutch and clutch pedal were eliminated for the car to be operated solely through the accelerator. General Motors, that was founded 108 years ago on September 16, 1908, currently produces vehicles under 11 brands.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Man accused of stealing 20 luxury cars arrested
article: The Delhi Police has said that they have arrested 35-year-old MBA graduate Satendra Singh Shekhawat, the accused in 20 luxury car thefts across the country. The police nabbed him while investigating the theft of an Audi Q7 from the Holiday Inn hotel in Delhi. Previously, Shekhawat has reportedly served jail-term in Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra and Rajasthan for stealing cars.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Ducati launches XDiavel bikes starting at ₹15.87 lakh
article: Italian motorcycle manufacturer Ducati on Thursday launched its XDiavel and XDiavel S cruiser motorcycles in India at ₹15.87 lakh and ₹18.47 lakh respectively (all prices ex-showroom, Delhi). Powered by an L-Twin liquid cooled engine, the 1262 cc XDiavel delivers 156 hp at 9,000 rpm. XDiavel S delivers 162 hp and also has a Bluetooth-enabled infotainment system on the dashboard.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Obama says self-driving cars could change lives
article: US President Barack Obama has said that self-driving cars could change the lives of senior citizens and people with disabilities for whom driving is difficult. "Automated vehicles have the potential to save tens of thousands of lives each year", he added. Obama's administration has also announced a 15-point safety checklist to be followed by manufacturers of self-driving vehicles.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Volvo unveils India-bound V90 Cross Country
article: Swedish car manufacturer Volvo has unveiled the India-bound five-seater wagon V90 Cross Country. While the company did not disclose the engine options, it is expected to carry 2.0-litre diesel motor. The car seats have a massaging function. The V90 Cross Country is expected to launch in India in 2017 with price ranging between ₹60-65 lakh.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Used car marketplace Droom starts selling new cars
article: Gurgaon-based startup Droom has forayed into the new cars segment, in addition to providing a platform for buying and selling used automobiles. The startup has tied up with brands like Nissan, Chevrolet, and Hero Electric for this purpose. Droom will reportedly also let users take a bank loan of up to 50% of the vehicle's pre-approved value.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Most Lyft rides to be self-driving in 5 yrs: President
article: US ride-hailing giant Lyft's Co-founder and President John Zimmer in a blog post on Sunday said, "Within five years a fully autonomous fleet of cars will provide majority of Lyft rides across the country". Zimmer added, "By 2025, private car ownership will all-but end in major US cities". Notably, Lyft rival Uber recently launched the first fleet of self-driving cars.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: New self-driving car 'smiles' at pedestrians
article: Swedish technology firm Semcon has developed a concept for a 'smiling' self-driving car that lets pedestrians know when it is safe to cross the street. When the car's sensors detect a pedestrian, a signal is sent to its front-facing display that lights up like a smile, confirming that the car will stop at a safe distance.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Mercedes unveils convertible AMG GT Roadster
article: German automobile manufacturer Mercedes has unveiled the open top version of its two-seater AMG GT sports car, the 'Mercedes-AMG GT Roadster'. Powered by a 4.0-litre, twin-turbo V8 engine, the car delivers 476 hp. The AMG GT Roadster accelerates from 0-100 kmph in 4 seconds and has a top speed of 302 kmph.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Honda reveals 2017 Civic hatchback
article: Japanese automaker Honda has revealed the 2017 Civic hatchback, ahead of its debut at the Paris Motor Show. The 10th-generation Civic hatchback comes with all-new styling and its rear features C-shaped LED taillights​. It will come with two new turbocharged petrol engines - a 1.0-litre three-cylinder unit with 127 bhp, and a 1.5-litre four-cylinder unit that delivers 180 bhp.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Porsche unveils Panamera 4 E-Hybrid
article: German automobile manufacturer Porsche has unveiled the Panamera 4 E-Hybrid model, which will head to the 2016 Paris Motor Show. Powered by a 2.9-litre twin-turbo V6 petrol motor and an electric motor, the car develops a maximum of 462 hp. The Panamera can accelerate from 0-100 kmph in 4.6 seconds and has a top speed of 278 kmph.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Rolls-Royce to cut over 200 management jobs
article: British car manufacturing company Rolls-Royce is cutting more than 200 management jobs as a part of its ongoing restructuring. The restructuring is a part of CEO Warren East's turnaround programme announced last year, to save $195-$260 million a year by 2017. The company in January announced cutting a few dozen senior management jobs and cut another 150 positions in March.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Aston teases DB11 Volante to be launched in 2018
article: British luxury sports car manufacturer Aston Martin has teased DB11 Volante by sharing three pictures on Facebook ahead of its launch scheduled for Spring 2018. The pictures reveal that the upcoming roadster will feature a folding soft-top roof. Power for the DB11 Volante is expected to come from the automaker's all-new 5.2-liter twin-turbo V12 that generates 600 horsepower.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mahindra suspends production of Verito Vibe: Report
article: Indian automaker Mahindra & Mahindra has reportedly suspended the production of its sole compact sedan in the country, the Verito Vibe. While no production of the car has taken place in the current financial year, 32 units of the car were sold during the same period. However, the company has maintained that the car has not been discontinued.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Mercedes opens its largest parts warehouse in Pune
article: German automaker Mercedes-Benz on Thursday inaugurated its largest parts warehouse in the luxury car segment and a vehicle preparation centre in Pune. Mercedes also inaugurated its biggest South-Asian retail training academy in the city. The parts warehouse will cater to over 50 locations, while the academy can offer training to 225 participants per day, the firm said.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: West Bengal to give 25 acres of land to Volvo
article: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said that the state will provide around 25 acres of land in the Panagarh Industrial Park to Swedish automobile firm Volvo. However, she did not specify what Volvo would do with the land. Further, Banerjee said the state government’s target is to prepare a workforce of six lakh skilled workers every year.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Speaker system made from Porsche 911 parts
article: German automaker Porsche's subsidiary Porsche Design has made a speaker out of a Porsche 911 parts. The 911 Soundbar, made out of a GT3's muffler system, replaces woofers with exhaust pipes, which deliver sound at a maximum volume of 99 decibels. Priced at $3,500, the limited edition speakers also feature a 2.1 virtual surround system and wireless, lossless audio transmission.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Non-HP vehicles to pay green tax for entering Shimla
article: Vehicles registered outside Himachal Pradesh will now have to pay a green tax for entering the Shimla Municipal Corporation area. The tax would be ₹50 for two-wheelers, ₹200 for small cars, ₹300 for SUVs, and ₹500 for trucks. However, no barrier would be erected at entry points and random checking of outside vehicles would be done to ensure compliance.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Hyundai recalls 41k SUVs in US over software glitch
article: South Korean automaker Hyundai is recalling about 41,000 small SUVs (sports utility vehicles) in the United States to fix a software glitch that can stop the vehicles from accelerating. The recall covers 2016 Tucson models with seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transmission. The recall began on September 7 following pressure from the US National Highway Traffic Safety Administration.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: GM seeks 1-yr delay in recalling Takata airbags
article: General Motors (GM) has asked US safety regulators for a one-year delay in the mandatory recall of almost a million vehicles with Takata airbags. GM has reasoned that the designated models have not been found to carry risks linked to deaths and injuries. However, earlier, drivers have reportedly been killed by shrapnel in instances of Takata airbags exploding with force.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Bugatti Chiron can consume 10 litre petrol in a minute
article: Sports-car Bugatti Chiron can consume over 10 litres of petrol in under a minute, while running at a top speed of nearly 420 km per hour. The car, with an 8.0-litre W16 engine, is capable of producing 1500 bhp and 1600 Nm of torque. The automaker's founder, Ettore Bugatti was born 135 years ago on September 15, 1881.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Bentley unveils its fastest four-door sedan
article: British automaker Bentley has unveiled 'Flying Spur W12 S', its fastest four-door sedan, with a top speed of 325 kmph. Powered by a 6.0-litre W12 engine, the luxury sports sedan produces 626hp and can accelerate from 0-100 km in 4.5 seconds. While the price of the W12 S model has not been announced, entry-level Flying Spurs start at over $200,000.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup unveils 1-seater electric car with 3 wheels
article: Canadian startup Electra Meccanica on Friday unveiled its 2017 SOLO electric car which has three wheels and seats one person. The car can travel at a top speed of 130 kmph, accelerating from 0-100 kmph in under eight seconds. Priced at roughly $15,500, SOLO will be able to operate for 160 km on a single charge.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Firm claims to make 1st Indian crossover electric bike
article: Chennai-based startup Volta Motors has developed 'Volta Zap' which it claims is the first crossover electric bike to be made completely in India. The bike offers a range of 60 km on a single charge and running cost of 7 paise per km. Volta Zap's battery can also be used as a power bank for charging mobile phones and laptops.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: India's 1st plug-in hybrid SUV launched at ₹1.25 cr
article: Volvo on Wednesday launched the first plug-in hybrid SUV in India, 'XC90 T8 Excellence Plug-In Hybrid' at ₹1.25 crore (ex-showroom, Delhi). Powered by a 2.0-litre supercharged and turbocharged engine and 9.2kWh battery, the hybrid SUV delivers 400 HP. Two charging stations, which can be installed at any location, are also included in the price of the vehicle.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: World's 1st vehicle that can be packed, shipped made
article: A philanthropist and a car designer have developed 'Ox', the world's first vehicle that can be packed into a flat box and shipped. The vehicle, which seats 13 people and carries over 1800 kg of cargo, can be dismantled by three people in 12 hours. It has been created to transport water, grain and building materials to Africa's developing countries.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Eider Motors Chairman arrested over ₹10 crore fraud
article: Chairman of Hyderabad-based two-wheeler company Eider Motors, Maroju Shiva Kumar was recently arrested by Hyderabad Police for cheating 40 investors of about ₹10 crore. Eider Motors has been accused of not supplying the vehicles to dealerships as the motorcycles did not have the required permissions from the government. The company had promised a 650 cc motorcycle for around ₹3,37,130.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ford engineers build in-car water dispenser
article: American automaker Ford's engineers have built a new technology called 'On-the-go H2O', which includes a drinking water tap on the front console of a car. The water supply comes from the condensation that is a natural byproduct of the vehicle's air conditioning system. According to the creators, the technology can provide clean water in developing countries.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Electric Chevrolet Bolt goes 383 km on single charge
article: General Motors on Tuesday said that its Chevrolet Bolt electric car will be able to go 383 kilometres on a single charge. The range is higher than Tesla's least expensive Model S priced at $66,000, which has a range of 352 kilometres. Scheduled to launch later this year, the electric Chevrolet Bolt is expected to be priced at $37,500.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: All cars to have overspeeding alert system, airbags
article: The Road Transport and Highways Ministry is going to make it mandatory to put an over-speeding warning system with beeps or continuous alarms and airbags in all cars, an official has said. Further, the government will also install cameras on roads to check errant drivers and curb accidents. Notably, India accounts for around five lakh road accidents annually.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: George Hotz unveils $999 kit to turn car self-driving
article: The first known person to unlock an iPhone, George Hotz on Tuesday unveiled 'Comma One', a $999 kit that turns select cars to self-driving vehicles. The first product of his startup, named Comma.ai, when fitted into a car wouldn't require a driver to touch the wheel or the brake. Hotz will start shipping the kit by the end of 2016.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: Anand Mahindra to gift golden Thar to Mariyappan
article: Giving into demands made by Twitter users, Anand Mahindra is set to gift a golden Mahindra Thar to Paralympic gold medallist Mariyappan Thangavelu. The industrialist later added a ₹10 lakh award for the athlete by tweeting, "[A]m adding a gift of ₹10 lakh from my personal a/c. His Paralympic Gold was achieved against higher odds. His was a #Rise moment."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Toyota launches Etios, Liva starting at ₹5.24 lakh
article: Japanese automaker Toyota today launched its hatchback Etios Liva and C-segment sedan Etios in India at a starting price of ₹5.24 lakh and ₹6.43 lakh (ex-showroom, Mumbai) respectively. Both vehicles carry forward their existing 1.2-litre and 1.5-litre petrol engines and deliver 80PS and 90PS respectively. Also available in 1.4-litre diesel variant, the car delivers 68PS.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ford to sell driverless cars to public by 2025: CEO
article: American automaker Ford's CEO Mark Fields on Monday said that the company will start selling driverless cars to the public by 2025. Fields added that Ford will begin sales of robot taxis to ride-hailing services by 2021. "We’re dedicated to putting autonomous vehicles on the road for millions of people, not just those who can afford luxury cars,” he said.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber launches first self-driving fleet
article: Ride-hailing startup Uber on Wednesday launched its first self-driving fleet for select users in Pittsburgh, US. Uber displayed a fleet of 14 Ford Fusions equipped with radar, cameras and other sensing equipment for self-driving. While a driver will always be behind the steering wheel, Uber riders will be able to see the car drive itself from the back seat.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mahindra launches new Bolero Power+ at ₹6.59 lakh
article: Mahindra & Mahindra on Monday launched​ its new SUV Bolero Power+ in India at a starting price of ₹6.59 lakh (ex-showroom, Mumbai). Its 1.5-litre mHawk-D70 engine claims to deliver 13% more power and 5% more mileage than the existing Boleros. The new Bolero shuts down the engine if any key other than the original is used to start the vehicle.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Ford to enter bike-sharing, shuttle service businesses
article: American automaker Ford has announced its acquisition of shuttle service startup Chariot and investment in bike-sharing program Motivate. Ford will also set up a "city solutions" team to work with global cities to solve congestion issues. "We want to work with communities to offer even more transportation choices and solutions for people—for decades to come," said Ford CEO Mark Fields.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: GM recalls 4.3mn vehicles globally over air bag defect
article: US automaker General Motors (GM) on Friday said that it will recall nearly 4.3 million vehicles worldwide due to a software defect that can prevent air bags from deploying during a crash. GM said that the latest recall involved trucks, cars, and SUV models from 2014-2017. The company was earlier involved in a record recall involving defective Takata air bags.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Google driverless car tech to detect emergency vehicle
article: Google has patented a new technology for its self-driving car which will let the car detect flashing lights of the emergency vehicles and respond accordingly. The technology would allow a car to see and interpret flashing lights and their colors, specifically red, blue, and a potential third color, which is a common scheme of emergency lights.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Toyota to hike prices of all vehicles in India
article: Toyota Kirloskar Motor is planning to hike the prices of all its vehicles in India by the end of this month or very early next month. The hike is to offset the impact of adverse foreign exchange and rising input costs. The company's Director and Senior VP N Raja said the hike could be around 2-3% in the current prices.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Apple starts testing self-driving car software: Report
article: Apple's self-driving car initiative, 'Project Titan', which aims to build software for autonomous cars, has reportedly reached its testing stage on closed tracks. Earlier this year, the company changed its strategy from building its own self-driving vehicles to developing software for autonomous cars. As per a previous report, Apple has been targeting a release deadline of 2020 for the software.

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: Volkswagen engineer pleads guilty in emissions case
article: A Volkswagen engineer, James Liang has pleaded guilty in a US District court to one count of financial fraud in the company's emissions cheating scandal. Liang was indicted in June over the financial fraud along with another count of violating the Clean Air Act. Earlier, Volkswagen had admitted to installing "defeat devices" and agreed to pay a $16.5 billion compensation.

author: Aarushi Maheshwari
abstract: Goa to host Vintage Bike and Car Festival in Oct
article: The Goa Tourism department is organising its first Vintage Bike and Car Festival on October 1, with over 50 vintage vehicles slated to drive down the city during the day-long event. The Tourism department spokesperson said the vehicles would be dated from 1933 to 1970 and include cars such as "Chevrolet, Mercedes, Volkswagen and bikes like Norton, BSA and BMW."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mercedes teases convertible AMG GT in new video
article: Global automobile manufacturer Mercedes on Monday teased a convertible version of its AMG GT sports car. The new car, scheduled to debut at the Paris Motor Show in a few weeks, will reportedly be called 'Mercedes-AMG GT C Roadster'. Powered by a 4-litre twin-turbo V8 engine, it is said to deliver 456 hp.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber releases video showcasing its self-driving taxis
article: Ride-hailing startup Uber has released a video titled 'Pittsburgh, your self-driving Uber is arriving now', showing one of its self-driving taxis driving passengers in the US city. The self-driving cars are currently supervised by a human in the driver's seat. The fleet consists of 14 modified Ford Fusion sedans with sensors that use cameras, lasers, radars, and GPS receivers.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Nissan recalls 134k Maxima, Murano over fire risk
article: Japanese automaker Nissan has recalled around 134,000 Maxima sedans and Murano crossovers in the US due to fire risk. Most of the models affected by the recall are equipped with Intelligent Cruise Control system. Owners of the affected vehicles have been asked to park their vehicles outdoors and not drive them until they are fixed.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Tata Motors global sales up 16% in August
article: Indian automaker Tata Motors on Friday reported a 16% increase in its global sales in August compared to the year-ago period at 86,288 units. In the passenger vehicles category, the company's global sales were up by 25% at 56,104 units, while sales of the luxury brand Jaguar Land Rover grew 28% to 42,260 units, during the period under review.

author: Audi
abstract: Audi launches the new A4 at ₹38.10 lakh in India
article: German automobile major Audi today launched the new-generation Audi A4 30 TFSI, starting at ₹38.10 lakh (ex-showroom Delhi & Maharashtra). Equipped with a 1.4-litre turbocharged petrol engine, it delivers 150PS of power, 250Nm of torque and a fuel efficiency of 17.84 kmpl. The car comes with intelligent technologies like virtual cockpit, new MMI control, LED headlights amongst others.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Hitler asked Porsche founder to make Volkswagen Beetle
article: Ferdinand Porsche, founder of Porsche, got a contract from Adolf Hitler in 1934 to build a 'people's car', or the Volkswagen, for the Germans. Porsche created a small and affordable car for the working class which could carry a family of five, called the Beetle. The legendary automotive engineer was born 141 years ago on September 3, 1875.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Sachin Tendulkar gets his BMW i8 custom painted to red
article: Cricketer Sachin Tendulkar has got his BMW i8 sports car custom painted to a shade of red from the factory shade of white, making it the country’s first custom painted i8. The new paint-job is also complimented with new, gunmetal finished HRE wheels and fatter tires. The cricketer is BMW India’s brand ambassador.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Sindhu and Sakshi receive customized Mahindra Thar
article: Olympic medalists PV Sindhu and Sakshi Malik were handed over customised Mahindra Thar vehicles for their performance in Rio, as promised by Chairman Anand Mahindra. Sakshi’s red-coloured Thar has been customised with a bronze coloured front fascia and matching stripes which symbolise her bronze medal, while Sindhu’s Thar has been finished in a silver colour with matching stripes.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Land Rover unveils world's first smart seat feature
article: Automaker Land Rover has unveiled world's first smart seat feature in its new Discovery, which lets owners reconfigure their vehicle seating from anywhere with an app. Land Rover claims that the app lets customers adjust the layout of the seats inside the car in 14 seconds. Adventurer Bear Grylls demonstrated the feature mid-air​ after jumping out of an airplane.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Porsche made the world's first hybrid car in 1901
article: Ferdinand Porsche, founder of German automaker Porsche, created the world's first functional hybrid car 'Semper Vivus' in 1901. With a reported total range of 200 km, the car could cover long distances on battery power until the petrol combustion engine had to be engaged to recharge the batteries. The automative engineer was born 141 years ago on September 3, 1875.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Man modifies Toyota Fortuner to carry off-road scooter
article: An Indian man, Vikram Dharam, has modified his Toyota Fortuner to carry a modified scooter at the rear of the SUV. The stock front bumper has also been removed for the convenience of climbing over steep inclines, and there is a ladder on sides to climb up the roof to access the tent system and cylindrical water tank.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Kawasaki cancels Mumbai dealership for cheating buyers
article: Japanese motorcycle maker Kawasaki recently terminated the dealership of SNK Palm Beach in Mumbai for failing to deliver motorcycles booked by users and issuing refunds for the payments made. In a statement, Kawasaki added that the dealer "had committed material breaches of the terms and conditions of the dealership". Some customers have reportedly filed FIRs against the dealership.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mercedes, Microsoft working on 'In Car Office'
article: Luxury automaker Mercedes and technology major Microsoft are currently working on an 'In Car Office' project that will let owners complete work-related tasks while driving. The technology will sync a user's smartphone to integrate calendar, to-do list and contacts with car’s navigation. This will allow the car to access meetings' addresses and make work-related calls through in-car voice system.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Quikr launches real-time car tracking platform
article: Classifieds platform Quikr has launched QuickScanner for Cars, a system for car tracking and diagnostics in real-time. The system includes a plug-and-play device that fits into a car's OBD2 ports, and offers real-time engine diagnostics. It also offers features like GPS tracking, real-time engine monitoring for fuel efficiency and theft or tow alarm, via the 'QuikrScanner for Cars' smartphone app.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Jaguar Land Rover to manufacture SUVs in India: Report
article: British automaker Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) is reportedly planning to manufacture Land Rover SUVs in India. The Tata Motors-owned company might make a mini version of its Defender SUV locally by 2019-20, said the report. In September 2015, JLR CEO Ralf Speth had said the company did not plan on building a plant in India.

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: Maruti Suzuki's Brezza, Ciaz lead car sales in India
article: Maruti Suzuki's Vitara Brezza has topped sales in the SUV segment with 31,930 units sold, and the company's Ciaz topped sales in the Sedan segment in the April-July period. Ciaz sold 18,852 units, overtaking Honda City, which sold 16,996 units in the same period. According to reports, Maruti Suzuki's market share has grown to 44.4% in the top 10 cities.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Dubai unveils its first driverless bus service
article: Dubai recently unveiled its first ever driverless bus service, which will be deployed in the city for a month-long trial period. The service includes 10-seater electric buses that can travel at a speed of 40 kmph. The bus can adapt its speed to the surrounding environment and even come to a complete halt if a pedestrian crosses its path.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Hyperloop track construction delayed in California
article: High-speed transport system developer Hyperloop Transportation Technologies (HTT) has not yet filed an environmental review application, delaying construction of the "world's first passenger-ready" Hyperloop track in California. In January this year, the company had said it would start construction in the middle of 2016. HTT CEO Dirk Ahlborn has blamed the delay on "bureaucratic processes".

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Mercedes unveils delivery vans that launch drones
article: Mercedes-Benz along with drone-making startup Matternet on Wednesday unveiled 'Vision Van' concept, an automated cargo van with integrated drones. Vision Van's rooftop serves as the launch and landing pad for drones that can carry packages weighing 2 kg across 20 km. The electric van can load cargo and change batteries without human intervention.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: BMW wishes India Ganesh Chaturthi with unique graphic
article: German luxury vehicles maker BMW's India unit on Monday wished Ganesh Chaturthi to people by posting a unique graphic on Twitter. The graphic featured the front of a BMW car which resembled Lord Ganesha. Reacting to the graphic, a user tweeted, "@bmwindia now that's brilliant, you guys never fail to surprise us with your creativity."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Porsche was 1st to have airbags as standard equipment
article: German automobile manufacturer Porsche was the first to introduce airbags as standard equipment in its 1986 Porsche 944. The safety device was initially created as an alternative to seat belts and was offered by some companies as an optional add-on before Porsche. Ferdinand Porsche, the founder of Porsche, was born 141 years ago on September 3, 1875.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Aston Martin forays into yachts, baby strollers
article: British luxury automaker Aston Martin has forayed into yachts, baby strollers and other branded merchandise. The company inaugurated a new store in London's Mayfair district on Thursday which offers ornamental bowls, handbags and other accessories. The automaker is reportedly under pressure to seek new revenue streams to return to profit by 2018 and prepare for an IPO.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Nissan opens pre-booking for 2017 GT-R at ₹25 lakh
article: Japanese automobile manufacturer Nissan on Thursday opened pre-booking for its flagship 2017 GT-R sports car in India at a deposit of ₹25 lakh. Powered by a 3.8-litre V6 twin-turbocharged engine, the car produces 565 horsepower. The 2017 Nissan GT-R has a top speed of 315 kmph and accelerates from 0-100 kmph in under 3 seconds.

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: Ford shelves compact car range for India, China
article: American automaker Ford Motors has shelved its plans to introduce compact cars in emerging markets including India and China amid disappointing sales, reports said. Ford had reportedly scheduled production of its B500 range in India with an investment of $100 million. Notably, Maruti and Hyundai own about two-thirds of the Indian market, whereas, Ford's only caters to about 3%.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Royal Enfield hikes prices across entire lineup
article: Indian motorcycle manufacturer Royal Enfield has announced a price hike across its complete range including the recently launched Himalayan. Applicable with immediate effect, the price hike varies from ₹1,100 to ₹3,600 based on the model chosen. This is the second time in a year that Royal Enfield has hiked the prices of its motorcycles.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Video: Giant robot destroying cars
article: Automobile news portal Autoblog has released a 2-minute and 55-second video which shows a giant dinosaur-shaped robot destroying cars. The robot throws flames of over 1000°C and applies over 10,000 kg of force to destroy the cars. The video is a part of Autoblog's 'CarBoom!' series where it destroys cars in different ways.

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: Passenger vehicle sales up for 14th straight month
article: Domestic passenger vehicle sales rose for the 14th straight month in August, with a 16.68% surge compared to the corresponding period last year, according to data released by Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM). Further, car sales jumped by 9.53%, while motorcycle sales were up by 22.19% and total two-wheeler sales rose 26.32%, against the corresponding period last year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Harley-Davidson plans to lay off 200 people in US
article: American motorcycle manufacturer Harley-Davidson is planning to cut around 200 jobs in the US as the company is adjusting its production schedule over lower motorcycle shipment forecast for 2016. Most of the job reductions are to take place in the fourth quarter. The company had lowered its 2016 full-year shipment target by 5,000 units in July.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Fiat, Samsung in talks over auto component biz sale
article: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles is in talks with several parties, including South Korea's Samsung Electronics, over the sale of its components business Magneti Marelli, the carmaker's Chairman John Elkann said on Saturday. Notably, Samsung has identified automotive components as a growth driver as its sales in existing businesses, including smartphones, slowed down, analysts said.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Jaguar Land Rover's sales up 26% in August
article: Tata Motors-owned Jaguar Land Rover on Wednesday reported a 26% increase in its retail sales with 36,926 units in August. The month's performance was driven by strong sales of the Land Rover Discovery Sport and the Jaguar F-PACE. Jaguar sales rose by 104% year-on-year to 10,868 units during the month while Land Rover sold 26,058 units, up by 9%.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Hyundai posts 9% growth in sales till August
article: Hyundai Motor has reported a 9% growth in its sales till August from the year-ago period, which stood at 3.27 lakh units aided by new launches like utility vehicle Creta, CEO YK Koo said on Monday. Koo added that the company is likely to report a decent double-digit growth in 2016 owing to further launches in the coming months.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Jeep launches Wrangler, Cherokee starting at ₹71.59L
article: American SUV maker Jeep on Tuesday launched the Wrangler Unlimited at ₹71.59 lakh in India. Jeep also launched Grand Cherokee Limited at ₹93 lakh, Grand Cherokee Summit at ₹1.03 crore and the Grand Cherokee SRT at ₹1.12 crore (all prices ex-showroom, Delhi). The company announced to open 10 distribution locations across India.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: SC quashes Singur land acquisition for Tata Nano plant
article: The Supreme Court on Wednesday set aside the Calcutta High Court order which had upheld the land acquisition by the then CPI (M)-led West Bengal Government in 2006 to facilitate Tata Motors to set up its Nano plant in Singur. Further, the court directed the state government to take the land's possession and distribute to its land-owners within 12 weeks.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jeep doesn't come cheap, tweets a user
article: Reacting to American automaker Jeep launching Wrangler and Cherokee in India at a starting price of ₹71.59 lakh, a user tweeted, "Wohaaa #Jeep doesn't come cheap. Look at the prices." Another user tweeted, "BMW, Audi, Mercedes, Range Rover look cheap now." A user also tweeted, "Pretty sure #Jeep did zero research in terms of pricing their vehicles appropriately for India."

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Jeep to build SUVs in India starting from ₹10 lakh
article: American SUV maker Jeep is reportedly working on locally-made compact SUVs in India that will be priced between ₹10-20 lakh. Jeep localised SUVs will compete against Maruti Suzuki Vitara Brezza, Hyundai Creta and Ford EcoSport. The brand entered the Indian market on Tuesday with its Wrangler and Grand Cherokee models at a starting price of ₹71.59 lakh.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: We'll not lead in self-driving tech: Aston Martin CEO
article: British luxury car manufacturer Aston Martin's CEO Andy Palmer in an interview said, "We will not lead in self-driving technology. Astons are to be driven." He added, "We concentrate on only technology we think that is useful to drivers such as automatic parking and around-view monitors." Palmer added that he is excited about self-driving technology's potential to enhance driving experience.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Designer firm transforms a Maserati into hearse
article: Italian funeral car designer Ellena Autotrasformazioni has converted a mid-size sport sedan Maserati Ghibli into a coffin-carrying hearse. The original car body was stretched by over 64 inches using fibre glass, to bring its total length to over 21 feet. The hearse features fancy exterior styling, low-profile sport tires, 'pretend nautical leather' and a stainless steel removable cross.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Jaguar F-Pace becomes Tata JLR's fastest selling car
article: The Jaguar F-Pace launched last year by Tata Motors-owned Jaguar Land Rover has become the fastest selling car in the company's history. Around 30,000 models of the British luxury car maker's first-ever SUV have been sold globally since it hit the roads in mid-April. According to the company, about 90% of the buyers of the SUV are new customers.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Startup plans to sell 'flying cars' for $600K
article: Dutch startup PAL-V has developed a two-seater 'flying car' which it claims will be ready for sale in US for $600,000 by 2018. The vehicle takes ten minutes to convert from automobile to aircraft and hits top speeds of 170 kmph on road and 180 kmph in air. Reportedly, Google Co-founder Larry Page is also funding development of flying cars.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Australia launches its first driverless bus
article: Australian motoring organisation RAC has launched the country's first ever driverless bus called RAC Intellibus, the trials of which began on Wednesday. The 11-seater bus will run on a 2.5 km route at a speed of 20 kmph. It has reportedly achieved the highest level of automation as it has no steering wheel, no operator or even pedals.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Porsche unveils 911 GT3 RS sports car in India
article: German car manufacturer Porsche officially unveiled its 911 GT3 RS in Bengaluru. Powered by a 4-litre carbon fibre engine, the lightweight car accelerates from 0-100 kmph in 3.3 seconds with a top speed of 310 kmph. While the price for the RS model has not been disclosed yet, the 911 range starts at ₹1.42 crore (ex-showroom, Delhi).

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: No rush to bring more models to India: Toyota
article: Japanese automaker Toyota has said that it is in no rush to bring in more models to India, amid uncertainties over regulatory issues around diesel vehicles. After being hit by Supreme Court's ban on diesel vehicles in Delhi-NCR which lasted for eight months, the company plans to take it "step by step" and increase its production capacity in the country.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Maruti launches its 1st light commercial vehicle
article: Maruti Suzuki launched its first light commercial vehicle (LCV) named 'Super Carry' on Thursday at ₹4.03 lakh (ex-showroom, Ahmedabad). The LCV comes with a 793-cc engine that delivers a mileage of 22.07 kmpl. It has a loading capacity of 740 kg and a 3.25-square metre loading deck. The company has invested about ₹300 crore for the LCV's development.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: GM India recalls Chevrolet Cruze over faulty ignition
article: American car manufacturer General Motors has recalled 22,000 units of Chevrolet Cruze sedans made in India between 2009 and 2011, over faulty ignition. Through the recall, GM will fix issues related to loss of ignition or engine stall at low speeds reported in some vehicles. According to the company, the free of cost repair will take less than an hour.

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: 'Vehicle scrapping policy to provide ₹14k crore'
article: The draft vehicle scrapping policy will provide a combined benefit of ₹14,000 crore to the Centre and states, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said on Tuesday. He added that it could drive the auto industry's growth by 22%. The proposed policy, which could curb pollution by reducing vehicular emissions by 25-30%, will soon be sent to the Cabinet, he said.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Renault India records highest ever monthly sales
article: French automaker Renault has recorded its highest ever monthly sales in India, selling 12,972 units in August. The company registered an eight-fold increase from the 1,527 units sold in the same month last year. A total of 86,835 units have been sold between January-August 2016 compared to 26,559 in the corresponding period last year, which is an over three-fold increase.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Racer sets world record with 379.4 feet truck jump
article: Off-road truck racer Bryce Menzies on Monday set a world record by making his modified truck Pro 2 jump to a height of 379.4 feet. Menzies beat previous record by roughly 50 feet that was set five years ago by racer Tanner Foust. Menzies set the record during a practice run for an event in San Diego.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Hero MotoCorp to launch 15 new products in FY17
article: India's largest two-wheeler maker Hero MotoCorp will launch 15 new products in domestic as well as international markets this fiscal, Chairman Pawan Munjal said on Wednesday. The new launches include the Achiever 150 motorcycle, Super Splendor, and Passion PRO with the Hero-patented i3S technology. Further, the Gujarat unit will become operational in the third quarter of 2016-17, he added.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Next generation Hyundai Verna unveiled in China
article: South Korean automaker Hyundai on Friday unveiled India-bound 2017 Verna model at the Chengdu Motor Show in China. The sedan will be available in China in 1.4 or 1.6-litre petrol engine delivering 100 hp and 123 hp respectively. It features new body panels, 8-inch touchscreen infotainment system and LED tail lights. It's expected to be launched in India in 2017.

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: Activa contributes 38% of July incremental sales
article: Japanese manufacturer Honda's Activa has topped the two-wheeler sales charts and contributed about 38% of the incremental sales in the Indian industry, selling 2,56,173 units in July. According to SIAM data, Activa has been the top-seller in the motorcycle market since January this year and has recorded the widest margin over Hero MotoCorp's Splendor by 58,413 units in July.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Audi A6 Matrix launched in India at ₹52.75 lakh
article: Audi has launched its luxury sedan Audi A6 Matrix 35 TFSI in India at a starting price of ₹52.75 lakh (ex-showroom Delhi). The car comes with a 1.8L TFSI petrol engine and seven-speed S tronic transmission delivering 190 horsepower and goes from 0-100 kmph in 7.9 seconds. The sedan sports eight airbags, electronic stabilisation control and an advanced infotainment system.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: 'Mercedes owners most willing to use autopilot'
article: According to a survey by MaritzCX, Mercedes-Benz and Infiniti owners are most willing to buy self-driving cars, with about 27% of them opting for the self-driving option. The owners of Fiat Chrysler's Jeep SUVs and Ram pickups were the least interested. While 94% of those surveyed are aware of autonomous vehicles, almost 48% aren't interested in buying, the survey added.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Tesla autopilot to alert inattentive drivers
article: Tesla has released an update for its semi-autonomous autopilot mode with a new feature called 'abort procedure'. The feature slows the car down to a crawl if an inattentive driver doesn't respond to autopilot's instructions to take control of the steering wheel within 15 seconds. The autopilot then re-engages only when the car is stopped and put into park mode.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Mitsubishi overstated fuel economy on 8 models: Nikkei
article: Mitsubishi Motors overstated the fuel economy on eight of its vehicle models, in addition to four others that the Japanese automaker had admitted to, the Nikkei reported on Tuesday. Further, it stated that Mitsubishi may withdraw the affected vehicles from the market to revise its catalogs. The automaker had in April admitted that it falsified fuel economy tests.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: BMW 5 series to get 'Remote View 3D' feature
article: German automaker BMW will include a 'Remote View 3D' feature in the next generation of its 5 series luxury sedan. The feature will allow owners to get a 3D-rendered bird's eye view of their car and its surroundings on their smartphones, using BMW's 360-degree Surround View camera system. The company will unveil the feature in October.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Maruti's domestic sales up 12.2% in August
article: Maruti Suzuki's domestic sales rose 12.2% to 1,19,931 units in August compared to the year-ago period, the automaker said in a statement on Thursday. The utility vehicle segment boosted the sales, as the number of such units sold more than doubled to 16,806 as against 7,836 last year. Its exports during the month also rose 10.8% to 12,220 units.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Bajaj Auto's sales see a 5% decline in August
article: Bajaj Auto reported a 5% decline in its total sales at 3.25 lakh units in August as against 3.41 lakh units in the year-ago period, the automaker said on Friday. Motorcycle sales during the month fell by 4% to 2.79 lakh units while commercial vehicle sales saw a 12% drop. Its exports also saw a 31% fall.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Toyota Corolla is the most sold car in history
article: With over 40 million units sold worldwide, Toyota Corolla is the best-selling car in automobile history. The first generation of the sedan was introduced in 1966, and has been in production since. Corolla's maker Toyota, which is the world's most valuable automobile brand, was founded 79 years ago on August 28, 1937.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: World's first self-driving taxis debut in Singapore
article:
Three-year old startup nuTonomy on Thursday
started the public trial of self-driving cabs in Singapore, becoming the world's first company to publicly test self-driving taxis. It will offer free rides to select customers in its six modified Renault and Mitsubishi electric cars. Taxi hailing app Uber is also planning to launch its autonomous taxis in the US within a few weeks.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla world's most innovative company of 2016: Forbes
article: Electric vehicle maker Tesla Motors has topped the Forbes list of 'World's Most Innovative Companies' of 2016. It was founded in 2003 by a group of engineers in Silicon Valley including Elon Musk, who wanted to prove that electric cars could be better than gasoline-powered cars. Notably, the automobile major unveiled the world's fastest electric car in production on Tuesday.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: World's fastest truck covers 1 kilometre in 21.2 secs
article: Swedish automaker Volvo's custom-built truck 'The Iron Knight' has become the world's fastest truck by covering a kilometre in just 21.29 seconds. The truck achieved an average speed of 169 kmph, powered by its I-Shift Dual Clutch transmission. It also became the world's fastest truck to cover a 500-metre distance in 13.71 seconds.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Miniskirt was named after BMW Mini
article: The Miniskirt, which became a popular fashion trend in London during the 1960s, was named after the BMW Mini. The car was a favourite of designer Mary Quant, who is widely known for the development of the clothing style. The first Mini was launched 57 years ago on August 26, 1959.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Indian King bought 7 Rolls-Royce cars to pick garbage
article: In the 1920s, the Maharaja of Alwar bought seven Rolls-Royce cars for collecting municipal garbage after being ignored by a salesman in a showroom in London. The present Maharaja, Jitendra Pratap Singh, once said that even now the royal family has "numerous vintage cars but not a single Rolls". Saturday marked the 139th birth anniversary of Rolls-Royce Co-founder Charles Rolls.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: China's elevated bus concept a scam: Reports
article: China's 'Transit Elevated Bus' concept that glides over the traffic and allows cars to pass underneath it, is being called a scam by the state's media. "The TES was little more than a publicity stunt...a lending scam that has duped retail Chinese investors by promising unreal returns," said a report. Earlier this month, the bus reportedly completed a test run.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Toyota’s logo contains every letter of its name
article: The logo of Toyota consists of three ovals and has every letter of its name. The outer oval symbolises the world embracing Toyota, while the inner ovals symbolise the hearts of the customer and the company, which was founded 79 years ago on August 28, 1937. Interestingly, each oval is drawn with different stroke thicknesses, to highlight Japanese calligraphy art.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Rolls-Royce had land, water, air speed record together
article: The 'R' engine by Rolls-Royce once held the speed records for land, air, and water simultaneously. In the early 1930s, Supermarine S6B broke the air speed record at 643kmph, with the BlueBird car breaking the land record and the Miss England II motorboat making a new record on water. Saturday marked the 139th birth anniversary of Rolls-Royce Co-founder Charles Rolls.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Volkswagen electric car to run 482 km on 15-min charge
article: German automaker Volkswagen's first fully electric car scheduled to launch in late 2018 or early 2019, will be able to run for 482 kilometres after a 15-minute charge. According to Volkswagen Chairman Herbert Diess, the car will roughly be the same size as the company's compact car Golf, but will feel as roomy as the sedan Passat on the inside.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: First Rolls-Royce model sold for £395
article: The first Rolls-Royce car ever made was a 10 horsepower model which sold for £395 (1 British Pound equals ₹88 at present) in 1904. Only 17 of these cars were produced by Henry Royce's company and sold by Charles Rolls' dealership, before they officially founded Rolls-Royce in 1906. Saturday marked the 139th birth anniversary of the founder Charles Rolls.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: 27 people were packed in BMW Mini to make World Record
article: The world record for the most number of people crammed in a Mini (Classic model) was made by 27 people. The record was made at the London to Brighton Mini Run in Brighton, UK, on 18 May 2014. The car, which is now owned by the BMW Group, made its debut 57 years ago on August 26, 1959.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: 65% of Rolls-Royce cars ever made are still on road
article: According to a documentary by National Geographic Channel, about 65% of all Rolls-Royce cars ever built since the company's inception are still on the road. The oldest Rolls-Royce still in working condition is reportedly a 1904 model owned by Thomas Love Jr. of Perth, Scotland. Saturday marked the 139th birth anniversary of Rolls-Royce Co-founder Charles Rolls.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Rolls-Royce cars have over 44,000 colour options
article: Rolls-Royce offers 44,000 individual colour choices to prospective buyers across its range of motorcars. Additionally, the British manufacturer claims to create a perfect match of any colour or object that customers may wish to replicate for the exterior of their cars. Saturday marked the 139th birth anniversary of the Co-founder of Rolls-Royce, Charles Rolls.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Toyota is world's most valuable automobile brand
article: Japanese automaker Toyota is the most valuable automobile brand in the world, according to Forbes. Toyota, which was founded 79 years ago on August 28, 1937, has a brand value of $42.1 billion. German luxury automobile manufacturer BMW comes second on the list, with a brand value of $28.8 billion.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ducati launches new bike in India at ₹17.44L
article: Italian motorcycle manufacturer Ducati on Thursday launched its 'Multistrada 1200 Enduro' bike in India at ₹17.44 lakh (ex-showroom Delhi). Powered by Ducati Testastretta DVT engine, it delivers 160 horsepower and its 30-litre fuel tank gives the bike a range of 450 km. Claimed to be all-terrain, the bike is available across Ducati dealerships in Delhi NCR, Mumbai, Pune and Bengaluru.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Mini in continuous production at same factory from '59
article: The Mini holds the record for being in continuous production at a single factory for the longest period of time, since 1959 at Longbridge, England. The car, which was first launched 57 years ago on August 26, 1959, is the most successful British car ever with more than 5 million Minis being produced till date.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Baidu unveils fully electric self-driving car
article: Chinese internet giant Baidu on Friday unveiled a fully electric self-driving car for testing  in China. Planning to release self-driving vehicles for the public, Baidu is mapping routes with information like height of the traffic lights and location of pavements. The company plans to launch the service by 2018.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Mercedes-Benz GLE400 petrol launched at ₹74.9 lakh
article: German automaker Mercedes-Benz on Thursday launched the petrol variant of the GLE400 in India priced at ₹74.9 lakh, ex-showroom, New Delhi. With a 3.0-litre V6 petrol engine, the SUV boasts of 329 horsepower and top speed of 247 kmph. Notably, Mercedes-Benz has launched the GLE with a petrol engine for the first time.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Ford's app lets users reserve car parking spots
article: Automaker Ford has released the latest update on its FordPass app, which lets users reserve a parking spot in garages in real-time across 160 US cities. The users need to enter a destination and time to park, and the app shows available spots on a map with pricing. Users can then pay for the spot using Ford's payment service FordPay.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Autoblog launches video series on destroying cars
article: Automotive news platform Autoblog has launched a new video series called 'CarBoom' that shows different ways in which cars can be destroyed. "Each week we'll be exploding, smashing, flinging, and straight-up eradicating anything on four wheels in the craziest ways we can think of", said Autoblog. The first episode features two cars being destroyed by confetti poppers and a fireball.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Amazon launches research platform for car buyers
article: E-commerce platform Amazon on Thursday launched 'Amazon Vehicles', a research destination and automotive community for car enthusiasts and people looking to buy cars. Users can find specifications, read reviews, and have discussions with existing car owners. Amazon Vehicles is an extension of the Amazon Automotive store, where users can buy spares and accessories for their vehicles.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Mahindra launches connected vehicle platform
article: Automaker Mahindra on Friday announced the launch of its connected vehicle platform DiGiSENSE. It sports features like vehicle tracking, route panning and fuel indication, allowing owners, drivers and dealers to access vital information in real time about their vehicles. This makes Mahindra the first Indian original equipment manufacturer to integrate its products onto a cloud-based platform.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Volkswagen hits deal to repay 650 dealers
article: World's largest automaker Volkswagen on Thursday stated that it has reached a deal in principle to compensate 650 US dealers connected with its diesel emissions scandal. The settlement reportedly includes spending over $1.2 billion, plus continued incentive payments to dealers. Earlier in June, Volkswagen agreed to a $15.3 billion deal after admitting to have rigged fuel emission tests since 2009.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Ford recalls 91k cars globally over faulty fuel pumps
article: Ford Motors on Wednesday said it was recalling about 91,000 vehicles worldwide to replace faulty fuel pump parts that could cause a car to stall without warning. The carmaker informed it was additionally recalling 23,150 Ford Escape SUVs of 2017 model year to update power-window software. However, Ford said it was not aware of any accidents associated with the issues.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Harley-Davidson makes superhero themed bikes
article: To celebrate Marvel's superhero Captain America's 75th anniversary, American motorcycle manufacturer Harley-Davidson has made 27 custom bikes based on superheroes and villains. The bikes have been customised from the company's regular line-up including bikes like the Iron 883, Fat Boy Lo and Street Glide Special. The customised bikes are available only in Australia and New Zealand.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Nissan gifts ambassador John Abraham new Terrano
article: Nissan has gifted the recently launched Terrano SUV to actor and its brand ambassador John Abraham. Available at a starting price of ₹9.99 lakh (ex-showroom, Delhi), the Nissan Terrano comes in both petrol and diesel variants. Last month, Nissan had given an opportunity to its customers to test-drive the Terrano for a chance to meet the actor.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: New Hyundai Elantra launched in India at ₹12.99 lakh
article: South Korean automaker Hyundai on Tuesday launched the next generation of its Elantra sedan in India at a starting price of ₹12.99 lakh for petrol and ₹14.79 lakh for the diesel variant (ex-showroom, Delhi). The petrol variant (2.0-litre engine) has a fuel efficiency of 14.6 km per litre, while the diesel variant delivers 22.5 km per litre with a 1.6-litre engine.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Tesla Model S catches fire during test drive in France
article: US-based electric vehicle maker Tesla's Model S reportedly caught fire during a test drive in France. According to comments from the Reddit user who posted its picture online, the car displayed a 'Problems with charging' message while moving. Tesla responded that all passengers exited the vehicle safely and they are working with authorities to establish facts of the incident.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Average Bugatti owner has about 84 cars, 3 jets
article: The average Bugatti customer has about 84 cars, 3 jets and one yacht, Wolfgang Dürheimer, President of Bugatti told Bloomberg in 2014. The brand, owned by German automobile manufacturing group Volkswagen, is famous for producing sports cars. The company's founder Ettore Arco Isidoro Bugatti passed away 69 years ago on August 21, 1947.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Bajaj withdraws ad comparing its bike with TVS
article: A memo filed by Bajaj Auto before the Chennai High Court said it has "withdrawn its comparative advertising campaign" which compared mileages of Bajaj's CT100 and TVS' XL 100. Bajaj also said it has agreed "not to reintroduce the said advertisement either by itself or through its dealers." TVS Motor had filed a case claiming the advertisement maligned its product.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Nissan to celebrate 'Happy Bolt Day' on August 21
article: Japanese automaker Nissan will celebrate August 21, 2016 as 'Happy Bolt Day' in honour of athlete Usain Bolt's 30th birthday. Fans have been invited to imitate Bolt's famous lightning bolt pose on social media with the hashtag #HappyBoltDay. Interestingly, Bolt was named Nissan's Global Director of Excitement in 2012, serving as an ambassador for the sports car GT-R.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Volkswagen ad shows how to workout with cars
article: German automaker Volkswagen has released a new advertising commercial where it shows how a person can workout using a car during long journeys. "Tension and fatigue are frequent consequences on long car journeys," says Volkswagen and suggests a set of light exercises that helps the driver feel refreshed.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Finland begins testing self-driving public buses
article: Finland has reportedly started real-world testing of autonomous self-driving mini buses on its public roads in the capital Helsinki. The 12-seater EasyMile EZ10 autonomous mini buses, which are intended as short-range shuttles for people, will run for almost a month during the test. Interestingly, road laws in Finland do not require vehicles to have a driver.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Lamborghini's new sports car sold out before debut
article: Italian luxury automaker Lamborghini unveiled its latest Centenario Roadster on Friday and it was sold out even before its debut. Based on the previous Centenario coupe, the roofless version sports a top speed of over 350 kmph with a 0-100 kmph acceleration in 2.9 seconds. Only 20 Roadsters will reportedly be built, and will be priced at $2.3 million.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Tesla is the biggest disruptor: Apple Co-founder
article: Apple Co-founder Steve Wozniak in an interview on Tuesday called electric vehicle maker Tesla "the biggest disruptor" in today's market. He added, "What Elon Musk does is just really driving toward that future that we can have that is so much more beautiful and not restricted by the way things were done in the past."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Rio medalist Sakshi to get customised Mahindra Thar
article: Rio Olympics bronze medal-winning wrestler Sakshi Malik will get a customised Thar SUV from automaker Mahindra. The company's Chairman and MD, Anand Mahindra ran a Twitter campaign where he asked users to tweet with #TharForSakshi in support of gifting the vehicle to Malik. "Overwhelming support for #TharForSakshi...let's check with her what colour & customization she wants," he tweeted later.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Volkswagen's 25k workers hit by supplier dispute
article: Europe's largest carmaker Volkswagen (VW) on Monday said that its production at six plants was impacted and over 25,000 workers were affected following a dispute between the carmaker and two of its suppliers. Volkswagen said it will resume talks to negotiate a settlement with Germany-based suppliers CarTrim and ES Automobilguss, who are seeking compensation after the carmaker canceled a contract.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Roborace reveals self-driving race car prototype
article: Roborace, the autonomous racing series which will run alongside Formula E next season, has revealed a self-driving race car prototype. Participating teams during the series will build their hardware and software upon the test car's basic kit 'DevBot'. Roborace is the first global championship for driverless cars and its first season will reportedly begin in 2016-2017.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla unveils its fastest electric car 'Model S'
article: Tesla on Tuesday unveiled a new version of its Model S sedan that goes from 0-100 kmph in 2.5 seconds, making it the company's fastest electric car in production. The new Model S has also become the first electric sedan that can travel over 480 kms on single charge. The car will be launched at a base price of $134,500.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Harley-Davidson to pay $12mn fine over emissions
article: According to the US Justice Department, Harley-Davidson has agreed to pay $12 million in civil fine and stop selling after-market devices that cause its motorcycles to emit too much pollution. The American motorcycle maker was accused of selling 3,40,000 'super tuners' that enabled its motorcycles to pollute the air at levels greater than certified by the US Environmental Protection Agency.

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: Skoda recalls 539 Octavia sedan units in India
article: Automobile manufacturer Skoda is recalling 539 Octavia sedans in India, produced between November 2015 and April 2016, to fix faulty manual child lock of rear doors, Skoda India said.
