The company added that the assessment and required servicing will be done free of cost. Notably, over two million vehicles have been recalled by various automakers in India since July 2012.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Aston Martin's new car goes 0-100 kmph in 3.7 s
article: British manufacturer of luxury cars Aston Martin on Friday unveiled a new convertible open-top coupe named 'Vanquish Zagato Volante' that achieves 0-100 kmph of speed in 3.7 seconds. Powered by a V12 powertrain engine, the coupe delivers 592 horsepower. The company will make only 99 units of the car and begin deliveries in 2017.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: 1955 Jaguar sold at a record price of $21.78 mn
article: A 1955 Jaguar D-Type car, which won a 24 hour Le Mans race in 1956 in France, sold at RM Sotheby's Monterey auction for $21.78 million. This made the Jaguar the most expensive British automobile ever sold at an auction. The car is painted in the winning team's traditional Scottish blue colour with a white cross.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Delphi, Mobileye partner for self-driving tech
article: Automotive technology supplier Delphi and driver assistance systems maker Mobileye, which used to provide support for Tesla's autopilot system, on Tuesday announced partnership for a self-driving system. The system would let automakers integrate it into their cars starting 2019. The two firms will invest "several hundred million dollars" for the development of turnkey self-drive system.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Ford to make self-driving cars with no steering wheel
article: Ford Motor has announced that it will mass-produce fully autonomous vehicles without brake pedals and steering wheels by 2021. "A driver will not be required", said Ford CEO Mark Fields adding that these vehicles, specially designed for ride-sharing, would "improve safety and solve...environmental challenges for millions of people – not just those who can afford luxury vehicles.”

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: McLaren unveils 570GT with electrochromic roof
article: McLaren has unveiled a 570GT concept which comes with an electrochromic​ roof that can be adjusted by a touch-sensitive headliner, turning it from opaque to nearly clear. It also features a sound-enhancing exhaust system in a golden titanium nitride tint that changes colours depending on the temperature. Slated for a 2017 release, the vehicle will come with price from $201,450.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Uber's self-driving service to start this month in US
article: Uber Co-founder and CEO Travis Kalanick has revealed that users in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania will be able to hail self-driving cabs starting later this month. The self-driving cars will be supervised by humans in the driver's seat for now. The fleet consists of modified Volvo XC90 SUVs with sensors that use cameras, lasers, radars, and GPS receivers.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bugatti made for driving, not for braking: Founder
article: French car manufacturer Bugatti's Founder Ettore Bugatti in a reply to a customer once said that the company's cars were made for driving and not for braking. The customer had personally complained Bugatti that the brakes in his race car were of poor quality. Ettore Bugatti passed away 69 years ago on August 21, 1947.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Bugatti Chiron is world's fastest production car
article: The Bugatti Chiron, which can go from 0 to 100km/h in under 2.5 seconds, is the world's fastest production car priced at $2.6 million. The car, with an 8.0-litre W16 engine capable of producing 1500 bhp, has a top speed of 420 km/h. The company's founder Ettore Arco Isidoro Bugatti passed away 69 years ago on August 21, 1947.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Renault Kwid 1.0L launched in India at ₹3.82 lakh
article: French automobile manufacturer Renault on Monday launched a new version of Kwid with 1.0-litre engine in India at a starting price of ₹3.82 lakh (ex-showroom, Delhi). Its 3-cylinder petrol engine produces 68 PS of power and delivers 23.01 km/l fuel efficiency. The new Kwid has been launched at a premium of ₹22,000 over the standard model.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Airbus to test autonomous airborne taxis by 2017
article: Aircraft maker Airbus is planning to develop autonomous flying taxis, which can carry passengers and cargo, to tackle problems of growing congestion in urban setups. Airbus subdivision A3's project, codenamed 'Vahana', plans to test a prototype of the same in late 2017. The team is also planning shared autonomous aerial vehicles that ferry passengers, which it is calling "CityAirbus".

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Rolls-Royce unveils its own picnic baskets
article: Rolls-Royce has unveiled picnic baskets especially designed for its Phantom and Drophead Coupes. Each of the baskets is crafted from walnut wood and leather matching its accompanying car's exterior colour. The baskets are equipped with fine dining ware including a cutting board, Rolls-Royce embroidered napkins, and stainless steel cutlery. Only 50 units of such baskets will be made by Rolls-Royce.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: First Shelby Cobra sold for record $13.75 mn
article: The first Shelby Cobra car was sold for $13.75 million on Saturday, making it the most expensive American car ever sold at an auction. Made by American custom performance vehicle manufacturer Shelby, the car is completely unrestored. Powered by a 260-cubic-inch V8 engine, it can go from 0-100 kmph in 4.2 seconds and has a top speed of 246 kmph.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Startup gets $160 mn to make car vending machines
article: US-based used cars startup Carvana on Wednesday raised $160 million in Series C round of funding to make car vending machines. A car vending machine is a big glass building that automatically dispenses cars preloaded by the startup. On inserting a coin, the fully-automated machine delivers the car to its respective owner.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Jaguar leads sales growth in US in 2016
article: Sales of Tata Motors-owned Jaguar surged by 59% in the first seven months of the year in the United States, outpacing other automakers in the country, as per a Bloomberg report. Volvo stood second with a 29% increase in cars sold while most of the luxury brands, including BMW, Cadillac, Lexus, and Mercedes, reported a dip in their sales.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Audi suspension to create electricity from rough roads
article: German carmaker Audi has developed a new shock absorber prototype called 'eROT', which generates electricity from rough roads while smoothening out the ride. Traditional absorbers are replaced with motors to capture the wheel's movement, convert it to electricity and feed it back to the car's 48-volt battery system. Audi claims eROT can reduce carbon emissions by three grams per km.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Keyless entry of 100 mn Volkswagen cars hackable
article: Around 100 million Volkswagen cars sold over the past 20 years and some current models are vulnerable to theft due to hackable keyless entry systems, according to European researchers. They claim that the systems can be hacked through cheap technical devices. The vulnerable cars include most Audi, Seat and Skoda models and the 2016 Audi Q3.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Yamaha Motor makes millionth scooter in India
article: India Yamaha Motor on Friday produced its one-millionth scooter in the country. The one-millionth scooter, a 'Fascino', was made at the company's Surajpur plant situated at Greater Noida. The company entered the country's scooter market in 2012 with the launch of Cygnus Ray scooter aimed at females. The company has set a target to produce a million vehicles this year.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Hero manufactures a cycle every 9 seconds
article: Indian cycle manufacturing giant Hero Cycles currently makes a cycle every 9 seconds. The company, which started as a bicycle spares manufacturer, had an output of 25 cycles a day at its first plant in Ludhiana. OP Munjal, who died on August 13, 2015, founded Hero Cycles with his brothers in 1956.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Rolls-Royce Ghost turned into a 'Crazy Taxi'
article: Car-owners in Michigan, USA turned a Rolls-Royce Ghost into a rusty taxi, in honour of popular 90's SEGA game 'Crazy Taxi'. The car is covered in a wrap to give it the look, and will participate in Motor City Rally, a sport event which started on August 3, 2016. It will travel from Detroit to Atlanta along with other cars.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Audi cars to tell when traffic lights go green
article: New Audi cars in the US will come with a system which will provide drivers with the countdown of when a traffic light turns green from red. The traffic light information system will communicate with the city's municipal traffic signals to gather the required data. The system will be available on select 2017 Audi Q7, A4 and A4 allroad models.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: World’s most expensive car was auctioned for $38mn
article: The most expensive car ever sold is a 1962 Ferrari 250 GTO, which was auctioned for $38.115 million in 2014. Only 39 original 'GTO' cars were manufactured between 1962 and 1963, and the car on auction had the 'true' 3-litre V12 engine. Enzo Ferrari, who died 28 years ago on August 14, 1988, founded Ferrari in 1939.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Mahindra plans self-driving tractors for farmers
article: India's largest tractor maker Mahindra plans to bring autonomous vehicles to the agriculture sector. Anand Mahindra, Chairman of Mahindra & Mahindra, said, "The most fertile ground— pardon the pun— for autonomy is in agricultural tractors." He further added that the agriculture sector is an "area where paranoia about accidents and collisions is virtually non-existent".

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: LeEco to build $1.8 billion electric cars factory
article: Chinese technology conglomerate LeEco on Thursday announced plans to invest $1.8 billion towards building an electric car manufacturing centre. It will be part of a $3 billion 'Eco Experience Park' project, which will include a theme park and offices. The plant will be located in China's Zhejiang province and is expected to manufacture 400,000 electric vehicles annually with self-driving features.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Mahindra's profit rises 12.36% in June quarter
article: Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M) on Wednesday reported a 12.36% year-on-year increment in its net profit to ₹955 crore for the quarter ended June. The firm's total revenue from operations rose by 14.05% from the year-ago period and stood at ₹11,943 crore. M&M's automobile sales grew by 10.9% to 1.21 lakh units in the quarter.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Hybrid e-sports car with solar roof revealed
article: American luxury hybrid carmaker, Karma Automotive has revealed the design of its upcoming hybrid electric sports car, Karma Revero, that features a solar roof which the company claims can "power the vehicle". The company will also provide hand-painted badges on every unit of the vehicle, which will be publicly revealed on September 8, with a starting price of $100,000.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Three-wheeler car up for pre-order at $7,000
article: Elio Motors has started accepting pre-orders for its three-wheeler car, priced at $7,000 for a base model. The two-seater car claims a mileage of 35.7 kmpl and is street legal in 41 US states. The 'autocycle' does not need a separate motorcycle license and its variant comes with auto-transmission, parking assist and premium entertainment system for additional $2,000.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Man blames Tesla crash on poor translation
article: The first Tesla crash in China is being blamed on the company marketing its semi-autonomous autopilot feature as 'zidong jiashi' in Chinese, which translates to 'self driving'. However, Tesla's autopilot requires drivers to keep their hands on the steering wheel. "If from the beginning Tesla had marketed itself as a “semi-autonomous” car...I never would have bought it”, the driver said.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Maruti Brezza becomes India’s highest selling SUV
article: Maruti Suzuki's Vitara Brezza has become the highest selling Sports Utility Vehicle (SUV) in India in the month of July 2016. Brezza took the top spot by overtaking South Korean automaker Hyundai's Creta by selling 10,232 units compared to Creta's 7,981 units. Launched in March this year, July marked as the best month for sales of the SUV so far.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: World's first titanium body car to cost $2.7 mn
article: World's first supercar featuring a titanium body, 'Icona Vulcano' is going for sale at $2.7 million in September. Inspired by the Blackbird SR-71 plane, the car's designers, which only made one unit of the car, took 10,000 hours to craft the titanium into the shapes required. Powered by a 6.2-litre V8 petrol engine, it goes 0-100 kmph in 2.8 seconds.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Lyft rejects acquisition bid by General Motors
article: San Francisco-based ride-hailing startup Lyft reportedly declined acquisition interest from General Motors (GM) and has instead opted to raise new funding. The startup has raised $2 billion till now, including a $500 million investment from GM in January. The partnership between Lyft and GM also includes testing self-driving cabs with autonomous systems installed in electric Chevrolet cars.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Fiat once made a car with in-built coffee maker
article: Italian carmaker Fiat in 2012 launched its 500L model which came with an in-built coffee maker next to the gear stick. The Lavazza-branded coffee maker included a sugar container, a coffee pod dispenser and a spoon. The Founder of the car company, Giovanni Agnelli, was born on August 13, 1866.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla removes 'autopilot' from its China website
article: Electric vehicles maker Tesla has removed the word 'autopilot' and a Chinese term for 'self-driving' from its China website. This comes after a driver in Beijing who crashed in autopilot mode accused Tesla of overplaying the function's capability and misleading the buyers. The crash, which took earlier this month, is reportedly the first known Tesla crash in China.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: GM used glue to make car 300 kg lighter
article: Automaker General Motors is using aircraft-grade adhesives instead of rivets and welds to make its 2017 GMC Acadia SUV lighter by about 300 kg. The glue has been used along seams to create a stiff car body, enabling use of thinner steel. The 2017 SUV sports 23 miles per gallon (mpg) on gas compared to 18 mpg of 2016 model.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Indian denied car sale fearing he'd sell it to Taliban
article: A Mercedes dealer in New Jersey, USA refused to sell a new Mercedes GLS550 to a US-based Indian buyer, who wished to exchange his old Mercedes, fearing he would "sell it to Taliban." He paid $1,000 deposit and updated his insurance, after which he was told he comes from a "high risk" area in US which sells cars to Taliban.

author: Chhavi Tyagi
abstract: SC lifts ban on registration of over 2k cc diesel cars
article: The Supreme Court on Friday lifted the ban on the registration of diesel vehicles having engine over 2,000 cc in Delhi NCR. The SC further ruled that all manufacturers, dealers or buyers have to deposit 1% 'environment compensation' cost on purchase of diesel cars. This comes after German carmaker Mercedes on Monday moved the SC seeking to lift the ban.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Hero held record for world's largest cycle maker
article: Cycle maker Hero Cycles was recognised by the Guinness Book of World Records as the world's largest bicycle manufacturer in 1986. The company, which produced 639 bicycles in its founding year, has a current manufacturing capacity of 7.5 million annually. OP Munjal, who died on August 13, 2015, was the Co-founder and Chairman of Hero Cycles for nearly 60 years.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: DC Design to make Innova Crysta luxurious at ₹4.95L
article: Car design company DC Design is making the interiors of Toyota Innova Crysta luxurious at a starting price of ₹4.95 lakh. The transformed car will feature wooden floor, off-white leather seats and a mini refrigerator. The car will also get a full-sized partition with a sliding glass window and the rear row seats will be replaced with electrically reclining seats.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Ferrari logo taken from WW1 pilot's fighter plane
article: Car manufacturer Ferrari's iconic logo featuring a black prancing horse was presented to its founder, Enzo Ferrari, by the mother of an Italian World War One pilot who had painted the emblem on his plane. Enzo Ferrari, who died 28 years ago on August 14, 1988, added a yellow background to the logo to represent his native city of Modena.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Ferrari did not choose its iconic red colour
article: The colour red was originally assigned to all Italian cars in the Grand Prix, but Ferrari continued exclusively producing red cars even after the tradition was stopped. Red remains the most popular choice even today, accounting for about 45% of Ferraris built over the last few years. The company's founder Enzo Ferrari died 28 years ago on August 14, 1988.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla requires $1.1 billion in cash for Q3
article: Electric vehicles maker Tesla has disclosed that it needs $1.1 billion in cash for the third quarter to meet its requirements in payments and planned expenditures. The amount is about a third of the company's cash in hand mid-year. Earlier in March, Tesla said the cost of building and operating its Gigafactory in Nevada, US could exceed the company's expectations.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Hyundai launches 3 Creta variants starting at ₹10L
article: To celebrate the first anniversary of its Creta SUV, Korean automaker Hyundai on Friday launched three new Creta variants in India. The variants include the Anniversary Edition (SE) priced at ₹13.76 lakh, the Executive variant at ₹9.99 lakh and the S+ diesel variant at ₹13.58 lakh (all prices ex-showroom, Delhi). A new Earth Brown colour option has also been introduced.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla's Autopilot drives owner to hospital
article: Joshua Neally, a 37-year-old owner of Tesla Model X has claimed that the car's Autopilot mode saved his life and drove him to hospital in July. Neally, who suffered blockage in lung arteries while driving, was driven for over 32 km by the car's Autopilot. However, Neally had to drive the final bit to the hospital on his own.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: India's 1st auto shredding plant to be set up
article: State-run metal scrap trading firm MSTC on Monday signed an agreement with Mahindra Intertrade, a subsidiary of the Mahindra Group, for setting up a first-of-its-kind automobile shredding and recycling plant in the country. A plant will be set up with a capacity of 1-1.5 lakh tonnes in either Gujarat or Maharashtra and will start production by 2018, Mahindra officials said.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Toyota net income falls 15% in June quarter
article: Japanese automaker Toyota on Thursday posted a 14.5% year-on-year decline in net income at ¥552.5 billion ($5.4 billion) for the quarter ended June. Net revenue also fell 5.7% to ¥6.59 trillion ($65.3 billion). Toyota attributed the decline to an appreciating yen as it cut its full-year operating profit forecast, expecting it to fall 44% to its lowest since 2013.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Car explodes during a racing event in New York
article: A Chevrolet car of American car racer Derrike Cope exploded without a warning during the NASCAR Xfinity Series race in New York on Saturday. It rolled to a halt in a runoff area on the track and exploded, with its front flying upwards. Unhurt by the accident, Cope said, "In 35 years of racing, I've never experienced anything like that."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hyundai to launch new Elantra in India on Aug 23
article: South Korean automaker Hyundai's sixth-generation Elantra sedan will officially go on sale in India on August 23. The third all-new Elantra model for India is both wider and longer compared to the outgoing model. The new model is expected to carry forward the existing 1.6-litre diesel engine, that currently delivers 128PS of power.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Datsun GO Special Edition launched at ₹4.07 lakh
article: Nissan-owned brand Datsun on Thursday launched special editions of its GO hatchback and GO+ multi-purpose vehicle in India, priced at ₹4.07 lakh and ₹4.78 lakh (ex-showroom, Delhi) respectively. The cars, in addition to featuring a limited-edition 'Style' moniker, will come in a new colour option called ‘New Blue’, and will be on sale from August through October 2016.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Volkswagen sets up IT delivery arm in India
article: German automaker Volkswagen on Thursday announced the establishment of its IT delivery and support centre in Pune, called Volkswagen IT Services India. A total of €3 million (₹22.5 crore) has been invested in the centre with 300 professionals at present, a company statement read. It will reportedly focus on IT delivery and drive innovation for Volkswagen brands across all geographies.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Mercedes-Benz opens training centre in Pune
article: German luxury carmaker Mercedes-Benz has installed an 'Advanced Auto Body Repair Training Centre' in Pune’s Chinchwad area. Mercedes has partnered with Don Bosco ITI and has spent an estimated ₹2.65 crore on the project. It will provide aspiring students the opportunity to hone their technical skills with the help of latest equipment, including a company-sponsored Mercedes-Benz car.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Saudi Prince buys Bugatti Chiron, Vision Gran Turismo
article: Prince Badr bin Saud of Saudi Arabia has bought the yet to be launched Bugatti Chiron and Vision Gran Turismo for a reported price of $5 million. Bugatti said that the Prince had the highest bid for the concepts of the hypercars. The Prince also posted the cars' pictures on his Instagram with Saudi Arabian license plates.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Jeep to launch Grand Cherokee, Wrangler on Sept 1
article: American luxury SUV maker Jeep will launch two of its models in India, the Grand Cherokee and the Wrangler, on September 1. The Grand Cherokee will be powered by a 3.0-litre EcoDiesel, turbocharged, V6 diesel engine while the Wrangler will have a 2.8-litre diesel​ engine producing 197 bhp power. Both the models will be imported as completely built units.

author: Sanira Mediratta
abstract: Sculptor has created car wheels of ice
article: A professional ice sculptor, Jack Hackney, has created functional car wheels made out of ice. The wheels which were tested on a Lexus NX consist of machine cut ice attached to a transparent acrylic rim which helps to support the weight of the car. A three-minute video explains the process of creation of the wheels.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Millionth Q5 rolls out of Audi's Ingolstadt plant
article: German automaker Audi Q5 on Thursday rolled out the millionth unit of its Q5 SUV from the production line at its main plant in Ingolstadt, Germany. The milestone car, a Sepang Blue-coloured SQ5, is scheduled for delivery to a family in Germany. The mid-range SUV has sold nearly 1.6 million units in over 100 countries since its launch in 2008.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Mercedes-Benz moves SC to lift diesel cars ban
article: Automobile giant Mercedes-Benz today moved the Supreme Court seeking to lift the ban on registration of new diesel vehicles of over 2,000cc, adding that it was ready to pay the 1% environmental cess on diesel cars' sale. Earlier, SC said that it was open to lifting the ban in Delhi NCR against payment of compensation cess.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Designer to build car from 1935 Cadillac sketch
article: American automobile designer Chip Foose is building a car based on General Motors' 1935 Cadillac coupe sketch, which never became a reality. His design agency Foose Design is working to build the commissioned custom car using a 1939 Cadillac Series 60 Sedan. Scheduled to be ready for unveiling at the end of summer, Foose has named the project "Madam X".

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Video: Electric van outruns BMW i8, Dodge Viper
article: Silicon Valley startup Atieva has released a video of its electric van 'Edna' outrunning a BMW i8 and a Dodge Viper in a 400-metre drag race. 'Edna' completed the race in 11.3 seconds, going 0-100 kmph in 2.94 seconds, reaching a top speed of 188 kmph. In July, Atieva had released a video of 'Edna' outrunning a Tesla and Ferrari.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Toyota launches Innova Crysta petrol at ₹13.72 lakh
article: Japanese automaker Toyota on Monday launched the petrol variant of Innova Crysta in India at a starting price of ₹13.72 lakh (ex-showroom, Delhi). Powered by a 2.7-litre dual VVT-i engine, it generates a maximum power of 166PS. It is available in three new shades, namely Garnet Red, White Pearl Crystal Shine and Avant-garde Bronze.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: BMW mocks Tesla in its new advertisements
article: German luxury carmaker BMW has mocked electric vehicle maker Tesla in two new advertisements of its 2016 BMW 330e plug-in hybrid version of its 3-Series sport sedan. "You will wait, and wait, and wait some more, all before that electric-car company’s new model ever even arrives,” says the advertisement. Notably, Tesla's Model 3 is scheduled to launch in late 2017.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla will unveil its electric minibus in 2017
article: American automotive company Tesla is expected to unveil its electric semi-truck and minibus in the next six to nine months, according to the company's Co-founder and CEO Elon Musk. After the unveiling, both vehicles “would enter production within low-single digit years", said Musk. The minibus, which might be called 'Spacebus', will be based off the chassis of Tesla's Model X.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Nissan unveils its BladeGlider working prototype
article: Japanese automaker Nissan has unveiled a working prototype of its BladeGlider concept car. Unveiled three years ago, the DeltaWing racecar-inspired triangular three-seater car is powered by a 220 kWh lithium-ion battery which delivers 268 horsepower. It goes from 0-100 kmph in less than 5 seconds and a top speed of 184 kmph.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Men build Star Wars-themed Speeder Bike
article: Workers at the Wisconsin-based customisation shop Vintage Works have made the 'Speeder Bike' featured in the sci-fi franchise Star Wars. The bike does not only look like the one featured in the movie, but also sounds the same. Its handlebars are customised to steer the motorcycle as well as control the flaps at the front.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Hackers arrested for stealing 30 Jeeps in Texas
article: According to reports, a hacker duo was arrested in Texas on July 29 for allegedly stealing a total of 30 Jeeps over a six month period. The duo had been using a laptop to connect to and start a vehicle. Michael Arcee and Jesse Zelay had attracted police attention for several months, before finally getting caught stealing another vehicle.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Grey-market Tesla Model X sells for $70k extra
article: Due to a mismatch in China's demand for Tesla Model X and Tesla's limited supply, grey-market Tesla Model X cars sell for $70,000 extra markup price in China. A private seller is reportedly buying the $170,000 cars and selling them to Chinese customers at $240,000. Though these imports are legal in China, the warranties on the cars have been voided.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Toyota Corolla highest selling car of 2016
article: Toyota Corolla sedan is the world's highest-selling car for the first half of 2016, according to data compiled by automotive consulting firm Focus2Move. Toyota sold 6,34,298 units of Corolla from January to June this year. Volkswagen Golf and Ford's F-Series were the second and third most sold cars across the world with 5,00,630 and 4,78,384 units sold respectively.

author: Shubhodeep Datta
abstract: Tata challenges ban on diesel vehicles in Delhi
article: Tata Motors on Tuesday approached the National Green Tribunal (NGT) challenging a Delhi government notification banning the registration of diesel vehicles with engine capacities over 2,000 cc. The automaker told the NGT that the current Supreme Court order, which had upheld the ban, was intended to apply to private luxury automobiles only, and not all classes of vehicles.

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: Domestic car sales rise by 9.62% in July
article: Domestic passenger car sales rose by 9.62% to 1.77 lakh units in July, from 1.62 lakh units in the corresponding period last year, according to data released by the Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM). During the same period, sales of two-wheelers rose by 13.52%, commercial vehicles grew marginally by 0.1% and vehicles across all categories increased by 13.22%.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Tesla minibus will be built on Model X platform
article: In line with Tesla CEO Elon Musk's master plan, the upcoming electric minibus will be built on the Model X platform. Confirming the development, Musk tweeted, "Some good guessing by Jalopnik. The Tesla Minibus will be built on a Model X chassis. People density potential is surprisingly high." Earlier last month, Musk had revealed a fleet of Tesla electric vehicles.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Ford was inspired by Thomas Edison to build a car
article: Ford Motor Company Founder Henry Ford, who was born on July 30, 1863, was encouraged by light bulb inventor Thomas Edison to build a car while working at Edison's company. In 1896, Edison reviewed his plans for a horseless carriage and advised Ford to keep working on it. He subsequently created a second prototype, and founded Ford Motors later.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Doubling wages was best cost-cutting decision: Ford
article: Car manufacturer Henry Ford, who was born on July 30, 1863, doubled the daily wages of workers in his car making plant to $5 a day. Ford recovered higher wages by speeding up the assembly line and banning trade unions. This made model T world's first mass produced car, and the industrialist described it as his 'best cost-cutting decision' ever.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Ford tried to build town in Amazon rainforests
article: American industrialist Henry Ford once tried to carve out a town 'Fordlandia' in Amazon rainforests. The car manufacturer, who was born on July 30, 1863, wanted his own supply of rubber, and established a miniature Midwest factory town out of the Amazon jungle. The project, however, ended in failure without a single drop of latex procured from it.

author: Renault
abstract: Renault Kwid clocks 1.5 lac bookings within a year
article: Budget hatchback Renault Kwid, launched in Sept 2015 at a starting price of ₹2.62 lac, has clocked around 1.5 lac bookings. The car, having a 799cc engine, claims to be India's most fuel efficient petrol car with a mileage of 25.17 kmpl. Kwid has won 24 awards including ‘NDTV Car of the Year 2016’.

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: Maruti Suzuki hikes prices by up to ₹20,000
article: Maruti Suzuki India (MSI) has hiked prices of several models including the new compact SUV Vitara Brezza by up to ₹20,000, starting Monday. MSI said the price hike will be between ₹1,500 and ₹5,000 for a selected range. "This price revision is based on factors like segment-wise demand, forex movements and strategic objectives of the company," MSI added.

author: Sumedha Sehra
abstract: Video shows Henry Ford, Thomas Edison in talks
article: A 2-minute-long video of Ford Motors founder Henry Ford, inventor Thomas Edison and Firestone Tires and Rubber Company founder Harvey Firestone shows the trio discussing about the prospects in the field of technological inventions. Born on July 30, 1863, Henry Ford was often seen with Edison, Firestone and essayist John Burroughs, and the four were famously called 'The Vagabonds'.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Maruti Suzuki records highest ever monthly sales
article: Indian automobile manufacturer Maruti Suzuki on Monday reported its highest ever domestic monthly sales for the month of July 2016. The company sold a total of 1,37,116 units in the month. Maruti Suzuki's new models Baleno and Vitara Brezza were the key sales drivers with 10,000 and 17,382 units sold respectively.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Audi CEO ordered to pay back for private party
article: Audi CEO Rupert Stadler has been reportedly ordered to pay back $13,980 that he spent for a party with around 30 top managers of the company in May 2015. An internal revision classified the party as private and asked the CEO to reimburse for the same. The expenditure was made on a 'beer contest', but Audi has not commented yet.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Ford Shelby GT350 caught fire at 190 kmph
article: While attending track day at a raceway in Georgia, US, a Ford Shelby GT350 sports car travelling at over 190 kmph caught fire. Engine component failure resulted in an oil leak which started a fire near the exhaust and spread throughout the car. The owner escaped unharmed and Ford has assured to replace the car with a 2017 GT350R.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Bosch launches electric scooter sharing service
article: Auto parts supplier Bosch on Wednesday launched an electric scooter-sharing service in Berlin, Germany with 200 scooters. With the new on-demand service, commuters can locate and book scooters using a connected app called 'Coup'. A management board member said, "Mobility requirements and demands are changing. Bosch wants to shape this change with their own mobility and service solutions."

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Ford Motors wasn’t Henry Ford's 1st car company
article: American industrialist and automobile pioneer Henry Ford, who was born on July 30, 1863, had started two car companies before he founded Ford in 1903. His first company was dissolved because Ford wasn’t happy with the low quality and high prices of the cars produced. He left his second company as he was unhappy with the investors’ decision.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Delphi to test self-driving taxis in Singapore
article: British automotive technology parts supplier Delphi on Monday announced a partnership with Singapore to start a pilot program for a self-driving taxi service. The system will work similar to ride-hailing services like Uber. Delphi plans to combine the cars, inter-vehicle communications systems, transactions, cloud services and security into a complete ecosystem which it plans to launch in 2022.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla app to let owners share their cars: Musk
article: Tesla Co-founder and CEO Elon Musk on Friday said that the Tesla app will let owners allow others to drive their cars when they aren't using it. Owners will be able to add or subtract users from the 'shared fleet'. Announced last week, 'shared fleet' enables Tesla owners to make money for them when they aren’t using it.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: China's elevated bus concept completes test run
article: China's elevated bus-transit concept, named "Transit Elevated Bus", recently completed its first road test run in the Qinhuangdao city. The test run featured a single bus carriage traveling over the traffic on a 300-metre long controlled track. Powered by electricity, the vehicle can carry 300 passengers and is about 72 feet long and 25 feet wide, spanning multiple traffic lanes.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Global self-drive rental program launched for Indians
article: Mobility solutions provider Avis India has launched a partner program for travel agents and travel management companies which lets them offer self-drive car rentals in over 168 countries to their customers. The company has also set up a training academy that provides a specialised training program for certification of staff at its travel trade partner locations.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Nissan to give golden cars to Olympic medal winners
article: Nissan has announced that it will give special gold-covered version of its electric car Leaf to the company-sponsored athletes who win gold medals at the Rio 2016 Olympic and Paralympic Games. The cars will be given to the winning athletes on their return from the games. The Nissan Leaf can travel up to 250 km on a single charge.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Online used-car dealer introduces VR to browse cars
article: US-based online used-car dealer Vroom has introduced virtual reality enabled system which lets users examine cars, open doors and inspect specific components before purchasing a car. The first version has been launched on Tuesday which covers 30 car models. Vroom is also set to open popups at malls for users who don't have access to equipment to experience its virtual showrooms.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Lamborghini releases video showcasing Centenario
article: Italian luxury automaker Lamborghini has released a video of its limited edition Centenario model which it launched to celebrate the hundredth birth anniversary of its Founder Ferruccio Lamborghini. Powered by a 759-horsepower V12 engine, the most powerful Lamborghini engine till date, the Centenario reaches 0-100 kmph in 2.8 seconds with a top speed of 350 kmph.

author: Parichit Mainra
abstract: South Korea bans sale of 80 Volkswagen models
article: South Korea has banned the sale of 80 Volkswagen car models and fined the German automobile company $16.06 million. The ban, which includes cars by Volkswagen, Audi, and Bentley, comes after reports that Volkswagen had forged documents on emissions and noise-level tests. Terming the ban "most severe", Volkswagen said that it would consider a legal challenge.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Video explores Obama's Presidential car 'The Beast'
article: A minute long YouTube video explores the 'Cadillac One' car used by the US President Barack Obama, also called 'The Beast'. The armoured vehicle is equipped to protect the President from bio-chemical attacks, and has an inbuilt fire fighting system. It also has shotguns, tear gas cannons and bottles of blood matching the President's type.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mercedes pulls ad over misleading self-driving claim
article: Mercedes-Benz has discontinued the television commercial for its new E-Class sedan over misleading automated driving claims. It compared the company's autonomous F 015 concept car with the E-Class and asked, "Is the world truly ready for a vehicle that can drive itself?" The E-Class features driver-assist system, but it requires the drivers to always keep their hands on the steering.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: New speed record for electric car set at 330 kmph
article: US-based electric car company Genovation's Extreme Electric (GXE) car has set a new land speed record of 330 kmph for a street legal all-electric vehicle. The GXE is a Z06 Corvette that has been customised to deliver 660 horsepower. The previous speed record of 300 kmph was also held by Genovation.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: BMW 5 Series M Sport launched in India at ₹54 lakh
article: German luxury automaker BMW on Tuesday launched its 5 Series variant, the M Sport sedan in India at a starting price of ₹54 lakh (ex-showroom, pan India). Powered by a 2.0-litre four-cylinder diesel engine, the M Sport produces 190 horsepower. The sedan can go from 0-100 kmph in 7.7 seconds and has a top speed of 233 kmph.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Chevrolet 1st to sell 100,000 hybrid cars in US
article: American automaker Chevrolet on Monday announced the sale of 100,000 units of its plug-in hybrid vehicle Volt in the US, becoming the first to reach the milestone for hybrid cars. Chevrolet reported that Volt owners drove 2.4 billion km in electric mode since the car went on sale, which the company estimates saved almost 220 billion litres of fuel.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Royal Enfield's design Director resigns
article: Indian motorcycle company Royal Enfield's Director of Design Pierre Terblanche has announced his resignation from the company after a 20-month tenure. Terblanche, who had joined Royal Enfield in November 2014, is known for his work with global automobile manufacturers like Volkswagen, Ducati and Piaggio.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: Tesla posts 13th straight quarterly loss
article: Automotive company Tesla Motors on Wednesday posted a loss of $293 million for the quarter ended June, its 13th consecutive quarterly loss. Led by Elon Musk, Tesla said it was still on track to meet its delivery target in the second half of 2016. According to Reuters, the quarterly report had little effect on the company's shares.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Honda builds Sonic-themed car for Comic-Con
article: The San Diego Comic-Con this year will showcase a Honda Civic designed in celebration of the 25th anniversary of Sega's Sonic the Hedgehog video game franchise. The Sonic Civic, as named by Honda, features a vinyl wrap over parts of the Sonic Blue body with Sonic Yellow accents, with rear wheels coloured to resemble Sonic's red-and-white sneakers.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Henry Ford's 1st vehicle had no steering wheel
article: The first vehicle of Henry Ford, widely regarded as the pioneer of the automobile industry, had a tiller instead of a steering wheel. The vehicle, made in 1896, was powered by a four horsepower engine with only two forward gears and no reverse gear. He later founded the Ford Motor Company, which sold its first car on July 23, 1903.

author: Yash Kumar
abstract: Aus man uses Lamborghini to tow trailer of goats
article: A video uploaded on YouTube shows a $250,000 Lamborghini Murcielago cruising on a road in Australia's Sydney towing a trailer full of goats. The driver of the car, which has a top speed of 330 kmph, is seen smiling at cars passing by. While one user commented on the video, "Lambo hauling lambs...", another commented, "Whatever floats your goat".

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Mercedes-Benz unveils electric transport truck
article: German multinational automaker Mercedes-Benz unveiled an electric heavy urban transport truck in Stuttgart on Wednesday, making it the first fully electric truck of its kind. With an admissible weight capacity of 26 tonnes, it has a maximum range of 200 km. The company said the production of the electric truck will be possible at the beginning of the next decade.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Ford, MIT create self-driving electric shuttle
article: American automaker Ford is collaborating with MIT researchers on a new project to create self-driving electric shuttles to operate on the university’s Boston campus. The shuttles will be equipped with cameras and a LiDAR system to monitor pedestrian flow, which helps predict demand and plan routes for the shuttles. The shuttles will be available for service via an app.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla shares fell post Musk revealed Master Plan
article: Shares of Tesla fell by 3.4% to $220.50 a share on Thursday after Co-founder and CEO Elon Musk revealed his 'Master Plan'. Standard & Poor’s cut its rating on Tesla saying that the new plan may "create a short-term cash flow sink hole.” Musk plans to expand Tesla into car-sharing, electric trucks, buses and solar energy systems.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Norway to build floating underwater tunnels
article: Norway is planning to build a series of floating underwater tunnels to reduce travel time. The 'submerged floating bridges' would consist of large tubes 100 feet below water, suspended by pontoon-like support structures. The $25 billion tunnel project could cut trip time from Kristiansand to Trondheim (1,095 km), which takes 21 hours via ferry to about 10 hours.

author: Vaibhav Gupta
abstract: RSS not registered organisation, says Digvijaya
article: Congress General Secretary Digvijaya Singh on Sunday claimed that RSS is an unregistered organisation and sought details of its annual fund collection, especially on 'Guru Purnima'. Talking about the attack by "cow-protectors" on Dalits in Gujarat's Una, he added that even the organisation behind it, was not registered and its members are "hooligans" collecting money in collaboration with police.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Renault launches Lodgy 'World Edition' at ₹9.74L
article: Renault India on Monday launched a new ‘World Edition’ line of its Lodgy multi-purpose vehicle with a starting price of ₹9.74 lakh ex-showroom Delhi. The new Lodgy comes with 'World Edition' badging along with body graphics, and is available in four colours – Fiery Red, Royal Orchid, Pearl White and Moonlight Silver.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Maruti net profit rises 23% to ₹1,486 cr in Q1
article: India's largest car maker Maruti Suzuki on Tuesday reported a net profit at ₹1,486 crore for the quarter ended June, a 23% jump year-on-year, amid favourable Rupee-Yen rate and a higher non-operating income. Further, the company's revenue rose 11.6% to ₹14,927 crore during the period under​ review. Net sales for the quarter rose by 12.1% to ₹14,654 crore.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Porsche plans 1,400 new jobs for electric sports car
article: Porsche is planning to hire at least 1,400 employees for the development of its first all-electric sports car. Around 900 positions will be created in production, 300 in development, and 200 in administration for the project code-named 'J1', said Porsche. Porsche is reportedly spending about $1.1 billion on the electric sports car, which it plans to release in 2019.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Israeli tech firm ends partnership with Tesla
article: Israel-based technology firm Mobileye ended its collaboration with electric-vehicle maker Tesla on Tuesday. Though Mobileye will provide technical support for its EyeQ3 processor, it won't develop Autopilot-related products for Tesla. Mobileye said that its earnings won't be affected as it will direct resources towards its partnership with BMW and Intel for developing self-driving features.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Hyperloop Transportation to create high-tech train
article: Hyperloop Transportation Technologies (HTT) announced plans to test a rail-based high-tech train by 2017. The train will feature interactive on-window panels that interact with passengers, offering real-time information including news, current time, weather and route info. HTT has partnered with Europe's largest train company Deutsche Bahn to develop this train.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Tesla car parts to be made from used bottles
article: US automotive supplier C3 Ventures, which makes interior plastic parts for automotive giant Tesla, on Tuesday announced plans to recycle used plastic bottles to manufacture Tesla parts. The company will set up a plant in Flint in US for the same, a town where high levels of lead in groundwater has led to increased bottled water consumption.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mercedes launches SLC 43 AMG in India at ₹77.50L
article: Global automobile manufacturer Mercedes-Benz on Tuesday launched its SLC 43 AMG in India at ₹77.50 lakh (ex-showroom, Delhi). The hard top two-door convertible comes with a 3.0-litre V6 bi-turbo engine which delivers 367 horsepower. It can accelerate from 0-100 kmph in 4.7 seconds and has an electronically limited top speed of 250 kmph.

author: Renault
abstract: Renault India celebrates its 5th anniversary
article: Automobile manufacturer Renault is celebrating its 5th anniversary in India by giving away several offers. The most notable offer is a chance to win a Renault car for free, for five lucky customers buying the car in July. Other notable offers include exchange bonuses of ₹25,000 and gift cheques of ₹20,000. The offers are valid till 31st of July.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: US company develops off-road wheelchair
article: US firm Howe and Howe Technologies has unveiled the Ripchair 3.0, an off-road vehicle designed for wheelchair users. The Ripchair is completely customisable, with left and right-handed electronic controls and add-ons like cup holders, fishing rod holders and gun racks.  The off-road wheelchair features a 29 HP 4-stroke engine and reaches top speeds of 16 kmph.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Old Porsche 911R sold for 7 times original price
article: Used Porsche 911 Rs are selling at prices as high as $1.3 million, almost seven times the car's original price of $185,950. The appreciation in value may be a record, according to high-end car finance company Magnitude Finance. Only 991 911 Rs were built by Porsche, with a top speed of 323 kmph and 0-100 kmph time of 3.8s.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: New app can help prevent car theft
article: US firm Voyomotive has developed an app to help prevent vehicle hacking and theft. The Lockdown app uses two-step authentication to authorise vehicle entry and engine start via a hardware controller that can be installed inside any car. If an unauthorised user tries to enter the vehicle, the app re-locks the doors, honks the horn and flashes the headlights.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Petrol variants in all Mercedes cars by Sept
article: German luxury automaker Mercedes-Benz will introduce a petrol variant to all its models by September. The diesel-only models CLS, GLE and GLS are likely to receive the 3.0-litre V6 petrol engine used in the recently launched S 400. This comes after the recent Supreme Court decision banning sales of 2,000 cc and above diesel vehicles in the NCR.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Lockheed Martin to build missile sub for US Navy
article: Aerospace company Lockheed Martin recently announced a $166 million contract with the US Special Operations Command to build a new "missile sub", called S302. The 30-ton vehicle will carry up to six divers to an underwater location in a completely dry environment. It will have a lock-out depth of 98 feet and a top speed of about 9.26 kmph.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Maruti Suzuki, TVS in Forbes 'Super 50' list
article: Maruti Suzuki, TVS Motor Company and Eicher Motors have been featured in the list of 'Super 50 Companies 2016' released on Wednesday by Forbes India. The list is based on shareholder return, sales growth and return on equity, with TVS Motor Company offering highest shareholder return (964%). Tata Motors appeared on the 2015 list but has been dropped out this year.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Hyperloop One opens first manufacturing plant
article: Hyperloop One on Wednesday announced the opening of its first manufacturing plant in Nevada, US. Called Hyperloop One Metalworks, the 1,05,000 square-foot building will be used to build and test components for a full-system Hyperloop prototype, for testing in 2017. Elon Musk's brainchild Hyperloop, if successful, could reduce travel time between Helsinki and Stockholm (483 km) to 30 minutes.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: Volkswagen $15bn settlement gets preliminary nod
article: A US federal court on Tuesday gave preliminary approval to German carmaker Volkswagen’s $15.3 billion settlement deal over the emissions cheating scandal. Last month, Volkswagen had agreed to spend up to $10 billion buying back or repairing around 4,75,000 vehicles (the largest-ever automative buyback in the US) while also compensating their owners with an additional $5,100-10,000 each.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Renault KWID is India's most fuel efficient car
article: Budget hatchback Renault KWID is India's most fuel efficient car with a mileage of 25.17 kmpl, according to the company. Around 1.5 lakh units of the car have already been booked since its launch in September last year. At a starting price of ₹2.62 lakh, the car comes with a 799 cc engine, power steering and central locking system.

author: Yash Kumar
abstract: Porsche left 'secret' note for Honda developers
article: Porsche attached a 'secret' note to a Porsche 911 GT3, after it found that the car had been bought by a Honda developers team. The note attached under the engine cover read, "Good luck Honda from Porsche. See you on the other side." The team had purchased the Porsche car to assess its steering while developing the Honda Acura NSX.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Volkswagen becomes world's largest carmaker
article: German automaker Volkswagen AG is the world's largest automobile manufacturer as per data available for the first half of 2016. Volkswagen sold 5.11 million units, around 80,000 units ahead of Japan's Toyota, and 360,000 units ahead of USA's General Motors, the second and third-largest automobile manufacturers. Volkswagen had been involved in an emissions test tampering scandal last year.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Fiat Chrysler under investigation for fraud
article: The US Justice Department is investigating whether Fiat Chrysler Automobiles had inflated vehicle sales figures, the company said on Monday. Earlier in January, a lawsuit by Illinois-based dealers had accused Fiat officials of pressuring dealers to falsify sales reports. Fiat had dismissed the claims, saying its quarterly financial reports presented a true picture of vehicles built and shipped.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Ducati app allows Scrambler bike customisation
article: Ducati has unveiled a Scrambler Configurator platform that lets users customise and personalise their Ducati Scrambler motorbike before purchase. The Configurator offers choices from over 60 accessories like tank covers, three different Scrambler logos and six different seats among others. There is also an option to share a configuration with nearby dealers and receive real-time feedback.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Scorpio with Intelli-Hybrid launched at ₹12.8L
article: Mahindra & Mahindra on Wednesday launched its Scorpio SUV with 'Intelli-Hybrid’ technology at ₹12.84 lakh (ex-showroom, Navi Mumbai) for the top-end S10-2WD model. The Intelli-Hybrid technology claims to reduce the fuel consumption by up to 7% by assisting the engine with electric power during acceleration. It comes with 2.2-litre mHAWK engine that delivers 120PS of power.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla drops 'Motors' from its web address
article: Electric vehicles maker Tesla has dropped 'Motors' from its web address. The company had reportedly acquired the new web address earlier this year and started shifting its employees' emails to the new domain. Earlier this month, Tesla Co-founder and CEO Elon Musk had tweeted, "Working on Top Secret Tesla Masterplan, Part 2. Hoping to publish later this week."

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: SoftBank-Honda partner to develop 'talking car'
article: SoftBank on Thursday said it was partnering with automaker Honda to develop 'talking cars' that can read drivers' emotions with the help of SoftBank's humanoid robotic technology. SoftBank described a future where Honda cars could interact with drivers, helping them park or offering company on long trips. The announcement comes after SoftBank agreed to buy British chip designer ARM Holdings.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: India to become Daimler's mobility strategy hub
article: Daimler, the parent company of Mercedes-Benz on Wednesday announced plans to multiply the engineering workforce at its Bengaluru research facility. The facility, which currently has Daimler's second-biggest team of dedicated software professionals, will become the strategy hub for testing Daimler's plans for becoming a mobility services company following recent trends in the automotive industry.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Gadkari urges Tesla to make India its Asia hub
article: Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari has asked US automotive major Tesla Motors to make India its Asia manufacturing hub. He has offered land near major Indian ports to promote exports to South and South East Asian countries, a statement read. Gadkari has further proposed joint ventures between Tesla and Indian automobile companies for developing pollution-free road transport in India.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Rannvijay to join Mahindra's first ever mountain ride
article: TV Actor Rannvijay Singh will join the first ever Mahindra Mojo Mountain Trail, a mountain motorcycle ride, between July 25 and July 29. The Mahindra organised ride will commence on July 24 from New Delhi and conclude on August 7 in Chandigarh. The ride will take riders to Leh, covering four passes, crossing water streams, and visiting monasteries.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Video: Self-driving electric pods concept unveiled
article: A one-minute video unveils Italy's NEXT Future Transportation's self-driving electric pods concept, forming a modular transport system. Pods can drive individually or attach to one another like a bus, whose full-scale prototype was launched last month. Each pod can accommodate upto 10 passengers, and offers value added services like food and drinks which can be booked via a mobile app.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Elon Musk reveals Tesla 'Master Plan'
article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Wednesday unveiled plans to expand the company into car-sharing, electric trucks, buses and solar energy systems. The car-sharing feature would let Tesla owners add their cars to the Tesla shared fleet to generate income when their cars are not in use. Musk also announced that the electric trucks and buses will be unveiled next year.

author: Sumedha Sehra
abstract: Tesla Model S was named top-rated car ever
article: The Tesla Model S P85D was named the top-rated car ever by Consumer Reports, outscoring cars like the BMW 750i xDrive. Described by the magazine as "the best car that Consumer Reports has ever tested", it broke the rating system, initially scoring a 103 out of 100. The magazine's road-test rating system was later adjusted, rating the car at 100.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Samsung invests $450mn in Chinese auto firm
article: Samsung Electronics invested $450 million for a 1.92% stake in Chinese car manufacturing firm BYD on Friday, making it the ninth largest investor in the company. The company said Samsung's investment will initially go into growth of battery production and R&D of new-energy vehicles. BYD makes gas-powered, hybrid and electric vehicles, solar panelling and rechargeable batteries.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: First Jeep was a 1940 Willys Quad
article: The first Jeep prototype was designed in 75 days by Willys-Overland Motor Company and delivered to the US Army in November 1940. The prototypes were called ‘Quad’, due to the four-wheel drive system equipped in them. Only two units of the prototype were built and it turned into the final production model, the Jeep Willys MB.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mercedes-Benz unveils self-driving 'Future Bus'
article: Global automobile manufacturer Mercedes-Benz on Monday unveiled its self-driving bus 'Future Bus'. It comes with a feature called 'CityPilot' which allows the bus to drive itself for about 20 kilometres in an urban environment using cameras, radar and internet. Able to navigate tunnels, brake and open or close doors automatically, the bus has a top speed of 70 kmph.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Ford partners tequila brand to make car parts
article: Automaker Ford and tequila producer Jose Cuervo on Tuesday announced a partnership to explore how the latter’s leftover agave plant fibres can be used to produce sustainable bioplastic car parts. Currently, the agave-derived material is being tested for wiring harnesses, AC units and storage bins. As per initial feedback, the new bioplastic is more durable and could reduce vehicles’ weight.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Mercedes launches new service programme in India
article: Mercedes-Benz India on Tuesday launched its new service programme, ‘My Mercedes-My Service’. The programme comprises initiatives like 'Digital Service Drive' that allows video call service updates and easy online booking, and 'Premier Express Service' that offers complete service in over two hours. Notably, India is the only market other than US to feature the 'Digital Service Drive' programme.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Video: Electric van outruns Tesla and Ferrari
article: Silicon Valley startup Atieva released a video of its electric van prototype 'Edna' outrunning a Tesla Model S and a Ferrari California in a drag race. Atieva claims 'Edna' sports a 0-100 kmph time of just over three seconds and delivers 900 HP to its four wheels. Interestingly, Atieva has a number of former Tesla employees in its ranks.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Royal Enfield India's fastest growing brand
article: Motorcycle brand Royal Enfield is the fastest growing Indian brand, according to Brand Finance's report on India's 100 most valuable brands of 2016. With a 91% growth in brand value, Royal Enfield is ranked 49th, up from last year’s 84. Tata topped the list with an estimated value of $13.7 billion.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Royal Enfield supplied gun-loaded bikes in WW I
article: Royal Enfield supplied motorcycles loaded with Lewis machine guns and stretchers to the Royal army during World War I. It also came with a Vickers machine Gun sidecar attachment which could be turned skywards and used against low flying aircraft. Notably, Royal Enfield became the fastest growing Indian brand in 2016.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: World's smallest motorcycle weighs 1.1 kg
article: The record for the world's smallest motorcycle is held by 'Smalltoe', which weighs 1.1 kg, as per Guinness World Records. It has a top speed of 2 km/hour, and is powered by a 0.22 kW engine. The creator of the vehicle, Tom Wiberg, rode the machine for more than 10 metre in 2003, as can be seen in the video.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: In Pictures: Auction of super-rare vintage cars
article: On July 30 in Detroit, US, auctioneer RM Sotheby's will offer for sale some of the most iconic American vintage cars. The sale, which will include cars like Ford's Le Mans-inspired GT, a 1972 Porsche 911 S Coupe and a 1957 Mercedes-Benz 190 SL, will open to the public at $200 a ticket.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Honda Activa becomes top selling two-wheeler
article: Honda Motorcycle and Scooter India has said that its Activa scooter has surpassed Hero Splendor to become India's largest selling two-wheeler in January-June 2016. This is the first time in 17 years that a scooter topped volume sales in the domestic two-wheeler market "ending...monopoly of motorcycles". HMSI further said Activa "added 1,97,295 units over last year in just six months".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Aston Martin makes warplane-inspired V12 Vantage
article: Aston Martin has built a limited edition V12 Vantage S Spitfire 80 model celebrating the 80th anniversary of British warplane Supermarine Spitfire. The warplane was employed by the Royal Air Force and its allies during and after the Second World War. The car comes with a Duxford Green paint-job and splashes of yellow to mimic the look of the warplane.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla Autopilot issue may fix through an update
article: Following a crash that killed a driver, Tesla will release a software update that may fix the Autopilot issue in its cars. "Promising call today with @BoschGlobal, maker of our radar sensor. Looks like significant improvements possible via OTA software update," tweeted Tesla's Co-founder and CEO Elon Musk on Monday. The US government is running an investigation regarding the crash.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Aston Martin recalls 6,076 cars over door lock
article: British luxury sports car manufacturer Aston Martin is recalling 6,076 cars to fix an issue with the vehicles' door locks. The recalled models include Aston Martin DB9, DBS, Rapide, V8 Vantage, Virage, Vanquish, V12 Vantage and V12 Zagato. The door unlocking components of these cars were reportedly not functioning properly, which may trap occupants inside the cars.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Geneva's new electric buses charge in 15 seconds
article: Switzerland's Geneva has approved a dozen electric buses which come with a 'flash charging' technology that recharges the buses in 15 seconds. In this time, the buses receive 600-kilowatts of energy, enough to get the buses to the next station. Developed by ABB at a cost of $16 million, the buses will connect Geneva airport with a new suburb.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Paytm wallet allows booking of Renault KWID
article: Renault India and Paytm announced a strategic tie-up on Tuesday which provides users the opportunity to book all variants of Renault's KWID on Paytm for ₹10,000. The users can also pay the booking amount at the dealerships using their Paytm wallets. Currently available for the Delhi-NCR area, the companies plan on extending the partnership at pan-India level soon.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: 1st Mustang was sold 3 days before release date
article: The first Ford Mustang was sold to a pilot, Stanley Tucker three days before the official launch  in 1964. Tucker convinced the dealership, and bought the car which wasn't meant for sale. He took serial number '5F08F100001', and became the only Mustang owner at that time. Tucker was later given the one-millionth Mustang by Ford in exchange of the car.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Mustang is in continuous production since 1965
article: Ford Mustang has remained in continuous production for over 50 years since it rolled off the assembly line in 1965. The company has produced six generations of the Mustang, and has sold over 9 million cars. Notably, the latest sixth generation Mustang is the first right hand drive model of the car.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Polaris launches new Scout Sixty at ₹11.99 lakh
article: All-terrain vehicle manufacturer Polaris India on Wednesday launched its 2016 Indian Scout Sixty bike in Mumbai priced at ₹11.99 lakh. The bike comes with a Liquid Cooled V-Twin 61 cubic inch engine which delivers 78 hp and a peak torque of 5800 rpm. It will be available from July 2016 in Thunder Black, Red and Pearl White colours.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Honda India announces to recall over 1.9L cars
article: Honda Cars India on Thursday announced to recall 190,578 cars of previous generation of Accord, CR-V, Civic, City and Jazz models to replace Takata airbags. The replacement will be carried out free of cost at Honda dealerships across India. Customers can check whether their cars are covered under the campaign by presenting their 17-character Vehicle Identification Number on Honda's website.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tamil Nadu dealership offers Kabali-themed Swift
article: A Maruti Suzuki dealership in Tamil Nadu is offering a custom variant of Swift inspired by actor Rajinikanth's upcoming movie 'Kabali'. The hatchback is wrapped in a sticker set featuring the movie's posters and dialogues. Priced slightly higher than the official ex-showroom tag, the edition is not an official variant but a custom sticker job offered by the dealership.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: ₹65L for 5 litre of American muscle, tweets user
article: Reacting to the India launch of Ford Mustang, a user tweeted, "₹65 lakh for five litres of American muscle. #Mustang is here & I'm absolutely loving it". Another user's tweet read, "Ford #Mustang launched in #India. Finally, my dream of driving my #Innova and watching a Mustang zoom past me will be fulfilled".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Alibaba's smart car lets drivers take selfies
article: Chinese online retail giant Alibaba's first internet-connected car 'OS’Car RX5 SUV' is equipped with a 360° detachable camera that allows drivers to record road trips and take selfies. The car owners can pay for parking spaces, fuel and coffee through connected Alibaba’s Alipay service. It also recognises different drivers and makes recommendations on music and destinations based on past trips.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Aston Martin's 820-hp Vulcan to go on auction
article: One of the only 24 Aston Martin Vulcans, all of which had been sold out, will go on auction in August and is expected to fetch more than its original price of $2.3 million. The vehicle comes with a 7.0-liter V12 engine that generates 820 horsepower. Till now, only one of the 24 Vulcan has been auctioned, at $3.4 million.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mercedes-Benz unveils luxury electric golf cart
article: Mercedes-Benz on Tuesday unveiled a new luxury electric 'Style Edition Garia Golf Cart' made jointly with Scandinavian golf cart manufacturer Garia. The cart comes with a carbon fibre body, wooden decor and includes a 10.1-inch touchscreen infotainment system and an in-built refrigerator. It has a top speed of 30 kmph and travels up to 80 kilometres on a single charge.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla unveils cheaper Model X priced at $74,000
article: Tesla on Wednesday unveiled 'Model X 60D', a more affordable version of its Model X SUV with a starting price of $74,000, which is around $6,000 cheaper from the original model. The Model X 60D can go 0-100 kmph in six seconds, has a top speed of 210 kmph and allows travelling up to 320 kilometres on a single charge.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Porsche launches Cayenne Platinum at ₹1.06 crore
article: German automobile manufacturer Porsche on Thursday launched its Cayenne Platinum Edition sports car in India at ₹1.06 crore (ex-showroom, Maharashtra). Powered by a V6 engine, the car delivers 300 horsepower. It can go from 0-100 kmph in 7.6 seconds and has a top speed of 230 kmph. Currently available for order, the car's deliveries will begin from August 2016.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Kerala gets jewellery store built inside a truck
article: A jewellery brand named 'Chemmanur International Jewelers' has opened a mobile jewellery store in Kerala, based on a Scania G410 truck. The store named Parrakum Jewellery, meaning Flying Jewellery in Malayalam, has been set up by design firm DC Design. The mobile store will travel to different districts of Kerala for exhibition and sale of gold and diamond ornaments.

author: Yash Kumar
abstract: Pop-art Bentley sells for £250,000
article: A one-of-a-kind Bentley Continental GT Convertible designed by "Godfather of British pop art" Sir Peter Blake has sold at the Goodwood Festival of Speed for £250,000. He designed each seat with a different colour, replicating them on the steering wheel. A distinctive treadplate, signifying that this is a Peter Blake design, has “Number 1 of 1” labelled on the car.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla has no plans to disable Autopilot: Musk
article: Tesla Co-founder and CEO Elon Musk has said that the company has no plans to disable the Autopilot feature in its cars. "A lot of people don’t understand what it is and how you turn it on,” Musk added. Musk's statement comes amid the US government's ongoing probe into a couple of Tesla crashes believed to be caused by Autopilot.

author: Vani Vivek
abstract: 'Tesla's Autopilot too much, too soon'
article: Consumer-advocacy organisation Consumer Reports has called Tesla's Autopilot system "too much autonomy too soon". The blog urges the automaker to disable hands-free feature until its system can be made safer. Laura MacCleery, Vice President of Consumer Policy and Mobilisation of Consumer Reports said, "By marketing their feature as ‘Autopilot,’ Tesla gives consumers a false sense of security".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: AeroMobil unveils new flying car prototype
article: Slovakian startup AeroMobil has put a flying car prototype 'AeroMobil 3.0' on display from July 7 to August 1 in Brussels. The car fits into any standard parking space and can take off and land using both grass and paved surfaces, just a few hundred metres long. The vehicle also features autopilot mode and an advanced parachute deployment system.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Twelve-seater self-driving bus unveiled in Tokyo
article: Japanese technology company DeNA recently unveiled its first self-driving bus named 'EZ10 Robot Shuttle' in Tokyo, that runs on electricity and carries 12 passengers. The bus is designed to ferry people from parking spaces to their destinations. It has a top speed of 40 kmph and will be first used at a Japanese shopping facility next month.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Working on top secret masterplan: Elon Musk
article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Sunday tweeted, "Working on top secret Tesla masterplan, Part 2. Hoping to publish later this week." The tweet comes amid the ongoing investigations by the US government in two crashes involving Tesla cars. Interestingly, Musk in August 2006 published a blog titled 'The Secret Tesla Motors Master Plan' where he revealed plans for new cars.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: 'Tesla being probed over its autopilot crash'
article: According to a Wall Street Journal report, the US Securities and Exchange Commission is investigating whether Tesla breached securities laws by not disclosing to its investors its autonomous car's fatal crash on autopilot in May. Reportedly, amid several state and federal ongoing investigations, it is still not clear if Tesla's Autopilot features contributed to or caused the accident.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Autopilot was off in Pennsylvania crash: Musk
article: Tesla's Elon Musk on Friday tweeted that the Tesla Model X which crashed in Pennsylvania on July 1 had autopilot disabled during the crash. The accident wouldn't have occurred if autopilot was on, he added. This came after a US Senate Committee called out Musk, seeking answers about the autopilot technology and how the company is educating drivers about it.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Land Rover's tech predicts road conditions ahead
article: Jaguar Land Rover has developed a 'Surface ID Research Technology' for self-driving vehicles that uses advanced sensors to identify and predict the surface conditions on the road ahead. Once identified, the technology prompts the driver to change the terrain response mode. This helps the drivers to optimise all-terrain performance of the vehicle without loss of momentum or control.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Nissan debuts driver-assist technology ProPilot
article: Nissan has introduced a new driver-assist technology called ProPilot, which will be available in its new Serena minivan in Japan. It makes the minivan capable of accelerating, braking and navigating highway stop-and-go traffic in a single lane. The system sends warnings when drivers take their hands off the wheel and eventually disables the autopilot mode if the prompts are ignored.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Man's Ferrari Enzo replica claims 650 kmph speed
article: A Canadian man named Ryan McQueen has built a replica of the Ferrari Enzo supercar, which he claims, has a top speed of 650 kmph. McQueen, who took 12 years and around $70,000 to build the car, has fitted two jet engines on the car's rear. The car, however, is yet to pass a safety test.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jeep releases video to mark its 75th anniversary
article: American automaker Jeep, which turned 75-years-old on Friday, has released a video featuring the evolution of its different vehicles. The video covers the company's models from the 1941 Willys MA to its modern 2016 Jeep Wrangler. Jeep, owned by Fiat Chrysler Automobiles, manufactures sport utility vehicles and off-road vehicles.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Jeep builds WWII-themed Wrangler as it turns 75
article: American automaker Jeep, which turned 75-years-old on Friday, has made a World War II-themed Wrangler concept that pays homage to the Willys MB, a utility vehicle which was manufactured during the war. The jeep's exterior features an olive-drab color scheme that was first seen on military vehicles 75 years ago. It is powered by a 3.6-litre Pentastar V-6 engine.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ford launches Mustang in India at ₹65 lakh
article: American automaker Ford on Tuesday launched its Ford Mustang in India at a price of ₹65 lakh (ex-showroom, New Delhi). Powered by a 5.0-litre Ti-VCT V8 engine, the car delivers 401 PS of power. The Mustang can go from 0-100 kmph in under five seconds and has a top speed of 250 kmph.

author: Aditya Nadkarni
abstract: Railways launches special train for car freight
article: The Indian Railways has launched a special train for car freight called 'Auto Express'. Currently available from Gurgaon to Nidvanda, the train can run at 100 kmph, reducing travel time to 57 hours from the current 70 hours. With the new train, the vehicles transported between the two regions will increase from the current 2,000 to 6,000 units per month.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US regulator probes yet another Tesla crash
article: The US regulator is investigating a Tesla Model X car crash that took place on July 1 in Pennsylvania, injuring the driver and a passenger. "We have no reason to believe that Autopilot had anything to do with this accident," said Tesla. The company is facing another probe against a fatal car crash that happened on May 7.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: DVD player recovered from crashed Tesla car
article: Florida Highway Patrol officials said on Friday that they have recovered a DVD player from the autopilot active Tesla Model S car which collided with a truck trailer in May. Whether the portable DVD player was operating at the time of the crash has not been determined. Tesla is facing an inquiry over the crash which killed the car's driver.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Ferrari unveils special edition LaFerrari
article: Ferrari on Tuesday unveiled a special open-top edition of its limited production hybrid sports car series 'LaFerrari'. All available units of the convertible were sold-out at a private event earlier this year, with an estimated price of $1.4 million per unit. Sporting the same performance as the original LaFerrari, the new model offers removable carbon fibre hard and soft tops.

author: Sanira Mediratta
abstract: BMW to build fully autonomous car by 2021
article: BMW is teaming up with chipmaker Intel and advanced driver assistance system (ADAS) provider Mobileye to build its first fully autonomous self-driving car by 2021. Called the BMW iNEXT, the car will reportedly be able to drive itself from start to finish without a human driver inside. The companies will provide extended autonomous test drives in 2017.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: China's Hanergy unveils four solar car concepts
article: Chinese solar power company Hanergy recently unveiled four fully solar-powered car concepts in Beijing namely Hanergy Solar R, Hanergy Solar O, Hanergy Solar L and Hanergy Solar A. The maximum area of the cars is covered by light weight thin-film solar cells, which allow up to 80 kilometres of travel after being in the sunlight for five to six hours.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Ferrari to release 350 special edition cars
article: Italian sports car manufacturer Ferrari will release 350 special edition cars at the Paris Motor Show in October to celebrate its 70th birthday​. Each car will be a one-off unique unit, drawing inspiration from 70 most iconic cars from Ferrari’s history. The announcement was made in private to 100 Ferrari owners who participated in a Ferrari event in Venice, Italy.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Aston Martin unveils AM-RB 001 hypercar
article: British luxury sports cars manufacturer Aston Martin on Wednesday unveiled its AM-RB 001 hypercar.
