Being made by Aston Martin in partnership with Red Bull racing, it is powered by a V12 engine and reportedly aims to be the fastest production car in the world. The company will make only 99-150 units of the car and start delivering them in 2018.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Alibaba unveils its first smart car 'Roewe RX5'
article: Chinese online retail giant Alibaba on Wednesday unveiled its first smart car Roewe RX5 in Hangzhou. Jointly developed with automaker SAIC Motor Corp and launching in August this year, the SUV runs on YunOS and suggests alternate routes in case of road closures or traffic. Alibaba's CTO Wang Jian said, "You'll quickly see driverless car technology resulting from this platform."

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Autopilot user safer than regular driver: Tesla
article: Responding to the fatality believed to be caused by Tesla's Autopilot mode, the company released a statement which said, "Customers using Autopilot are statistically safer than those not using it at all." Tesla added, "To be clear, this accident was the result of a semi-tractor trailer crossing both lanes of a divided highway in front of an oncoming car."

author: Ayan Ghosh
abstract: New Fiat Linea launched in India at ₹7.82 lakh
article: Fiat has launched its mid-sized sedan Linea 125 S in India with prices starting from ₹7.82 lakh (ex-showroom, New Delhi). The most powerful mid-sedan in its segment, the Linea 125 S comes with features like a 5-inch multi-functional touchscreen infotainment system with navigation, ambient lighting, rear sun-curtain, disc brakes on all four wheels and dual airbags.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Ford unveils special edition GT model
article: American automaker Ford has unveiled the all-new Ford GT '66 Heritage Edition with unique black and silver stripe livery to celebrate the '1966 Le Mans' winning GT40 Mark II race car. The new model, which will be available in limited quantity, sports a white number "2" on the hood and door, 20-inch one-piece forged aluminum wheels and ebony leather seats.

author: Amit Chhangani
abstract: Yamaha India recalls 902 units of the YZF-R3
article: Following Yamaha Japan’s recall of the R25, MT25, R3 and MT320, Yamaha India also announced a recall of 902 units of YZF-R3 on Thursday. The affected motorcycles suffer from clutch pressure plate and oil pump assembly malfunction, which may render the motorcycle non-operational. The defective parts will be replaced with the new ones free of cost at authorised Yamaha dealerships.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ducati launches Multistrada in India at ₹20 lakh
article: Italian motorcycle manufacturer Ducati on Monday launched its limited edition 'Multistrada 1200 Pikes Peak' in India at ₹20.06 lakh (ex-showroom, Delhi). The bike celebrates the 100th anniversary of the iconic Pikes Peak International Hill Climb race. Powered by a 1198.4cc engine, the bike delivers 160 hp. It will be available at Ducati dealerships in Delhi, Gurgaon, Mumbai, Pune and Bengaluru.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Kentucky dealer makes giant US flag with cars
article: Ahead of the Independence Day of the United States, which is celebrated on July 4, Kentucky-based car dealer Paul Miller Ford has created a giant American flag using cars. To make the 22,000-square-foot flag, 123 red, white and blue vehicles were used. "We wanted to do something special to honor the Fourth of July", Paul Miller Auto Group CEO said.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Spanish Nissan dealer sells car over Twitter
article: Antamotor, a Nissan dealer in Spain, recently sold an X-Trail crossover over Twitter to a customer named Raul Escolano. Escolano had used the hashtag #compraruncocheportwitter (buy a car on Twitter) to challenge automakers across the country to sell him a car only through social networks. Nissan then gave him a walkthrough of the car through Periscope before sealing the deal.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Ducati unveils special edition 1299 Panigale
article: To celebrate the 90th anniversary, Italian motorcycle manufacturer Ducati has unveiled the special edition '1299 Panigale S Anniversario'. It comes with several upgrades including Akrapovič titanium exhaust, billet aluminum mirror block-off​ plates and carbon fiber heel guards. The company will build 500 units globally with each bike having a distinct number etched onto the top triple clamp.

author: Amit Chhangani
abstract: Ducati Museum reopens in Italy after renovation
article: Dedicated to the company's iconic road bikes, the Ducati Museum in Bologna, Italy was reopened on Wednesday after undergoing renovation to celebrate the company’s 90th anniversary. Open till July 5 this year, the new museum has three different themes - racing, production bikes and Ducati moments. Of the 27 production bikes on display, 15 have never been on show before.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Mercedes unveils cheapest convertible at $18,900
article: Luxury carmaker Mercedes-Benz on Wednesday announced the '2017 Smart Fortwo Cabrio' priced at $18,900, making it the cheapest convertible car in the market. The environment-friendly​ two-seater can reportedly accelerate up to 96 kmph in 10.4 seconds and will come equipped with a 1.0-liter turbocharged three-cylinder engine pumping out 89 horsepower. It will hit the US market later in the year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla driver killed in crash with Autopilot mode
article: In the first known fatality in a Tesla where Autopilot was active, a Model S driver was recently killed in a crash with a tractor trailer on a highway in Florida. The National Highway Transportation Safety Administration is investigating the incident. "Our condolences for the tragic loss," tweeted Tesla CEO Elon Musk.

author: Sanira Mediratta
abstract: Man develops wheels that allow sideway movement
article: A Canadian inventor William Liddiard has created a prototype of wheels that allow a car to move in all directions. Liddiard fitted the omnidirectional​ wheels on a Toyota Echo enabling it to glide sideways and spin 360 degrees. Designed to be used in all weather and road conditions, the wheels can be bolted on any car.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: First ever Shelby Cobra going up for auction
article: The very first Shelby Cobra, that was built by late American automotive designer Carroll Shelby and kicked-off the Shelby Mustang legacy, will be up for auction at RM Sotheby's Monterey Auction in August. The car, which was built in 1962, has a top speed of 246 kmph and can go from 0 to 96 kmph in 4.2 seconds.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Supersonic car to attempt speed world record
article: Supersonic car 'Bloodhound SSC' has received new funding for its first attempt to break the land speed world record of 1227.985 kmph in October 2017. Powered by a Rolls-Royce EJ200 jet engine, a Jaguar V8 engine and Nammo hybrid rockets, the 13.4-metre long car delivers 135,000 brake horsepower. The earlier record was set 20 years ago by Thrust SSC.

author: Ayan Ghosh
abstract: Renault unveils its one-tonne pick-up 'Alaskan'
article: French automobile manufacturer Renault has unveiled Alaskan, the company's first global one-tonne pick-up. The Alaskan will initially go on sale in Latin American markets, followed by Europe. With contemporary Renault design cues and a conventional pick-up profile, the Alaskan’s cabin seats five persons. It is powered by a 2.3-litre twin-turbo dCi engine with 160 hp and 190 hp options.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Jaguar announces debut of new XKSS
article: British luxury carmaker Jaguar recently announced that the continuation Jaguar XKSS will receive its world debut presentation in November this year in California. Production of the new model will be limited to nine examples, hand-crafted by Jaguar Classic expert technicians and manufactured to the exact same specification as the original XKSS, which was produced in 1957.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: 'Peel P50' is the world's smallest car ever made
article: Three-wheeled micro-car 'Peel P50', having a length of 53 inches, is the world's smallest production car ever made, according to the Guinness World Records. The one seater car has a top speed of 64 kmph and weighs 59 kg. Only 100 units of the car were manufactured by the Peel Engineering Company in the 1960s.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Linkin Park-themed Mercedes-AMG GT3 unveiled
article: European GT squad Black Falcon recently unveiled a Linkin Park-themed Mercedes-AMG GT3 race car featuring black lightning bolts, thick red stripes and the band's logo draped over the silver base. The car will be used by the Black Falcon at the upcoming 'Spa 24 Hours' annual endurance racing event in Belgium over the last weekend in July.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: Hail the new Dawn, a user tweets
article: Reacting to Rolls-Royce Dawn launch in India, a user tweeted, "Hail the new #Dawn. The one to own! #RollsRoyce." While another user's tweet read, "Possibly the best car to spend ₹7 crore plus on a luxury convertible. #Dawn launched in India." "Love of beauty is taste. The creation of beauty is art. #RollsRoyceDawn," read another tweet.

author: Rahul Raj
abstract: Bentley releases 53,000 megapixel car photo
article: British luxury carmaker Bentley on Tuesday released a 53,000 megapixel​ photo of its latest car ‘Mulsanne EWB’, taken using a technology initially developed by NASA. The technology was built to capture images of the Mars landscape. Interestingly, the image of the car can cover a complete football field when printed.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Volkswagen agrees to $15B settlement for emission scam
article: German automaker Volkswagen on Tuesday agreed to a settlement worth $15.3 billion with the US government after admitting to have rigged fuel emission tests since 2009. In the largest-ever automative buyback in the US, Volkswagen has agreed to buy back a record half a million emission cheating vehicles from consumers and provide funding to benefit makers of cleaner technologies.

author: Amit Chhangani
abstract: New Porsche 911 launched in India at ₹1.39 crore
article: German carmaker Porsche on Wednesday launched the updated 2017 Porsche 911 models Carrera and Carrera S in India at a starting price of ₹1.39 crore and ₹1.42 crore respectively. The new models feature styling updates and three-litre turbocharged flat-six engines which deliver 370 hp and 420 hp in the Carrera and Carrera S respectively.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Aston Martin to build only 99 Vanquish Zagatos
article: British luxury sports car manufacturer Aston Martin on Wednesday announced that it will make only 99 units of its Vanquish Zagato Coupe. It comes with a six-litre V12 engine which accelerates from 0-100 km/h in 3.5 seconds. The car's delivery will begin in the first quarter of 2017. Aston Martin's upcoming 'Project Nebula' hypercar will also have only 99 units.

author: Parichit Mainra
abstract: Aston Martin in loss for 5th consecutive year
article: British luxury carmaker Aston Martin made a pre-tax loss of $170.3 million in 2015, for the fifth consecutive year. An official said on Monday that 3,615 cars were sold in 2015, down from the 3,661 sold in 2014. Earlier this year, the company had made an investment of around $263 million for a new manufacturing plant in the UK.

author: Abhishek Bansal
abstract: Volkswagen Group owns Bugatti, Bentley, Porsche
article: German automaker Volkswagen Group sells passenger cars under the brands like Audi, Bentley, Bugatti, Lamborghini, Porsche, Skoda and Volkswagen. The motorcycles are sold under the brand Ducati, and commercial vehicles under SCANIA, MAN and Volkswagen Commercial Vehicles. The group also owns the German football club VfL Wolfsburg.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Tesla lacks experience, says Audi executive
article: Claiming that Audi's experience in designing traditional vehicles will help it outperform Elon Musk's Tesla, Audi's electric-car strategy architect said, "Tesla lacks experience with classical auto manufacturing". "Drivers won't adopt electric cars if they're seen as smaller, uglier and more expensive", he added and insisted that Audi will leverage its experience to push e-cars into a new era.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Aston Martin will make only 99 Nebula hypercars
article: British luxury car manufacturer Aston Martin's Design Chief Marek Reichman has said that the company will build only 99 units of its AM-RB 001 model or the Project Nebula hypercar. Expected to launch in 2018, the hypercar combines the latest aerodynamics from Formula 1 and the design of an Aston Martin sports car. It will reportedly be a petrol-electric hybrid.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ducati is not for sale: Audi CEO Rupert Stadler
article: Putting an end to rumours of Volkswagen Group selling off Ducati in the wake of the emissions scandal, Audi CEO Rupert Stadler said in an interview, "Ducati is not for sale." "Ducati and Lamborghini belong to Audi and, together with us, have an excellent future," added Stadler. Notably, Audi-owned Ducati and Audi itself are owned by the Volkswagen Group.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: BMW to use i3 batteries for storage solution
article: Luxury carmaker BMW on Tuesday announced an energy storage system solution by integrating new or used i3 BMW vehicle batteries. The system, which can be used for residential and commercial applications, can be charged during the day, taking advantage of the energy that may otherwise be underutilised. It can also help enable efficient use of energy produced from solar panels.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: BMW sculpture at Goodwood Festival of Speed
article: At the 2016 Goodwood Festival of Speed on Thursday, a giant sculpture honouring the German luxury carmaker BMW was unveiled. Every year since 1997, the festival honours historic motor racing cars with a central display statue in front of the Goodwood House in England. This year's structure contains three of BMW's most successful cars from the past 100 years.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Aston Martin unveils a one-off GT12 Roadster
article: British luxury manufacturer of sports cars, Aston Martin unveiled a one-off GT12 Roadster called the Vantage GT12 Roadster at the Goodwood Festival of Speed on Friday. It is based on the GT12 Coupe and features carbon-fiber body panels, a folding fabric roof, and titanium exhaust system. The one-off model was conceived and delivered within nine months for a specific customer.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Rolls-Royce launches Dawn in India at ₹6.25 cr
article: British luxury car maker Rolls-Royce on Friday launched Dawn in India at a starting price of ₹6.25 crore (ex-showroom​, Mumbai). The soft-top convertible has a 6.6-litre twin turbocharged V12 petrol engine capable of churning out 563 bhp of power. The car can go from 0-100 kmph in five seconds and has an electronically limited top speed of 250 kmph.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mercedes-Benz unveils AMG GT R sports coupe
article: Mercedes-Benz on Friday unveiled a new sports coupe, the AMG GT R. Powered by a 4.0-litre V8 Biturbo engine, it produces 585 horsepower and accelerates from 0-100 km/h in 3.6 seconds. The AMG GT R has a top speed of 318 km/h. The sports coupe is scheduled to debut in March 2017 in Europe.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Land Rover Discovery Sport pulls 100-tonne train
article: The Land Rover Discovery Sport pulled a 100-tonne train over 10 kilometres along a railway bridge in Switzerland. The vehicle employed its semi-autonomous driving technology and its 180 PS Ingenium engine to tow the train which was 60 times its own weight. The stunt was conducted to demonstrate the towing capabilities of the all-terrain vehicle.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Porsche unveils world's fastest sedan
article: German carmaker Porsche on Tuesday unveiled the world's fastest sedan Panamera Turbo, which accelerates from 0 to 100 kmph in 3.6 seconds. Powered by a four-litre twin-turbo V8 engine, the sedan delivers 550 hp and has a top speed of 306 kmph. It will launch in January 2017 in the US at a starting price of $146,900.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Yamaha unveils 3-wheel electric vehicle concept
article: Japanese motor company Yamaha has unveiled a three-wheeled vehicle concept called '05GEN'. The vehicle has a compact body and a roof that provides protection from light, rain and the sun. Designed primarily to help people travel short distances, the vehicle also features a storage compartment.

author: Prashanti Moktan
abstract: Jeep to probe if Anton was killed by car defect
article: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles, the parent company of 'Jeep', has announced that it will investigate the accident where 'Star Trek' actor Anton Yelchin got crushed to death by his own car, a 2015 Jeep Grand Cherokee. As per records of the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration, the 2015 Grand Cherokees were among the 1.1 million vehicles recalled by Fiat in April.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Faraday to test self-driving cars in California
article: California Department of Motor Vehicles on Tuesday said that the US-based electric vehicles startup Faraday Future has been approved to test self-driving vehicles on public roads. Faraday plans to begin testing prototypes of its self-driving vehicles in California later this year. Faraday is one of the several Chinese-funded startups competing with Tesla in the premium electric vehicles segment.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Fastest electric car goes 0–100 kmph in 1.5s
article: The Academic Motorsports Association Zurich has built the world's fastest electric car 'grimsel', which can accelerate from 0–100 kmph in 1.5 seconds. Made mostly of carbon fiber, it uses a four-wheel drive, and has an onboard computer. The previous record of 1.7 seconds was held by an electric race car made by the University of Stuttgart.

author: Yash Kumar
abstract: Volkswagen to pay $10 bn in US emissions scam
article: Volkswagen, after losing the US emissions case, is set to make a settlement of over $10 billion to nearly 500,000 car owners. In addition to repair and buyback costs, Volkswagen will pay an average of $5,000 to the car owners. Volkswagen is also expected to pay for environmental impacts and to promote zero emissions vehicle.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Lamborghini unveils Aventador Miura Homage coupe
article: To celebrate 50 years of its super sports car Miura, Lamborghini unveiled the 'Aventador Miura Homage', a special edition of the current Aventador coupe. Lamborghini said that it will produce only 50 units of the car. Powered by a V12 engine, the coupe can accelerate from 0-100 km/h in 2.9 seconds and has a top speed of 350 km/h.

author: Mansha Mahajan
abstract: Toyota recalls 2.87 mn cars over emissions defect
article: Japan's Toyota Motor Corp on Wednesday said that it has recalled 2.87 million cars worldwide over possible defects in their fuel emissions control units. The move covers cars produced from 2006 to 2015 including the Prius and Corolla models. The automaker had earlier recalled 1.43 million Prius and Lexus models globally due to issues in their air bag inflators.

author: Satyaki Das
abstract: Porsche created world's 1st hybrid car
article: Ferdinand Porsche, founder of Porsche AG, unveiled the world’s first functional hybrid car in 1900, the 'Lohner-Porsche Semper Vivus'. The vehicle could travel almost 200 km on full charge, reaching a top speed of 35 kmph. Remarkably, it was also the first car with an all-wheel drive and four-wheel brakes.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Volkswagen plans to launch 30 e-vehicles by 2025
article: Volkswagen CEO Matthias Müller has unveiled "Together - Strategy 2025," a new initiative by the German car manufacturer to launch 30 new electric vehicles by 2025. The plan also includes development of battery technology, digitalisation and autonomous driving. "The Volkswagen Group will be more focused, efficient, innovative, customer-driven and sustainable," said Müller.

author: Shankar Venkatraman
abstract: Suzuki Chairman Osamu Suzuki to step down as CEO
article: Suzuki Motor Corp's head Osamu Suzuki will step down as the CEO on June 29, the Japanese automaker said on Wednesday. However, he will continue working as the Chairman. This comes after the company, last month, admitted to using fuel-economy testing methods not compliant with Japanese regulations on 2.1 million vehicles sold in the nation since 2010.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bentley unveils new 2017 Continental GT Speed
article: British luxury cars maker Bentley has unveiled the updated 2017 Continental GT Speed coupe with a top speed of 332 km/h. It has a twin-turbo W12 633 hp engine, which can go from 0 to 96 km/h in 3.9 seconds. The starting price for the model is around ₹1.6 crore, while a black-coloured convertible model costs around ₹1.8 crore.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: Royal Enfield sales jump 37% in May
article: Chennai-based Indian motorcycle manufacturing company Royal Enfield on Wednesday reported a 37.47% rise in total sales in May at 48,604 units, as against 35,354 units in the corresponding period last year. Domestic sales grew by 36.4% to 47,232 units as against 34,615 units in the year-ago period, while exports surged 85.6% from 739 to 1,372 units.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Land Rover sues Chinese firm for copying Evoque
article: Tata Motors-owned Jaguar Land Rover is reportedly suing Chinese automaker Jiangling Motor for allegedly copying its Range Rover Evoque SUV. The suit claims that Jiangling's first China-made model that went on sale last year, the Landwind X7 SUV, has copied the design of the Evoque. The Jiangling's X7 costs around a third of the price of an Evoque.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: China to debut electric car K50 at $106k in 2017
article: China-based Qiantu Motor is set to launch 'K50', an electric sports car priced at $106,000 in 2017, which the company says is comparable to the Tesla Model S. The K50 has a carbon-fibre body and aluminium frame. The car has a top speed of 200 km/h and claims that it can go from 0-100 km/h in 4.6 seconds.

author: Sultan Mirza
abstract: Rolls Royce unveils concept car with no steering
article: British luxury carmaker Rolls Royce on Thursday unveiled its self-driving concept car ‘'Vision NEXT 100’, with no steering wheel. The 20-feet long car, expected to be entirely voice controlled, can seat just two people on one giant sofa. The vehicle will be electrically powered and is expected to hit the market by 2040.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: McLaren's special edition sold out in pre-sales
article: McLaren's recently unveiled supercar 'MSO Carbon Series LT', which was limited to 25 units globally, has been sold out in pre-sales. The car, reportedly priced at $515,000, is based on the recently launched '675LT Spider' and features around 40% additional carbon fibre parts. It has a top speed of 326 km/h and can accelerate from 0-100 km/h in 2.9 seconds.

author: Tushar Kamath
abstract: Mercedes launches A-Class, GLA 'Sport Edition'
article: Celebrating the 2016 UEFA Euro Championship, Mercedes-Benz India has launched 'Sport Editions' of the A-Class, GLA and CLA. While the Sport Edition A-Class starts from ₹25.95 lakh, the Sport Editions of CLA and GLA start from ₹33.4 lakh and ₹34.23 lakh respectively. The versions include different bumpers, side skirts and mirror covers, available in limited numbers until July 10.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: Suzuki denies use of wrong fuel economy tests
article: Suzuki Motor Corporation on Tuesday denied using wrong methods in testing the fuel economy of its cars in Japan, saying there is no universal method of calculating mileage. This comes after the automaker on May 18 admitted to using fuel economy testing methods not compliant with Japanese regulations on 2.1 million vehicles sold in the country since 2010.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: 22.4L cars recalled in India since '12: Report
article: Automakers recalled 22.4 lakh vehicles in India over safety concerns between July 2012 and May 2016, according to an analysis of Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM) data by Mint. The highest number of recalls were made by Honda at 5,13,768, followed by Volkswagen (4,02,007), Ford (3,70,054) and Maruti Suzuki (2,82,875). Notably, 10.1 lakh cars were recalled in 2015 alone.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: Tata Motors sales rise 1.45% in May
article: Tata Motors has reported a marginal 1.45% growth in sales at 40,071 units in May, compared to 39,496 in the corresponding period a year ago. Domestic sales of passenger vehicles dropped 22.6% to 8,617 units while the commercial vehicles segment witnessed a 14% rise in sales in the domestic markets to 27,026 units. Exports fell by 5.3% to 4,428 units.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Volkswagen launches its cheapest Sedan at ₹5.1L
article: German auto major Volkswagen on Sunday launched its cheapest Sedan ‘Ameo’ in India, starting at ₹5.13 lakh (ex-showroom Mumbai). The 1.2-litre petrol variant of the vehicle would be available across Volkswagen showrooms starting July 2016, while the diesel version of the car will come later. The made in India car is the company's first ever sub 4-metre sedan.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Datsun redi-GO launched at ₹2.38 lakh
article: Japanese automaker Nissan's subsidiary Datsun, has launched its most affordable hatchback, the redi-GO. Priced between ₹2.38 lakh and ₹3.34 lakh (ex-showroom, Delhi), it will compete against the Nano and the Renault Kwid. Powered by a 54 PS, 799 cc engine, it claims to deliver 25.17 kmpl mileage. It has features including driver airbag, power windows and an integrated music system.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: Mahindra & Mahindra Q4 net profit rises 6%
article: India’s largest utility vehicle and tractor maker Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M) on Monday reported a 6% year-on-year rise in net profit to ₹583.70 crore for the quarter ended March. Revenue grew by 14.5% to ₹10,800.8 crore on the back of a 14% jump in auto sales volumes to 1.4 lakh units and 12.2% growth in tractor sales to 43,321 units.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: JLR opens first facility outside UK in Brazil
article: Tata Motors-owned Jaguar Land Rover on Wednesday announced the opening of its £240 million (around ₹2,280 crore) manufacturing facility at Rio, Brazil, the firm's first establishment outside of the UK. It will manufacture Range Rover Evoque and Land Rover Discovery Sport at the facility. The establishment will also house an education centre for training 12,000 local children every year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla Model S on autopilot crashes into a van
article: A Tesla Model S car on autopilot mode reportedly crashed into a parked van on a Switzerland highway last week. The Tesla was behind a car, which later switched lanes to avoid a van that had stopped on the highway. The driver has blamed the car for not spotting the van and the automatic braking system for failing to trigger.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: Tata Motors profit triples to ₹5,177 cr in Q4
article: Tata Motors on Monday reported a three-fold jump in consolidated net profit to ₹5,177 crore for the quarter ended March. The rise was attributed to strong sales by Jaguar Land Rover and higher domestic demand for trucks. Further, for the entire fiscal 2015-16, the company posted a consolidated net profit of ₹11,024 crore, down 21.18% from ₹13,986 crore in 2014-15.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: New web tool allows configuring Aston Martin GT8
article: British luxury sports car manufacturer Aston Martin has launched an online configurator for its Vantage GT8, a limited-edition sports car that was revealed last month. Only 150 units will be produced with prices starting from £165,000 per unit. The configurator offers a choice of 35 exterior colors, four special racing-inspired liveries, four wheels and an aero kit, among others.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: World's most expensive car tyres sold for ₹4 cr
article: Embedded with 24-carat gold and specially selected diamonds, a set of four tyres made by Dubai-based firm Z Tyre was recently sold for over $600k (approx ₹4 crore), setting the Guinness world record for the most expensive set of car tyres. The tyres were decorated by Italian artisan jewellers and designed in Dubai, the company said.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: BMW unveils transparent Mini concept car
article: German automobile major BMW unveiled its transparent concept car 'Mini Vision Next 100' in London on Thursday. The car's most notable feature is the option of changing the exterior colour or pattern anytime as per a user's desire. The electric car also features a steering wheel which can slide across between passengers.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Ferrari unveils one-off supercar 458 MM Speciale
article: Italian sports car manufacturer Ferrari on Tuesday unveiled a one-off supercar, dubbed '458 MM Speciale', designed for a British customer. The vehicle is painted in a shade of white along with the Italian flag colors. It is based on Ferrari's 458 Speciale, which takes three seconds to go from 0 to 100 km/h, with a top speed of 325 km/h.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Tesla introduces 2 cheaper Model S versions
article: Electric carmaker Tesla Motors on Thursday said that it would offer two slightly lower-priced versions of its electric Model S sedan, priced at $66,000 and $71,000 in the US market. The current Model S starts around $76,000 and is often delivered to customers at about $100,000. The newer versions will have a range of over 200 miles, the company said.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla gives free sunshades to Model X owners
article: Tesla is giving free sunshades to its Model X owners after they complained of heat and glare from the car's glass roof. The removable sunshade claims to block 66% of the light out. Tesla CEO Elon Musk says the 31 sq ft glass roof was made to give a helicopter cockpit-like riding experience.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Daimler to unveil long-distance electric car
article: German automaker Daimler will unveil the prototype of its long-distance electric car at the Paris Motor Show in October this year. The prototype will be an electric-powered Mercedes car which can travel up to 500 kilometres in a single charge. Daimler will also launch its fourth-generation electric Smart car at the end of 2016 in both two and four-seater variants.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Electric Harley-Davidson to launch within 5 yrs
article: Harley-Davidson's electric model LiveWire is coming within the next five years, the company's Senior Vice President of Global Demand, Sean Cummings has said. It will reportedly come with a 74 hp engine which can reach 0-100 km/h in under 4 seconds. Earlier, American company Mission Motors had helped Harley-Davidson to develop its first electric motorcycle, which was later pulled back.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Self-driving car which uses IBM's AI unveiled
article: US-based car manufacturer, Local Motors has unveiled 'Olli', the first autonomous electric vehicle to use IBM's Artificial Intelligence (AI) platform Watson. Watson will help improve the passenger experience and allow natural interaction with the vehicle, IBM said. The 12-passenger vehicle will be used on public roads locally in Washington, DC, and will come to Miami-Dade County later this year.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Tesla used cheap labor to build factory: Reports
article: According to media reports, electric carmaker Tesla used cheap imported labor to help build its Silicon Valley factories. These workers, brought in from Eastern Europe, were paid $5 an hour as opposed to their American counterparts who earned $52 an hour, the reports added. Responding to the accusations, Tesla CEO Elon Musk said, "Sounds like the wrong thing happened…will investigate."

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Tesla Motors to raise $1.7 bn via stock sale
article: Automotive firm Tesla Motors on Wednesday said it will offer up to $1.7 billion in shares to raise funds for financing the early launch of its Model 3 electric sedan. Tesla CEO Elon Musk had earlier said the company would need additional cash after it received 373,000 reservations for the Model 3, delivery of which will start in 2018.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Used cars startups get record funding in Q1 2016
article: Used cars startups received record funding in the first quarter of this year with a 74% growth and a 20% increase in deals over the previous quarter. Notably, India and China combined saw nearly half of all the deals occurring in the past 4 years. Mumbai-based auto classifieds platform CarTrade raised $145 million in Series B funding in January.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Renault enters pre-owned car business in India
article: French automobile manufacturer Renault on Thursday entered into the pre-owned car business in India by opening its first outlet in Bengaluru. The division, named 'Renault Selection', would provide customers a platform for buying, selling and exchanging certified pre-owned cars of all brands. Besides Bengaluru, Renault Selection will also start operations in Jaipur, Nagpur and Chandigarh.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: 12 mn cars recalled in US over Takata airbags
article: Eight automakers including Honda, Toyota, Nissan and Ferrari are recalling over 12 million vehicles in the US to replace potentially dangerous airbags manufactured by Japan-based automotive parts maker Takata, according to a US government release of Friday. Notably, automakers around the world have previously recalled about 50 million vehicles fitted with Takata air bag inflators.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Aston Martin creates art with leftover leather
article: British manufacturer of luxury cars, Aston Martin has created an artistic representation of its grand tourer Vanquish by arranging leftover cutouts of leather on a canvas. A team of artisans used various shades of white, brown and black leather to complete the art. The final art was showcased at the VIP atrium of Aston Martin's Gaydon headquarters in the UK.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Google patents tech to curb self-driving mishaps
article: Google has patented an adhesive layer on the front end of its self-driving cars to protect the pedestrians during an accident. The adhesive coating reportedly activates when it comes in contact with a person and aims to reduce the damage caused. Further, a pedestrian may be carried by car until its driver or the car itself reacts to the accident.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Ford recalls 48k plus EcoSport units
article: American automaker, Ford has issued a recall for over 48,000 units of its popular compact SUV, the EcoSport. Cars manufactured between April 2013 and June 2014 are recalled for installing a bundle clip for the fuel and brake lines. Additionally, 700 units have been recalled to change a bolt on the rear seats, which Ford believes isn't up to standards.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Volkswagen Group was founded on this day
article: Car manufacturer Volkswagen Group, which translates to 'People's Automobile' in German, was founded on May 28, 1937. The world's second largest car manufacturer Volkswagen has three cars namely Golf, Beetle and Passat in the top 10 list of best-selling cars of all time. The Volkswagen Group comprises 12 vehicle manufacturers including Audi, Lamborghini, Bugatti, Bentley and Skoda.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Diesel car ban in Delhi affected 5k jobs: SIAM
article: The Supreme Court imposed ban on the registration of diesel cars and SUVs with engine capacity over 2,000 cc in Delhi-NCR has impacted about 5,000 jobs in the automobile sector, according to the Society Of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM). Further, the ban, which came into effect in December last year, led to a production loss of 11,000 vehicles, it added.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Scorpio, Kwid, Eon fail global car crash test
article: Vehicle assessment agency Global New Car Assessment Programme (NCAP), which conducted its first crash tests in India on five cars on Tuesday, gave zero rating to all of them over safety. The cars tested included Mahindra Scorpio, Hyundai Eon, Maruti Suzuki's Eeco and Celerio and three models of Renault Kwid. “All showed low levels of adult occupant protection,” it added.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Scrapping policy to boost auto industry: Gadkari
article: The government's proposed new scrapping policy that will provide incentives for surrendering old polluting vehicles will boost the automobile turnover by over four times to ₹20 lakh crore, Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari has said. Reportedly, the new norms are likely to provide a rebate of 50% on excise duty of new vehicles for those who have surrendered their polluting ones.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: Maruti to recall 75,000 Baleno, 1,900 Dzire cars
article: Maruti Suzuki on Friday said it is recalling 75,419 Baleno cars manufactured between August 3, 2015 and May 17, 2016 to upgrade the hatchback's airbag controller software. Further, 1,961 units of Swift Dzire are also being recalled for the inspection and replacement of a faulty fuel filter. Maruti Suzuki said dealers will begin contacting car owners starting from May 31.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Airbus unveils 3D-printed electric motorcycle
article: European aeronautics giant Airbus unveiled the 'Light Rider', a 3D printed electric motorcycle made from tiny aluminum alloy particles, in Germany on Friday. It has a range of 60 kilometers per charge. The motorcycle's frame weighs around three pounds, almost 30% less than conventional e-motorbikes. The company has started taking orders for 50 motorbikes, with a price tag of $56,095.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Suzuki admits to improper fuel test on 2 mn cars
article: Japanese automaker Suzuki on Wednesday said it has used fuel-economy testing methods, not compliant with Japanese regulations, on 2.1 million vehicles sold in the nation since 2010. However, the ratings need not be revised as they fall in an acceptable range of deviation, Suzuki claimed. Following the announcement, Suzuki's shares fell 9.37%, the highest decline in over seven years.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Audi unveils its fastest car, the R8 V10 Plus
article: Cricketer Virat Kohli on Thursday unveiled Audi's most powerful and fastest production car, the Audi R8 V10 Plus priced at ₹2.55 crore (ex-showroom Maharashtra). Powered by a 5.2 FSI quattro V10 mid-engine capable of producing 610 hp, the car can accelerate from 0-100 km/h in 3.2 seconds, and has a top speed of 330 km/h.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: Honda launches new Activa-i, priced ₹50,255
article: Honda Motorcycle & Scooter India on Tuesday launched a new variant of the Activa, the Activa-i, priced at ₹50,255 (ex-showroom, Mumbai). The Activa-i, which is Honda's seventh new model in 2016, features a 110cc Honda Eco Technology engine. Notably, the Activa-i will be available in standard and deluxe variants, featuring a different range of colors for each.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: GM to pay $100 mn to SUV owners: Report
article: General Motors (GM) will reportedly spend $100 million to compensate 1,35,000 customers who bought 2016 Chevrolet Traverse, GMC Acadia and Buick Enclave SUVs. The company reportedly overstated the fuel economy by 1 to 2 miles per gallon for these cars. GM will give the customers a debit card or a 48-month or a 60,000-mile protection plan in compensation.

author: Shubhang Mittal
abstract: Mercedes-Benz GLS SUV launched at ₹80.40 lakh
article: German auto giant Mercedes-Benz has launched its flagship SUV the GLS in the country at a price of ₹80.40 lakh (ex-showroom Pune). It is powered by a 3.0-litre V6 diesel engine which delivers 258 PS of power and 620 Nm of torque. It goes from 0-100 kmph in 7.8 seconds with a top speed of 222 kmph.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Maruti launches new Alto 800 starting at ₹2.49L
article: Maruti Suzuki today launched the 2016 Alto 800 with prices starting at ₹2.49 lakh. It claims to deliver a fuel efficiency of 24.7 km/l of petrol, nearly a 9% improvement over the earlier version. The car comes with revamped interiors, remote keyless entry and two new colours. A CNG variant is also available at a starting price of ₹3.70 lakh.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Mercedes-Benz puts India investments on hold
article: Luxury car maker Mercedes-Benz on Wednesday said it has put on hold investments in India due to the current ban on diesel vehicles over 2,000 cc in Delhi-NCR. Terming the current uncertainty surrounding diesel vehicles as a "lost opportunity for India", the German company said its investments will be affected in the long term if the Supreme Court's ban continues.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: Polaris unveils new Indian Scout Sixty motorbike
article: Polaris India on Tuesday unveiled the 2016 Indian Scout Sixty, priced at ₹11.99 lakh (ex-showroom, New Delhi). The motorbike, which will available for purchase from July 2016, features a 78 HP, 60 cubic inch engine with a 5-speed transmission. The new Indian Scout Sixty will be available in an all-black with alongside more than 200 accessories available.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Uber confirms testing self-driving cars in US
article: Taxi-hailing app Uber on Thursday confirmed testing its self-driving cars in Pittsburgh, the US. The car is a hybrid Ford Fusion which includes sensors like radars, laser scanners, and high resolution cameras to map details of the environment up to 100 meters in any direction. However, a trained driver will monitor operations when a car's self-driving mode is turned on.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Maruti recalls 20,427 S-Cross over faulty brakes
article: India's largest automaker, Maruti Suzuki has issued a recall for at least 20,427 S-Cross units regarding an issue with a faulty brake part. The recall is applicable to both the DDiS200 and DDiS320 variants, manufactured between April 20, 2015 and February 12, 2016. "The inspection and replacement will be done free of cost,” Maruti Suzuki said in a statement.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Aston Martin unveils Vanquish Zagato concept car
article: British car manufacturer Aston Martin, along with Italian design house Zagato, on Friday unveiled Vanquish Zagato Concept, the fifth creation emerging from their partnership. It features a retractable spoiler and a new bodywork made entirely of carbon fiber. The concept, that runs on V12 engine boosted to 592 hp, features round tail reflectors along with "bladed" LED lights.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: Fitch projects India’s GDP growth at 8% by FY19
article: Financial ratings agency Fitch on Thursday projected India’s economic growth to accelerate to 8% by 2018-19, from 7.9% in 2017-18 and 7.7% in 2016-17. “Gradual implementation of the structural reform agenda, which continues to broaden, is expected to contribute to higher growth,” Fitch said. In comparison, it estimated global growth to remain at around 3% in 2018.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: Harley-Davidson unveils XG750R flat-track bike
article: American motorcycle manufacturer Harley-Davidson on Thursday unveiled a new-generation of flat-track racing bike 'XG750R', the company's first all-new flat track race bike in 44 years. The new XG750R features a 750 cc, fuel-injected, liquid-cooled Harley-Davidson Revolution X V-Twin engine. The company said that the motorcycle is strictly for race competition and will not be offered for sale.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Mahindra TUV300 mHAWK100 launched at ₹8.87 lakh
article: Mahindra has launched a more powerful variant ​of its TUV300 compact SUV called the mHAWK100 with prices starting at ₹8.87 lakh (ex-showroom). It is available in the top-spec T8 variant only with both manual and automatic transmissions. Power is bumped up to 101PS and torque now stands at 240Nm. Other than this, the mHAWK100 is identical to the standard TUV.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Gold-plated car worth $1 mn displayed in Dubai
article: A million-dollar worth gold-plated Nissan GT-R car named 'Godzilla' was put on display at the Automechanika motor show in Dubai on Tuesday. The gold-plated customisation of the car was completed by Japan-based sports cars customiser Kuhl Racing and engraver Takahiko Izawa. It has a 3.8-litre V6 twin turbo 545 hp engine with additional horsepower and torque.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: Hero profit up 71% on highest quarterly sales
article: India’s largest two-wheeler manufacturer Hero MotoCorp on Thursday reported a standalone net profit of ₹814.16 crore for the quarter ended March, up by 70.85% over the corresponding period a year ago. The rise was attributed to a 9.25% increase in quarterly sales to the highest ever figure of 17.21 lakh units, with net sales rising by 10.3% to ₹7,385 crore.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Rolls-Royce unveils $45k six-piece luggage set
article: Luxury automobile-manufacturer Rolls-Royce on Friday unveiled a six-piece luggage set for Rolls-Royce owners. The $45,854 set of the Wraith Luggage Collection - three "Long Weekender" bags, two "Grand Tourer" valises and a "Garment Carrier", was designed to complement the company's cars. Every piece of the set can be customized to mimic the design features found in the actual Rolls-Royce Wraith.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Ford welds 2 Mustangs side-by-side
article: To celebrate the completion of 50 years of the line of Mustang automobiles, American automaker Ford has welded together two Mustangs side-by-side – a 1965 and a 2015 model. It was unveiled at the National Inventors Hall of Fame and Museum in Virginia, where the visitors would be able to hear recordings of the engines that powered both the models.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Environment cess on diesel cars not good: SIAM
article: Future investments in India and the country's image as an investment destination will be adversely affected if the proposed 30% environment cess on diesel cars and SUVs is implemented, Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM) said. This comes after the Supreme court asked Delhi Police to pay a 30% environment cess on vehicles' value as a pre-condition for their registration.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: BMW relaunches 320i at ₹36.9 lakh
article: German automaker BMW has launched the petrol variant of the 3-Series sedan. Called the 320i, it is available in two trims viz. Prestige - ₹36.9 lakh and Luxury - ₹42.7 lakh. It is powered by a 2.0-litre turbocharged petrol motor developing 184PS of power and 270Nm of torque. Features include a sunroof, 17-inch alloy wheels and LED headlamps. ​

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Audi pledges new electric car per year from 2018
article: Rupert Stadler, the CEO of German automobile manufacturer Audi, has announced that the company will introduce a new electrified car every year starting 2018. It will kick-off the plan with its all-electric crossover utility vehicle based on the E-Tron Quattro Concept, unveiled at the 2015 Frankfurt Motor Show. Stadler also confirmed that the next-generation Audi A8 will debut in 2017.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: McLaren puts one of last produced F1s on sale
article: McLaren Special Operations recently announced that it is putting McLaren F1 chassis #069 for sale, which was one of the six F1s hand-built in 1998, the final production year of F1. The car, having covered less than 2,800 miles since new, features a Carbon Black body and 17-inch magnesium wheels. The company, however, has not revealed the vehicle's price.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Model 3 to feature ludicrous mode: Elon Musk
article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has tweeted that the latest Model 3 car will feature the ‘ludicrous mode’, that lets vehicles go from zero to 60 mph in 2.8 seconds. Earlier, it was announced that the car will be able to do so in less than six seconds. It is available in Model S and Model X cars as an upgrade.

author: Nihal Thondepu
abstract: Japan: More car charge points than petrol pumps
article: According to a survey by Japanese automaker Nissan, Japan has more electric car charging stations than petrol pumps. Nissan also reported that there are over 40,000 car charging stops while there are around 35,000 petrol stations.  “An important element of the continued market growth is the development of the charging infrastructure,” Nissan officials said about electric cars.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: BMW to launch self-driving car 'i NEXT' in 2021
article: During an annual shareholder meeting in Munich, BMW CEO Harald Krueger revealed the company’s plans to debut a self-driving car, called i NEXT, in 2021. Krueger said that the car will feature “autonomous driving, digital connectivity, intelligent lightweight design, and a totally new interior”. He added that the vehicle will bring “the next generation of electro-mobility to the road.”

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: BMW rolls out its 50,000th locally produced car
article: German luxury car maker BMW has announced to have rolled out its 50,000th locally produced car, the 7 series, from its factory in Chennai. According to the Chennai plant’s Managing Director Jochen Stallkamp, the company has also ramped up its localisation content by up to 50%. Notably, BMW produces eight models at the Chennai factory in two assembly lines.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Lamborghini launches Huracan Spyder at ₹3.89 cr
article: Lamborghini has launched the Huracan Spyder with prices starting at ₹3.89 crore (ex-showroom, Delhi). It has a convertible soft-top roof, that can be folded in 17 seconds, and up to speeds of 50km/h. The supercar, having a 5.2-litre V10 engine developing 610PS power and 560Nm torque, can go from 0-100km/h in 3.4 seconds, and hit a top speed of 324km/h.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: MV Agusta launches 5 bikes in India from ₹16.78L
article: Mercedes-Benz part-owned Italian motorcycle brand MV Agusta, in partnership with Pune-based Kinetic group, has launched five luxury bikes in India priced between ₹16.78 lakh and ₹35.71 lakh (ex-showroom Pune). The company also plans to launch F4 RC model in India later in the year priced around ₹50 lakh, which would make it the most expensive two-wheeler in the Indian market.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Hero MotoCorp enters into motorcycle racing
article: Indian motorcycle and scooter manufacturer Hero MotoCorp has partnered with German off-road racing specialist Speedbrain to enter into the motorcycle rally racing with the team "Hero MotoSports Team Rally". The team will make its debut at the Merzouga Rally in Morocco later in the month, riding on the upgraded version of the Speedbrain 450 rally bike, Hero MotoCorp said.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: US startup unveils self-driving truck concept
article: Nikola, an Utah-based startup in the US has unveiled 'Nikola One', a self-driving six-wheeled electric truck concept that claims to run for 1,280-1,930 kilometres on a single charge. It has a 2000 hp battery powered by natural gas. The truck also has a touchscreen cockpit, fridge, Wi-Fi and claims to pull a convoy of five driverless trucks behind it.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Toyota Innova Crysta launched at ₹13.84 lakh
article: Japanese auto-giant Toyota has launched the Innova Crysta, with prices ranging between ₹13.84 lakh and ₹20.78 lakh. The Crysta debuts two all-new diesel engines, that produce 150 and 174 PS of power respectively. Available as a 7-seater or an 8-seater, it gets new features such as projector headlamps, automatic climate control, seven airbags, touchscreen audio system among others.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: BMW develops smart emergency tech for motorbikes
article: BMW has introduced what it claims to be the first smart emergency technology for motorbikes, called Intelligent Emergency Call. IEC's acceleration and lean angle sensors can detect a bike crash, and automatically call for help. Further, it times the call based on the severity of the accident, and sends the bike’s location as well in case of a serious accident.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: TVS receives patent for air-injection system
article: Two-wheeler manufacturer TVS Motor has secured a patent for an invention relating to an air-injection system operative during the deceleration of an automobile engine meant to improve its fuel economy. The system is also capable of reducing exhaust emission. Meanwhile, the firm has received another patent relating to a lubrication mechanism for the crankcase assembly of an automobile.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: EcoSport Black Edition launched at ₹8.58 lakh
article: American automaker Ford has launched a Black Edition of its compact SUV, the Ford EcoSport at ₹8.58 lakh (ex-showroom). The edition is available from the 'Trend+' variant onwards, with both the petrol and diesel engine option. It includes blacked out elements such as the grille, alloy wheels, fog lamp bezels and more. Mechanically, the EcoSport remains unchanged.  ​

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Google to partner Fiat Chrysler for self-driving
article: Google and Fiat Chrysler have agreed to work together to build a fleet of 100 self-driving minivans. Engineers from the two companies will work together to fit Google's autonomous driving technology into Fiat's Pacifica. The deal marks the first time that Google has worked directly with an automaker to integrate its self-driving system into a passenger vehicle, the companies said.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Honda BR-V launched at ₹8.75 lakh
article: Japanese auto-giant Honda has launched its BR-V compact SUV, with prices starting at ₹8.75 lakh (petrol) and ₹9.90 lakh (diesel). The BR-V is a seven-seater that gets goodies such as projector headlamps, 16-inch alloy wheels, automatic climate control, rear AC and an integrated music system. The diesel motor delivers 100 PS of power, whereas the petrol variant produces 119 PS.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Hyundai unveils wearable robot
article: Hyundai on Friday unveiled a wearable robot that can enhance the physical strength of the controller and lift objects weighing over 60 kilograms. Users can wear the robot, reportedly similar to the Iron Man suit, by buckling into it. Hyundai said the robot is being developed for commercial purposes and will be applied in areas including military and production lines.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Ferrari names Fiat Chrysler's chief as its CEO
article: Italian sports car manufacturer Ferrari on Monday appointed its Chairman Sergio Marchionne as the new CEO with "immediate effect", adding yet another title for the Italian-Canadian manager, who also runs Fiat Chrysler. Marchionne replaced 69-year-old Amedeo Felisa, who retired from his post when the carmaker's board of directors met to discuss the first-quarter results, the company said.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: McLaren uses 20-yr-old laptop to maintain F1
article: McLaren Automotive reportedly relies on a roughly 20-year-old Compaq LTE 5280 laptop to maintain its F1 supercar. "The reason we need those specific Compaq laptops is that they run a bespoke Conditional Access card which is installed into them," a spokesperson explained to autoblog Jalopnik. However, it is working on a new interface which will be compatible with modern laptops.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: Nissan to buy 34% stake in Mitsubishi for $2.2bn
article: Japan’s second-largest automaker Nissan on Thursday agreed to purchase a 34% stake in scandal-hit Mitsubishi Motors for $2.2 billion. The deal would make Nissan the single-largest shareholder in the latter company. This comes after Mitsubishi, in April, admitted to cheating fuel economy tests on its cars – including two mini car models sold under Nissan's name – several times since 1991.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Mahindra launch Scorpio Adventure at ₹13.07 lakh
article: Mahindra has launched the Scorpio Adventure, an edition limited to 1,000 units at ₹13.07 lakh. It gets updates such as a dual-tone paint job, gunmetal alloy wheels and smoked out taillamps. The interiors get faux leather upholstery on the seats, steering wheel and gear knob. Mechanically, the Scorpio remains unchanged. The Adventure will be available in both 2WD and 4WD.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Nissan unveils Datsun redi-GO
article: Japanese auto major Nissan on Thursday unveiled its compact car Datsun redi-GO that will hit the market in June. The car will compete with the likes of the Maruti Alto 800 and the Tata Nano. redi-GO is the company's third vehicle from under the Datsun brand in India. Prices of the car are expected to start at around ₹2.5 lakh.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Italian scooter Vespa turns 70
article: Vespa, the Italian scooter brand manufactured by Piaggio, was founded on April 23, 1946, in the city of Florence. The scooter was initially designed as an affordable means of transportation for the masses after the World War II. Vespa, meaning "wasp" in Italian, has reportedly sold over 18 million models so far.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Jaguar partners with Tile to locate keys, wallet
article: Automaker Jaguar has partnered with Silicon Valley startup Tile to allow drivers to locate missing items like phones, keys and wallets. Tile makes small, waterproof tags that are affixed to objects and they beep after an accompanying app detects them within a 100-feet range. Jaguar will feature Tile as an in-car app on its 2017 Land Rover Discovery Sport.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: Mercedes-Benz India records highest ever sales
article: German luxury carmaker Mercedes-Benz on Wednesday announced its highest ever sales in India in a fiscal year. The company sold 13,558 units in India in 2015-16, up 21% from 11,213 units in 2014-15. Mercedes also recorded its highest ever quarterly and monthly sales in March. Further, the E-Class emerged as the carmaker's highest selling model in the quarter ended March.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Aston Martin builds voice-controlled luxury boat
article: British manufacturer of luxury cars, Aston Martin has revealed its new voice-controlled convertible boat 'AM37', with a top speed of 60 mph. The boat has a wooden deck which accommodates ten persons and features a touchscreen with access to air conditioning, a fridge, and a coffee machine. The fingerprint-protected boat will launch by the end of 2016.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: Domestic car sales grow at fastest rate in 5 yrs
article: Domestic passenger car sales grew by 7.87% to 20.25 lakh units in 2015-16, the fastest since 2010-11, according to data released by the Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM). Further, sales of two-wheelers rose 3.01% to 1.64 crore units, commercial vehicles grew 11.51% to 6.85 lakh units and vehicles across all categories increased by 3.78% to 2.04 crore units.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: LeEco unveils its own autonomous electric car
article: China-based LeEco on Wednesday unveiled its first autonomous electric car, dubbed as LeSEE. With a theoretical top speed of around 209 kmph, its front face features a smart screen, displaying specific vehicle data when it is running, the company said. In a video, the company revealed that the vehicle's back seat can adapt to the shape of a passengers' bodies.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Ford to prevent drivers from speeding in Europe
article: Ford is launching an 'Intelligent Speed Limiter' feature in Europe to prevent drivers from exceeding the set speed limit. Cars will use a camera to scan traffic signs and adjust the throttle to help drivers stay within the speed limit. Cars with navigation will also be able to augment camera data with the speed limit data from the maps.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Tata Motors gets auto stop-start system patent
article: Tata Motors has secured a patent for its invention regarding an automatic stop-start mechanism in vehicles with manual gear transmission. The system comprises an electronic controller and a mechanism which can start or stop the engine in response to electronic commands. This will save fuel by automatically switching off the engine when the vehicle is stopped, the company claimed.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Audi builds custom 20-feet-long, 6-door limo
article: Audi on Monday announced that it has built a custom A8L Extended limousine for a European customer. The six-door car is 20.9 feet long, more than three feet longer than the A8L. It can accelerate from 0 to 62 mph in 7.1 seconds. Notably, the four rear seats do not face one another, as they do in most limos.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Startup creates electric motor for boats
article: Seattle-based startup Pure Watercraft has created an eco-friendly electric vehicle motor for boats to replace gas-powered motors. It can push a lightweight 27-foot boat at about 34 kmph and can run up to 40 hours on a single charge, the Co-founder said. It also comes with a cooling system that uses the water around it to keep the electronics cool.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Electric vehicle sales up 37.5% to 22k in FY16
article: The electric vehicle sales in India for 2015-16 has risen to 22,000 from 16,000 in the previous fiscal, registering a 37.5% year-on-year growth, according to the Society of Manufacturers of Electric Vehicles. However, it added the government's plan of ensuring 50-60 lakh electric or hybrid vehicles by 2020 would be tough to achieve unless ground level infrastructural deficiencies are removed.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Shell unveils concept car with flip-up front
article: Shell on Friday unveiled its concept car with flip-up front which claims to consume 34% less energy compared to a typical city car. At an average of 45 km per litre of fuel, the car delivers a maximum speed of 110 kmph. The three-seater car has a body made from recycled carbon fibre.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Audi debuts concept car with electric longboard
article: Audi on Monday debuted its connected mobility concept car with an electric longboard stored into the rear bumper. The navigation system automatically calculates and suggests whether a user is better off driving the car or using the longboard to reach the destination. Capable of going 12 km on a single charge, the longboard can also be used as a scooter.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Mahindra launches NuvoSport at ₹7.35 lakh
article: Mahindra on Monday launched its latest compact SUV, called the NuvoSport with prices starting at ₹7.35 lakh. It is powered by a 1.5-litre diesel engine generating 100 bhp and 240 Nm of torque. With a mileage of 17.45 km/litre, the SUV sports features like daytime running lamps, 16-inch alloy wheels, 6.2-inch touchscreen music system, and steering mounted controls among others.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Tata Tiago launched at ₹3.20 lakh
article: Tata Motors today launched its latest hatchback, the Tiago (earlier called Zica) with prices starting at ₹3.20 lakh for the petrol and ₹3.94 lakh for the diesel variant. The 1.2-litre petrol motor delivers a mileage of 23.84 km/l, whereas the 1.05-litre diesel engine offers 27.28 km/l mileage. Features include an 8-speaker Harman sound system and 14-inch alloy wheels, among others.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Toyota to unveil concept car made of wood
article: Japanese car manufacturer Toyota will unveil Toyota Setsuna, a concept car crafted almost entirely out of wood, at the upcoming Milan Design Week. The two-seater car made of cedar and birch wood was built using traditional Japanese carpentry techniques that don't involve nails or screws. It has a 100-year meter embedded inside which can track how old the car is.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Man creates electric bicycle-car prototype
article: Mikael Kjellman, a Swedish design engineer, has made 'PodRide', a four-wheeled electric bicycle-car prototype. Covered in full fabric and a waterproof body, the vehicle has a top speed of 25 kmph and can run 60 km in a single charge. Equipped with indicators, headlight and a wiper, it also has space for baggage in the rear.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Tesla to build more affordable car: Elon Musk
article: Speaking at the Future Transportation Solutions conference in Norway, Tesla CEO Elon Musk said that the company’s next electric vehicle will be a car “most people can afford”. He added that Tesla’s fourth generation car will be more affordable that the latest Model 3, which is priced at $35,000 and which “roughly half the people” can afford.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Aston Martin launches Rapide at ₹3.29cr in India
article: British luxury car manufacturer, Aston Martin launched the updated Rapide sedan at a starting price of ₹3.29 crore in India. The four door car gets a 6-litre AM29 V12 engine that pumps out 510 bhp. It can accelerate from 0-100 kmph in 4.6 seconds and reach a top speed of 306 kmph.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: World's fastest SUV launched in India at ₹3.85cr
article: British luxury car manufacturer, Bentley launched the world's fastest and most expensive SUV, the Bentayga in India - with prices starting at ₹3.85 crore. It is powered by a 6.0-litre, twin turbo W12 engine that produces 600 bhp of power. The SUV does 0-100 kmph in 4.1 seconds and has a top speed of 301 kmph.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: GT Spyder fastest convertible car at 265 mph
article: Hennessey Venom GT Spyder has become the world's fastest convertible car after reaching a top speed of 265.6 mph (427.4 km/h), beating the previous record set by Bugatti Veyron Super Sport Vitesse at 254.04 mph (408.8 km/h). The car can do 0 to 60 mph in less than 2.4 seconds. Priced $1.3 million, Hennessey will build three Venom GT Spyders.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Tesla offers free trial of Autopilot feature
article: Tesla is offering the owners of its Model S and Model X cars a free monthly trial of the Autopilot feature. The feature lets a car navigate itself along road curves, manage speed and change lanes with a single tap. The car can park itself on the user's command. Users can also make the feature permanent via a software update.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: Domestic car sales down by 0.3% in March
article: Domestic passenger car sales fell by 0.3% to 1,75,730 units in March from 1,76,260 units in the corresponding period last year, according to data released by the Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM). During the same period, sales of two-wheelers rose by 10.92%, commercial vehicles grew by 22.03% and vehicles across all categories increased by 10.76%.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: BMW to offer its ride-booking service in Seattle
article: Germany-based luxury car manufacturer BMW plans to offer its own ride-booking service called ReachNow in Seattle, which will be later expanded to 10 US cities. Notably, a pilot version of this service was launched in San Francisco last year. The app-based service will offer a fleet of 370 vehicles, including BMW 3 Series sedans, i3s and Mini Coopers.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: Automobile body lowers sales forecast for FY17
article: The Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM) has lowered its growth forecast for passenger vehicle sales from 11-12% to 6-8% for 2016-17, after hitting a five-year high of 7.24% last fiscal. This comes on the back of uncertainty over the ban on registration of certain diesel vehicles in Delhi NCR and the 1-4% infrastructure cess announced in the Budget.

author: Dishant Sharma
abstract: Aston Martin, Red Bull team up to build hypercar
article: British luxury-car manufacturer Aston Martin has teamed up with Red Bull's Formula One team to develop a new hypercar for the road. The car, which has been codenamed AM-RB 001, is expected to be released in 2018. Notably, Aston Martin will also serve as the innovation partner to Red Bull in the 2016 Formula One season.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Tesla to enter India with Model 3 launch
article: US-based electric car major Tesla will enter India with the recently unveiled Model 3. At a starting price of $35,000, the Model 3 will be the most affordable car from the American manufacturer. Customers can book the car online through Tesla's official website for an initial token amount of $1000. The deliveries will begin by the end of 2017.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Mini Cooper Convertible launched at ₹34.9 lakh
article: German luxury carmaker BMW on Wednesday launched the new Mini Cooper Convertible at ₹34.9 lakh (ex-showroom). Powered by a 2-litre, twin turbocharged petrol motor, the car can clock 100 kmph in 7.1 seconds and reach a top speed of 233 kmph. The fabric roof can be folded in 18 seconds, at a speed of up to 30 kmph.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: BMW cars get Spotify, Pandora support on Android
article: Germany-based luxury car manufacturer BMW on Tuesday announced the integration of Spotify, Pandora and iHeartRadio on Android devices for its new 2016 BMW 7 Series. The feature was launched for iOS in 2011. For using the apps within the vehicle, a user needs to download the 'BMW Connected' app and connect their phone over Bluetooth with the vehicle.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Toyota unveils plug-in hybrid car Prius Prime
article: Toyota has unveiled Prius Prime, a plug-in hybrid car that has a range of 22 miles in the all-electric mode and of 600 miles in the hybrid mode. It features an 11.3-inch multimedia screen, 120 MPGe fuel efficiency and a battery that can be charged in five-and-a-half hours. It sports automatic emergency braking, lane departure assist and automatic parallel parking.

author: Team MotorScribes
abstract: Royal Enfield Himalayan now available in Delhi
article: Royal Enfield has now confirmed that the Himalayan motorcycle will be available in Delhi, at an on-road price of  ₹1.73 lakh. On March 17, the 400cc adventure-tourer was launched across all major cities in India, with the exception of Delhi, owing to the ban on sale of two-wheelers that aren’t BS-IV compliant.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Smart alcohol detector key prototype revealed
article: Honda and Hitachi have developed a prototype smart key that comes with an inbuilt alcohol detector. The system is able to detect the amount of saturated water vapour in human breath and check the alcohol levels within three seconds. It won’t allow a vehicle to start if the driver fails the test thus reducing drunk driving instances.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Vitara Brezza deliveries begin 25th March
article: India's largest automaker, Maruti Suzuki announced that deliveries for the Vitara Brezza will commence on the 25th of March. The new compact SUV has received over 20,000 bookings till date, said the manufacturer. The Brezza will be sold through over 1800 Maruti dealerships, unlike the Baleno and the S Cross that were sold exclusively through Nexa.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Mercedes-Benz launches the C 250d in India
article: Mercedes-Benz India has launched the C 250d for ₹44.36 lakh (ex-showroom) in India. It is powered by a 2143cc 4 cylinder diesel engine that generates 204 hp at 3800 rpm and 500 Nm of torque between 1600-1800 rpm. Fitted with a host of features including Parktronic and Pre-Safe systems, the C 250d also comes with an innovative intelligent light system.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Baidu to launch driverless cars by 2018: Reports
article: According to reports, Chinese search giant Baidu is planning to roll out a “commercially viable” self-driving car by 2018. Chief scientist Andrew Ng said that the company will soon start testing driverless cars in the US. Notably, a number of companies recently testified in front of a US Senate committee to discuss possible safety regulations regarding the autonomous car industry.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Tata Tiago launch postponed to 6th April
article: Indian auto giant, Tata Motors will launch the Tiago hatchback on April 6, 2016. The official launch was originally slated for January 20, 2016 and was later postponed to March 28. The hatchback can be booked across Tata dealerships for a token amount of Rs. 10,000. The Tiago will compete with the Maruti Celerio, Hyundai Grand i10 and Chevrolet Beat.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: 'Bajaj V' video in YouTube's most viewed today
article: A video entitled 'Bajaj V - Bookings Now Open' was the fifth most viewed YouTube video in India on Saturday. It was published on Mar 9 and has garnered over seven lakh views so far. Bajaj Auto had opened bookings on March 10 for its 'Bajaj V' motorcycle, forged from recycled metal of India's first aircraft carrier 'INS Vikrant'.

author: Rommel Albuquerque
abstract: New Suzuki Access 125 launched at ₹53,887
article: Suzuki Motorcycles India has launched the new Access 125 at ₹53,887 (ex-showroom Delhi). It is powered by a new 125 cc engine that churns out 8.6 bhp of power and 10.2 Nm of torque. It gets a completely new design with a chrome headlight casing, new instrument console, longer seat and the largest under seat storage in this segment.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla to unveil first mass-market car on Mar 31
article: Tesla will launch its first mass-market electric vehicle, the Model 3, in an event at Hawthorne, California on March 31 this year. Expected to launch in 2017, the Tesla Model 3 will reportedly be priced around $35,000. The new car is likely to be 20% smaller than Model S with a range of 200 miles or more in single charge.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Maserati recalls cars over unintended speeding
article: Italian car manufacturer Maserati recently recalled more than 28,000 cars manufactured between February 2013 and November 2015 over unintended acceleration caused by broken floor mats. The notice explained that a broken mat can get trapped underneath the accelerator pedal and may result in high speeds of vehicles that have the ability to go from 0 to 60 in 4.2 seconds.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Mercedes Benz launches S400 at ₹1.31 crore
article: German automaker, Mercedes-Benz launched the S400 variant of the S-Class luxury sedan. The new variant is priced at ₹1.31 crore and is powered by a 3.0-litre V6 petrol engine producing 333 bhp and 480 Nm of torque.  The S400 gets Napa leather upholstery, a 31.2-cm infotainment system and reclining rear seats with massage function among other goodies.

author: Nihal Thondepu
abstract: Volkswagen suspends Vento sales, recalls 3k cars
article: German automaker Volkswagen on Friday suspended the sale of its 1.5L Vento diesel cars with manual transmission and recalled 3,877 units of the model in India over emission inconsistencies. Volkswagen clarified this is not connected to the global controversy over its use of "defeat" devices to cheat emission tests. The company added that none of its other cars were affected.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Tesla gets 180,000 orders for Model 3 in a day
article: After unveiling the Tesla Model 3 on Friday, CEO Elon Musk announced on Twitter that Model 3 had 180,000 orders in 24 hours. Musk tweeted that based upon an average retail price of $42,000, the company has effectively netted around $7.5 billion in a single day. Model 3 will be the most affordable car from the American manufacturer.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Mahindra NuvoSport to launch in April
article: Mahindra is set to launch a new compact SUV christened as the NuvoSport in the first week of April this year. Designed and developed by Mahindra with the research and development carried out at the state of the art Mahindra Research Valley in Chennai, the NuvoSport will compete in the sub-four metre compact SUV segment.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Koenigsegg showcases its $2 mn hypercar 'Regera'
article: Swedish sports car manufacturer, Koenigsegg on Thursday showcased its $2 million hypercar 'Regera' billed as the "Bugatti killer". It can go from zero to 96.6 kmph in 2.8 seconds, and has a top speed of 399 kmph. Company founder, Christian von Koenigsegg claimed that the vehicle features 1,500-plus-horsepower engine, adding, "We can reach 200 miles per hour in 0.6 miles".

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Audi unveils R8 Spyder convertible supercar
article: German manufacturer Audi unveiled its new convertible R8 supercar at the 2016 New York Motor Show, starting at $129,400. The two-seater car has a convertible roof that folds within 20 seconds and a V10 engine which achieves 0 to 60 mph acceleration in 4 seconds. It also offers Wi-Fi, wireless charging and a connected Virtual Cockpit infotainment screen.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Mazda unveils MX-5 RF with retractable roof
article: Japanese automaker Mazda on Tuesday unveiled the MX-5 Retractable Fastback sports convertible car at the 2016 New York Auto Show. The MX-5 RF roof is fully automatic for the first time, which opens and closes the roof within 12 seconds. Its direct-injection gasoline engine delivers 155 hp at 6,000 rpm. Mazda will start taking pre-orders for the car this summer.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: GM buys self-driving car kit startup Cruise
article: General Motors (GM) today announced it is acquiring US-based driverless car technology startup Cruise Automation for an undisclosed sum to develop the company's autonomous vehicle technology. Cruise will operate as an independent unit within GM’s recently formed Autonomous Vehicle Development Team. Founded in 2013, Cruise makes sensors to turn regular vehicles into ones that can drive themselves.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Royal Enfield launches Himalayan at ₹1.55 lakh
article: Royal Enfield today launched the Himalayan, a 410cc bike developed for mountain motorcycling, at ₹1.55 lakh (ex-showroom Mumbai). It is powered by a 4-stroke, single cylinder engine that delivers a maximum of 24.5 bhp at 6500 rpm. Available in snow white and granite colours, it comes with monoshock suspension for hard terrain and claims a service interval of 10,000 kilometres.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: MY17 Nissan GT-R unveiled at New York Auto Show
article: The MY17 Nissan GT-R made its global appearance at the New York International Auto Show. It comes fitted with a 3.8 litre V6 24-valve twin turbocharged engine that generates 565 hp and 633 Nm of torque. The handling has been improved by employing a more rigid body structure and a new suspension set up that allows for better lateral transitions.

author: Team MotorScribes
abstract: UK firm to launch special vehicle for under-10s
article: Young Driver, a training academy for drivers under 17 years of age, will be launching a car for five to ten-year olds. Four working chassis’ for the car will be showcased at the Gadget Show Live from March 31 to April 3, 2016. The vehicle will come equipped with collision sensing and speeds will be limited to 16kmph.

author: Nihal Thondepu
abstract: Tesla unveils its first mass market car Model 3
article: Electric carmaker Tesla Motors on Friday unveiled the Model 3 sedan car and opened pre-bookings in several new markets including India. The car supports autopilot safety features, can cover 215 miles on a full charge and can go from 0 to 60 mph in six seconds. Tesla's first mass-market car, it will reportedly be launched in 2017 for $35,000.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Maruti Suzuki announces hike in prices
article: Following the 2016 Union Budget, Maruti Suzuki has raised prices of its vehicles across models.
