An effect of the 1%-4% infrastructure cess levied on automobiles, the price hike ranges from ₹1,441 to ₹34,494. However, there are no changes in the prices of the Ertiga SHVS and Ciaz SHVS,  that are classified as mild hybrids.

author: Rommel Albuquerque
abstract: Suzuki Hayabusa price slashed by ₹2.38 lakh
article: Prices of the sports bike Suzuki Hayabusa were slashed by ₹2.38 lakh in India after Suzuki Motor Corporation started assembly of the bike at its plant in Gurgaon, Haryana. The Hayabusa will now be imported as CKD (Completely Knocked Down) Kits. It will be available at Suzuki Big Bike Dealerships for ₹13.57 lakh (ex-showroom Delhi) by the end March.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Mercedes trolls BMW on its 100th birthday
article: On the occasion of German automaker BMW's 100th birthday in 2016, arch rival Mercedes-Benz took to social media to congratulate BMW. Mercedes shared a video that had the message “Thank you for 100 years of competition. The previous 30 years were actually a bit boring”. The company also invited BMW employees for a tour of its museum.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Audi unveils SQ7 SUV with a diesel V8 engine
article: Audi has disclosed specifications of the 'S' variant of it's flagship SUV - the Q7. Called the 'SQ7', it sports a diesel powered, 4.0-litre twin-turbocharged V8 that is aided by the world's first electric powered compressor. The engine produces 435 hp of power and 900 Nm of torque, making it the most powerful diesel SUV in the world.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Volvo calls for a standard EV charging system
article: Volvo Cars has called on the global automotive industry to standardize electric vehicle and plug-in hybrid vehicle charging systems. With major manufacturers moving towards offering electric vehicles in the near future and Volvo themselves stating that they will offer an all-electric product by 2019, the plan is to overcome a major hurdle for the EV industry by standardizing vehicle charging.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Mahindra launches 1.99-litre XUV500 and Scorpio
article: Mahindra has launched the XUV500 and the Scorpio with a 1.99-litre engine, priced at ₹11.58 lakh and ₹9.67 lakh respectively. The smaller engines are available in Delhi only, to circumvent the ban on diesel vehicles with engines larger than 2000cc. Based on the 2.2 litre mHawk motor, the power and torque output of the smaller engine remains unchanged.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Bentley Mulsanne Limousine unveiled
article: Bentley has launched the Grand Limousine, based on its flagship luxury saloon - the Mulsanne. The Limousine is one meter longer and 79 mm taller than the standard version. Handcrafted by Bentley's coachbuilding division Mulliner, the Limousine gets six seats, 21-inch wheels and it's own intercom system. Prices were not revealed since the limousine is made to order.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Ford slashes EcoSport price by upto ₹1.12 lakh
article: Ford India on Friday slashed the prices of its compact SUV EcoSport by upto ₹1.12 lakh. Applicable with immediate effect, the petrol variants of the EcoSport will be available from ₹6.68 lakh onwards and the diesel variants will start from ₹7.28 lakh (ex-showroom Delhi). Notably, the price reduction comes in three days after Maruti launched Vitara Brezza at ₹6.99 lakh.

author: Team MotorScribes
abstract: Bridgestone showcases DriveGuard tyre technology
article: Tyre manufacturer Bridgestone has showcased its latest DriveGuard run-flat tyre at the Geneva Motor Show which enables cars to be driven for 80km at a speed of 80km/h even after deflating from a puncture. To counter the immense heat generated the technology includes cooling fins and Nanoprotech reinforced side walls, making these the most effective run-flat tyres yet.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Volvo launches S60 Cross Country at ₹38.9 lakh
article: Swedish car maker, Volvo has launched the S60 Cross Country at a price tag of ₹38.9 lakh. Based on the S60 sedan, the Cross Country gets aesthetic additions like matte black cladding and a different set of alloy wheels. The ground clearance is raised to 201mm and it also gets an AWD system as standard.

author: Rommel Albuquerque
abstract: Kawasaki Z125 Pro mini bike launched
article: Kawasaki have launched a new motorcycle in the mini bike category - the Z125 Pro in the US for $2,999. It is powered by a 125cc, 4-stroke, single cylinder, air-cooled engine and comes with a four-speed manual transmission. The Z125 Pro has 30mm inverted front forks and 200mm front and 184mm rear petal disc brakes.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: GXE becomes world's fastest street electric car
article: The International Mile Racing Association has declared Genovation's GXE, a heavily modified Chevy Corvette, as the world's fastest street-legal electric car with a top-speed of 300.6 kmph. The car was being tested in Florida when it broke the record in the 'Top Speed Street Legal Electric Car' category. The previous record for the same was set by a Finnish prototype car at 284.8 kmph.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: BMW showcases Vision Next 100 concept
article: The BMW Group showcased the Vision Next 100 concept as part of their ongoing centenary celebrations. The concept embraces future technology such as autonomous driving yet allows for human operation as well. It comes with two driving modes, namely Boost and Ease, which change the set up of the vehicle to suit the driver’s needs.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Canadian man turns Mercedes into a 'snow car'
article: Canada-based mechanic Tod Anderson has turned his 2006 Mercedes smart car into a car that is fit to drive on snow, at a cost of $7,000. It took Anderson a month to convert the car by replacing wheels with skis and tracks that are meant for an all-terrain vehicle. It can reach a speed of up to 70 km/h.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Bugatti considering idea of four-door limousine
article: French luxury car brand Bugatti is considering developing a four-door limousine. CEO Wolfgang Duerheimer said, “I can’t get the idea for a four-door limousine out of my head. It’s one of the options… as a possible next project.” Notably, Bugatti recently launched the world's fastest production car Chiron, which can go from 0 to 100km/h in under 2.5 seconds.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Tata Tiago will launch on 28th March
article: The new hatchback from Tata Motors, called the Tiago, will be launched on the 28th of March. The car was renamed to Tiago since it's original name 'Zica' sounded similar to the Zika virus. The hatchback gets petrol and diesel motors with a manual gearbox, an 8 speaker Harman sound system and optional color coded interiors.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Ssangyong unveils SIV-2 hybrid SUV concept
article: Mahindra owned Ssangyong unveiled its latest SUV concept called the SIV-2, at the Geneva Motor Show. The concept borrows design cues from the Ssangyong Tivoli, that was showcased at the 2016 Auto Expo. The SIV-2 is a hybrid, powered by a 1.5-litre turbo petrol engine aided by a small electric motor. The production version will go on sale in 2018.

author: Jatan Desai
abstract: Renault launches updated Duster at ₹8.47 lakh
article: French automaker Renault has launched the updated Duster compact SUV at an introductory price tag of ₹8.47 lakh. The petrol and diesel engines have been carried over from the previous version. It gets a 6 - Speed AMT that is available with the 110PS 4x2 variant only. The ARAI claimed the efficiency of the AMT variant is 19.6 km/l.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Mahindra announces free Service Camp
article: Mahindra has announced a free service camp called the M-Plus for it's personal vehicle range. The camp will be organized at 450 Mahindra service centers, across the country from March 7 to March 13, 2016. A 75 point check-up will be conducted free of charge. Discounts on spare parts and labor are included in the camp as well.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: 'Vitara Brezza' most trending on Google today
article: Maruti Suzuki Vitara Brezza was launched in India on Tuesday starting from ₹6.99 lakh following which 'Vitara Brezza' was the most trending Google search in India. It was most looked up in Manipur, Haryana and Himachal Pradesh. 'Womens Day Images', 'Maria Sharapova', 'ICC World T20' and 'Hong Kong' were also among the trending Google searches on the same day.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Stephen Hawking appears in new Jaguar ad
article: Renowned British physicist Stephen Hawking has made an appearance in Tata Motors-owned Jaguar’s new commercial for its first performance SUV called the F-PACE. The commercial shows Hawking as a “typical British villain” who is the “master of time and space”. Interestingly, Hawking has earlier made on-camera appearances in various shows and movies including 'The Big Bang Theory' and 'Star Trek'.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Hyundai and Nissan announce price hikes
article: Following the 2016 Union Budget, car manufacturers Hyundai and Nissan have hiked prices across their entire line-ups. The hike passes on the additional infrastructure cess of 1%-4% levied on automobiles onto the end consumer. While Hyundai's price hike ranges from ₹2,889 to ₹82,906, Nissan has raised prices of all vehicles, including the Datsun Range, by 1% to 3.5%.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Mercedes launches India's most expensive sedan
article: German automaker Mercedes-Benz launched the Maybach S600 Guard in India today at ₹10.5 crore (ex-showroom Delhi), making it the most expensive sedan in the country. The vehicle is bulletproof and can survive a blast of almost 15kg TNT from a four-metre distance. The company also claims that the fuel tank won’t catch fire even on a direct explosive hit.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Maruti launches Vitara Brezza at ₹6.99 lakh
article: Maruti Suzuki India has launched its first compact SUV, Vitara Brezza at a starting price of ₹6.99 lakh. It is only available with the 90 PS 1.3-litre four-cylinder DDiS 200 diesel engine. The top-spec variant sports automatic projector headlamps, touchscreen audio system and 16-inch alloy wheels. The SUV will compete with the likes of Mahindra TUV300 and the Ford Ecosport.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Hyundai is now the official partner of BCCI
article: Korean auto-giant Hyundai, has signed a deal with the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) as an associate sponsor. Under the four year pact, Hyundai shall be an official partner for all matches to be played across the three formats - Test, One day, and T20. The deal includes in-stadia car display, promotions and Hyundai branding during matches.

author: Rommel Albuquerque
abstract: Lazareth LM 847 V8 Powered Quad bike launched
article: The Lazareth LM 847 is a V8 powered Quad motorcycle. It is propelled by a 4.7-liter  32-valve V-8 engine made by Maserati. This engine churns out 470hp at 7,000rpm and a torque of 620Nm at 4,750rpm. It gets dual 420mm disc brakes with Nissin calipers up front and dual 255mm discs with Brembo calipers at the rear.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Lamborghini registers record annual car sales
article: Italian supercar manufacturer, Lamborghini announced that its global sales exceeded 3,000 units for the first time in history, in FY15. Lamborghini sold a total of 3,245 units that includes 2,242 units of the Huracan range and 1,003 units of the Aventador series. The sales saw a growth of 28% while turnover increased by 39% to €872 million (approximately ₹6,425 crore).

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Ferrari 488 GTB launched in Mumbai
article: Ferrari has launched the 488 GTB in Mumbai for ₹3.88 crore and will be sold through Navnit Motors. The car features a 3902cc V8 turbo engine capable of generating 660 bhp and 760 Nm of torque. Mated to a 7-speed automatic F1 gearbox, it can go from 0-100km/h in 3.0 seconds and reach a top speed of 330 km/h.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: Car sales drop after 14-month rising streak
article: Domestic passenger car sales dropped after recording gains for 14 consecutive months, witnessing a slight dip of 0.72% year-on-year to 1.68 lakh units in January, according to data released by the Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM). During the same period, sales of two-wheelers rose by 2.63%, commercial vehicles grew by 17.53% and vehicles across all categories increased by 3.03%.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Hyundai opens India's first digital car outlet
article: Hyundai Motors on Thursday opened India's first ‘Digital Automotive Experience’ outlet in New Delhi's Rohini area. The outlet will use smart tablets to let customers book cars and give information about various cars under the Hyundai range. Digital screens, creatives and artworks have also been installed in the 1800 sqft outlet.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Budget 2016: Hatchbacks, SUVs to get costlier
article: The Union Budget announced today introduced an infrastructure cess on hatchbacks and SUVs, effective from April 1 this year. An infrastructure cess of 1% will be levied on small petrol, LPG, CNG cars within 4 metres and 1200 cc engine capacity, while 2.5% on sub-4 metre diesel cars within 1500 cc. Further, SUVs will carry additional 4% 'high capacity' tax.

author: Jatan Desai
abstract: Ferrari GTC4Lusso launched at Geneva Motor show
article: Italian supercar manufacturer Ferrari, unveiled the GTC4Lusso at the ongoing Geneva Motor Show. The car replaces the FF in Ferrari’s lineup, but retains its V12 engine. The engine has been tuned up to produce 680 bhp of power and 697 Nm of torque. Mated to a 7-speed dual clutch gearbox, the car can clock 100 km/h in 3.4 seconds.

author: Jatan Desai
abstract: Maruti Vitara Brezza to launch on March 8
article: Maruti Suzuki will be launching the Vitara Brezza compact SUV on March 8. The Brezza will compete against the Mahindra TUV300 and the Ford Ecosport. It will be powered by a 1.3-litre diesel engine developing 90 PS of power and 200 Nm of torque. It is expected to be priced at around ₹7 lakh.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: GM patents vehicle e-mail notification system
article: General Motors has secured an Indian patent for an invention that will automatically send vehicle's information through an e-mail to the owner. The new invention will wirelessly collect a vehicle's data including mileage, oil life and vehicle safety system status. This data will be e-mailed to the owner as a reminder of servicing or oil change, without human intervention.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Volvo to replace car keys with smartphone app
article: Swedish car maker Volvo is developing a keyless car technology to replace car keys with a smartphone app. The technology will allow drivers to unlock car doors and start engines through a Bluetooth connection. Users will also be able to share their digital car keys and access more than one car. This will be commercially available by 2017.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Tata Motors renames hatchback Zica as Tiago
article: Tata Motors on Monday said it has renamed its upcoming hatchback Zica as Tiago. The carmaker had earlier said that it will have a new name for the car, following the recent outbreak of the Zika virus in Latin America. The car, which was showcased at the Auto Expo 2016 earlier, may be launched by March-end, the company said.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: UK to get Suzuki Baleno by June 2016
article: Suzuki has stated that they will be launching the new Baleno in the UK in June this year. The company will be showcasing the car at the upcoming Geneva Motor Show and unlike the Indian version, it will feature a 1.0 litre direct injection turbo boost engine as well as a 1.2 litre SHVS version.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: UK to get Audi Q7 e-tron hybrid SUV in May
article: The Audi Q7 e-tron hybrid SUV will go on sale in May this year in the UK and prices start at £65,000. The Q7 e-tron gets a 3.0 TDI V6 engine and a 94kW electric motor that offer 373 hp of combined power and 700 Nm of torque. Smart features include the Predictive Efficiency Assistant and the MMI system.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: Mahindra & Mahindra Q3 net profit falls 14.1%
article: Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M) on Friday reported a 14.13% year-on-year decline in its net profit to ₹808 crore for the quarter ended December. However, net sales increased by 17.1% to ₹10,900.39 crore. M&M’s tractor sales grew by 5% to 59,883 units, while combined sales of utility vehicles, trucks and light and commercial vehicles, rose by 15% to 1,30,888 units.

author: Shankar Venkatraman
abstract: Ferrari 488 GTB launched in India for ₹3.88 cr
article: Italian luxury car maker Ferrari on Wednesday launched the Ferrari 488 GTB in India, priced at ₹3.88 crore (ex-showroom, Delhi). The car features a 3.9-litre, V8 turbocharged engine mated to a 7-speed dual clutch transmission, which can generate a power of 660 bhp. It can touch 100 kmph in 3 seconds, and has an electronically limited top-speed of 330 kmph.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: Tata Motors Q3 net profit falls 2% to ₹3,507 cr
article: India’s biggest automobile company Tata Motors on Thursday reported a 2% year-on-year drop in its net profit to ₹3,507.54 crore for the quarter ended December. Net sales, however, increased by 3.71% to ₹71,686.12 crore. The company attributed the fall in its profit to factors like higher depreciation and amortisation expenses and non-recurrence of an annual China tax rebate.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Mercedes-Benz launches ‘Edition E’
article: Mercedes-Benz India has launched the ‘Edition E’ from ₹48.60 lakh onwards. This new model commemorates 20 years of production of the E-Class in India.  Till date over 32,000 E-Class sedans have been sold. The Edition E is available with both petrol and diesel engine options, including the E200, E250CDI and E350 CDI.

author: Jatan Desai
abstract: Aston Martin DB11 debuts at Geneva Motor show
article: The latest supercar from British marque Aston Martin - the DB11, debuted at the ongoing Geneva Motor Show. The DB11, houses a 5.2-litre twin-turbocharged V12 engine. The engine produces 600 bhp and 700 Nm of torque, making the DB11 the most powerful production DB model ever. The top speed is rated at 322 km/h, while 0-100 km/h takes 3.9 seconds.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Iconic 1963 Jaguar E-Type to be auctioned
article: A 1963 Jaguar E-Type was found under a hedge and is now set to be auctioned on the 7th of March at the COYS Spring Classic Auction. The first owner of the car was a gentleman named Ivor Arbiter who owned Drum City in London and was responsible for designing the ‘drop-T’ logo for The Beatles.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Off-road vehicle that moves on ice developed
article: A Russian startup has made an off-road all-terrain vehicle 'Sherp', priced at $50,000, that moves easily on land, ice and water. The diesel-run vehicle with a 44 horsepower engine achieves speeds of 28 mph on land and 3.7 mph in water. The vehicle can climb obstacles up to 27.5 inches, turns like a tank and comes with self-inflating tyres.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Harley-Davidson introduces mobile dealership
article: At the 4th edition of the India Bike Week in Goa, Harley-Davidson has showcased their mobile dealership platform known as ‘Legend on Tour’. Customized by DC Design, the bus has place to feature motorcycles, accessories and merchandise. Post IBW 2016, it will move on to Bangalore and Coimbatore in March and eventually tour the entire country.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Skoda launches third-generation Superb in India
article: The third-generation Skoda Superb was launched in India on Tuesday at a starting price of ₹22.68 lakh (ex-showroom, Mumbai). The 1.8-litre petrol engine variant produces 177.5 bhp and 320 Nm of torque, while the 2.0-litre diesel variant generates 174.6 bhp and 350 Nm of torque. The petrol version comes with a 7-speed automatic Direct Shift Gearbox (DSG).

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Limited Edition Porsche 911 R launched
article: Porsche has launched the limited edition 911 R for £136,901 (approximately ₹1.3 crore) in the UK. Only 991 units of this pure bred sports car will be made. The car features a flat six boxer engine that delivers 500 hp and 460 Nm of torque. It is capable of going from 0-100km/h in 3.7 seconds.

author: Jatan Desai
abstract: World's fastest car Bugatti Chiron launched
article: Bugatti Chiron, the world's fastest production car which can go from 0 to 100km/h in under 2.5 seconds, debuted at the Geneva Motor Show on Tuesday. The car, with an 8.0-litre W16 engine capable of producing 1500bhp and 1600Nm of torque, has a top speed of 420km/h. Only 500 units of the car, priced at $2.6 million, will be made.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Skoda to reveal VisionS concept at Geneva
article: At the 86th Geneva International Motor Show set to be held between the 3rd and the 13th of March this year, Skoda is set to reveal its VisionS concept. This plug-in hybrid SUV concept showcases the new design language of the Skoda brand plus boasts of being able to drive 100 kilometres on just 1.9 litres of petrol.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Bengaluru startup makes 'smart' electric scooter
article: Flipkart founders-backed Bengaluru startup Ather Energy today launched a smart electric scooter 'S340', which comes with a touchscreen dashboard. Connected through an app, the dashboard lets driver sync navigation. It has a top speed of 72 kmph and charges up to 80% within 50 minutes. Ather Energy was founded in 2013 by IIT-Madras alumni Tarun Mehta and Swapnil Jain.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Royal Enfield opens first showroom in Thailand
article: Royal Enfield has launched its retail operations in Thailand. The first store has been set up by the General Auto Supply Co. Ltd in Thonglor, Bangkok. Currently, Royal Enfield will offer the Bullet 500cc, Classic 500cc and Continental GT 535cc cafe racer. The 3685 square feet showroom will also retail motorcycle accessories and brand merchandise including riding boots and jackets.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: Tata Motors hikes car prices by up to ₹35,000
article: Tata Motors on Tuesday increased prices of its passenger vehicles by ₹2,000-35,000 with immediate effect. The step has been taken to offset the impact of the 1-4% infrastructure cess proposed for different categories of cars in the Budget 2016-17. Further, Hyundai Motor India and Honda Cars are also planning price hikes of up to ₹80,000.

author: Arun Shenoy
abstract: Honda Amaze facelift launched at ₹5.29 lakh
article: Honda has launched the updated version of the Amaze at a starting price of ₹5.29 lakh in the Indian market today. The compact sedan gets a few cosmetic updates on the exterior and a new interior which includes a dual-theme dashboard, touchscreen audio video navigation and a new automatic climate control. However, there is no change in the engine lineup.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Hyundai showcases Tucson at Auto Expo 2016
article: Hyundai Motor India has unveiled the all-new Tucson at the Auto Expo 2016. This global SUV will slot in between the Creta and the Santa Fe once it is launched in India later this year. Hyundai also showcased a sub-4 meter SUV concept as well as the N 2025 Vision GT at their stall.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Harley launches Sportster 1200 Custom at ₹8.9 L
article: Harley-Davidson on Thursday launched its new Sportster 1200 Custom bike at ₹8.9 lakh (ex-showroom price Delhi) in India. The new bike comes with an air-cooled 1200 cc engine, pull-back handlebar, steel laced wheels, 105 mm ground clearance and 17 litres of fuel tank capacity. This is the 13th Harley-Davidson model launched in India.

author: Siddhraj Singh
abstract: Toyota unveils the new Innova in Auto Expo 2016
article: Toyota on Thursday unveiled the new generation Innova Crysta MPV in the Auto Expo 2016. Slightly bigger than the outgoing model, the new Innova is reportedly expected to be priced around ₹10 lakh, and be powered by a 2-litre petrol and an all new 2.4-litre diesel engine. The vehicle is further expected to hit the market later this year.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla stops production of Model S 85
article: Tesla has officially confirmed to end the production of its mid-range sedan Model S 85 that offered 85-kilo-Watt-hour battery. However, Tesla would continue the production of two other variants of Model S with 70 and 90kWh batteries. "The recently introduced 90kWh battery pack offers unprecedented range and value that has been well received by our customers", said a Tesla representative.

author: Siddhraj Singh
abstract: Volkswagen India showcases the Ameo
article: Volkswagen has showcased their first sub-4 meter offering that is destined for the Indian market and will go on sale in the second half of 2016. Christened as the Ameo, it will be offered with both petrol and diesel options which include the 1.2-litre gasoline burner and the 1.5-litre TDI unit. The Ameo is expected to be competitively priced.

author: Muntaser Mirkar
abstract: Maruti Vitara Brezza unveiled at Auto Expo 2016
article: Maruti has unveiled the compact SUV Vitara Brezza which will take on the Ford Ecosport and the Renault Duster when it launches later in the year. The Vitara Brezza is powered by the DDiS200 diesel engine with the petrol engine to follow later. Expect the Vitara Brezza to be priced starting at ₹6.5 lakh (ex-showroom).

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Jaguar launches the XE sports sedan in India
article: Jaguar launched its new sports sedan, the XE at the Auto Expo today. The XE will be powered by a 2-litre petrol engine available in two versions, a 197bhp and the other 237bhp. They are priced at ₹39.9 lakh and ₹47.5 lakh (ex Delhi) respectively, and come with 8-speed automatic transmission. Sale commences by the end of the month.

author: Nihal Thondepu
abstract: Toyota tops 2015 global auto sales
article: Japanese automaker Toyota topped 2015 global sales by selling 10.15 million vehicles, thereby retaining its top position for the fourth consecutive year. Volkswagen and General Motors finished behind Toyota with 9.93 million and 9.8 million vehicle sales respectively. However, Volkswagen had overtaken Toyota sales briefly in the first half of 2015, before the former's emission scandal broke out.

author: Anupama K
abstract: Govt ships 6 metro coaches to Australia
article: The Ministry of Shipping on Friday said that a batch of six metro coaches made in India were shipped to Australia from Mumbai port. Out of the planned 450 coaches, this is the first shipment to be exported to Australia within a period of two and a half years. Each coach is 75 feet in length and weighs 46 tonnes.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: General Motors forms team for self-driving cars
article: General Motors has created a dedicated team to speed up the development of its self-driving and electric cars. For this, the company has appointed its Vice President for global product programs, Doug Parks, as the Vice President for autonomous technology and vehicle execution. General Motors plans to launch its electric Chevrolet Bolt car late this year at about $35,000.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Bajaj V video among YouTube's most viewed today
article: A video titled 'Bajaj V - the rebirth of INS Vikrant' was among the most viewed YouTube video in India on Saturday. It was posted by Bajaj V on 25th January and has garnered more than 4,86,000 views. The video showcases an upcoming range of motorcycles called 'Bajaj V', made from the metals of India's first aircraft carrier INS Vikrant.

author: Muntaser Mirkar
abstract: Akshay makes appearance at Auto Expo 2016
article: Bollywood actor Akshay Kumar made an appearance at the Honda Pavilion at Auto Expo 2016 on Sunday. He spoke of his long-standing relationship with Honda and revealed that he has owned the legendary Africa Twin adventure motorcycle for years before expressing his delight at the new version being showcased in India.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Ather Energy to unveil e-scooter at SURGE
article: Ather Energy will unveil India’s first smart electric scooter at SURGE – Web Summit’s globally recognised technology summit which is being held in India for the first time between 23-24 February 2016. The e-scooter boasts of a quick recharge time, personalized profiles for varied ride experiences and multiple ride modes. It will go into production later this year.

author: Aditya Kashyap
abstract: Volkswagen launches new versions of Polo, Vento
article: German automaker Volkswagen on Monday launched new versions of the existing models Polo and Vento in India. The two models will come with additional features including SMS and Phonebook viewer and touchscreen infotainment system among others. The new Polo is priced between ₹5.33 lakh and ₹8.9 lakh while the updated Vento is priced between ₹7.85 lakh and ₹12.13 lakh.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Ford Mustang set for India launch by mid-2016
article: Ford India is set to launch the iconic Ford Mustang to India in the second quarter of 2016. The Mustang will be brought in with Right Hand Drive and will sport a five-litre V8, making over 420 horsepower and 529 Nm of torque. Through its five generations, Ford has sold over nine million Mustangs worldwide so far.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Bajaj set to launch V 15 in March
article: Made from the metal of the INS Vikrant, the Bajaj V 15 is a commuter motorcycle that comes with a 150cc DTS-i engine capable of delivering 12 PS of power and 13 Nm of torque. It draws its inspiration from the legendary aircraft carrier and is expected to be priced around ₹60,000 when it launches in March 2016.

author: Prashanti Moktan
abstract: Tata's latest car 'Zica' may undergo name change
article: Tata Motors is reportedly planning to change the name of its latest hatchback, the 'Zica', as it sounds similar to 'Zika' virus, which the WHO declared a 'global health emergency'. Extensive marketing for the car featuring footballer Lionel Messi had been going on for two weeks. Notably, the car will be showcased at the upcoming Auto Expo in New Delhi.

author: Siddhraj Singh
abstract: Honda to introduce BR-V crossover in India
article: Honda unveiled their soon-to-be-launched BR-V crossover, based on the Brio/Mobilio platform at the Auto Expo. The seven-seater is expected to share powertrains with the City and the Mobilio, and come in both diesel and petrol variants. Honda also showcased the ninth generation Accord sedan which is expected later this year.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: MY 2016 Jaguar XJ launched in India at ₹98 lakh
article: The 2016 model year Jaguar XJ has been launched in India and prices start at ₹98.03 lakh. The luxury car is locally manufactured at the company’s Pune facility. The new XJ boasts of subtle design changes, performance oriented petrol and diesel engines and comes packed with a plethora of features designed for both convenience and comfort.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Qatar's first homegrown supercar unveiled
article: Qatar's first homegrown supercar called Elibreia was unveiled at the Qatar Motor Show 2016 in Doha. A graduate from the University of Texas A&M Qatar conceptualized the idea for the car during an undergraduate research project. The vehicle, which is made of carbon fibre, weighs less than a tonne and features a 535 horsepower engine.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: 'Auto Expo 2016' top Google search today
article: The 13th edition of the Delhi Auto Expo kicked off at the India Expo Mart in Greater Noida on Wednesday following which it was the most googled term in India. It was most looked up by Greater Noida, Faridabad, Gurgaon and Noida. 'Maruti Vitara Brezza' and 'Honda Navi' were also among the trending searches in India.

author: Siddhraj Singh
abstract: Jeep brand to debut in India by mid-2016
article: The iconic Jeep brand will make its debut in India by mid-2016. The rugged four-door Wrangler Unlimited, as well as the Grand Cherokee, will first be introduced with diesel engines, to be followed by petrol engines. The range will be topped by the sporty 475 bhp Grand Cherokee SRT. Jeep will also build a new SUV 'for India' from 2017.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Bajaj to unveil bikes made of INS Vikrant scrap
article: On the 67th Republic day, Bajaj Auto released a teaser of its new 'V' range of motorcycles forged from the metals of India's first aircraft carrier INS Vikrant, that was decommissioned in 2014. The new range is expected to be launched in the 150cc segment with a top speed of 110 kmph. The company, however, has not revealed any details.

author: Muntaser Mirkar
abstract: Mercedes unveils new GLC SUV, S500 Cabriolet
article: For Auto Expo 2016, Mercedes unveiled their upcoming luxury SUV, the GLC, which is set to take on the BMW X3 and the Audi Q5 later this year. Mercedes also showed the S500 Cabriolet, a two-door, 4-seater convertible based on the S-Class. Powered by a V8 petrol engine, this luxury convertible is expected to be priced over ₹1 crore.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: New Chevrolet Cruze launched in India at ₹14.68L
article: New Chevrolet Cruze 2016 was launched in India on Saturday priced between ₹14.68 lakh to ₹17.81 lakh (ex-showroom, Delhi). The premium sedan features a 7-inch touchscreen MyLink infotainment system with radio, bluetooth audio streaming and voice recognition. With new exterior styling and multi-function steering wheel, the sedan also bears a rear vision camera.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Nissan to launch GT-R in India in Sept
article: Japanese multinational automobile manufacturer Nissan is all set to launch the GT-R in India by September this year. The GT-R delivers 545 PS of peak power and 632 Nm of torque. Though the price hasn't been revealed yet, it is expected to be in the range of ₹1.5 to ₹2 crore when it eventually goes on sale.

author: Muntaser Mirkar
abstract: Tata launches contest to rename Zica hatchback
article: Tata Motors has taken to an internet contest called #Fantastico Name Hunt to rename the Zica hatchback which is slated for launch soon. The outbreak of the Zika Virus had prompted the company to find a new name for the hatchback. The contest was announced during the Auto Expo 2016 and the results will be out in a few weeks.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Jeep to announce first sales in India next month
article: Fiat Chrysler's SUV brand Jeep will announce its first sales in India next month, according to the company's Chief Executive Mike Manley. Having previously said that Grand Cherokee and Wrangler will be the initial models to be sold in India, Manley added that the first sales will start by the end of second quarter of 2016.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Mahindra launches the KUV100 compact SUV
article: Mahindra has launched a new compact SUV christened as the KUV100. It boasts of new 1.2-litre petrol and diesel engines, bold SUV styling, flexi seating and a host of innovative features. The KUV100 is priced aggressively with the range starting from ₹4.42 lakh for the petrol variant and ₹5.22 lakh for the diesel variant (ex-showroom Pune).

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Takata to recall another 5 million vehicles
article: Federal safety regulators on Friday asked Japanese automotive parts company Takata Corporation to recall another five million vehicles containing faulty airbags including Volkswagen and Mercedes-Benz cars. The move comes after Takata was found responsible for the tenth death caused by its faulty airbag. Nineteen million vehicles with Takata's faulty airbags have already been recalled.

author: Pragya Swastik
abstract: Tesla releases promo video of Autopilot feature
article: Tesla on Monday released a promo video of the new 'Autopilot' feature for its Model S cars. The video shows the car navigating itself along the curves of the road, managing its speed and changing lanes with a single tap. It further shows the car parking itself safely on the user's command.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Royal Enfield Himalayan launching on 2nd Feb
article: The Royal Enfield Himalayan is set to launch on the 2nd February 2016. The launch will mark Royal Enfield’s entry into the affordable adventure tourer segment – a first for the company. The Himalayan is expected to be priced competitively and will come with numerous accessories to cater to this class of bikers.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Manfred Fitzgerald to head Hyundai's Genesis
article: Hyundai Motor has announced that Manfred Fitzgerald, the former Director of Brand and Design at Lamborghini, has been recruited as the Senior Vice President at Genesis – the premium brand of the Korean car manufacturer. His core deliverables include brand strategy and marketing. Manfred Fitzgerald comes with over 20 years of experience of working with luxury car brands.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Mahindra Launches the Imperio pickup
article: Based on the Ingenio platform, the all-new Mahindra Imperio pickup is available with a 75 hp 2.5 litre DI engine that makes 220Nm of torque. Designed to look like an SUV, the Imperio comes in both single and dual cab configurations and has a payload capacity of 1240 kilograms. Pricing on the Imperio starts at ₹6.25 lakh (ex-showroom, Thane).

author: Prashanti Moktan
abstract: World's cheapest car 'Nano' unveiled on this day
article: Tata Motors unveiled its car 'Nano', terming it as the world’s cheapest car on January 10, 2008. The car was launched at the New Delhi Auto Expo in India at the price of  ₹100,000. At launch, the car was 5 feet wide and 10 feet long and had a top speed of 105 kilometers per hour.

author: Shankar Venkatraman
abstract: Domestic car sales rises for 14th-straight month
article: According to the data released by the Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM), domestic passenger car sales rose for the 14th straight month in December 2015, as it witnessed a 12.87% surge against December 2014. Motorcycle sales declined 5.93%, total two-wheeler sales fell 3.10% and commercial vehicles sales surged 11.45% in December 2015, against the corresponding period the last year.

author: Animesh Choudhary
abstract: BMW tops luxury car sales for 11th straight year
article: Annual sales figures for luxury cars indicated that German automaker BMW had retained the top spot for the eleventh straight year since 2005. BMW topped sales charts with 1.91 million luxury vehicles sold in 2015, a 5.2% rise over the past year. Mercedes sold 1.87 million cars and Audi sold 1.80 million vehicles to be placed second and third respectively.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: New Ford Endeavour coming in January 2016
article: The all-new Ford Endeavour is set to make its Indian debut in January 2016. Boasting of a bold design and plush interiors, the new Endeavour will be offered with two powerful diesel engine options and 4x4 as well. It is built on a new chassis and is expected to be competitively priced at the time of its launch.

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Renault-Nissan India produce millionth vehicle
article: The Renault-Nissan Alliance plant in India rolled out its millionth vehicle on Friday. The landmark vehicle was a Nissan Micra that rolled off the line at 12:15pm. This facility, set up in Oragadam near Chennai, is the largest Alliance facility in the world. It commenced production in 2010 and manufactures over 32 models across the Renault, Nissan and Datsun brands.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: Automotive sector body asks govt to merge taxes
article: Stating that the automotive industry, with up to 77% taxation on cost, is among India's highest taxed, the Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM) has asked the Finance Ministry to merge multiple taxes into a single excise duty. "All kinds of domestic indirect taxes, including Road Tax, R&D Cess and Octroi should be subsumed in the proposed GST,” SIAM said.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: MSIL  Alto gets an airbag for the driver
article: The Maruti Suzuki Alto 800 and Alto K10 will now come with a driver side airbag as standard fitment across all variants. In recent months, Maruti Suzuki has been upgrading their product portfolio with additional safety features. Dual airbags, ABS and EBD are already on offer on the Ciaz, DZire, Ertiga, Celerio and Wagon R.

author: Swarnim Bagre
abstract: Maruti Suzuki hikes car prices by up to ₹12,000
article: Automobile manufacturer Maruti Suzuki India on Saturday increased the price of their cars by up to ₹12,000. The hike is in the range of ₹1,000 to ₹4,000 across models and ₹5,000 to ₹12,000 for recently launched premium hatchback Baleno, the company said. Previously, Honda, Skoda, Toyota and Tata Motors, all had hiked the prices of their vehicles.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Ford India launches the new Endeavour
article: Ford launched the new Endeavour in India on Wednesday, at a starting price of ₹24 lakh. Available in six variants, and two diesel engine options, the car has a ground clearance of 225mm and an 800mm water wading capacity. The variants are equipped with satellite navigation, electrically folding rear seats, electric tail gate and seven air bags including knee bags.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Motorscribes lists top automotive stories of '15
article: Motorscribes has released a list of the biggest stories of the automotive industry of 2015. Mercedes-Benz launching fifteen new models and the sales figures of Renault Kwid and Hyundai Creta were on the list. Tech Mahindra acquiring controlling stake in Pininfarina, Maruti Suzuki launching a luxury experience and demise of industry stalwart Brijmohan Lall Munjal were also on the list.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Kawasaki launch Versys 650 and KLX110 in India
article: India Kawasaki Motors has introduced two new bikes for the market, namely the Versys 650 and the KLX110. The Versys 650 is a CKD and comes with a parallel-twin engine, while the KLX110 is a 112cc off-roader. The Versys 650 is priced at ₹660,000 and the KLX 110 will retail for ₹265,000 (ex-Showroom Delhi).

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Free e-bike rides in Delhi during odd-even rule
article: In view of the odd-even ruling, Hero Electric on Saturday launched a Free Ride initiative in Delhi, under which it has deployed 100 e-bikes to ferry commuters for free. The bikes will be placed at 15 strategic metro stations till January 15 with a rider to provide commuters with last-mile connectivity during rush hours within a distance of three kilometres.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Maruti Suzuki offers DZire VDi with AGS Tech
article: Maruti Suzuki has introduced their Auto Gear Shift (AGS) technology on the DZire VDi model. It is the first diesel model to benefit from this technology in MSIL’s portfolio. Designed for convenience, the DZire AGS VDi offers a fuel efficiency of 26.59 kmpl and has been priced at ₹8.39 lakh (ex-showroom, New Delhi).

author: Twishy Shahi
abstract: Honda Cars to hike prices up to ₹16,000 from Jan
article: Honda Cars India on Wednesday announced to hike prices in the range of ₹10,000-16,000 from January across different models. "The price increase has been necessitated on account of increase in input costs," Jnaneswar Sen, Senior VP Marketing and Sales, Honda Cars said. Several car manufacturers like Maruti Suzuki, Tata Motors, Hyundai, Toyota have also announced a hike from January.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Mercedes-Benz unveils its 1st SUV Coupé in India
article: Mercedes-Benz has launched its first-ever SUV Coupé in India, GLE 450 AMG Coupé, at ₹86.40 lakh (ex-showroom Mumbai). With a 362 horsepower engine, the sports car can go from 0 to 100 kmph in 5.6 seconds and hit a top speed of 250 kmph. It has a fuel capacity of 93 litres and is fitted with a 360° camera system.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Flipkart ties up with Mahindra to sell KUV100
article: Flipkart has tied up with automaker Mahindra & Mahindra to exclusively sell the latter’s recently launched KUV100. Buyers can start booking the compact SUV on Flipkart’s website from January 18. The vehicle, starting at a price of ₹4.42 lakh, will be available in seven colour variants. Notably, Flipkart ventured into the automobile market space only last month.

author: Muntaser Mirkar
abstract: Tata Zest enters the Asia Book of Records
article: In an event held in Pune recently, 154 Tata Zests converged to be part of the Asia Book of Records for the biggest convoy with a single brand of vehicle. The rally started and culminated at the Pancard Club in Baner and each of the Zests drove a distance of 21.19 km to achieve the record.

author: Shruti Nagpal
abstract: HT lists "cars that turned heads" in 2015
article: Hindustan Times has compiled a list of cars “that turned heads” in 2015. The list includes Renault's low-cost Kwid and Maruti Suzuki’s premium hatchback Baleno in the economical segment with Hyundai Creta among SUVs. Suzuki's crossover S-Cross has also been mentioned. In the luxury segment, the newspaper lists Mercedes’ AMG GT-S, Maybach S500 and S600 and the BMW i8.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Tata Motors to showcase 20 products at Auto Expo
article: Tata Motors has announced that they will be showcasing over 20 new products at the upcoming Auto Expo to be held at the Greater Noida Expo Centre in the first week of February. The company's new design language – Impact Design – will also be showcased at the Expo for the first time.

author: Shankar Venkatraman
abstract: Alto 2015's best selling car in India
article: Maruti Suzuki Alto emerged as the largest selling car in 2015, with nearly 2.50 lakh units sold between January-November. In October, the model became the best-selling car in India, with over 29 lakh units sold since the car's launch in 2000. Maruti Suzuki Swift Dzire was second in the list, followed by the company's Swift, WagonR models and Hyundai i20.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: JLR to set up manufacturing unit in Slovakia
article: Jaguar Land Rover has confirmed that they will be setting up a new plant in Slovakia. The new facility will be built at the cost of £1 billion and will eventually employ over 2,800 people. Construction will begin in 2016; however the first product will only roll out by 2018. The plant will have an initial capacity of 150,000 units.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: An Electric Porsche Sportscar by 2020
article: The Porsche Mission E project has been given a go-ahead by the supervisory board of directors at Porsche AG. Set to launch the all-electric sportscar by 2020, Porsche has announced that they will be investing over 700 million Euro to ramp up their existing facility which includes expansion of the engine line in order to produce the electric motor.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: SUV Creta wins Indian Car of the Year 2016 award
article: Hyundai Motor's SUV Creta has won the 'Indian Car of the Year 2016' award. The second and third position was bagged by Maruti Suzuki Baleno and Renault Kwid respectively. This is Hyundai’s third consecutive win after Grand i10 in 2014 and Elite i20 in 2015. Creta, launched in July this year, has reportedly received over 74,000 bookings and 400,000 enquiries globally.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: VW launches new Beetle variant in India for ₹29L
article: German carmaker Volkswagen on Friday launched the new version of its iconic car Beetle in India for ₹28.73 lakh (ex-showroom, Mumbai). Wider and lower than its discontinued predecessor, the new variant comes with 7-speed transmission, an electromechanical speed-sensitive power steering and six airbags. Further, it features bi-xenon headlamps, a panoramic sunroof, and refined leather interiors.

author: Muntaser Mirkar
abstract: Jaguar returns to racing in 2016 with Formula E
article: Jaguar is returning to open-wheel racing for the first time since 2004 with a brand new team in the FIA Formula E Championship. The team will feature on the 2016 grid onwards. This move is expected to help the brand develop a whole new breed of electric performance racing and road cars from the lessons learnt in the Championship.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: SsangYong offers 4x4 on the Tivoli
article: Korean SUV manufacturer SsangYong has introduced a 4x4 variant on their compact SUV– the Tivoli. Launched earlier this year, the Tivoli is rumoured to be introduced in India by mid-2016 and will compete against the Hyundai Creta, Renault Duster and Nissan Terrano. Mahindra incidentally owns 73% stake in SsangYong.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: Mahindra buys 76% stake in Italian car designer
article: Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M) and its subsidiary Tech Mahindra on Monday agreed to acquire a 76.06% stake in Italian car designer Pininfarina for €25.3 million (₹187 crore). The firm has designed cars for Ferrari, Rolls-Royce, Maserati, and Cadillac. M&M earlier acquired South-Korean automaker SsangYong in 2011 and French PSA Peugeot Citroen’s motorcycle division this year.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Jaguar builds Santa the F-Sleigh
article: As part of a little Christmas fun, Jaguar has built the F-Sleigh. Based on the design of the Jaguar F-Type convertible, the all-ice F-Sleigh gets skates instead of wheels, a generous amount of boot space and jet power to fly through the night. The F-Sleigh has been recently showcased as part of JLR's exhibition of their 2016 accessory collection.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Kazem takes over as President and MD of GM India
article: Effective from January 1, 2016, Kaher Kazem will succeed Arvind Saxena as the new President and Managing Director of GM India. Kazem has been working as the COO of GM India since August 2015 where he was overseeing the industrial side of the business. Before he moved to India, Kazem has served as the Managing Director of GM Uzbekistan.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Mahindra launches miniSMART diagnostics
article: Mahindra is the first OEM in India to launch a smartphone enabled workshop diagnostic solution. Called miniSMART, this system allows a low cost smartphone to carry out the same diagnostics done by traditional equipment. Offering quicker turnaround times through better diagnostics, the system monitoring and reporting tool includes the Android app, a wireless Bluetooth VCI and cloud support.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Google, Ford to develop autonomous cars: Reports
article: According to media reports, Google and Ford are creating an independent company for developing self-driving cars. The partnership is non-exclusive, meaning Google would still be able to collaborate with other automakers for the same. Further, the new company will be legally separate from Ford. The partnership is expected to be officially announced at the Consumer Electronics Show in January.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: Audi launches new version of Q7 in India at ₹72L
article: German carmaker Audi on Thursday launched two variants of its new-generation Q7– Premium Plus and Technology, for ₹72 lakh and ₹77.5 lakh (ex-showroom, Delhi) respectively– in India. The second generation Q7 is claimed to be faster and more fuel-efficient than its predecessor and comes with several cosmetic changes, including Matrix LED head-lamps and a new infotainment display.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Nissan reaches out to 8000 customers in Chennai
article: Nissan has taken to social media, SMS and email to reach out to over 8000 customers in Chennai and inform them that all Nissan service centres are now operational. Nissan dealers are getting top priority on parts and customers can expect a quick turnaround time. For any assistance, Chennai customers can call a special toll-free number (0124 – 6628111).

author: Nihal Thondepu
abstract: Excess emissions found in Mercedes cars: Report
article: According to tests conducted by a German environmental group, nitrogen oxide emissions from a Mercedes diesel car model exceeded European standards. Daimler group that owns Mercedes questioned the tests done on the Mercedes C-Class 200 CDI model saying the test conditions were unclear. Earlier, carmaker Volkswagen was caught in a scandal after it admitted to rigging emission test results.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Tata Motors introduces new Safari Storme variant
article: Tata Motors has introduced a new variant of the Safari Storme. The upgraded SUV comes with a new 2.2 litre VARICOR diesel engine that makes 156PS of power and 400Nm of torque. It also gets Tata’s new CONNECTNEXT integrated system. Prices range from ₹13.3– ₹14.6 lakh (ex-showroom, New Delhi). The new Storme comes with a 3 year/100,000km warranty.

author: Shankar Venkatraman
abstract: Mercedes-Benz A-class facelift launched in India
article: Mercedes-Benz India launched two new variants of the A-class– A180 petrol and A200d diesel– for ₹24.95 lakh and ₹25.95 lakh (ex-showroom, Mumbai) respectively. The new features include updated headlamps, new bumpers and revamped interiors. The A180 features 1.6-litre, four-cylinder turbo engine which churns out 120bhp while A200D has 2.1-litre, four-cylinder engine with a maximum power of 136bhp.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: OK Play gears up to launch E-Rickshaws
article: OK Play India Ltd has announced their ambitions to enter the E-Rickshaw business. The company has stated that their product is India’s first 100 per cent indigenously designed and developed E-Rickshaw and uses 90 per cent of components sourced from India. It boasts of a lightweight body and is touted to be rather efficient and easy to operate.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Tata Motors set to launch all-new Zica soon
article: The all-new Tata Motors Zica is set to make its market debut in January 2016. The hatchback will be endorsed by Football legend Lionel Messi. It will be available in both diesel and petrol engine variants and is set to compete against the likes of the Hyundai  i10 and Maruti Suzuki Celerio.

author: Mirza Mohammed
abstract: Govt finds VW cars in India with "defeat device"
article: The government on Tuesday said initial findings by the Automotive Research Association of India found that Volkswagen diesel cars manufactured in India with the E189 engine were fitted with the "defeat device". The "defeat device" senses the vehicle being tested and adjusts engine performance to the regulatory emission test cycle. Volkswagen will recall 3.23 lakh cars fitted with the device.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: Volkswagen scandal well thought-out crime: Geete
article: Union Heavy Industries Minister Anant Geete on Wednesday called Volkswagen's emission scandal a “well thought-out crime”. He added that the German automaker has been found to violate India's emission norms by 8-9 times of the specified levels. The matter is being referred to the Ministry of Road, Transport and Highways to take action against the company, Geete further said.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Mahindra KUV100 to launch on 15 Jan 2016
article: Mahindra has revealed that their upcoming compact SUV will be known as the KUV100. The small SUV boasts of a youthful design philosophy and will be introduced with a choice of 1.2 litre petrol and diesel engines. These all-new engines belong to the mFalcon engine family. The KUV will launch on 15 January 2016. Bookings start from 19th December 2015.

author: Arjun Bhatia
abstract: Domestic car sales up by 10.39% in Nov: SIAM
article: Domestic passenger car sales increased by 10.39% to 1.73 lakh units in November from 1.57 lakh units in the corresponding period last year, according to data released by the Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM). During the same period, sales of two-wheelers rose by 1.47%, commercial vehicles grew 8.56% and vehicles across all categories increased by 3.18%, SIAM said.

author: Vikram Gour
abstract: Nissan, Datsun announce 3% price increase
article: Nissan Group of India has announced that the price of all Nissan and Datsun products is set to increase by up to 3 per cent in January 2016. According to Mr. Arun Malhotra, Managing Director, Nissan Motor India Pvt. Ltd, the revision of prices has been carried out to offset the rising input costs.

author: Mirza Mohammed
abstract: NGT issues notice to Centre, Volkswagen
article: The National Green Tribunal on Monday issued notices to the Centre and carmaker Volkswagen over a plea that sought a ban on the production and sale of Volkswagen vehicles in India. The body sought replies by December 23 from the Ministry of Heavy Industries and Public Enterprises, Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change, Central Pollution Control Board and Volkswagen.

author: Shankar Venkatraman
abstract: Suzuki launches Ozark 250, Quadsport Z400 ATVs
article: Suzuki Motorcycle launched two All Terrain Vehicles (ATVs) on Saturday– Quadsport Z400 and Ozark 250–priced at ₹8.50 lakh and ₹5.45 lakh respectively (ex-showroom Delhi). The Ozark 250 features a 245cc four-stroke engine with twin front hydraulic disc brakes and fuel capacity of 9.7 litres. The Quadsport Z400, weighing 193kg, has a 398cc four-stroke engine and can be used for off-roading.

author: Bhavika Bhuwalka
abstract: Ford updates software to add Siri Eyes-Free tool
article: Ford has announced the first on-the-fly update to the second generation of its SYNC software to include Apple's Siri Eyes-Free feature for about five million of its cars. By long-pressing the voice recognition button placed on the steering wheel, drivers will now be able to make phone calls, get directions and check the weather, among other things, without touching their iPhone.

author: Mirza Mohammed
abstract: Toyota to hike vehicle price by 3% starting Jan
article: Auto maker Toyota said it would increase vehicle prices on all its models in India from January 2016 by upto 3% owing to increasing input costs and foreign exchange fluctuation. "We have been holding back a price hike and absorbing for a long time, but input costs, electricity, maintenance and foreign exchange have increased," Toyota Kirloskar Motor's director said.

author: Jatan Desai
abstract: Lamborghini Huracan LP580-2 launched at ₹2.99 cr
article: Italian luxury car maker Lamborghini on Friday launched the Lamborghini Huracan LP580-2 in India priced at ₹2.99 crore (ex-showroom, Delhi). The rear-wheel drive Huracan can reach 0-100 km/h in 3.4 seconds while its top speed is 320 km/h. Five of the ten cylinders in its 5.2-litre V10 engine are deactivated when full engine capacity is not required to conserve fuel.

author: Trivedi Bhutnath
abstract: Audi becomes first to sell 10,000 luxury cars in 2013
article: German luxury car maker Audi announced a sale of 10,002 units in 2013 (11% increase from 2012), becoming the first luxury car manufacturer to cross 10,000 unit annual sales in India. The month of Dec-2013 was a landmark for Audi India as it recorded its highest ever bookings at 1,340 units, despite the delayed delivery of 450-odd vehicles.

author: Aayushi Ajmani
abstract: Now, Harley Davidson bikes to be 'made in India'
article: Harley Davidson has unveiled two new products for starters - the Street 750 and Street 500 marking its first all-new platform in 13 years.  Also For the first time in the company's history, these products will be manufactured outside the US, in India. The Indian plant will only get Street 750 initially and supply to the local market and Europe.

author: Trivedi Bhutnath
abstract: Triumph launches motorcycle range in India
article: Almost two years after its appearance at the 2012 Auto Expo in Delhi, British bike maker, Triumph Motorcycles, has finally launched its products for commercial sale in India. The company plans to launch 10 models priced in the range of Rs. 5.7 lakh and Rs. 20 lakh. It aims to sell 1,000 bikes by the end of 2015 fiscal.

author: Trivedi Bhutnath
abstract: Car sales dips 8% in Nov
article: Marking a full year of continuous decline, car sales in India dipped 8% in November this year. The Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers' has called it as one of the longest negative streak of the Indian auto industry. In November, Maruti Suzuki and Hyundai Motor India sales dipped by 4% each, while Tata Motors car sales dropped by 42%.

author: Amit Kunal
abstract: 62% petrol used by two-wheelers, 19% diesel by SUVs
article: Two-wheelers use 62% of national petrol-consumption, while cars and three-wheelers use about 27% and 6% respectively- says a survey conducted by Nielsen for the Oil ministry. The survey also shows that 19% of diesel is used for agriculture and 66% for transport; highlighting that Commercial-vehicles burn 38%, while cars and SUVs use 19% of total diesel sold in the country.

author: Nihal Thondepu
abstract: 'Top Gear' set to return to BBC on May 8
article: Automobile TV series 'Top Gear' will return to BBC on May 8, announced its new presenter Chris Evans. He did not reveal who his co-presenters would be in the show that had stopped airing in June. Suspended Top Gear presenter Jeremy Clarkson and his co-presenters Richard Hammond and James May announced they will host a new Amazon Prime motor show.

author: Durga Ranjan
abstract: After BMW, Audi to hike prices by up to 5%
article: Citing pressure on its business due to economic factors, German luxury car maker Audi on Thursday announced an increase of 3-5% across its range of models in India (priced between Rs 27.93 lakh and Rs 2.14 crore), effective Jan-1, 2014. Earlier this week, rival BMW had also announced a price hike of up to 10% from January 2014.

author: Richa
abstract: Mercedes builds helipad to fly in luxury customers
article: In an attempt to reign supreme over the Indian luxury-car market, Mercedes Benz has built a helipad within its factory premise in Pune to fly in potential customers of its coveted AMG brand. The company, which has sold more than 200 AMG cars in India, says this latest move is aimed at giving an all-new experience to customers.

author: Moazzam Rafi
abstract: Maruti, Hyundai to hike car prices
article: After Mercedes, BMW, Audi, and Honda, the country's largest car manufacturer Maruti Suzuki has also announced a price hike in its cars from January 2014. Hyundai Motor India also said it is looking to take a similar step to offset rising input costs. The quantum of increase was not declared though.

author: Trivedi Bhutnath
abstract: General Motors names its first-ever female CEO
article: The largest US automaker General Motors (GM) on Tuesday named Mary Barra (51) as its first female chief executive. Barra would succeed current CEO Dan Akerson on January-15. Barra has been working at GM for last 33 years and currently serves as the executive vice president for global product development, purchasing, and supply chain.
